Reviews.Title: “A great family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Partyof5rocks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Kissimmee hotels over the years including Disney resorts, Nickelodeon, chain resorts and condo rentals. This by far was our most favorite place. Are kids are 17, 10,and 8 , (grandma too) and they all enjoyed the amenities at this resort. Check in was quick, our room was in the 206 building which was a 2bd rm condo. Although it was not one of the updated rooms in the pictures on the website we found it to be clean, comfortable (beds were great) and best of all quiet. It was located near the main pool which the kids prefered but just a short walk to the waterpark. We enjoyed the surrey bikes, paddle boats, and golfing which were all included in our room price. The resort grounds were well kept and very clean. All three pools were crystal clear and heated. Hot tub was great way to relax in evening. We went to the waterpark in the afternoon and had no trouble finding chairs. They do not allow chair hoarding which is great. I have been many places where people put their towels out then leave for the day just so they have a chair when they return. The food at the poolside cafe hot, tastey and plentyful. We found the staff to be very engaging and helpful. As we have done Disney many times we wanted to try some other activites around the area. Diane was very helpful in recommending great alternatives to the parks that we enjoyed very much. We were asked several times about the timeshare and to be honest we may have listened to the presentation if it was offered in the evening during our down time not during the morning/afternoons. I expect to be asked when we stay at a timeshare resorts but they were not pushy at all like other places. The location of Liki Tiki was great. It was minutes to dining, shopping, and the parks yet set off of the main road. Security gate at the entrance was always manned and checked every car that went in. After reading some other responses I would like to say that our condo was in perfect working order, very clean, and bug free. Enjoyed having coffee and breakfast in the morning on the screened in porch! We prefer to stay in a condo resort to have a full kitchen which is a great $ saver. I thought it was a bonus to have a washer and dryer to throw our towels in and we washed all our clothes before coming home which is a treat. It was stocked with everything you need and a family of 6 for 5 nights we did not run out of anything. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel with daily maid service this is not it. If you want a clean, friendly place for your family and don't mind picking up after yourself then this is the place to be. We will denfinately be staying here again on our next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for families”
Reviews.Author: DanCLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and I can't think of anything bad to say. Our room was clean and the kitchen had all the utensils & pans needed to cook. The wireless internet signal was great in our room, and there is a huge grocery store 2 minutes away to stock your fridge. By far and away the best thing about this place was the waterpark! Not only was it great, but there were lifeguards stationed all around it which was nice to see. One thing I would say is that the waterpark is probably best suited for kids ages 10 & under. I didn't see much that would keep older kids occupied for very long. For the younger kids though, there's definitely enough at the waterpark to keep them occupied for an entire day. We did not get to use the paddleboats because the lake was flooded from a huge rainstorm while we were there. No big deal though, this place has plenty of other things to do. This is the best place we have ever stayed at when visiting the Orlando area. We cannot wait to stay at the Liki Tiki again!

Reviews.Title: “Family pool waterslide fun, nice interiors, great deal”
Reviews.Author: Tropicbird
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a suite or condo at a resort near Disney with a playground and fun zero-entry + water slide pool for our 2 preschool "pollywogs." They are not good enough swimmers to do a lazy river or big kid's high water slide. Liki Tiki Village was way more reasonably priced ($109 plus resort fee for a 2 BR condo) than the other "super-pool" properties I researched (like Hilton Bonnet Creek or Disney Beach Club) and offered full bedrooms, a kitchen and w/d amenities, not just a hotel room. I was pleasantly surprised by the nicely finished interior and furnished screen porch. We had such a hard time prying the kids out of the main pool that we missed our dinner reservations, the 5 year old went nuts on the 5 waterslides. There is a separate gated baby pool but the 3 year old insisted on playing in the "big kid pool." They have surrey bikes, shuffleboard, pedal boats, basketball, tennis, a sandy playground, hot tubs and a fitness center. Nice aquarium in the lobby. The only downside is that Shipwreck Sally's is just a lunch and early dinner poolside bar and cafe so you have to go off site for breakfast or bring supplies. There is a Publix grocery 1/4 mile west and a ton of restaurants along Route 192. The resort is about 8 miles from Disney. If they offer a time share presentation while you are picking up maps, tickets etc at the service desk, just politely decline. I did not feel pressured at all. I would totally stay here again, recommend it for families with tots to teens.

Reviews.Title: “An incredibly pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: PlayaFamily
Reviews.Content: Our plans to stay with relatives fell through at the last minute and with only a few days before our trip to Orlando, my wife came across Liki Tiki Village on Trip Advisor. With three children in tow, my wife and I were loathe to spend a week in a hotel room enjoying family "togetherness." With incredibly low expectations, we booked a very reasonably priced week at the resort. Upon arrival we checked into a lovely two bedroom villa (all the three bedroom villas were already booked) with a sizable living/dining area and a full kitchen. The decor was updated and the room was very clean. You can't beat the amenities available on property. The water park was small, but the kids (ranging from 6-12) had a blast. We went paddle boating once and didn't get a chance to play mini-golf or ride on of the available surrey bicycles. The staff was courteous and helpful. The property is a timeshare property, and we knew enough not to answer the phone to avoid the hard sell ;). All in all, we will likely go back. It was convenient to everything, yet set back enough from the hustle and bustle of the area.

Reviews.Title: “3 D's and a T!!”
Reviews.Author: ThreeDsandaT
Reviews.Content: Hello to anyone who is planning to stay at the Liki Tiki Village. I did ALOT of research prior to staying at this resort and my family and I consisting of a 17 year old daughter a 12 year old daughter myself and my husband really enjoyed ourselves at this resort. It was clean, people were so friendly, had no problem enjoying the pools always found loungers, enjoyed the food and overall the experience was GREAT. There was no pressure to sit in on the 90 minute meeting, but if you were interested in purchasing a time share in Orlando sit in on the meeting and take advantage of their cheaper rates for the attractions. The Super Wlamat is only 5-7 minute drive which was so handy when purchasing groceries. It is also a GREAT place to buy the Disney souviners. Kissimmee was GREAT, this was our first time in Orlando and will go back many more times. We have vacationed in California, Las Vegas, Utah, Mexico and Cuba but Orlando and the Liki Tiki will be our love for the next few years. We also enjoyed the fact they had the two pools our family sat in the sun at the larger pool during the day and in the evenings we went to the smaller pool. In closing this was a great place to stay, I am telling all my friends who are planning a family vacation wanting to see Flordia and not wanting to break the bank account.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: katie b
Reviews.Content: me and my husband visited liki tiki village for our honeymoon for a 2 week break from the uk back in nov 2011, i was pleasently suprised when we arrived at the resort, check in was smooth and flawless, the staff were very helpful upon our arrival. we arrived to our room which was a bit dated but not overly disapointed as we planned to be out enjoying the sights rather than sitting in watching tv complaining about the decor. i have to say it wasnt the the best start for me as whilst unpacking we discovered our safety deposit box was broken !! we called reception and had several guys look at our box with no success ( 2 hrs later) i was starting to get annoyed as i was excited to go out and explore and eat after a long flight this wasnt the best start, finally it was sorted and i could explore florida !! later that evening ( after a few drinks) we arrived home, to my horror as i walked into the toilet i saw the most hideous cockroach i have ever seen ! i was devastated as our honeymoon wasnt having the best start to what should have been the best holiday of our lives, my husband tried to tackle the beast but it ran under the bath, i then spent the next 2 weeks petrified it would return ( i have a huge phobia of bugs ) i called reception a couple of times to report this i was told someone would be up to our room to sort out the issue but noody ever arrived!! highly disapointed. i also found that it took forever to bring clean towels and toilet tissue, apart from my moans i found the accomadation ok nothing special, but just what we needed, perfect location !! we had an amazing honeymoon i just wish we had stayed elsewhere. x

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: susans1007
Reviews.Content: Took my nephew to Liki Tiki Village last week and was pleasantly surprised. Nice accommodations, great water park and other activities. We stayed in the 800 building and had a view of the water park but it is noisy with the DJ at night. Staff was very attentive and friendly especially Victor. Definitely for kids though but my nephew loved it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing - 4/10 to 4/15/2012”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: Where to start?? Well upon arrival after trying to find this place in the dark, which by the way, the directions on their website are not good to follow. If you do decide to stay there, turn right onto Avalon Rd, off 192 West, then immediate left onto Bali Blvd. So we finally get there and are greeted by someone with no name tag, no introduction, no welcome, just "You need something?" Seriously, this is how I was greeted. Not to mention, I then feel bad because her attitude was that I was interrupting her evening or something. She shows me a park map of where our building and room is and I asked twice if there was anything closer to the lagoon. All I got was a look and the response, "this is where your room is..." Great customer service there!! I was then told about the resort fee and additional fee for a pack-n-play. Which was fine, I knew that ahead of time and was ok with it. Then I was told that if I lost a key card for the room, or it needed to be reprogrammed, it was a $10 fee, after I got 4 keys for the family. Upon getting to the room, only 2 worked, the other 2 never did but for fear of being out an additional $20 we just made do with the 2 keys. Then I'm told there would be additional fees if the pool towels in the room were not returned. What kind of "resort" doesn't have pool towels at the pool? Then I'm told to go see this guy at the guest services desk. He then hands me a packet of restaurant options, tries to sell me park tickets and all that and then I was free to go. Of course, looking back, he was the nicest person I interacted with the whole time there. So then we get to the room, what a joke. When sitting on the couch, you may as well just have sat on the floor. The bathrooms were disgusting with dirt and hair on the floors. The tub in the master bath looked as though it hadn't been cleaned or much less even wiped down in about a good year or two. The shower head had not had a good cleaning in about 10 years with mold and lime build up all over it. The sprinkler head in the kitchen area had so much gunk and dust on it, that it was literally hanging down from it!! God forbid there was a fire, I don't think the water could spray from it! The refrigerator door had a big dent in it, which really, no it doesn't affect anything, but it shows that if you don't care what your rooms look like, you obviously don't care about your guests. The kitchen floor was full of dust and dirt and good Lord, don't look to the right of the fridge on the floor between the cabinets!! Nasty!! And then there were little gnats or some type of bugs constantly on the counters. No matter what, we could never get them to go away! So I decided to call the front desk and ask to be moved. First call, let it ring for several minutes, no answer. Tried again a few minutes later, no answer. Kids were hungry and cranky, we'd been traveling all day so we decided to just get them fed and to bed and I went to Wal-Mart and purchased our own cleaning supplies and my wife and I decided to clean the room up ourselves to be accceptable. Although, you're better off picking up the carpet with your hands as the vacuum left in the room was worthless. I think it was actually a toy/pretend one. I figured housekeeping would be in the next day and I would tell them about it. Nope!! Little did I know that if I wanted even the slightest bit of housekeeping, it was $29.99 per day. Full housekeeping was $39.99 per day!! Seriously?? You're a "resort" yet you don't have simple house keeping? I've stayed in $35/night rooms and had full housekeeping!! Oh but there's a note that says that's why they have in room washer and dryer so you can do your own. Gee now that's what I think of when I think vacation...cleaning my own towels and pool towels, etc. So on the second day, we had gone through the 3 garbage bags they give you for the kitchen trash. So I called housekeeping at 1:45pm and asked if I could get garbage bags or if I would be charged. The lady on the phone chuckled and said, "no charge, I will send some right over." By 6pm when we left for dinner, no bags had shown up. We returned at 10:30pm and still no bags. I called the front desk and again, so sorry to have bothered them but I got the "(sigh..) I don't know why they didn't get there, but I will send some over". 25 minutes later they finally dropped off a whopping 3 more bags. Good thing I saved the Wal-Mart bags!! But no matter, you have to take out your own trash to the trash shoot which had oh just the most so pleasant odor!! I really love wretching from the smell every time I have to take out my trash on vacation!! Now I will say the kids had fun playing 'who can kill the most bugs' and they especially liked the giant spider in the living room that we affectionately decided to name him Herb. They think he went to the neighbors, but he went to spider heaven while they were sleeping. We especially liked the free waterfall in the master bathroom toilet everytime the room above flushed their toilet. Yep right from the vent in the ceiling down on to the toilet. Not so much fun when my wife was sitting there, now that was a scream for a horror movie!! OH and if you do stay here, be prepared for the constant calls every day wanting you to take time out of your vacation to try and have them sell you your own condo there! Now if you all really want to try and pull that on guests, improve the condos first!! And do something about the nasty well water....the water literally smelled coming out of the showers and sinks. Now let's talk about the lagoon and pools. First the pool outside our building, was open till Midnight, which I wouldn't mind so much if it was just open. But the blaring music and the constant water splashing from the mushroom thing at the kiddie pool was enough to make you insane!! And that mushroom for the kiddie pool area, yeah, real nice if you want hypothermia!! I have never in my life seen water that cold for a kiddie pool area. Not that the main pool was much better and I'm all about cooling off in the heat, but no joke, someone could die from water that cold!! The main pool, well let's just say, obviously you all don't hire people to clean your pool. Nasty, nasty, gross!! So we tried the lagoon, because after all, that's the big attraction here right? NOT!! You have 600 some rentals and about 35 to 50 chairs at the lagoon!! We got there shortly after it opened at 10am and there was no where to sit at all!! Oh wait, that was part of the resort fee was to use the lagoon. So where was my family of 5 witih an infant supposed to sit for the day?? I asked the lifeguard and his response was, " oh well, not sure what to say, most people get here right at opening and stay for the day." Hey thanks buddy, great help there! So we then loaded everyone back in the car, yeah that's right, had to drive over to the lagoon and back to the room. Needless to say, the kids were disappointed but we did get back there a few days later by getting there really early. Now I would have thought that with the resort fee for use of the lagoon, the amenities there would be included...oh no!! You pay for everything you want to do there, activities, temp tatoos,etc. So i'm still having a hard time figuring out what the additional resort fee was for? Why not just make it part of the per night room charge?? So by the 4th call from the guest services folks trying to sell me a condo, I told them never in my right mind would I ever invest in that place much less ever stay there again!! His response was pretty much an I don't care attitude and told me to have a good night. Honestly folks, do your homework, this place is a rip off and a joke. The photos on their website are photo shopped and I can assure you, the reviews on here that praise this place, were written by the management or ownership staff. Every person I talked to at the pools or in passing had the same complaints and not one person I came across said anything good about it. If you do go there, stay away from room 641E. Unless you already live in a box on the streets of Chicago or something like that, this place is worthless. Once we get the pix off the camera I'll upload the pix of the nasty room, the bugs and everything that was supposed to be so wonderful according to their website. One thing I forgot to take pictures of was how black our socks and feet would get after walking on the carpets every day. The shame of it is, the resort, if I can call it that, really has a lot of potential. But do you really need to charge $1 per page if you need to print something out from the business center? Anyway, the place really does have very good potential. There are a lot of other things that happened and I can sum it all up from saying, your entire staff need lessons on basic customer service. It would be really great if someone that knew what they were doing could buy this place and manage it appropriately. Otherwise, it was extremely disappointing and I will be sure to let everyone I ever talk to know about it. I'll be sending this review to every travel site I can find. No I really don't have that kind of time but trust me folks, if this place was to go out of business, it would be a blessing for other folks to not waste their time or money to stay here.... Oh and I would be more than happy to discuss this with anyone from Liki Tiki management that cares to hear it. Even though when I checked out yesterday and asked for a manager, I was told there wasn't anyone around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Disney...”
Reviews.Author: Fandangos
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before coming out to Disney and the Liki lived up to expectations. I was there from the 25/03 - 06/04 with my wife and two girls and we got a 1 bedroom apartment for around £620 (Jan sales) for 12 nights which was an absolute bargain. Driving to all the Disney parks was extremely simple and took around 15 to 20 mins although getting to Universal Studios took around an hour although we may not have taken the quickest route but thats what the SatNav said! There are loads of places to eat on the 192 road but they are mainly junk food type places or cram as much into your mouth for $10 but there were some nice restaurants nearby and I can recommend Houlihans for a nice steak or ribs. The main 192 road which runs past the Liki is quite tacky with lots of 'bargain' gift shops and "we buy your Disney ticket" shops but it's not too bad and there are interesting places to visit and a Walmart and Publix nearby. I was really impressed with the resort itself, check in was a breeze and the apartment was how I expected it to be in terms of decor but actually bigger. As long as you get it into your head that your accommodation is not 5* you will not be disappointed, think of it more as a home from home with everything you need to function normally as a family such as oven,iron, bath, shower, washing machine, dining table and chairs, living area, dining area etc etc. I would probably go for a 2 bedroom place if you have two children but if you are on a bit of a budget the one bedroom with pullout sofa bed in the living area is definitely doable and my girls did not moan once about being uncomfortable. The pool areas are quite nice and if you have small children the will love the swimming pool around Shipwreck Sally's, there is a quieter pool if you want it although this can get pretty noisy if you get a bunch of school kids having a bombing session. We stayed in block 400 which overlooked the 'quiet' pool. At first we got a little annoyed that you had people shouting and swimming in the pool until 12 at night but after a while we got used to it and once you had a tiring day at one of the parks and closed the patio doors you did not really hear it. In the end I liked over looking the pool because my girls could go and have a swim after the parks whilst my wife and I had a wine on the balcony keeping an eye on them or joining them. Apart from that we didn't really use any of the ammenities apart from the gym which was a bit small but had just about enough to get rid of the calories including free weights and bench, running, cycling and cross trainer. Would I recommend this place to anyone else, most definitely. Would I go back myself, probably not, personally I think once you have done the Disney parks you do not need to do them again and the Liki Tiki is great for the Disney parks. Universal Studio's is a different matter and I would like to go back in 2 years time and do that again plus Busch gardens but I will probably stay somewhere closer next time. My tips: if you want to save a fortune on direct flights to Orlando fly to Miami and hire a car and drive 3.5 hours to Orlando, it's easy. To be honest I could have done the flight and drive in one day but we stayed in Miami for one night before setting off to the Liki. Take a pack lunch or snacks to the parks and eat somewhere nice after you come out. The parks are full of over priced, fast food rubbish which just isn't worth it. I'm not a health freak but I actually lost weight after nearly 3 weeks in and around Disney, the food is serious heart attack material and I couldn't stomach it after a few days. If driving and staying a length of time take your own UK SatNav and download us maps before you go, car companies charge around $10 a day. That's it, have a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places”
Reviews.Author: Marty M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The facilities are nice, but a good distance from many of the units. Members get far better treatment than renters, which turned us off. They offer deals on theme park tickets that are not a deal and want you to listen to a 90 minute sales pitch that ends up being 2-3 hours if you don't have the discipline to tell them "get lost".

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations make up for location”
Reviews.Author: CoolNJmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 800 building. Perfect location if you want to be near the pool (also can get noisy with screaming kids and loud music, but we didn't mind. Check-in was quick and even though our room wasn't ready when we got there we got a call shortly thereafter informing us room was ready. Accommodations are very comfortable. Kids enjoyed their full size beds and own bathroom and we appreciated having our own privacy (king size bed, shower and jacuzzi). As people commented kitchen is a little outdated but who cares? you're only there for a few days. We barely got to enjoy the facilities since we were at the Disney parks all day long. Drive to any of the parks was about 20-25 minutes. There is a Publix supermarket about 2 min from the hotel so that was convenient. Unfortunately, on our last night there we got a family next to our room (adjoining rooms) and it was painfully loud. We waited until 11pm to call security to have them quiet down. We are the kind of people that can sleep through anything but they were so loud we could hear their conversations. Also, TV was loud. And apparently they had invited another family to their room (that was staying in the same resort) so at a point there were about 10 people there!!! It wasn't until about midnight that it got quiet but they were up again around 7am and loud as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Honestly, we were gone most of our 4 night stay but the room was perfect for a family of 6. We stayed in a 2BR/2BA (in the 1000 building) and were overall pleased. The resort decor needs some upgrading as well as upgrades to a flat screen TV (not a true necessity but definitely a perk) and grout cleaning on the tile. We had a couple of maintenance issues; stopped up sink, lights not working, but these were resolved VERY quickly. There is no daily housekeeping, which is truly fine with me as I don't like the idea of people coming in and out every day. We did pay for housekeeping to come and do a full cleaning in the middle of our stay. The room was cozy and clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool area was fantastic and the staff was nice and easy to deal with. We weren't there to experience any of the activities but the schedule was impressive. The WiFi definitely needs improvement and was the only downer of the trip as we are business owners and needed to check on some things while there and couldn't because of the spottiness. I would definitely stay here again, though. I liked the close proximity to a grocery store, restaurants and Disney (the reason we were in FL).

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki -Our young family gives it 2 thumbs up! LISTof what to expect your condo to have:”
Reviews.Author: johnandjenk
Reviews.Content: Read on if you would like to know what to expect of your condo. We stayed in the 700 building, which had been recently renovated, in a 2 bedroom condo. The condo itself is a bit dated in the kitchen with the cabinetry and florescent lighting, but it felt really ended up feeling like home. The carpet, like people have mentioned was looking a bit dirty, but I didn't mind to much for the price. Everything else was pretty clean including the beds which had nice clean sheets and were very comfortable. The air conditioning worked wonderfully, especially for a week that was hitting 90 degrees! The kitchen was equipped with the basics and we were able to do all we wanted with what was there -Full refrigerator, freezer with ice maker, microwave, dishwasher, a few pots and sauce pans, a block knife set on the counter -with steak knives and other knives. A coffee maker with 1 coffee packet -if you are a coffee drinker you will need to bring coffee and filters. A blender, a 4 slot toaster, a cutting board and a few basic serving and cooking utensils -the basics, but all we needed. Included in our room was a couple rolls of toilet paper (one set for each bath), hand bar soap, body soap, shampoo and conditioner, towels, wash clothes, hand towels, POOL towels (if you loose these you have to pay for a replacement), liquid dish soap and new scrub sponge, 1 (or 2) dishwasher detergent packs, 2 laundry soap packs. I would recommend taking a small amount of dishwasher detergent (or tabs) if you plan to eat in some, it's nice to run the dishwasher and not worry about running out. I also bought laundry detergent and some fabric softener sheets. They also had a few trash bags so you could empty the trash every couple days. Yes the pool hours are limited from 10am to dusk, but there are plenty of other things to do like mini golf, shuffleboard, ride the 2 or 4 person bikes, tennis, basketball, and they have a small playground for the kids. The reason for the "lagoon" or waterpark to close at dusk is for safety of the kids swimming. We ate a Shipwreck Sally's after hearing about the all you can eat fish fry on Friday nights. It was a great meal to have for our last night. The food was good. Although we were right near the basketball and tennis courts, I never had trouble sleeping. Things always seemed to quiet down around 10pm every night and even though we were right next to a family we could only hear them during the day (through the adjoining rooms). We did have a large grasshopper-type bug that we caught and put outside along with a little lizzard that got in! :) But, we just made sure not to leave the doors open and keep the lights off when you are entering at night. It's Florida, there ARE bugs people! They have a small vacuum and broom with dustpan. That was nice to have to help clean up after eating (kids). We had a couple small problems (one, our vacuum wasn't working properly) and we simply called the number listed near the phone and almost immediately someone was knocking at our door to help us out (replacement vacuum). So, if you have any problems, just call. They want to make sure you are happy. The only complaint is that the internet was extremely slow -but luckily, my husband was there on vacation and really didn't need to do business. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations and activities”
Reviews.Author: ald3114
Reviews.Content: We traveled 17 hours by car from up north and arrived at 830am. Which is significantly prior to stated check in, however our check in person had us wait 15 minutes and she found us an available 2bd 2bath condo, which we reserved online via their spring special rate. We stayed in104a, which is a two story villa pool front with kitchen and laundry. The property is peaceful and secluded. The landscape is very photo worthy. We ate on the screened in porch and had an upper and lower balcony. There are plenty of activities, we had smoothies at shipwreck Sally's and did the paddle boats, we weren't pressure about a time share. We were close to shopping and the parks. One of the pools was outside our door . Security was tight. The watermark is nice. The dj adds a nice touch. The gas grills is also and the Internet room are also nice touches. It is easy to find an employee and they are helpful. Breakfast on the balcony was great. The cons: the bathroom and kitchen tile floors are very slippery when wet. The wifi is slow and sometimes nonexistent, except late at night or early in the day. a better mattress needed on the sofabed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Val_In_Turks
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at this family friendly resort close to Disneyworld - must say that the service was extremely good (very attentive, helpful, courteous, etc), and the kids' amenities were very good (including the mini-golf, playground, restaurant, kids' activities, and most of all the MASSIVE waterpark) - also would say that the rooms are a bit dated. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: insightray
Reviews.Content: We were very apprehensive to return to Liki Tiki Village after a disastrous event that occurred 11 years a go at this location. We related our concern upon check-in and the person at the front desk named Jesaida listened and took action to mitigate our consternation. The supervisor of security (Angel Nieces)) met us and assured us this was a much different place today than we experienced in 2001. By the end of the third day we were convinced that was the case. We felt very comfortable and at ease. We were in one of the older town homes. The entire unit had been refurbished recently, all newer appliances, carpet, fresh paint and the most comfortable bed we have ever slept on. We found absolutely no bugs or insects in or even around our unit. Soundproofing must have been added as a family with toddlers was next to us and we never heard them through the walls. Now these older units can never come up to the luxury of the high rise buildings, but we enjoy the town home units more for the more relaxed atmosphere. All of the gas grills were very clean each time we used them. With at least 6 gas grills and even more charcoal grills available, we never had to wait for one. The on site restaurant, Ship Wreck Sally's, offered very good sandwiches at a price that would not break the bank, albeit more expensive than off site but nevertheless a reasonable price for the size of their offerings. A down side was the mandatory fee ($59.00?) or so for the use of amenities. This was a charge per unit. It did include all usage of resort amenities, including the on site water park, bikes, paddle boats, local phone calls and a somewhat high speed Internet. All in all, not a bad deal since it would include everyone in your party. Liki Tiki is best suited when you have younger kids. The water park is great for pre- teens but I would suppose the older teens would get bored very fast. The game room is very nominal. Adults can immerse them selves in the other two pool ares. They have signs up that the hot tubs not for the kids, but that was not enforced. Many times they were filled with pre-teens. Our biggest disappointment that we could not even get close to the hot tubs on many days. Overall, we were made to feel very welcomed and the staff was eager to please. Jesaaida and Angel both went over the top to alleviate our concerns, and it is not often that you can point out any one individual that has really made your trip enjoyable. On this one, two persons stick out and Liki Tiki should be proud of Jesaida and Angel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: avantian
Reviews.Content: For the purpose of full disclosure, we are owners of a Liki Tiki timeshare unit. We had not returned to our "home" resort since a very unfortunate incident that occurred in 2001. Upon check-in this year, we voiced our concern over that problem and the associate Jesaida listened intently and alerted the office about our previous problem. The security supervisor, Angel, met with us and assured us that security has changed dramatically in the past ten years. That turned out to be an understatement as we never felt more secure than we did at Liki Tiki. Upon arrival we saw that our unit, an older townhouse, had been completely refurbished and was immaculate. Didn't even see a fly or an ant during the entire two weeks we were there! The bed was the most comfortable one we have slept in and there was never any noise to wake us. All of the furnishings in the unit were clean and comfortable and relatively new. We used the pool a couple of times and found it to be warm and clean. All the gas grills were spotless as were the charcoal grills. The on site restaurant/bar, Ship Wreck Sally's, served good sandwiches at reasonable prices. The service was great. We were very satisfied with this stay and will return. Couldn't ask for nicer people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: flyinghighFlorida
Reviews.Content: tayed at this hotel with two friends and the kids 3 adults 6 kids 2 bedroom room nothing special but was clean and served its purpose. Fitting us all in. The beds were ok the hotel was off the beaten path a little to far out for my liking but the pool and outdoor amenities were great. the kids had a blast at the pool the outdoor bar restaurant was fun decent food great drinks one night they had a dj and karoke we had so much fun singing and dancing. We had a great three days made up for the average rooms usually like staying at a more upscale hotel but was great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Family resort of choice”
Reviews.Author: JKS903
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Liki Tiki and will return again. We especially love the apartment style condos with the screened in porch. A great place to enjoy a morning coffee! Our unit was clean and well maintained. Extra sheets/pillows arrived promptly. We have never seen any type of insect on any of our visits. We stayed closer to a pool area, not water park as our kids are older. The pool staff was constantly cleaning around the pool, would help move lounge chairs to find the sun, and cleaned the barbeques every morning (which were new and very functionable). The kids loved the dollar bingo and other activities offered by the staff at the water park. The front gate security was always courteous and prompt, and all the staff helpful in finding taxis or restaurants. The only improvement would be the internet connection, which seemed to be hit or miss, but better by the pool. Overall, a great family vacation spot and a favorite for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fma05
Reviews.Content: Despite reading negative reviews about Liki-Tiki Village, we found it to be first-rate. The staff was always above and beyond, very pleasant, and the grounds were kept super clean. They even cleaned the bbq grills on a daily basis. The rooms were spacious. The only downsides to the trip were the v-e-r-y s-l-o-w internet connection and several families who had a total of ten kids with them. They showed very little consideration for everyone in the pool area. However, that can happen at any time and at any place. We will definitely be back to Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Village”
Reviews.Author: beachpop
Reviews.Content: Family vacation 3/21/12 with 4 adults and 2 children under 10. Keith at check-in did a fabulous job finding us a condo near the lagoon where pools, slides and fun in the sun experiences were plentiful. Kids had a great time and we met new friends and had fun conversations around the activities. Excellent security day and night. About 6 miles from Disney entrance, Publix closeby and multiple dinner opportunities nearby. All in all a terrific place for children and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far away from the pool”
Reviews.Author: UALDutch
Reviews.Content: Condo was clean, but noisy. We stayed in 1300 building and you can hear the pool noises, the music from the other resorts, and the next door neighbors. You are charged a $7 per day resort fee, but then you have to pay to rent the fishing poles, etc. Not a fancy place, but clean. I saw no pests, except a raccoon running away with garbage. Took a long time sometimes to get extra towels, etc. Check-in is slow. Location is one street away from HW192 "tourist gift shop overload."

Reviews.Title: “This place is PERFECT for families”
Reviews.Author: flowerde
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Liki Tiki 4 or 5 times. Each time it seems to just get better. Sure it's not the fanciest but I bet you'll have the time of your life. I found the cndos to be very spacious and clean. Grounds are very well maintained and the staff goes above and beyond. The lagon pool(the main pool) will keep the whole family happy for hours. And this is one of the few places that has life guards, and they do a great job watching what is happening. Kudos for that. At night they do Karaoke that keeps things fun and lively. I think that this place keeps all ages happy. Go there you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: leela20_999
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the liki tiki! We had planned for two days to hang by the pool and use the resort amenties and it was fantastic! This place was clean, lots to do, great pools! It was within twenty min of universal, disney, seaworld! Perfect! The only problem is finding it. Our gps couldnt locate the address, it only found the street. And its tucked neatly away, basically look for a 7 eleven, and to the right of it theres a little street, go down that! Theres actually a big billboard for titanic as of now to the right of that street, good luck finding it. Theres a million seven 11s. Its not the one besides mcdonalds! The liki tiki needs a big sign on the road! But beside that u will love it! Go! The price was great for what u get too! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Kathie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and had lots of activities for the kids...I was pleasantly surprised to see a host of lifeguards at the pools... made me feel very safe letting the kids go swimming.The restaurant in the pool had good food and good prices.Our suite was beautiful,spacious and clean.I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: dowcomm
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Liki Tiki resort in March and I have to say that it was a great stay for the family. It did offer lots of things to do for all ages at a great price. Pros: cost, pool, bar, room. Cons: hard to find without a GPS

Reviews.Title: “I don't like it”
Reviews.Author: 123Kimberly
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited LiKi TiKi in July 2011 and let me tell you that the four of us didn't like it. We were supposed to stay for three nights and we barely got through one night. The sofa sleeper was so horrible that my husband and I both needed assistance getting out of it. There was a gap so big under the door that these bugs(foreign to us), large bugs and tiny lizards kept coming in. We had to sacrafice some towels and stuff them under the door. The beautiful pool area was pretty but the area that for the children was closed and taped off. If the kids can't enjoy themselves and you can't sleep for the bugs and the sleeping arrangement,what do you do? You leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Seanont
Reviews.Content: This was our first year of visiting Florida with out going to Disney or Universal so we were looking for a resort that could keep our kids (7 & 9 ) occupied. After researching we choose the Tiki based on price and amenities. The location is just a little out of the way, about 15-20 minutes away from Disney but has a good selection of restaurants and shopping close by. The resort is gated with security working the front and with no neighboring hotels or homes, so I would say it is a very safe location. We were in the 800 Building in a 2 bedroom condo on the 4th floor over looking the water park. The condo was a good size with a nice master bedroom with a king bed private bathroom with a shower and separate jacuzzi tub. the living room had a pull out couch and the other bedroom had a two beds. The unit had a full kitchen and washer and dryer.. The styling could use some work but over all no major complaints and for the price we paid a very good value. We enjoyed the view of the water park and grounds but this could be loud for some so ask for a different location if you want peace and quite. The unit was clean and we did not see a single bug. Their is a resort fee that includes WiFi, Water park, Bikes, Paddle boats, Mini Golf, Fishing equipment, tennis rackets, basket balls. The main water park is nice geared more for kids under 12 and I was very impressed with the life guards and how attentive they were. This is not a huge water park like Great wolf lodge or wet and wild but still nice. They have a bar and restaurant if you want food or some drinks. They have sign saying no outside coolers but they didn't seem to enforce it. The park closes at 6:30. They have two other pools that are open to 12 one of which has some gas barbeques. other amenities were nice tennis courts and a smaller basket ball court which was always busy. The Mini golf was okay and only had nine holes but fun for the kids. Internet was slow and a times even slower. Bikes were fun and paddle boats a workout. The Exercise room was too small but we opted to walk and exercise out side As long as you have realistic expectations of how much your paying or not paying this is a great family resort. It is a time share resort but out side of a couple phone messages asking if we were interested in attending we were not pressured to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Neat, Well-Organized...Just Check Your Receipt”
Reviews.Author: KC71
Reviews.Content: Stayed from March 12 to March 15, 2012 with 3 kids in a one-bedroom condo in 1200 building. Grocery story right around the corner, lots of restaurants on route 192, so location is not too bad - but bit far from main attractions (says it's minutes away from Disney, which is true, if there is no traffic and you hit green light all the way, otherwise, it's more like 20mins). Condo is clean and functional with washer and dryer (which was extremely useful-they provide one package of laundry detergent per day) and fully equipped kitchen. Towels were thread-bare, so may want to bring your own. Pool area was very nice and with the wonderful weather, bit crowded (hard to find a chair to sit on) and general atmosphere was good. They did close the pool on Tuesday, due to "clean-up" - possible accident. My older kids (13 and 11) were bored quickly, but the youngest (3 years old), couldn't get enough. The water slides were very fun and water was not too deep, so he totally loved it. Beach towels were also provided by the resort. The on-site restaurant was OK (we had the pizza and ingredients were not fresh, but edible) and prices reasonable. The only problem we had was that they double billed us for the resort fee and if we hadn't read the bill, would have left it unnoticed, so make sure you ask for a receipt upon check out and read it. This is our first time at an Orlando resort. It works very nicely for our family. Will definitely try it again, but maybe a different resort, just to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wondeful time..;0)”
Reviews.Author: Lynnette L
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful, check in was a breeze. We stay in a 1 bedroom condo. It was very clean, and was stocked with everything. There were no bugs.... We stayed in building 1200, just a short walk to the pool. My boys 5 and 13 had a blast!! They didn't want to leave. This place was beautiful. Many activites for the family to enjoy. The staff at the resort are very friendly. Disney is only about 10 mins away. There are many shops and places to eat near by. We loved it!!!! And for the price!!!! This place can't be beat!! They do ask if you would like to tour the resort, but I declined and it was no pressure, still very friendly.. I will surely return for another visit...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place....Don't believe the haters!”
Reviews.Author: Terralln
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at here 3/10-3/15 (1100 building) & I LOVE it! As soon as we pulled up I was impressed, the grounds are beautiful & very well maintained. We are in a one bedroom & they have thought of everything, it is very well stocked. Close to grocery stores. We have brought 2 teenagers & they have not been bored once. They are having a blast! The price was unbeatable & it included wi-fi, bikes, paddle boats & waterpark. The waterpark is VERY nice! We haven't had any pressure to attend a time share meeting. They tell you once that was it. Also, you recieve a free 5x7 vacation photo! We did not go to any Disney parks & this resort has kept us plenty busy. Gas grills offered by the pool area in front of resort...nice touch! This place is hardly in the middle of nowhere. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't have to leave the hotel, next time we won't!!!”
Reviews.Author: RankinRacing
Reviews.Content: I knew when check in only took 10 minutes things were off to a good start. They just got better and better. Our 2 room suite was unbelievable for the price. Top floor, overlooking the waterpark and main activities area. So many activities. Next trip our daughter does not even want to leave the hotel!!! Grocery store nearby, close to Orlando attractions, GREAT WATERPARK!!!! They even supplied the initial amenities for the dishwasher and washer and dryer...yes a washer and dryer. So nice to go home with mostly clean clothes and not have to do laundry immediatly. I really can't say how great this place is. We will be returning next year. No, we were not in the least pressured about a timeshare presentation!! Asked at check-in and never again. No harrassing calls either!! Just a great place for the whole family. Definately family oriented! We cannot wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay from 3-1-12 to 3-8-12”
Reviews.Author: lsteeves23
Reviews.Content: Check in - as expected expect we booked through book-it where we were promised a 2 person jacuzzi tub ended up with a old jetted tub for one, which we didnt use. One Bedroom - Spacious and nice to have seperate bedroom from living area. Furniture very dated and tile cacked in bathroom. Stayed in 900 building 5th floor last room. Wi-fi free and terrible to get connected in a week we may have stayed online 15 mins and not for lack of trying. TIP** take your own toilet paper the stuff supplied was horrible. Pull out couched needed to be replaced mattress was horrible. Patio door did not lock we were 5 floors up and last rooom on corner we knew it wouldnt be a seciurity issue, but needs to be fixed. Overall, for pricepoint it was good at 77.35 CAD a night. We would return again even with minor complaints. Waterpark - slides only for kids, pool near tiki hut in water was very dirty with leaves and pool filters were always clogged. Only complaint was it closed at 630pm so we didnt get as much use as we hoped. Did not know there was a hotub until almost last day. My 5 year old enjoyed the slides very strong currents but were hours of fun. Grounds - very well kept, no signage from main road ? Overall it was a good place to stay, did not see any bugs and clean for the mostpart.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: CheapEnglishman
Reviews.Content: Far away but otherwise okay. We had real trouble finding the place. Our GPS got us close but not onto the right street. It is not in Kissimmee as we thought, unless the city has moved its boundaries. However once we got there it’s not in a bad location for Disney. It’s quite some way to Universal. On check in the guy was very uninterested. First thing that annoyed me was the “It is prepaid, however there is $15 for resort fees to be paid on checkout”. (We were there 2 days so I guess it’s $7.50 per day). On asking what it was for it’s basically for the wifi and facilities (pool, bikes, mini golf) The rooms are a good size, with a full kitchen, living room and one bedroom (I think they do 2 and 3 room condos). The room supplies are not replenished during your stay, so when you run out of toilet paper you are on your own. So much for the $7.50 a day. You get free wifi but no toilet paper. The pool is a pool with water slides. It is not a waterpark as is highlighted. It’s a good size and you will enjoy it but I just want you to be realistic in your expectations. The onsite restaurant is a snack bar and all food is grilled or fried. No desserts. I probably wouldn’t return because of the geographical location not because of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort... As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Michelle K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki tiki Village from 2-25-12 to 3-1-12. The rooms are very roomy and as advertised. Full Kitchen, family room, seperate bedroom. The resort is easy to get to, a 10 minute drive to Disney, other attractions and is close to many shopping and dining oportunities. The resort is secure and tranquil...you feel as if you are at home. The main attraction is the acquatic park which has water slides and swimming for younger kids (ages 1 - 10). The water park is targeted towards kids 10 and younger so the water slides and swimming will probably be dull for older kids. The water park features Shipwreck Sally which provided poolside bar with TVs, music, and food. The only bad thing is that the aquatics park was only open from 10:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. We were able to use the "regular" pool and hot tub area during the later times. The staff was very responsive to our requests and fixed issues promptly. Staff was friendly and professional. There were no hidden fees. There is an extra daily fee to have housekeeping straighen your room and make your bed. This is optional and is only selected upn request. We were gently requested to listened to a timeshare presentation but we declined. They were not pushy about this request. The lobby has a large fantastic acquarium with many interesting fish. The internet is free, but is very, very slow. We were not able to get a signal in the far north building which our room was in. Overall experience is this is a great resort, friendly staff, great rooms, great value and best of all a waterpark that our family enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth F
Reviews.Content: Everything was close by - lots of restaurants, grocery stores, and shopping areas to chose from. At the resort, if at any time you needed to call and ask for someone to come to your unit for any type of problem, they arrived quickly (sometimes within minutes). The only negative comment would be that a much larger exercise room is needed. On a positive note, I would like to compliment one particular employee (Gerry Laporte) that worked the evening shift at the main office. He had the most delightful personality; he was very knowledgeable and professional. Overall - a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: RandyDz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 821F from Feb 27 to Mar 2. This was a second floor one bedroom unit in the 800 block, which backs on to views of the pond, park, and main kid pool area. The resort was perfect for us as we have a 3 year old and 6 month old, and your kids can have as much fun on the resort as they will at expensive Disney sites. We rented a pack and play fold up playpen from the resort which our 6 month old slept in and our 3 year old slept on the pull out couch. We spent about $200 at Walmart on groceries and we cooked all but two meals in the well equipped kitchen in our unit. The in room laundry was also very convenient. The pools are great for young kids as there is a zero entry area, numerous water slides of different speeds, and a kid pool which was very warm and shallow. Our 3 year old had a blast with the mini putt and paddle boat rides. You can see turtles and alligators in the pond. We never had any issues with bugs in our room. I had read some negative reviews about this prior to going, so we just made sure we kept all of our food in the fridge or boxed/bagged in drawers. We never left a drop of food or juice laying around, and never left our patio door open, why take the chance if you know it will attract bugs? The rooms all have a vaccuum and brooms so take advantage of them. We avoided the time share presentation, which they try to draw you to by offering discounted attraction tickets. We bought two tickets to SeaWorld/Aquatica for $100 from a discount ticket seller located across the 192 road (if we had purchased through the resort it would have been $180). The resort is about 20-30 mins from Orlando and we also went to Cocoa Beach on the East Coast which was approx 1 hour drive. We also used Babys Away and rented a jogging stroller, exersaucer, infant car seat, large beach umbrella, and a high chair (the resort only had wooden ones) and they drop off and pick up to the front desk at the resort.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Syracuse, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “This property is a Hit or Miss....Very close to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Voncia A
Reviews.Content: We arrived on February 20, 2012 and stayed until February 26, 2012 in room 820F. We were told that your rooms dont get cleaned unless you stay at least 10 days, so we had to clean the tub, and make the beds ourselves. There were 3 of us, myself, my husband and 15 year old daughter. We had a one bedroom attached to the bathroom with a telephone and flat screen TV and also a livingroom with a pull out couch and flatscreen TV. There is a full kitchen with all cooking essentials, you have to buy your own food. You can definitely here the people in the next room talking if you have an adjourned room condo. There is a washer and dryer in the bathroom and 4 small packages of laundry detergent were supplied in the room. Unfortunately, we also had roaches. I called to the front desk and they sent pest control. Pest control left a card letting me know that they had sprayed the condo. I was also disappointed with the price of wi-fi...$8 for a day or $32 for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if it wasnt for the "time share" people pushing”
Reviews.Author: Joakim R
Reviews.Content: Spent one week over New year at this place. Very nice family place. Only bad thing was that they tried to sell apartments to us. Was almost like a religious sect trying to convince you how good deal it was. Our apartment was in a very good condition. Nothing to blame on. Good to have our own kitchen. Nice neighbourhood close to all disney and universal parks. Can recommend this place, but please don't go on the meetings for apartments. They promise you lots of things for free, but it really isnt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Young Family”
Reviews.Author: stephaniemck
Reviews.Content: We visited this location with my husband's parents, sister and our niece. We are a young married couple with no children. The location is very secure with someone constantly at the gait checking all vehicles. We were in building 1300 and enjoyed our two bedroom suite. It had a full kitchen and laundry facility. The hotel is fairly close to an area with lots of shopping, restaurants, etc. We were about a 10 minute drive from Animal Kingdom and 20 minutes from Magic Kingdom. *All parks are connected with some transit system* Housekeeping came in mid week to change the beds. Front desk was very helpful, especially when we needed assistance when our niece became ill. I suggest buying tickets at the desk for the park during dinner hour so you don't have to wait. All passes were similar price at the park gate. Our 3 year old niece loved the water park area. The water was clean and warmish. The paddle boats were nice to try along with the mini putt. There is a more 'adult' pool. Children are still there but it is typically a more quiet setting. The hot tub was small but we had gorgeous weather and did not use it much. The food that we ate at the hotel was great. You can call down your dinner order and it will be ready within 15 minutes. Overall, great little place for people with young children. I wouldn't want to take adolescents as they may find it mundane. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for our convention purposes”
Reviews.Author: deniselagrange5
Reviews.Content: During a recent convention in Orlando, we swapped an Interval Week for a 2 bedroom unti Liki Tikki Village. While it is not comparable to our Marriott timeshare in overall experience, we did find that it fit very well for our purposes. We didn't have any problem with pests as other guests have mentioned. However, the master bath shower did have a definite problem with the pan and it creaked when you showered. Although it was a bit cool, there were children swimming in the pool and parents watching sports at the bar/restaurant there. I wouldn't hesitate to bring my children here in the summers. Convenient to Disney attractions and lots of restaurants, grocery stores and Target within a mile.

Reviews.Title: “advoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: We had a first floor bedroom and it smelled of urine. It was infested with ants and roaches. Everytime the 2nd floor unit flushed, it sound like the wall was coming down in a waterfall. There were not enough toilet paper or towels for 4 yet they nickel and dime for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Blast!”
Reviews.Author: Maria2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Liki Tiki. We stayed Presidents week. We were initially booked at another hotel but after reading reviews on trip adviser and seeing the pool with the water slides we decided to cancel and book with the Liki Tiki. We put in for a request to stay in the new section of the resort and they were able to accommodate our request. After checking out the resort we realized all the buildings were very nice and it seemed you really couldn't go wrong with which ever building they put you in. Our villa was clean and spacious. We stayed in building 1300 in a two bedroom. The only complaint I have about the room is that it is an adjoining room and you could hear alot of chatter in that other room. Not sure if they are all adjoining rooms, I will look into that next visit. The kids had a blast in the pool with the slides and we enjoyed the on sight amenities like fishing, tennis, mini golf and bike rentals. We have stayed at the Sheraton and the Westgate and this is our new pick. It may not have the fancy granite counters in the kitchen but it has all the space that the others have for less cost and in my opinion is a much better value! Already planning a stay for next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Daniella1279
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Liki Tiki in a 2 bedroom unit 1020E. We felt right at home. My only complaint is the floor could have been cleaner. When we check in our room wasn't ready yet so we headed out for some mini golf down the street and some lunch. House keeping called me as soon as it was ready. My husband and I stocked the fridge with snack, breakfast foods and drinks for the week. It was nice to have a washer and dryer in the unit. We can back with little laundry! We played a few rounds of mini golf, paddle boats, shuffle board, husband and oldest son played basketball, youngest son played on the play ground and plenty of swimming. Things did close early but we just planned a head for that. The first we went to play mini golf we got there after they closed but the guy let us go on. I thought that was VERY nice. We would love to vacation here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Gemie84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in November/December 2011 with my sister for her 30th birthday. This was my 9th time to Orlando and we always stay in condo/apartments as its so much easier than a hotel. Its about 45mins from Orlando airport and on a dark quiet road so not the easiest place to find. However it is gated with security and very safe and nice and quiet. We had booked a 2 bed apartment as we wanted on our rooms and on arrival i was told we were on the 3rd floor. i am scared of lifts so asked if there was room on a lower floor - the lady on reception was great and immediatley upgraded us to a 2 bed townhouse!! for 2 of us this was massive but i am so glad i asked!! We had a lovely big kitchen with microwave, toaster, coffee maker, oven etc the lounge was huge with a nice big TV and dvd player and boom box (not that we used those). upstairs was a big king size room with generous sized ensuite shower and toilet. The second bedroom had single twin beds and the bathroom and shower was downstairs. Air con was great and so was the heating - odd temperatures being quite cold most nights and warm in the day. Very clean and had loads of towels - the room was cleaned once after the first week which included fresh towels and bed sheets. Parked no problem right outside the house. Had a lovely balcony and downstairs seating area ouside which was meshed off from the bugs. We were situated on the main lake so had a lovely view and it was always very quiet and peaceful - apart from around 930pm when illuminations at epcot was on - this was very noisy. Resort had a lot to offer but we were so busy at the theme parks we didn't have time to use any of them. They left messages everyday for some offer they had or some activity but we just deleted them. Liki tiki is about a 15minute drive to Disney - it is further out that i usually stay but traffic wasnt' too busy so it didn't really matter. in all a lovely place with great staff and i would stay again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family stay”
Reviews.Author: Qbbqgal
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect at 3.5 star resort. Dated and some areas could use fresh up a little. Reasonable price. Loaded amenities. Great pool area. But the wifi is not reliable at all. Target is 2 miles away on 192. 10-15 minutes drive to disney world.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: labonte66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because it was across the street from our friends small home that we were visiting. What a nice surprise! We had a one bedroom villa equiped with everything plus it has a small waterpark and man made beach. This is a wonderful place for a family to vacation and it is close to Disney and all the other attractions. In fact, our daughterand her family want to go in June!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: gwyld
Reviews.Content: We would come back to this resort for sure! Very family friendly. The guy who looks after the paddle boats had only 3 in the water, When I said I'd help him take one of the 5 off the grass into the water he said they were broken. Funny how after I complained, the next day there was only 2 out of the water! That is the only negative occurance the entire week so I won't let that ruin my trip. Trivial but he just hit a cord that I didn't appreciate. Overall we were very happy with the resort and ammedities. Close to shopping, restaurants, etc. Note this is a time share resort and as such they will try to sell you. But a friendly "no -thanks" and you won't be bothered again. You will need a car at this location as well. Lots of shopping nearby and great restaurants. Make sure to visit Miller's Ale House!

Reviews.Title: “Wow....”
Reviews.Author: Joey S
Reviews.Content: This resort was an amazing trip for our family of 4. we had two groups of 4 and the staff gladly found two rooms near each other. the view of the pond was great and we saw a TON of fish swimmig around. it was fun for the kids to explore around the pond and catch all the little lizards. during our stay, we were given special cards to use all the boats(paddleboats) bikes and everything else. you could rent fishing poles and catching bluegill off the dock was very fun. BEWARE....while fishing the alligator in the pond attacked my catch and was accidentally hooked. still very fun...the pools were aimed for younger kids and the hotel was very close to everythinng... the rooms were average nothing special, but hey your in florida why should you stay longer than needed? Overall a greta vacation spot and trip

Reviews.Title: “Great service and beautiful experiences”
Reviews.Author: Ricky G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and it was like a second home, the staff our so helpful and everything is so accessible, there's a Walmart 5 minutes away so you can stock on food and have a BBQ by any of the many pools. Would I recommend anyone to go there.........a big yes, in fact I intend to back next year

Reviews.Title: “I should have booked for 2 weeks!”
Reviews.Author: mazooo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my Florida vacation where I spent my 1st week at Liki Tiki. We were in this very private, and quiet 2 story condo which was 1/4 of a townhouse/villa style building. We had a great screened in porch, beautiful land scaping and close access to a heated pool, fitness center, children's area and spa. I loved all of the amenities- our condo was very clean and the two tubs were both jetted. Liki Tiki also has a water park, poolside bar and grill, mini golf, paddle boats- activities all day long. It's close to all of the attractions, restaurants and stores. The staff was very kind and helpful and the security in the front made me feel really safe. At the end of our first week- I didn't want to leave to go to our next condo and after just spending a week at the second condo, my instinct was right- Liki Tiki felt like home, a home I want to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: trusteeeva
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki Village is the perfect family vacation destination. My family of five have visited for week long stays 3 times since 2007. The proximity to Disney is great. As well as easy access to the highways to other Orlando attractions. The pool area and waterpark are great. Rather than trying to hit the expensive theme parks every single day of our stay, we always like to spend a couple of days just relaxing on the property. There are fun, daily activities for kids of all ages and the Tiki bar is great for mom and dad time. They also have themed activities in the evening, karaoke night, luaus and such. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We were assigned the 1200 building twice and the 1300 one time. Both buildings are close enough to walk to the waterpark but not too close to get the noise. Negatives? Not worth mentioning as they were very few and dealt with immediately. The staff was very friendly and accommodating whenever we had a request.

Reviews.Title: “childhood memory”
Reviews.Author: kealy a
Reviews.Content: I used to live in New York and come here all the time I currently live in Florida now I LOVE this place! I had to wright a review after Debbie Downer wrote a book under my review lol. My experience at Liki Tiki Village over all was great the pool area was amazing I have a big family so we were all having a blast great place for kids, over all the resort is amazing rooms are great I feel like for family its a great place to be although i'm always happy when I go away and make the best of everything I guess you cant make everyone happy haha! Would love to go agian for old times sake.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service”
Reviews.Author: T J
Reviews.Content: Every resort has some issues, there are bugs people, but this is Central Florida. Our villa was extremely clean although we booked the updated building, what they they gave us was ok too. Housekeeping let a jacuzzi overflow in which the water travelled 4 floors below to our tub but we immediately had maintenance and quality assurance there to make sure all was satisfactory. The water only dripped in our tub, no big deal. They had housekeeping clean our villa (although we didn't pay extra for it) and replenish all supplies. They also offered to switch our room but it wasn't necessary. The only thing to be wary of is (and they are a separate entity) the belligerent timeshare salesman, very cheesy used car sales looking. He is rude and deceitful. We had a huge issue with him but the management of the Liki Tiki came to our room in person to see if there was anything he could do to rectify the problem. All in all the customer service was outstanding, they are very quick to respond and accomodate any problems. The waterpark is awesome, pools are clean and warm, and staff very friendly. What more do you want for this price? If you want the Hilton, go pay Hilton prices.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing- Fun- Clean, a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: familywhotravels_11
Reviews.Content: There are 600 units here, so i can imagine in the busy season things can get a little chaotic,however we booked January 19th to the 25th. We were in building 900, second floor. The unit is clean, and you get starters for everything you need. Walmart is 2 miles away, Target and Publix are down the street to get the essentials. You have a washer and dryer, a large living room with pull out couch, huge bathroom with a whirlpool tub, and a bedroom. We also had a vaccuum cleaner which came in really handy with 2 young children, a mop and broom. It is a resort, yet you are essentially leasing a unit for a short stay. It is not a hotel, therefore you do not have housekeeping, nor do you need it since you have everything you need. The deck-balcony was huge complete with a table and 4 chairs. That is part of the relaxing part, that i enjoyed. Any entertainment at shipwreck sallys runs from 5pm to 9pm, so it is quiet by 9pm if you are near that section. The waterpark is fun for all ages. They have waterslides for older kids, zero entry for the younger ones. The toddler pool is large with an octopus fountain in the middle. Pools are heated to 80 degrees. The resort has other pools as well, yet we didnot go there. The resort fees are more than reasonable for what you get, and inexpensive compared to other resorts. You have the surry bicycle rentals which have baskets in front for young children [my 3 year old and 1 year old love it....but i will warn, itis a workout]. The paddle boats my 3 year old loved [It is a florida lake, and with that comes wildlife...], mini golf, tennis courts, shuffle boards, playground with slides and more. I really do not have anything bad to say about it. I heard units 700-1200 have been remodeled. This is our 6th trip to Florida in the last 3 years. TIP for anyone reasearching...do it right the first time and dont cut corners. This area [kissimmee] is loaded with switch and bait...not here.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to next vacation and will rebook w/ Liki Tiki!”
Reviews.Author: JacknTai M
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 from Alaska with three teens (first vacation beyond the west coast states). Loved the accomodations. Staff is wonderful! When taking a break from theme parks, we enjoyed paddle boating, playing mini-golf, basketball and volleyball. The room was clean and saw no bugs as mentioned in previous posts. I agree with others to state Liki Tiki is an excellent value. 2 bedroom suite was spacious and pool side unit highly appreciated. Teens went swimming every evening. Every morning, husband or I took advantage of fitness room. Next time will upgrade to a 3 bedroom unit for added teens privacy. Thank you Liki Tiki for making our east coast visit positively memorable.

Reviews.Title: “BAD PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: cindy l
Reviews.Content: Liki tIki Village is a very bad place please stay away Smelled like urine Bloodstains on the Sheets Cockroach Bugs in Kitchen Mold in the bathroom Dirty Old Never again stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: WestRob
Reviews.Content: This resort is a fantastic place to stay if you plan on coming to Orlando. The rooms are nice and the staff are very friendly. The bar and grill to my surprise had some fantastic food and the bartenders were very friendly. The water park was neat and there are other pools if you wanted a quiet place to relax instead. The music all week was great and the dj on Friday was a blast! Me and my wife didn't expect much for how cheap it was but liki tiki definitely impressed

Reviews.Title: “Bug infested”
Reviews.Author: shadowace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki tiki in January and found a constant streem of ants all over our kitchen counter even though we did no cooking or did not leave any food out on the counters .We also have killed two large ROACHES running across the master bedroom floor other than the bug infestation the place seems ok but you will be asked daily by phone calls to tour there place for the timeshare sales pitch.My recomendation is do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen C
Reviews.Content: I booked this fabulous hotel less than a day before we arrived as our original arrangements fel through. There was a family of five (four adults and one toddler) and we are very comfortable in the one bedroom condo which was COMPLETELY equipped with everything we would need including blender, pots, pans, baking dished, and anything we might need to cook in the condo. They charge a resort fee of about $7 a day which I though was reasonable considering how much they have. I spent an entire day using the amenities: fishing, mini golf, shuffleboard, paddle boats, covered bikes and a children’s water park. It was also really nice to have heated pools we could swim in even when it was only in the 70s most days. And the pools are open till midnight so I could go for a late swim after dinner and drinks. The staff was helpful and friendly and checking in and out was fast, they also let us have an extra hour to check out wich put it at 11 (10 am is already reasonable I think). If I had to say there was any issues it would be that room service didn’t visit at all. If we needed towels(they encourage you to launder them in your in-condo washer/dryer) or pillows or a tidy up or even more paper products we had to request them. It wasn’t difficult, but hotels seem to do that on their own for the most part so that might be the only down side. This was a great time and worth every penny of the reasonable price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: Foreveratraveller40
Reviews.Content: We recently returned after staying at Liki tiki for 8 days in total over Christmas. The Condo's were great - very spacious and the price was very good for the amenities and the size of the unit. I would highly recommend this for a stay with your family. It was also only a 15-20min drive to all the Disney Parks. The highlight is the Water Park - my kids loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take the family!”
Reviews.Author: lisa k
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Liki Tiki over the Christmas Holidays and it was an awesome resort! The rooms were clean and very well kept as was the resort/grounds. We have 2 kids and there were lots of activities for them to do. We especially loved the water park. Liki Tiki is a very safe and secure resort. My husband and I loved the service at Shipwreck Sally's service. I have been to the bar many times over the years and this was by far the best service we have ever had. The bar staff has really improved. The food was good and very reasonably priced. One of the highlights of our stay was singing karaoke and dancing with the DJ. We had a great time! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler570
Reviews.Content: this place was great! i stayed in liki tiki from May 29-June6, 2011, and i couldnt have been more pleased! the water park was fantastic to have fun with the kids, and due to being there for disney world, this place was great for the down time relaxation! The money paid and the atmosphere was well worth it! we will definitely stay here again! Timeshare was introduced and i bought a time share only because i was very pleased with this place! They do not force u into anything like i have read in the past, u completely have a choice if u want to go or not....it is NOT FORCED!

Reviews.Title: “The last review you will need to read”
Reviews.Author: njtravelgirl03
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 Bedroom villa. I also had my family stay in 2 separate 1 bedroom villas. We were in the 1200 buliding from Dec 30-Jan 6, 2012. There are 3 pools.
