One is the Liki Tiki Waterpark. All 3 are HEATED!!CLEAN!! and simply gorgeous! We did not eat at Shipreck Sallys because there are plenty of restaurants in driving range. You absolutely need a car to get around. There is a 7-11 very close but creepy to walk to. Super Target and Walmart all within a 5 minute range. NOT ONE BUG/INSECT to be seen in or around our villas . Since I had 3 units to judge by-they were all remodeled and newer. Do not expect Granite or high end fixtures-but do expect nice flat screen TVs in the 2 bedroom. A nice VCR/DVD combo as well in all units. The 2 bedroom has the hugest Jacuzzi tub I have ever seen at a timeshare-wonderful! The showers in all units had THE BEST WATER PRESSURE!!!! The hairdryers were brand new but kind of weak. I have long hair & it took 15 minutes longer than my home dryer but I managed. NO MAID SERVICE-We have exchanged 10 times in the last 7 years and have never encountered NO MID WEEK MAID SERVICE???.-just weird-but we managed. Tennis courts and mini golf are great. shuffleboard was a blast. They had paddle boats but we didnt use them. The surrey bike rental was so much fun. The weight room had weights,natilus, EFX and 2 treadmills-very clean but very small. Weight room closes at midnight. The pool by the weight room had the nicest BBQ set up. It was far from 1200 bldg but if we needed to BBQ- we would have driven the food over and cooked it with no complaints. Villas have cookie sheets for baking. You can request non stick frying pans for cooking. Bring or buy coffee filters. We were 6 VERY serious coffee drinkers and couldnt believe there was no starter filter for your first day??????????? Do not hesitate to book LIKI TIKI. If you have kids-the waterpark is worth its weight in gold. The 11 and 4 year old in my group were in heaven! Email me with questions. We had ages 4-74 with us and EVERYONE was really happy at this location despite the small inconveniences. You will be so close to Disney Park entrance. We spent 3 days at Universal and it was 15 minutes away. Orlando Premium Outlets are 10 minutes away. hope this helped make up your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive at first about staying here based on some negative reviews but in the end we booked anyway. We stayed over the new years holiday and had a fantastic time. The positives: Easy check in, super clean resort, well appointed and decorated rooms, very secure, close to Walt Disneey World, large water park, friendly staff (Shipwrecks), great BBQ ribs. The only negative was that the large pool with the slides closed very early (around 5 PM) and our kids would have loved to gone to that pool more often especially after a long day at the parks. This resort as a whole went above what we had expected especially with the great New Years Eve party that was free to all guests. It was great not to be nickeled and dimed to death like so many resorts nowadays.In closing....we hope to return again and again and we do give this location a 5 star rating. Thanks Liki Tiki......well done!

Reviews.Title: “Gran lugar, un poco alejado pero valió la pena”
Reviews.Author: FSAURIO
Reviews.Content: Reservamos por Despegar y nos sorprendimos gratamente al llegar. Nuestro "Studio" era realmente muy agradable y espacioso, con una cocina completa y equipada, lavavajillas, lava-secarropas y 2 televisores. Los servicios y las areas comunes son muy agradables tambien, con piscinas para chicos y grandes, minigolf, canchas de tenis, basket y volley. Lo unico que realmente no funciono 10 puntos es el Wifi, en los horarios pico se hacia casi imposible navegar por internet.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Village is a great place for families”
Reviews.Author: telling_the_truth
Reviews.Content: We have owned a condo here since 1995. The water park is still fun for my girls (12 &13 yrs) while my husband and I relax on the pool edge and have a few drinks. We have never gotten a dirty room while staying here (pharoah ants invaded one year so don't leave your Krispy Kreme donut box on the counter!). If you stay for more than 1 week, expect to be locked out of your unit at the end of that week. One year the battery went out in the card reader and maintenance was nice enough to hang out in the adjacent unoccupied unit while he fixed it (it was hot and we would have gone swimming but the suits were in our unit). Other than that, our time is usually relaxing and uneventful. There are grills to use by the swimming pools (not the water park). The resort is gated which lends the thought of safety.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort.....”
Reviews.Author: baligirl431
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the New Year holiday at Liki Tiki Village and it was very clean and a well kept Resort with loads of amenties for the kids, they loved the water park and the wave pool. We loved our time spent at Shipwreck Sally's, the food was great with very reasonable prices, they had lots of food and drink specials, But mostly we had a great time singing Karoke, it was one of the best New Years for us and would recommend it to anyone and encourage everyone to go and see, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice water park”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Nice service too, our family love this resort. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great food!”
Reviews.Author: katie W
Reviews.Content: Shipwreck Sally's food and service were great, and bartenders were quite entertaining! The Punch challenge was a blast and the free T was a great way to remember the trip. Overall the service was great and the waterpark was a great way to relax and pass the time :)

Reviews.Title: “Not as we hoped!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygal27
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Liki Tiki for Christmas and were very much looking forward to spending time there as we had read some fantastic reviews. The receptionist was very helpful and welcoming. She overdid it with the amount of paperwork and information, "this is for your car, this is for the internet wifi, this is for etc etc". We were quite surprised to be told that they were pleased to provide us with a card for "free" access to the facilities at the resort such as the waterpark, like we were lucky and should appreciate it. I would have thought all guests would be allowed to use ALL facilities it comes with the booking. The receptionist advised us that our apartment was located in the 1300 block which was the newly "remodelled block". We arrived at the block which seemed like the farthest away from the other blocks. The apartment seemed nice but the decor was a little old fashioned and the closet just had 3 hangers which was not very helpful and the balcony looked out on to the bush. I made a call to reception and asked if we could be moved as we were there for week and would prefer to look at the pool area or something with a better view and closer to everything. Unfortunately we were advised they had nothing to offer us so we had to put up with it and he advised us the other blocks were not remodelled and as nice so we should stay where we are. He also told us we would have a fantastic view of the Disney fireworks from the balcony which was a bonus. On reading a review below the writer stated that they were told block 1300 was not the remodelled block so perhaps the receptionist did not tell us the truth to begin with (the apartment did not seem refurbished) and we also heard the fireworks but could not see them so we were misinformed about that too. The waterpark is great for children and our son loved it. The only disadvantage was that it opened late at 10am so we had to use the other pool which was a walk away and the waterpark pool closed around 5pm. As this resort is very close to Disney perhaps they should consider accommodating to peoples needs as children would like to play in the pool after returning from parks or early in the morning. The crazy golf and pedalo boats also closed at 5pm which was also a shame. Our son was disappointed that he could not play crazy golf after an early dinner. The facilities close very early! We stayed at a different resort the first week of our vacation and everything closed at 11pm. I took a walk to reception about 8pm one evening and the area surrounding the pool, bridge and children's playground was very dark and quite scary at night especially for a female walking alone perhaps some security/safety lighting on the bridge could be added for safety. On a whole we found the hotel average not as good as we had hoped on reading the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Liki rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Huxter1
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a super time in Dec. at Liki Tiki. From cleanliness to a cool water park with awesome slides to yummy food at good prices, the Liki Tiki rocks on all levels. I highly recommend this resort-kid friendly and parents will love it too-karaoke and dancing made us all giggle. The manager Ron we had met at Shipwreck Sally's even convinced us to hold our forthcoming reunion...so see you soon, Liki Tiki!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Erika Z
Reviews.Content: We came down for a family vacation. The resort was very clean. Lots of things for the kids to do. The water park was alot of fun. We felt safe at this resort. The restaurant, Shipwreck Sally's, was priced very reasonably and the food was good. The staff was very friendly. We had a great time singing karaoke and dancing with the DJ. Would not only recommend this resort to anyone but we will be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “was there on vacation”
Reviews.Author: lance w
Reviews.Content: Had a great time the Resort was clean and safe no time share pressure not like other places me and my girlfriend had a great time at ShipwreckSallys bar &grill bought some shirtss to wear and just had a great time Ron your beverage and food manager was helpfull funny and answered questions and showed us a good time thanks see you next year ...

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: travelingal0702
Reviews.Content: We brought our family down to Orlando the week before Christmas and rented two 2 bedroom condos. The gal that checked us in at first (Dana) was so rude I wanted to walk away but the other gal (Yiya) took over and was very helpful. The first rooms they gave us were close to each other but we needed to change because the setup of the rooms did not fit our needs. Yiya help change us and got us close together in the 1300 building. She allowed us to look at these rooms before they were changed. We liked the accommodations. It was very nice having laundry and dish soap provided. It met our needs wonderfully. The first night the jets on the jacuzzi tub went off every 20 minutes so we had to call maintenance and they came up right away. I do not understand why they charge each room $55 for the use of the resort facilities- especially when everything shuts down at 5pm. The wifi was slow and we couldn't get logged on some days. Then there was a charge for the magic show where they served pop and popcorn. The very well done pizza was an extra charge. It was geared toward the little kids and they each ended up with a sculptured balloon. We are timeshare owners elsewhere and were not bothered by staff about their timeshare offers. We loved the 24 hour security. The grounds are nice. My daughter did have a cockroach fall on her head in the bathroom but it gave us all a good laugh. After all it is Florida and we expect critters. The Liki Tiki Village is a decent place to have a nice vacation and we loved spending time with our family during this Christmas Season.

Reviews.Title: “great location close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Conewago
Reviews.Content: close to highway but set back from it and the noise. close to disney only a short drive away. close to shopping and restaurants. did not spend alot of time here but it was the perfect base camp for a week away. would stay here again. loved the tub in the master bedroom. very romantic set up away from kids bedroom. only negative is the mini golf course could use some work. when it rains it stays wet for days.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Liki Tiki, Same Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: xgozx
Reviews.Content: We reviewed and gave this property a 5 star rating after our first stay in Feb 2011. We just returned from another week long stay at Liki Tiki and have the same opinion again! Wonderful property for a great price at a convenient location. I'll keep this review shorter than our last, but here are some of the highlights. Property is well designed with 24 hour security and is located about 15 minutes west of Disney. Publix and Super Target very close for groceries and many quality restaurants within 10 minutes. Another shout out to our favorite Indian joint, "The Clay Oven", look for the big purple wizard, it's right next door. Check in for us was a breeze. We booked thru Travelocity and had no problems. My Mom and Sister had a separate reservation for the same week. They arrived first and basically choose our two units upon arrival. Liki Tiki accomidated us and gave us side by side units and let us choose where. Keep in mind that early December is a slow season, so this kind of attention may not be available all the time, but we sure appreciated it. We were in unit 209C and it was a much better set up for us compared to the condo buldings. It's a two-story unit with two bedrooms. Great location overlooking the pond and playground, for our kids, that was perfect. Furniture was decent, beds were great, decor was typical rental standard. Well stocked with all needs, towels, tp, sheets, pillows, dishes etc. Overall, quite pleased with this particular unit. Now the minor problems: slow draining tub upstairs and dryer lint exhaust completely clogged. Both problems were handled immediately, within 15 minutes, and they were completely professional in their service. I would suggest to the resort that dryer lint is a huge fire hazard and should be checked more regularly in the future. No dryer exhaust should ever look like ours looked. Yes, it is a timeshare resort, but the only "timeshare invitation" we had to decline for both of our stays this year was at check in. They do call your room from time to time, but we never answered our condo phone and hence, never heard from timeshare salespersons all week. Every staff member from top to bottom was polite, informative and friendly. Shipwreck Sally's pool bar/restaurant has good food at decent prices. Great pools all over, all activities included with resort fee. See their website for activity details. Can't say enough about this property, we are so happy we found it. We'll be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “two week holiday over thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: anne m
Reviews.Content: just got back from liki tiki village, which went way beyond our expectations,dont know how some hotels survive with accomodation like this available ,the apartment was lovely had everything you could need, the complex clean and well maintaines 3 pools and jacuzzis ,one being a Lagoon , that had slides and play equipment, with good lifeguard cover,who were friendly and profesional , the only bad thing for us was we ha difficulty finding the place after a 9 hour flight arriving in the dark,there is no signage visible from the 192 west,the only address we had was Bali boulevard ,which is actually off Avalon Rd off the 192west , The Bahama Bay Resort has a large sig on the 192,it would be helpful if Liki Tika ha the same, once found we soon got over our journey,as the place was lovely ,close to all amenities,very close to Disney via Sherbeth rd around mile marker 5 this takes you straight onto disney propert avoiding traffic , we will definatly be booking again next June ,we had 3 children with us who loved the place aged 12 , 8, an 6 the staff were all more than helpful an friendly the place very secure 24hr security staff on gate ,who were also very nice, thank you liki tiki for a lovely 2 week holiday

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem close to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: chrissykevin
Reviews.Content: A friend who lives in Fl. Recommened this plac. During my searches via Internet this did not pop up on it's own. It is close to Disney. About a 10-15 minute car ride and the resort offers a fun pool and DJ and games and tiki hut during pool hours. They also have a variety of things to do. Paddle boats, playground, fishing, mini golf, bikes. Also a moviethaetre across street that a resort tram brings u too. Kids had a ball. The rooms were clean and updated and very roomy with laundry and full kitchen in e 2 bedroom we had. We stayed for 3 nights and only one was spent in Disney park but they were so busy in resort they didn't even ask if we were going back to parks! Had plenty of kids to play with. Although it says no outside drinks in pool area each day we packed a small cooler and drank them in plastic cups while at pool. No one bothered us but we went in late August so not sure during busy seasons. If going to Disney again would Deinatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: Tommyswally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 600 building, two bedrrom unit. It had everything that we needed, washer and dryer, full kitchen & cookware, in room jacuzzi. 3 pools, waterpark, paddle boats, surrey bikes. Kids loved it. Bascially a community in itself. Outstanding customer service. Secure gate. Quiet location. 15 Minutes from Disney, walk to Publix Supermarket, close to walmart, target, many restaurants. With it being a timeshare we were asked to attend open house but not pressured in any way, then again those guys have to make a living to. Have reccomended Liki Tiki to many friends & family. Hope to go back in 2 years time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but watch out for the hard timeshare pitch!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCrutcher
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the resort. We stayed in one of the town homes and while not deluxe, it was very comfortable. Our kids (4 and 7) really enjoyed both the waterpark and the pool. It was quiet and all the staff were nice. The only think I really did not like is on check-in they started showing us the "VIP" price list for some attractions based on us "being week long guests". Only after we picked some attractions did they tell us the fine print -- that we had to attend their timeshare talk to get the "VIP" price for those attractions! Even after we set no, they called us up on the resort phone the next day and asked if we would do it for more money off, and when we ignored that, the lady again asked me in the lobby if I would sign up for it. I would definitely go again, because for the price the value was quite good, but I wish I'd known about the timeshare-talk pressure early so I could firmly decline from the beginning!

Reviews.Title: “Good self-contained relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: philobuck
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to relax after a day at the amusement parks and priced right. Nice pools, relaxing bar, and several activities. Comfortable room, although the walls are not very thick, so if your neighbors have noisy kids you will hear them loud and clear.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I stay at Liki Tiki Village, I have a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: retreat12
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Liki Tiki Village for over 12 years on and off and every time I visit the resort, I have a wonderful experience. I have taken my grandson there on several occasions and he always has a wonderful time. I returned last year with my 81 year old mother and she can't wait to return - she had a wonderful experience - being her first trip to Florida. If there is any slightest indication that you are unhappy with your accommodation, the staff are always at hand to make sure your vaction is a memorable one and the staff have always been on hand to make sure our stay is a happy one. Its a pity to hear other reviews of customers whose stay has not been to their satisfaction but I would recommend that you just keep calling customer services and I assure you, they would make sure your accommodation and holiday is a fabulous one that you will always remember. I will be returning again next week and I am sure coming all the way from London, my stay will, as always, be a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There”
Reviews.Author: Evelia E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Liki Tiki this past summer with another family and I dont typically post reviews but I have to share my experience there - it was that bad. First, I want to clarify that this resort is a time share property so their main objective is to offer you a time share. Those with time shares have higher priority over the rest of the visitors. Second - The condo descriptions are misleading because the flat screen t.v. and state of art amenities they describe are only for a certain number of condos - and they are mostly for the condos with time shares. Third - although our room was ready when expected our friends' room wasn't ready until early evening, and we arrived there at 10 a.m. It took many heated arguments for them to finally get a room assigned to them. They were not the only ones who were waiting in the lobby, it was packed with many unhappy guests who were also waiting for their rooms. The staff at the lobby was very rude and couldnt gaurantee anyone a time of when the rooms would be ready. Fourth - The package described cleaning service would be done but not once did anyone come and change our sheets, or clean the room - and we stayed for about 5 nights. Cleaning service I found out is a service that we would have to pay an additional fee - and we would need to schedule that separately. Fifth - safe box and AC unit wasn't working in our friend's room so we had to deal with that as well. I was soo disappointed and want to warn anyone who is considering going to Liki Tiki - go somewhere else, it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Visiting”
Reviews.Author: K8hope11
Reviews.Content: Went to this place for the day to visit our friends we were travelling with. WOW. The pool and slides for kids was AMAZING!! The pool chlorine was a bit on the strong side but the pool was too cool. Their room was a 2 bedroom and had an amazing attached bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. I wanted to hop in it...lol. Thinking of staying their next year.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Patricia K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Oct 27 - Nov 3 in the 900 section. Rooms were decent, but definitely needed updating, looked nothing like the pictures on line in this section. We couldn't enjoy the balcony because it was loaded with ants, but hey it's Florida! Bathroom definitely needs updating, the sink was rusty and chipped. Internet was horrible! Very slow and you had to pay for it. Resort is in a good location for all the parks and various restaurants. Most likely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the family!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyhuss
Reviews.Content: Stayed from October 26 to November 2. Had a two bedroom in the 1200 section with an adjoining room with the in laws, plenty of space for our two year old in the two bedroom, but even better with the adjoining. Decided on the ground floor room to avoid the stairs and the townhouse style rooms to avoid the stairs for our daughter the explorer. Staff was friendly, lifeguards courteous and alert (they had to jump in after a parent left their 10 year old in charge of their 2 year old sister, no life jacket) drinks were pricey at the bar. $8.25 for a mixed drink during the day. Sunday they had beer specials and they have a happy hour for discounts. Slides were a nice touch suitable for kids up to 12. The other pools were warm and big and quiet. Grills located at the most southern pool for cooking up lunch or dinner. lots of paddle boats, 2 tennis courts, basketball court, shuffle board, 9 hole mini golf, tandem bikes, play scape, and lots of paved sidewalks to walk around the resort. 2 blocks away, Papa Johns pizza, Publix grocery, 7-11, Denny's. 15 minutes to Disneys Magic Kingdom, 1hr to Busch gardens, 10 minutes to Target and a bunch of chain restaurants, 10 minutes to Orange lake golf course, Polo Park golf course and Heritage. Tickets aren't that discounted so use discretion and may be better deals if you buy from the park. Wasn't hounded by timeshare, but in-laws were because they were duped into thinking it was a free $60 bucks just to show up and pick up info. whoops, just say no at the beginning if you aren't interested and you will be left alone. 45 minutes to the airport, but a little tricky to find if you don't have a GPS, but turn at the 7-11 on the 192.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Jennie C
Reviews.Content: The resort was decent. But or Condo was terrible with bugs all over. The first condo we had there were ants in our beds, kitchen and a crochroachs in our condo. Yes, I know it is Florida but they should not be in the bed. The hotel then moved us to another condo, and we still had ants in our bedroom. They weren't in our bed or closet this time but they were all over. Other then that the pool area was very nice, and the activies were fun. They need to update the golf course. I was also disappointed in them not offering any kind of service to us after we had to move our stuff to a new condo, and still had to deal with ants, and the previous peoples hair in the shower. All over. It was nasty. I think if you are trying to provide people a nice place to stay make sure you clean good and get rid of the bugs! Internet was very slow also, and you had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “You can not go wrong staying here!”
Reviews.Author: GOSEEITALL24_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been bringing are kids here for years. We have 6 kids ages 9-21 now. Not one of my children have ever said "I am bored" when we have stayed. We always try to stay 5 days a year here. My hubby and I have also used this as a weekend getaway. The resort is huge so kid friendly and adult friendly! From the water slide in the pool to karaoke night! We have did the Luau here one year and it was great! Its funny, are family and friends ask all the time if we have booked yet so they also can stop in for the day! The service is incredible. I read review and still are sceptic but you can not go wrong booking here. They have several pools and even a place for the tiny toddlers so over crowding is not an issue. The kids have activities they can sign up for daily also. We have stayed during peek months and slower months and I have never had issues.

Reviews.Title: “I had a brilliant time (and so did my Grandson)”
Reviews.Author: Chelseacuckoo
Reviews.Content: I along with my son, daughter-in-law and grandson stayed from 14 September until 29 September 2011. It was my first trip to Orlando and staying at the Liki Tiki made my trip complete. The service, accomodation and resort was excellent. We preferred the quieter pool which my grandson loved (he is only 8 months old). I especially want to thank the handy men who were so friendly and very quick to respond to any defects reported and the security guards who were equally friendly and helpful. Thank you for a lovely hoilday. I wouild definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: Stacy H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 811 Oct 8 - 15th. We were so happy with the room and all the fun activities and amenities this place has to offer. We look forward to coming down again, we will not be staying ANYWHERE else. The only bad part is that we were only there for a week and wished we could have had more time to just hang out by the pools so next time we come it'll be for 10-14 days instead. I will make sure to request the same 3 bedroom condo we stayed in, it was perfect for our family!! Thank you so much for the great memories we hope to save up enough to make it back soon!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: micsloss
Reviews.Content: best accomidations, best location! had a blast! 900 building was all that! frying pans sucked, ask 4 non stick!!! best time ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: StacieP13
Reviews.Content: I am a massive skeptic so believe me when I say I almost didn't stay here after reading some of the other reviews but I am sure glad we did. The only part that bummed us out was it stormed the entire weekend so the kids did not get to do any of the activities such as the pool & waterslides, paddle boats, fishing, etc which is why we chose to stay at Liki Tiki Village to start with. I wanted somewhere that had space for 2 parents and 3 kids to move around and fun activities for the kids. I am so glad we chose well as I would have gone insane cooped up with boys 6, 10, & 17. They also offer daily kids activities such as crafts, competitions, and Xbox. We stayed in the 1200 building in 12444E a 2bed/2bath. It was being renovated on the outside so there was a crane in the parking lot but we heard no noise so it didn’t bother us a bit and was glad to be staying in a newly painted area. I paid $213.14 total with tax for our 3 day 2 night stay Oct 7th -9th. We also had to pay a resort fee of 15.00 to the hotel when we got there separate from our total bill, & they charge $50 to your credit card to be refunded if you didn’t break anything or charge anything to your room but I knew that going in and the $50 charge came off the next day after we got home. Everything was included such as towels, dishes, detergent for clothes and dishes etc. I loved washing all of our clothes before we left so I did not have to do it when we got home. The dryer was very handy as we came back from Downtown Disney soaked from the torrential downpour. We had a massive amount of towels. Dish towels, bath towels, hand towels, pool towels. I was very excited not to have to call to get more towels like I always do when we stay at our regular one room hotels. Our beds were super comfy and we had a ton of pillows. I loved it as I am a pillow hog. The kids all got their own bed when we put the 6 yr old on the sleeper sofa so no one had to fight over who had to double up in a bed. There are 3 tvs so the kids didnt have to argue over what to watch. The staff was extra friendly and went out of their way showing us things to do nearby, where to eat, etc. I read some reviews about the hotel trying to talk you into a time share there but when I checked in they asked me if I was interested in a 30 mins spiel to sell me one and I would receive a $60 gift certificate to use in their restaurant. I said I wasn’t interested and they didn’t ask again. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will be staying there for all our Kissimmee/Orlando trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MLT123
Reviews.Content: My family and I stood at the resort and we had an amazing time. The property is very large and has a lot of activities for the family. There’s paddle boating, a basketball court, mini golf, and waterslides in one of the many pools they have. We were very skeptical on staying here because of the reports we read. Don't read into the negative comments. We stood in the 300 blding, it was spacious and very clean, no bugs in site.. The beds were amazing!! Our next vacation to Orlando we will definitely stay at the Liki Tiki Village..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGIE004
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Liki Tiki from Oct.2-9th. Two adults, two kids 7-9. What an amazing place! The property is very large with many things to do. Swimming, paddle boating, waterslides,mini golf. The rooms are large and spacious and have everything you need including a washer and dryer. I read in other reviews people were concerned about Bugs. There are no bugs to be seen,not inside the room or in the bed. Publix, grocery stores , restaurants , are very close by. Pools are amazing after a long hot day at Disney ! It's about a 15 min drive to Disney from here, Stay at the Liki tiki ...you won't be disappointed !!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: enrique d
Reviews.Content: I am going to write a review based on all the reviews that i read before going to this hotel. I just came back from a 5 night "staycation" from 10/5 to 10/10 in this hotel since i live 2 hrs. away from Orlando. i was a little bit afraid when i read some of the reviews about this hotel but let me tell you, DONT BE AFRAID!!!!. i am 35 y.o. and went with my wife and 2 kids, 4 years old and a 2 month old. The first thing that i was afraid about was the reviews about bugs in the room, well i did not see any bugs in my room, not a single one, no bed bugs or roaches at all, i was on a 4th floor room, maybe that has something to do but NO BUGS!!. Some other bad reviews was about the condition of the rooms, well the room was clean which for me is the most important thing and yes maybe there is a cracked tile in the bathroom floor but is it really tha relevant? i dont think so. there is wall paper on the walls but i really dont care about the looks. Other reviews mentioned that the staff would insist in joining the time share, well i was never asked about time share al all, and neve received a call in my room asking me to attend anything so dont worry about it. Also let me comment about the place, it is a kids friendly place so if you want a quiet place maybe this is not a good idea, there will be kids playing and running in the pool and waterpark which is fine with me since i have kids. The pool is really nice for kids and adults, has many slides for small kids, also the best part is that they have a restaurant and bar at the pool and the prices are very reasonable, (burgers around 8 bucks) and the drinks and cocktails are good also, i recommend the liki tiki punch. They also have daily activities for kids and you can use the paddle boats, mini golf, fishing poles and bikes that are included in the resort fee. the place is only 20 min awayfrom disney parks.The place was not crowded at all and i never had any problems finding good seats at the pool, in summary i dont find any reason why i would not go back to liki tiki village, actually i am already planning our next trip, after all i'm only 2 hrs away, dont be afraid of the bad reviews, i admit that i was but believe me, there is nothing to be afraid of. if you are tha kind of person that is extremely picky this hotel is a very good choice for you, and i dont want to sound considered but i have been to many hotels, not ony in the orlando area but around the world. so liki tiki village is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: agent-steve
Reviews.Content: This is my 10th Visit to Orlando,but my 1st visit to the Liki Tiki and im glad to report everything was excellent,well equipped apartments with plenty of on sight facilities made our family holiday a memorable experience.I work as a travel agent and have made recommendations to future clients to stay at this property.We stayed in block 400 over looking the pool with the fitness room which we often used as it had a real good atmosphere with the music being played in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: Jennydowd
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay when visiting the Orlando area! The value for the price can't be beat. We were there off-season, so it was quiet and not crowded at all. You can tell by looking at the photos of the pool I posted how empty it was as those were taken around 4pm. We love having a condo when traveling with kids. The extra space and full kitchen make for a much more pleasant and comfortable experience. We stayed in unit 1351E - a 2 bedroom unit - and were very pleased with our accommodations. The master suite was roomy with a king-sized bed and the other bedroom had 2 full-sized beds and it's own bathroom in the hall. There was a nice, screened porch/balcony and this building backs up to open space, so it was quiet with a view of lush, tropical green space. The unit was very clean and reasonably well-kept, albeit with a few minor imperfections: a cracked door on the microwave, an exposed electrical outlet, and dirty carpets. The dirty carpets were a bit of a turn off, but you would never know they were dirty by looking at them, so I can understand how the management wouldn't know unless it was brought to their attention. My children's black feet after walking around barefoot for a while were my only indication something was amiss. To their credit, when I informed the desk clerk of this upon checkout, she apologized profusely and made note of it, explaining that the carpets are cleaned on a routine maintenance schedule and sometimes a unit will need a cleaning in-between. Made sense to me. The maids would never be able to tell as they cleaned a unit because they are not cleaning barefoot. ;) Walls are pretty thin. We were lucky enough to have no one in the unit next to us for most of the week, but the last 2 days we had the pleasure of hearing our neighbors through our connecting door. I'm sure they enjoyed hearing us correcting our unruly preschoolers too. Haha. Liki Tiki has lots of activities planned throughout the week to keep you entertained on property and the lagoon pool is lots of fun with all the slides and squirting fountains. My 2 and 4 year olds had a blast on the smaller slides! The food at Shipwreck Sally's was your basic poolside grill, but very convenient! Great playground too. Can't say enough good things about the amenities here. The property is lush and tropical and well-maintained. It is on a quiet access road right off 192, just outside of the tourist-y, gift-shop filled part. It was only a 10 minute drive (7 miles) each day to the entrance ramp to World Drive and all the Disney parks. There is a Publix and a Super Target 3 miles away to stock up your unit, and a 7-Eleven right at the end of Bali Blvd. for your convenience needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: maverickmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the end of September. A 3 bedroom unit in the 1000 building. Plenty of space for the 10 of us. 6 adults, 4 kids under the age of 5. We spent most of our time at the parks, but enjoyed the time at Liki Tiki. The water park was lots of fun for the kids and the lifeguards did a great job. We got drinks one afternoon at the bar and they hit the spot. We visited the other pool, close to the check-in area several times. The pool was the perfect temperature day and night. The hot tub was a bit too hot, but helped with our aches after all the park walking. We did deal with a few bugs in the room but let's be honest...We had a first floor unit and it's Florida. Distance from parks was decent, 20-30 minutes depending. We really liked how close the resort was to restaurants and shopping. Great stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: dididb911
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed in a 3bedroom condo which was comprised of a connecting 1 bedroom unit and a 2 bedroom unit. It was extremely spacious with a large amount of room for us. The waterpark was an excellent feature and the entire facility was clean. Location was good if you plan to drive anywhere. If your seeking a resort with great value and great amenities then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Super vacation”
Reviews.Author: sproetjes
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful 25 days vacation at Liki Tiki. A special thank you to the front desk team. Keith, Jerry and Jerry, Jessica and Jesaida. Also a thank you to Oscar Hernandez, this man work so hard to keep the poolside and BBQ's clean. Excellent work !!!!!! Looking forward to come back next year. And to the team at the front desk. I know there are people who are coming with expectations like they are royals. Next time you should tell them to book the superior suite at the Hilton Hotel then you can have expectations. Still I have 1 remark. It would be nice to screen the balkony like the townhouse. Thats all and this is not a complain. See you all next year! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Always nice to stay here”
Reviews.Author: freckles_44
Reviews.Content: It was our third vacation at the liki tiki. Stayed here for 8 nights. We cannot understand why there are bad reviews about liki tiki because it is always such a pleasure to stay here. My sis says that if people are complaining they should rent the presidential suite at the Hilton, maybe they will be satisfied then. It's clean, no bugs in the app. Beds are oke. Washer and dryer, dishwasher, always a balcony with a view of the pool/gardens. Gardens very wel maintained. Friendly staff. Guarded entrance. plenty of towels and pool towels. tv in room and bedrooms. Close to shops and parks. The only thing what we miss is a sort of bug net on the balcony so you can sit bugfree. In this time of year there are a lot of lovebugs. They don't do anything but are very bothersom. 1 suggestion towards the checkin desk, if guests arrive late tell the arriving party to consider the time. People in the adjacent app. could be sleeping!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too much wildlife!!!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 1020E, furniture very dated,fixtures and fittings much the same.View from the balcony- non existant,in fact, hardly used it due to the amount of mosquitoes and "love bugs" ,we all suffered insect bites from day one,and i am not sure wether or not the bites occurred inside or outside of the room??.Cockaroaches were in abundance,even in and around "shipwreck Sallies", Rats were also observed in this area were food preperation takes place.Prior to the rats and roaches being seen, did try the food once,which just about sums it up. Would not stay their again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGang
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenage sons for four nights. We were in the E building, and it could definitely use updating from the retro 80s decor. But the grounds are very nice, the parking was convenient to our room, and the kids loved the pool while we enjoyed the bar next door. It was especially nice to have lifeguards stationed at the pool since we invited our sons' cousins to join them there. It was reasonably close to Disney World, but probably a half hour plus to get to Universal Studios and about 45 minutes to get to the airport. The beds were great and the kitchen was outfitted appropriately. Our only complaint was that the walls are paper thin between units. Fortunately that only seemed to be a problem on the living room side, so it didn't keep us up at night. Oh, and the WIFI is extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: fragilli1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from out family trip to liki tiki. we also had 5 rooms. the rooms were on opposite area's of the resort but we will remember to ask next time when booking. we checked in at approx 6pm and we had no problem and were not harrassed by any timeshare requests. In fact we decided to ask for a timeshare visit and got our disney tickets for all 20 of us which saved each person $50. we loved the rooms and waterpark. we had all ages from 2 - 70 and everyone was very very happy with the resort. we are looking to return in 2 years for another family visit and have looked at a few hotels on I - drive and I am struggling to see anything we would be as happy as this. I drive location would be the swinger for us as we have never stayed there before. Great resort all round, nice friendly staff and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: Shaleena
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at the Liki Tiki from September 1, 2011 to September 6, 2011 and had a fun time. My kids enjoyed the slides and other activities. I can't wait to visit again. The staff needs to be a little more courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: Mhopstetter
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners at this resort so we go each year but I have to admit that we probably wouldn't return if we were just paying for a place to stay. The units are nice but the one we stayed in was due for an upgrade. Furniture is comfortable enough and the kitchen is adequate to feed a family. I couldn't get the coffee pot to work though. The worst part about our unit (#1053E) was that you could only turn the shower on if you were standing in the shower itself. My husband and I took turns throughout the week getting hit with the freezing cold water. The resort needs to address its other attractions. The mini-golf had loose borders, carpet that was rolled over, and overall unattractive areas. I also question how a "Green Lodge" does not have recycling anywhere. That seems to be the most obvious way to help the enviroment! Internet is free for owners but it was barely working. The waterpark area is great for the kids. We have two boys (2 & 4) who have hours of fun there and the lifeguards are very attentive. Wal-mart is only a few miles away and has everything you need to stock your unit for the week.

Reviews.Title: “I'm only giving one star because I have to in order to post my review”
Reviews.Author: Kiki P
Reviews.Content: First impression was unexpected because the staff at the front desk is very unprofessional and not courteous at all. At the time of check in I felt like I was bothering the lady at the front desk. The room looked clean and fully equipped...that was until bed time and we opened the sofa bed to find a humongous roach in it and when we unfolded the mattress there was a huge smelly stain in the mattress. It was too late around 3am and the kids were already asleep so we decided to sleep all four of us in the same bed. When we called in the morning to complain, they sent a building supervisor who said and I quote "I'm not too worried about the bug issue that is normal in this area because of the lakes, but I can have the room fumigated and the mattress changed for you" NO!!!!!! All I wanted was a new room free of bugs but she made it sound as if it was almost impossible for them to find an available room for us. About an hour later they gave us a new room and of course the first thing we did was check the sofa bed which seemed clean (although in the morning I had to call them to have them replace the fire alarm batteries that wouldn't stop beeping all night long and to fix the clogged bathtub). The next day when the weekend arrived the place was super crowded so if you want a place to relax by the pool, this is not the right place for you. We brought our little girls 5 and 4 and most of the time we stayed in the kiddie pool which will get the f you are planning on visiting any of the disney parks and use Liki Tiki's shuttle bus be prepared to deal with the unprofessional shuttle bus drivers who will pick you up at the hotel early in the morning and drop you off at another hotel for a second shuttle bus (we waited about 25 minutes or the next bus) and she did not explain to us this process until we pulled over to the hotel to wait for the second shuttle bus. Also their last shuttle bus leaves Epcot's parking lot at 9:35pm so we were not even able to watch the firework show at magic kingdom which is at the park's closing time 9:00pm :-( Their fast food in their restaurant is ok and price is cheap. Their amenities like the 6 boats for the boat rides in the lake, 1 tennis court, 1 basketball court, 4 bikes and mini golf court were too few for the amount of guests they have, there was always a long waiting list to use any of those amenities. We went to the lobby to get some money out of their ATM and heard a lady complaining about some very rude people running in the pool and playing very rough among themselves, all happening right next to her kids and she was afraid they could hurt her kids. I heard when the supervisor told her that there were other pools that she could move to and that the other guests were allowed to do whatever they wanted!!! are you serious? Then the supervisor had the nerve to call security on her to take her out of the lobby because she was yelling at him when he gave her that response. In our last night we asked front desk to call a cab for us to drive us to the Orlando airport early next day. They told us that the taxi company they worked with would charge $76 but because they had to come so early to pick us up (5:00am) they had to charge a total of $86. When we got to the room we went through the yellow pages and found a cab company that charged us $56 for the airport ride! I'm pretty sure the people at the front desk work for a commission with the cab company. Overall, my one week experience in this hotel was HORRIBLE! I hated it and I will never ever go back to a filthy place like this run by a bunch of unprofessional teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “For family is brilliant.......”
Reviews.Author: griswall
Reviews.Content: As usual liki tiki is great..... we spent 10 days and if you like comfort as well as peace and quite from the crowed areas... the condom flat (queen size bed and sofa bed) flat was big and spacious with shower as well at jacuzzy, full kitchen 2 tv, radio, dvd, washer dryer, balcony... outside swimming pool, jacuzzy, gym...bbq.... plus all the others activities.... the staff was pleasant and in all total the area was clean and well maintained.... this resort its at about 20mn from the disney parks and so you will need to rent a car....but its much quiter than international drive and definitely somehwere to stay if you have kids....

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around...”
Reviews.Author: Mykell
Reviews.Content: this is our second time staying at liki-tiki village. my nieces and nephew enjoyed it last year and when we planned a trip for this year, liki-tiki got the unanimous vote. if you have kids, this is the place to be. yes, you have the disney and universal resorts nearby but if you are in a budget, this place is great. the staff was very friendly the resort was very clean. all the amenities that you need is a resort is available. no complaints here whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second time and we will return”
Reviews.Author: visitmom
Reviews.Content: We checked in a day late they gave us a room across from the lagoon which was great (thank you Jerry Vazquez)The majorsuccess of this resort is its pool area,managed by Cathy Demeo and staff,Wil,Gardner,Paydro,Anthony..and of of course the beautiful Erica. Thank you guy's. (We've been here twice & we will return) H. Horacio & family. Em. 1314F

Reviews.Title: “Lots of activities for the youngsters. I'd actually give it a 3.5.”
Reviews.Author: LeonardsofSherman
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 children (21 and 33 months at the time), and I had a good time at the Liki Tiki. We had a 1-bedroom in the older section (700-1000). There was enough space, and the room was clean and acceptable with decent ammenities. Our vacuum didn't work and our washer/dryer needed to be replaced, but we were otherwise satisfied. Check-in wasn't an issue for us, but other guests were having problems while we were in the lobby a few times. Customer service seemed fair at best (one of the guests trying to check in and the manager were in a heated discussion b/c they admittedly gave the reserved room away.). We were staying through a timeshare, but we had to pay and additional $6.99 a day for unlimited access to wireless (which was very unreliable), surrey bikes (which the kids LOVED), paddleboats, golf, and other rentals. It was worth it, but you had to keep track of a little paper card which was tattered by the end of the week and an inconvenience to keep track of and dry. The waterpark and 2 other pools were very nice. The kids never got sick of it, and they enjoyed the variety of slides. There were at least 2 lifegaurds on duty. Shipwreck Sally's was convenient, had decent food, and was fairly reasonably priced. The only negative that I have about the waterpark (and rental shack) was that it didn't open until 10. My kids are early risers, and were anxious to get the day rolling, but we had to wait. The other pools did open at 7:30. Overall, we liked the Liki Tiki and we would consider going back. It is ideal for adolescents with the amount of stuff to do. We didn't do any of the scheduled activities. The resort is off the beaten path a little bit, but that kept things relatively quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun”
Reviews.Author: chanda s
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was thinking about going to another resort but the price for this one was to good for me to pass up. My family and I had so much fun It was so worth it and I am very glad we went. The room was clean we had the old building one bed room. The bath was so big and clean the kitchen was clean and had everything I needed to cook. the living room sofa needed to be updated but it was ok. My 4 yr old and 9yr old loved both pools perfect size for mom to keep my eye on them . the paddle boat was a great work out my 9 yr old loved it. we did not see a gator but in florida water they are there. golf was small but perfect for my kids. overall if you have small kids you need to go. and the gator show on wed night was worth 5 dollars. we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: This resort was great. I had two kids and the one bedroom kitchen suite was great. I loved having a regular sized refrigerator for 2 kids under 3 to store a whole gallon of milk, yogurt, cheese and other goodies. There was plenty of room and very well kept. The bed was very comfortable (Just wished it was a King). Sofa sleeper not so much, but I haven't been on one that was. We could hear our neighbors TV, but is typical for a hotel. The fire alarm did go off once, but our babies slept through it so no harm. I only had one complaint and it was with the shower. It only had really cold or really hot water. We managed to work around it, but couldn't get it just right. The grounds and amenities were great. My almost 3 year old loved the water park. She loved going down all the slides. It was perfect for 3-5 year olds. Parents would send their kids up to the slides and all take turns at the bottom catching their child as they came down. The playground was perfect too. We only spent naps and night time sleeping in the room, and when we weren't at Disney or other theme park we were in the pool. The resort seemed packed, but the amount of people at the pool didn't seem too crowded. It could have been good timing on our part. The temperature of the water was perfect. There were other pools, but we really only spent our time at the water park one. We spent half our time here and half at a Disney resort and really enjoyed it here. Would stay here again and highly recommend. Great value for the money. Don't listen to the bad reviews this ended up being a great place especially for younger kiddos.

Reviews.Title: “2 good 2 b true...”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Q
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews I felt uneasy about staying @ the resort, but the trip was already booked. Much to my surprise there was nothing negative about this place. Check- in was quick, the whole property was very, very clean, every staff member we ran into was friendly, security greeted us everytime we arrived. I would like to mention one security guard in particular, Jennie M. not only was she friendly and helpful, she seemed to be very on point with her job because we saw her everywhere we went. My family and I felt very safe and secure. The only complaints I have is the internet service was very slow, but then again we're on vacation, why should it matter. Also finding an available chair at the water park was very hectic and difficult. Definitely will come back next year... =)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, but not at FIRST!”
Reviews.Author: cjsharpe
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were excited, it looked nice and clean! But, once we went to our room, (the back building-I think it was "D") and I immediately had a bad feeling because it looked really rough! We walked into our room, and it was muggy smelling, and just looked very run down! On top of that our room was connected to the next door neighbors by a door and they were so very loud! I called to the front desk to get us a renovated room and told them that the neighbors were loud....they didn't move us. About 15 minutes later I called the front desk and asked again, and this time I was transferred to what seems like a manager, and she said we have townhomes available that are renovated would we like to look at them, I immediately said YES! And we fell in love with them! That's the way to go there! Our boys LOVED the waterpark, it was awesome! But very crowded at times, but makes sense since they were almost filled! But, my boys were happy so were we because they were :0)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, water park and very secure! Not far to disney attractions. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Janine N
Reviews.Content: You will need to hire a car if you choose to stay at Liki Tiki Village. It is approximately 20 minutes drive to the Disney attractions. If you are going to Universal studios, it is another 15 mintues further again. It is quite difficult to find when you arrive, so make sure you have clear directions. The ones on the website are sufficient. The water park on site is great fun for families. The rooms are really high quality - clean and spacious. The furnishings are very good quality. We had a washing machine and drier, so this was excellent. The kitchen is completely equiped with everything you could possibly need. It really is a home away from home. There is security to get into the complex, so no problems there. There is even a small lake for fishing and paddle-boating. Just watch out for the resident alligator! We will be staying here when we come back to Florida next time. It is worth spending a bit more to stay here - value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sfamilyfour
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about staying after reading some reviews we almost cancelled our reservation! Our family of five stayed during spring break. We have a 7 yr old and a 3rd old and the rest of our family stayed at the westgate town center. I have to say we loved the resort the staff were friendly and helpful. The pools and watermark were great!!!! I am so glad we gave it a chance it was a wonderful family vacation! Don't let the bad reviews scare you those people must have either stayed at another resort or just like to complain. We would def go back anytime !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: Angieb
Reviews.Content: Check in: We checked in on Sunday. We arrived early and our room was not ready until exactly 4p. This is our 6th stay and is the first time we have not got into our room before check in. The check in staff were very friendly as well as were the ladies at the information/gift desk. Room: We have personally toured the higher numbered rooms and they are in better condition than some, but if you want a room with the most beautiful view ask for either the 700, 800 or 900 buildings. They are older, but for the most part in pretty good shape. We are not extremely picky. They are the closest to the water park. We stayed in the 800 building on the 4th floor and had a view of the lake, beach area, bball/tennis courts, miniature golf and the water park. When on the patio you can hear the pool sounds - the music, people laughing and having fun, and the local wildlife. It is the most relaxing feeling in the world! I spent a lot of time on the patio watching the ducks, birds, fish and turtles. The 700 and 800 buildings have the best view. The newer buildings in the back behind these have views of woods only. There are other larger building units on the other side of the lake, closer to the other 2 pools that we have never stayed in. Not sure of the condition or views. Ammenities: My family loves the water park - Kids ages 15 and 12. Bring a cheap blow up ball for fun playing volleyball in the pool. There is one larger slide that all ages enjoy. There are 4 smaller slides that my older does not like anymore. But, my 12 year old still likes them. They are geared more for the younger ages. The atmosphere is fantastic. Families having fun and enjoying the music that is always playing. This year my kids did not join any of the kids activities as they are geared to the younger kids. It would be nice if they had a program for older kids. There are plenty of tables and chairs, but on weekends it is busier and they are harder to get. My 15 year old's only complaint about the water park area is that it closes too early. This time of the year it closes at 7:30p-8p. It closes in sections. The bar and grill at the pool closes around 9p. There are 2 other pools. A larger pool near the main building that has a tiki bar now - new since we were here before. There is a smaller pool near the workout room that has gas grills. We did not grill there, but the atmosphere was nice and relaxing with families having fun and the fun of food cooking. The workout room has several pieces of broken equiptment. The management really needs to fix this. The all in one machine had a loose piece that when my daughter bumped it it, fell and could have hit someone. It was pretty heavy. Shows: The only show we paid for was the Magic show. It was just ok. It really is geared for kids under the age of 10. It costs $10 for adults and I cannot remember the cost of kids as mine were both adults. ?5. it is an hour show. Don't go if you have older kids. We did not go to the Luau Dinner show this year, but in the past it was pretty good for all ages. The cost is $27.5 adults and $17.5 children 3-11 yrs. Disney is very close - we drove there in 15 minutes. Shopping: When you go out of the complex, turn rt on Bali and take another rt onto 17-92. There is a Publix Supermarket for groceries. The prices are reasonable. If you go a little further down and turn rt onto hwy 27 there is a Super Walmart and it is about a mile and a half down -on your right. In that general area is a Taco Bell, KFC. If you turn left on 27 and drive for approx. 15 miles. Just past where it goes over I-4 there is a shopping area on the RT. Dollar Tree, JC Penny, Ross, Super Target, Staples and much more. On 192 if you go left - there is a Super Target, Walgreens and many restaurants. There are really no restaurants or shopping within quick walking distance. There is a 7-11 to the rt out of the complex that you can walk to. Don't be surprised when you check in if you have been here before - they now charge a $50 (fifty something) complex fee when you check in. Instead of paying for the activities such as: fishing, boats, bball, min golf, bikes and Internet - you are just billed up front for them and get to do as much as you want. If you have kids this is an excellent deal. These were pricey in the past. My only large complaint this trip was the internet. It was contantly disconnecting. You have to log out of everything and disconnect the service and reconnect and open up your explorer again. If you are on a work trip. You will not get anything done if it involves the internet. My computer worked best on the patio. The most trouble was at night. Maybe high usage time. This facility is excellent for families with kids. We have really enjoyed coming here over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tracee50226
Reviews.Content: We received great customer service from Angel L. Nieves. Thanks, Angel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sherryruss
Reviews.Content: We come to Orlando once a year. This was such a nice place to stay. It was clean, modern and fun. Every employee that we came in contact with was friendly, courteous and professional. The pool was clean, had lots of chairs around it and had numerous life guards on duty. We loved staying here and will definitely be back. We recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “very kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: brainradio
Reviews.Content: The kids loved this resort. It is very kid friendly and is packed with may activities for them. The rest of the resort would be 3 stars for me. I am a TV snob... I like these in the bedroom, but that is not the reson for my rating. We had issues with little bugs in the kitchen... thousands of them. As well the fitness facility was really tiny for a resort of this size. One working treadmill.... The accomodations themselves were average but still worked well for a family of 5. For the price this is a fine resort and the kids will love it. But it is still a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “always a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: jenh29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort last week for our fourth time as a family. And again I cannot complian. we had a two bedroom which had more than enough room for 5 people. the staff is always very helpfull and my kids love the pools. having a fully stocked kitchen saved my budget from having to eat out every day. The resort is located on 192 and is close to everything. I also brought home clean clothes thanks to the washer and dryer in room.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Resort A+++”
Reviews.Author: ezpacman2000
Reviews.Content: Me, My Wife and 10 year old son stayed here for our Vacation. It was Spotless with more than enough room for the three of us. The people went above and beyond. The pools and water slides were fantastic. We will be back every year. An A++ resort. Compare to any hotel in or near, they offer much much more. And the condo was Spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: rfkaufman
Reviews.Content: We had an overall great time at the resort. Had some problems up front, but Dana Bellicico was extremely helpful in getting us off to a good start. Thanks Dana. Room was good, service was great, but the fitness center, for this day and age was not only an inadiquate, but we saw several safety problems that could have turned into injuries. Half the equpment didn't work and was dangerous. We ate at the snack bar by the pool once and were surprised by the quality and freshness of the food. Service was good even though it was crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Djenepha
Reviews.Content: A representative named Yajahira provided us exceptional service. She was helpful, kind, and quickly resolved an issue that noone else was willing to assist us with. I would like to recommend her for employee of the month and if I dare say a raise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: histo49
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at Liki Tiki....had 20 month old twins who loved the zero entry area and older boys who loved the many water slides. Price was very reasonable and the staff were very helpful and courteous! We plan to make this a yearly trip for the family !

Reviews.Title: “Return Stay at Liki Tiki - Better than the 1st time”
Reviews.Author: LoreenNY
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this property. We came back again this summer because we enjoyed our stay the previous summer. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit in the 900 building. Our friends were traveling with us and management was kind enough to accommodate both of our families in rooms within close proximity to each other. The room was immaculately clean with the exception of some crumbs on the pull-out mattress that I cleaned up before putting sheets on it for my younger daughter to sleep on. The pull-out mattress was perfect for a skinny 6 year old, but would probably not be comfortable for a full grown adult. The room had a stacking washer & dryer which we used regularly. Our room was stocked with all kinds of soaps & detergents that made the stay easy. The rugs were either new or recently cleaned. The pool area with the slides were enjoyable for both my 6 year old and my 1 year old; the lifeguards are fantastic and watch all of the children closely! The only issue that we had this time were some of the guests of the resort which is obviously not the fault of the resort. I would suggest that the hotel monitor how many people are staying in a room (although I can see how that would be difficult). We found that on the weekends, the pool was extremely overcrowded and many of the people in the pool were not really a family crowd (use your imagination). Unfortunately, we did not get a chance to use any of the activities that the resort provides such as bikes, fishing, boats, etc. The resort also hosts different theme nights and shows; there is something for everyone! The hotel also gives you a free photo, but we did not have time to do that either. I suggested this resort to my friend who stayed on the property this past June and she had a fantastic experience in the 1200 building. Some other tips: Use toll road 429 to get Disney World super fast, the Publix and Walmart are right outside the hotel on the main road. Overall, we would definitely stay here again. The hotel staff really do care that you have a great stay and it is evident by the little extras that they do to make sure it happens. We will be back again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best family hotel weve stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dartsmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in june and thought it was great.nice pools,staff and very clean through out. The only thing we think it misses is a nice on-site resturant and a bar at all the pools(just personal preference). It is perfectly positioned for car drivers not so sure about buses. we are seasoned travellers and use this site alot & yes you will find some negative reviews but we found no reason to do so(we stayed at the wyndham on int drive & that was a dirty hotel)we normaly stay at residence sea world but not anymore after the liki tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: sallesnik
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Liki Tiki. Check in was fast & very friendly staff. Very courteous staff at the counter across from check-in (where you get your parking pass), gave lots of info & gps addresses - we were not asked about timeshare. We stayed in the 100 A villa - loved this location, central to the resort. Screened lanai was wonderful. Villa was two floors, two bedrooms and two bathrooms, laundry room and kitchen. Lots of room, clean. Newly renovated, ceramic tile. Master bedroom - very comfortable king bed. Checked mattresses upon arrival, all new pillowtop mattresses. Only recommendation is to have ceramic tile and no carpet (even though the carpet was clean and new). Pools & waterpark were wonderful/clean. Excellent lifeguards, very attentive to children and undistracted. Constantly scanned the area, gave peace of mind & allowed us to have relaxation...as well as to enjoy the waterpark too! Security at the front entrace was fabulous. We needed more detergent suds on the 5th of our 7 night stay. I just asked at the front desk for more - no problem whatsoever. We truly enjoyed our stay & highly recommend this resort. Super Wal-Mart & Publix are 5 mins away, approx 10 mins to Disney & outlets, 20 mins to Universal & Sea World/ Aquatica. What we liked most about Liki Tiki was it brought tranquility in the midst of busy-ness of Orlando area with the theme parks. This is our 4th visit to Orlando area, first time at Liki Tiki - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: floridan77
Reviews.Content: Upon reading reviews on bedbugs, we had second thoughts about staying here. However, the reviews were all wrong. There were no bedbugs. This was a great place to vacation and we loved every minute of it. The condos are very spacious and clean. They have many different activities for the children to do. The water park was a hit. They have mini golf, fishing, bike rentals, and many more activities. Everyday this resort have something for the whole family to do. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “" we never go back "”
Reviews.Author: memestar
Reviews.Content: 1)First of all , ( safety) ,My daughter got cut from a nail hanging out by the big water slide, she got first aid, they said the will call to fulow up how she is doing, no body called or cared, we had to stay in the room all day,while she was crying . 2) the kitchen full with Bugs, Spaider, Ants. we called twice , they told me that they will be treathing the room 10:00 am they come round 4:00 pm when we got back from Disney Park we taking nap.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty ghetto, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Love2Vacation1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Liki Tiki village July 2011 with another family, who had their own unit. Both families had a one bedroom unit. The unit was clean, though it definitely needs updating. Our showerhead was one of those which detached, but apparently the original mount had broken off and the hotel put a plastic clip there instead. This clip was obviously not universal, as it did not hold up the showerhead at all, and it would fall down constantly. Our balcony door lock was broken, and the hotel again rigged another way to close it - not sure how secure the makeshift lock would be compared to the broken one. I didn't like the pillows in the master (too big and firm) so I took a pillow down from the living room closet to see if I'd like it better. After putting my face against it to see if it felt softer, I noticed a THREE inch cockroach moving around underneath the pillowcase. Now, I know this is Florida and they're known as Palmetto bugs here, but a cockroach is a cockroach, especially when it takes up residence in my pillow. The walls between the units are very thin, and there is a connecting door between the one bedroom and two bedroom units. Our neighbors were apparently celebrating a birthday and invited every family member alive to come along, because there were about 15 people going in and out of their unit all weekend long. We could hear their music, conversation, celebration - and apparently they could hear me talking on the phone, because they started banging on our wall when i had the nerve to have a telephone conversation with a friend later in the evening. Our first morning at the resort, a Guest Services representative found it prudent to call us at 8:40 AM to try and sell us a timeshare. Since we had driven half the prior day and stayed up later than normal settling in, my husband (who had worked 36 of the previous 48 hours prior to driving) and my 3 year old were still asleep. The call obviously woke them up, and when I asked the representative what he was thinking calling people on vacation prior to 9 AM, his answer was "It is the resort's policy to call guests before they might head out to the parks". So, it is more important for this place to sell timeshares than to ensure their guests have a relaxing vacation. I called asking to speak to a manager and left about 3-4 messages. Nobody ever got back to me. Now, the worst part - their waterpark. Oh my goodness. I didn't go to the other pools so I can't attest to their condition, but this was nightmarish. Imagine a cesspool of the worst every culture has to offer crammed into a pool which is clearly not big enough for all the people, children screaming and splashing with no adult supervision, and loose pieces of hair extensions floating up against you as you try to avoid being hit by the kids cannonballing from the slides. Yeah, that bad. To summarize - would not return, and you shouldn't go. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Cupcake52
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful from the we checked in to the day we checked out. The staff was very helpful especially (Teresa Fernandez). I thanked her and she gave me a hug. The Water Park was so much fun for the old and the young. It was so close to all the Disney parks. My whole family loved it and we look forward to returning again. Thank you staff at Liki Tiki Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: KathyP2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two boys, age 11 and 8. We had a great time. There was plenty of room in the pool and water park and the boys especially liked playing water volleyball. We wish we would have had an extra day to just spend at the resort. Everything was perfect except for our loud neighbors that kept the boys from getting to sleep a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Aquaman617
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Liki Tiki the week after July 4, 2011. It is a solid time share-type condo development. On the plus side: room were clean (no bed bugs!, which I had feared based on earlier reviews). On the negative side: the water slide pool was a bit sketchy, IMO (lots of tattoos, ear splitting music playing), but there's a quiet pool near the two-story condos. Overall, the location was convenient enough to the Disney Parks, but it's unlikely I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, very big with lots of activities. Great landscaping.”
Reviews.Author: bretonsimon
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Disney tour. 2 adults, 2 kids. Everybody was pleased with the room and the resort. Lots of pools to choose from. The room is a little dated but still gives a good experience. Their policy don`t cover cleaning services for a week. You have to manually put your used towels in front of the door to get new one after 3 days. You may also have to call to get the clean back ! The kitchen is well outfitted with enough cooking ware so you don't have to craft crazy tools for every thing you cook. Their restaurant was not particularly good. Just basic burgers by the pool with slow staff tired by long working hours. The place suited our needs pretty good. Its not a five star place for an honeymoon. It does the job for a family venturing long days on Disney sites. Disney is a quick drive away of 10 -18 minutes depending which park you are going. On your way there you will have plenty of shopping and restaurant and stuff to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but unusuable internet”
Reviews.Author: NCTechieTraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean place Good location Very friendly staff, even if they can't solve your problem Very unreliable internet connectivity "Waterpark" is more of an advanced child's water playground The Liki Tiki is a huge condo complex rented out like a hotel. The suite we were in was a 2BR 2BA with a kitchen. It was very clean, safe, and comfortable. We stayed in the ground floor of the 700 building. We have stayed at IslandOne properties before and been impressed. I really like the condo-hotels for family trips.. the kitchens, extra space, and separate bedrooms make it a much more relaxing trip. The biggest problem was the internet connection. This was a "work-cation" for me and I needed to be connected into my office every night for several hours. In short, I could never get a decent connection from inside the building (or another building I went to test). If you need your internet connection like I do, this is NOT the place for you. (details below). For work or for attraction surfing and emailing, not having viable internet access in a hotel is like not having hot water... You can stay there, but it's unreasonable. That's why I have to say "poor" on the overall rating. I'd specifically confirmed that they have connectivity when I called to book them. The lack of it overshadowed an otherwise decent place. The "water park" is more of an advanced water playground and the "wave pool" was a small side of the pool. It wasn't working while we were there, but it would be more of a novelty than anything else. Water-park-wise, I think it'd be great for wowing the 0-10yr old kids.
