Mine (11 and 13) enjoyed the swim and beachball volleyball playing, but it wasn't what they thought when they heard waterpark (long slides, lazy rivers, wave pools etc.. ). The Mini-golf was small, in poor repair, and never gets vacuumed, so you're golfing over leaves and twigs. The Paddleboats were fun and my 11yr old enjoyed our outing. Internet.. the long-version: The in-room wifi was never more than 2 dots and even when I *could* get connected, it would take >5 minutes to bring up the google search page (the most lightweight page I know of). I spent over an hour on the phone with their IT (in Iowa) to no avail. The rebooted all the access points and did everything they could remotely. The solution I was offered was to walk to the main office building where their "business center" was (4 pcs in a closet) and jack into the wall for several hours a night. I found that if I sat outside on the patio, I could get a reasonable connection.. I did one night of that, in Florida.. in summer...and my legs still look like a polka-dot farm of bug bites. The next day I called the front desk, talked to IT some more, and started lobbying for a new room. That evening, I got a visit from the operations manager. A very nice man who was trying to do everything he could to help me out. He took me to the only other available room, in a different building. Standing outside, 3-4 bars and decent speed... step into the unit (bldg 1300, 5th floor) and it's 1-2 bars and a 5 minute wait for Google. It was all he had, so there wasn't anything he could do. He was as nice as he could be, but if it doesn't work, it doesn't work. Back in the room, I pull out my tech-bag (I'm a professional nerd) and dug out 20ft of cat5 and my wireless travel router (doesn't everyone carry one with them everywhere they go?). The router can be switch into router mode, access-point mode, or client mode. For the remainder of the trip, i plugged the router into the wall outside, switched it to client mode, and ran the cat5 cable from it, under the door, and into my PC. I had to sit within the reach of the cable, but I was usually able to get a marginally reliable connection with the outside antennae. there was still one night and day where it was just plain down and had to be fixed (apparently, my calls to the desk had led them to call the local ISP for more bandwith, though that wasn't the problem I was having, and they horked it up for a day).

Reviews.Title: “best place my family has ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: bfdfirefighter
Reviews.Content: first time i have ever done a review but i felt like i needed to, the place was very clean and our two room condo was very very nice. kids had there own room and my wife and i had our priviate room with a nice master bath just like the pics.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the waterslide pool!”
Reviews.Author: pednurse
Reviews.Content: Our stay was mid-June in the 400 building, 3 bedroom/2 bath. After a misunderstanding and some disappointment at check-in which was actually our exchange company's fault...we thought we were getting 3 full bedrooms. What was booked was 1 king/1 queen, each with a living area and sofa bed, kitchen and bath. Although the condos were spacious and had plenty of room for our party of seven. Each had a washer and dryer, were well stocked and clean, but the furnishings and interior were somewhat dated. The property has 3 nice pools. Two of which stayed open until midnight. Unfortunately, our favorite, the waterslide pool and the bar & grill closed at dusk. The lifeguards at this pool were exceptional and I commend them for their attentiveness to even minor mishaps! Shipwreck Sally's Bar & Grill had great food and drinks. Just wish they would have stayed open a little later. The property was lush and clean, had on-site mini golf, paddle boats and daily & evening activities, even though we did not participate in these. Our only request for extra linens and pillows was immediately responded to by the front desk and promptly delivered by friendly personnel. Although Liki Tiki was not as "fancy" as some of the condos we have booked in Orlando, I would recommend especially for vacationers with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: sleggat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great stay at the Liki Tiki. Our 4 year old had a blast at the water park. We had a great time hanging out there as well. Ship Wreck Sally's had the best food and excellent drinks. We love the Liki Tiki Punch =) We also had alot of fun playing bingo. We really enjoyed our stay! Next year we want to bring the whole extended family for a family reunion

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: liznhu
Reviews.Content: this place is the best. our family of 5 stay there from 6/10 to 6/16. the kids love it. check in was like 5 minute. when we got to the condo the kids was all excited. the place feel like home. love every thing from the check in, pool, ect...the only thing that i wish they need tho change was the carpet. its was old and dirt. make sure you were sock or wash your feet before go to bed. beside that love every thing about it. our room was 307b.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Enigma111
Reviews.Content: Just got back to Pennsylvania from Liki Tiki. Absolutely everything we imagined and more. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms (we rented a 3-BR unit, actually 2 plus 1, and a 1-BR to handle a dozen people) were spotlessly clean and nicer than we thought they would be. The slide pool was a bit frenetic with all of the kids (you expected tranquility at a pool with waterslides?), the central pool (salt) was wonderful, warm and much quieter. The grounds are well-kept and everything was very tasteful. Disney parks are a 15-minute drive (if you can't spare 15 minutes each way, your itinerary is way too OCD). In a word, perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: scienceiscool
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for our family vacation - grandma, mom, dad, & kids -10, 8, & 5 years old. We loved the water park, & the life guards were really attentive! There were tons of planned activities, both free and some with a small charge. The surrey bikes were fun, and we all fit on one. We stayed in a 2 bedroom that had lots of room for the kids to play, yet was relaxing for the adults. The kitchen area was a great size, and the balcony was nice for enjoying a cup of tea in the mornings. Take advantage of the free 5X7 photo. The photographer was wonderful, and we got some great family photos at very reasonable prices! This was a very enjoyable place to vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond expecatations!”
Reviews.Author: ppperegoy
Reviews.Content: We were also somewhat leary after reading some of the other reviews here, but it in the end we were more than satisfied. Our 2 bedroom unit was near the pool with the Tiki Hut and was clean, well decoarted, and stocked with the appropriate supplies. We didn't have any issues during our stay and we found the staff to be friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Ron and Lance from the the f&b department showed us a great time and were very cordial with our children. The pool party on Sundays is one not to be missed, our kids had such a blast dancing and playing with the giant beach balls. We were not hassled at all concerning timeshares and never had any problems with the internet. We would give Liki Tiki 5 stars and we hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “i want to be back there!”
Reviews.Author: EssexUkpeter
Reviews.Content: we were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews..but dont be..we stayed in 500 building overlooking south oasis pool for a fortnight. nice and quiet. just a 5 min walk to harbour area for water slides etc if thats what you want. personally we were happy with 'our' pool. Once you have your resort fee ticket (ours was included in price from Expedia) you get free mini golf, cycle hire, paddleboats, fishing and tennis,..which was fun in 98 degs! Condo was clean, had everything and got fresh towels, washing powders, coffee, dishwasher stuff etc replenished after a week which was a bonus. we had a 2 bed condo and counted 27 towels when we got there!! beat that! Really short drive to disney, walmart and publix. No hassle about timeshare or presentations, just said we had all our tickets when we checked in and wasnt bothered again. would go back in a flashto Lik Tiki...please!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Thefam88
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Liki Tiki in 10 years. I was not sure about this one after reading some of the reveiws. I am not sure how people could have had a bad experience. We did not have any problems, everything was nice and clean. You will be about 15 minutes from the disney parks and just minutes from Walmart and resturaunts. Kids loved the water park and parents loved the pool and spa. Had a great time and will return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Luckyguy09
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the time of our stay, the front desk agent "Judy "was very helpful, super on point with her job and when she discovered their was a problem with our reservation she was able to take care of it right on the spot. Also I really have to give her praise for her great customer service and the ablilty to handle herself excellent under pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adbrey
Reviews.Content: At first when I booked this hotel I was worried about some of the reviews that I had read. THE REVIEWS WERE SO WRONG. I stayed in unit 209 c, and it was great. The condo was clean, and in a perfect location right across from the lagoon and all of the activities. As for the people who said the resort doesnt supply anything. they are wrong. We had soap and shampoo in both bathrooms. Soap for the washing machince, and dishwasher. When we ran out we asked for more and gave us more. We did not pay extra. Also for the people that said internet acc was not included Yes it was for FREE. There are no hidden charges. So I suggest you go stay here and enjoy your stay. They also have D.J.'s by the water park mini golf kids playground surrey bikes, and a hawaiian luau (didnt get to go to it but heard it was fun) Plus 2 other pools on the grounds. Daily activities ect. I would be glad to send anyone pics of the grounds, and the one we stayed in if they would like. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone that wants a nice resort at a good price, and location. Also go to the Boston Lobster Feast great food, and Arabian Nights Dinner Show.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place with children!”
Reviews.Author: pauldarken
Reviews.Content: Loved it here. We were in a 1 bed condo so we used the sofa bed in the lounge. It meant we could have the lounge, kitchen and balcony when the kids were asleep. The kitchen was fully equipped so we were able to prepare meals there although there was no grill, just an oven with 4 hob rings. There was a large fridge freezer, microwave and dishwasher which were useful. The lounge had a sofabed as mentioned which was comfy to sit on but less so to sleep on. The mattress was a little too thin and one of the bars dug into our legs. It would have been more suited to young children really. The TV was good, 45 channels. There was also a TV in the bedroom which my kids loved. It gave us all our own space. There is also a safe in the cupboard. The bathroom has a jacuzzi bath with shower and a really useful washing machine and dryer. We did all our washing before we came home which was great. The real highlight is the pool area which has a mini water park. My girls, 5 and 7, loved it and were able to play all day within it. It is fenced off with a gate so they knew where they could/couldn't go. Slides and water chutes galore! Great for a day when you don't want to do a theme park! The lifeguards were excellent and very attentive. The deepest point was 4ft too (at the end of the slide) in just 1 spot whereas the rest was between 3ft -3ft 6 so safe for my girls who could stay in their depth mostly. ENtertainment at the pool was good too as was the bar. They also serve food. When you arrive the staff will offer you a free breakfast but advise you don't take it as it comes with a 90 minute show and hard sell on buying a time share. I was just firm with them when they offered me the breakfast as I'd read the reviews beforehand. Also, if you get called in the morning, we didn't btw, don't answer the phone as again, they are trying to sell timeshare.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Some where in the US of A
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic we will go back”
Reviews.Author: englishmumof2
Reviews.Content: Superb condos. The condo was clean and well maintained and well stocked to cook in, even the sofa bed was ultra comfortable! The pool was big and clean very well staffed. Our boys aged 8 and 5 loved it they have fun in the slides and the water sprays. It does get very busy at the weekends but we just headed to the theme parks. It is near a Walmart and Target to stock up on cold drinks and snack for the days out. Staff where very pleasant and at the pool water was provided for free. Would recommend to any families. if you are after quiet pool don't stay here as is it loud and fun. The condo's are quiet though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: terie55
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Liki Tiki because the pictures of the pool and the outdoor area looked so fun for our kids! The rooms were clean though a bit dated but it was fine. It's not like we stayed in our room all day long for it to bother us. There was a full kitchen with all dinnerware, pots, utensils etc. My kids loved the pool and the adults enjoyed the little bar area that also served food which was a plus! We had a great time and would go back!! The only thing was the internet service was extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Joseph /Michel's review”
Reviews.Author: pjosep01
Reviews.Content: I just want to let you know of what a wonderful job Judy Pagan is doing here at Liki Tiki. From the time I got here she has not stopped asking my family if there is anything else she can do. I just want to thank her for her obsession to Total Customer Satisfaction. Her thoughfulness and her dedication distinguish her as a Champion of Customer Satisfaction. Thanks, Pierre

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamlovesIslands
Reviews.Content: I throughly enjoyed my stay at the Liki Tiki Village! Clean rooms, high pressure showers, close to attractions. It was lovely to leave the parks then relax in the pool and hot tub before bed. The security guard that came to close the pool was the most memorable! What a sweet heart! After escorting me and my girlfriends out of the pool area, which was quite the task, I realized I dropped our only room key and he patiently waited and scoured the property with me to find it. Adrian was quite a professional and a gentlemen. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with just a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Biylie
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Came for the pool and Water park. Hours for the pool were terrible. Only one day did we get to spend any time there. (we were there for 7) Liked the pool and the kids had a good time but should have different hours. Never stayed at one that closed so early. Ate at Sally's food was good and the service was good too. Another issue was we were told they had breakfast in the mornings we found out the 1st day the hours for that was terrible too, we were turned away. So we finally made it on the last day since we hadn't planned anything for that day and were very disapointed litterally bagels and juice is what they had. I don't know what we expected but we didn't think we would have to load our children up and be back by check out. All in all it was nice and the day we got to spend at the pool was worth it we just know not to base our trip around it. We even had friends staying about 10 minutes away so we went to their hotel to swim in the pool it had slides and stuff too and it was open well after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travelw2boys
Reviews.Content: This place was great for my family of 4 (two kids 5 and 2). The best part of this place has to be the main Liki Tiki Pool Area with the slides and mushroom and pools. I love the pool that gradually gets deeper for the little ones - the kids especially liked the water slides. There are also other pool areas - if you want a quieter more relaxed pool and in the evenings we would often hit the heated pool with gas grills so we could grill dinner and swim at the same time! It was wonderful! Very relaxing! We also enjoyed the mini golf, surrey bikes and paddleboating! Its like you don't have to leave the place - unless of course, you are going to go to explore the rest of Orlando! The drive to the Disney area was very easy and quick. Its nice to come home to their spacious rooms and relax there when you need to. We stayed in the 1400 building and enjoyed it! The only downsides were the Florida heat and mosquitoes in the evening.....You also had to pay extra to have your room cleaned during your stay (as these are condos). The good thing about the condos are that they have a great kitchen and the rooms are nice. We had no complaints about the room - it was great and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: close2homer
Reviews.Content: we went with other families- we had a great time! the only complaints- you NEED shoes by the pool, pavement gets very hot in the sun! There is very little shade anywhere so wear your sunblock and be prepared to be HOT- pool is great, kids had fun- its perfect for a weekend trip. Since these are timeshares/ AND hotel, you can bring your coolers in to the pool- the sign says you cant but they dont mind- we brought our own drinks in (beer and water) but used the bar for the mixed drinks.... Food at the bar is very good too. No complaints - we will def. go back.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, had better from this resort though...”
Reviews.Author: Hunterleesmomma
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Liki Tiki and have stayed before. This trip however was not the best for us. The room was missing several listed items in the kitchen. A huge burnt pan mark on the kitchen counter and other small eminence issues. Which upset us little bit considering we pay a fairly high maintence fee every year to cover stuff like this. We did have an issue with another guest. I do believe that Adam Lentz and Angel Nieues (?) handled it very well. They were very sympatric and genuinely concerned with the issue. I do however feel that the resort itself could have compensated better than a 25$ meal. My son loved the water park, as he did last time. Pool staff was very friendly with the children but also very attentive to what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can,t wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: brenda018
Reviews.Content: We were there from May15-22nd and the place was very clean and nice with excellent linens in the MB. The water park was great for smaller children the grand children enjoyed it very much. The life guards do a great job. Good to have a washer/dryer in the unit. Will definitely stay again. We had two rooms 1031F and 1032 F and a daughter stayed their in 2009. Great vacation.and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jackfog
Reviews.Content: This is about the 10th time we have stayed at the Liki Tiki. For the money its fantastic. We have 3 children and comfortably stay in a 2 bed unit in either 7, 8 or 9 block. This is near to the lagoon area and has lovely views over the lake/lagoon. If there is one small complaint I have about our stay it's the bar/restaurant area. I think they have new management there and although they were friendly enough and the food was ok etc., they really were not a patch on the former Shipwreck Sally!. Also, we noticed, apart from the days when the fantastic Jammin Jimmy is there doing Karaoke and the Luau, this area is very rarely open past lagoon closing time. This is really annoying when you come back from a day out only to find it all shut up by 7.30 - 8pm! Lastly we noticed this time around, they have cut the days the karaoke is there. Shame! our kids love this man, he is a real entertainer and these are the days when the bar usually stays open later! That being said we do still love this place and are in the process of booking again for October this year.

Reviews.Title: “My Two Cents- The Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: TheVirginiaGentleman
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki Village acted as our "base of operation" during our vacation in Orlando. The Room(s) Because there were 7 of us on vacation together (my wife, two kids, in-laws and sister-in-law), we rented two adjoining suites which were linked by an interior door that could be opened between the two suites. Both suites were equipped with a full kitchen, living/family area, bedrooms, bathroom(s) and a screened in porch area. The larger of the two suites contained two bedrooms and two bathrooms while the smaller suite contained only one bedroom and bathroom. Both kitchens came equipped with some dishware and flatware, a dishwasher, microwave, a coffee maker and a stove/oven. The larger of the two suites had a washing machine and dryer. On arrival, the rooms were very clean and in good order. The bathrooms were very clean and the shower in the bathroom my wife and I used worked very well. Be aware that the resort did NOT provide new towels on a daily basis, but we were aware of this fact from the beginning and the washer/dryer can be utilized for people who need a clean towel every morning. The only "maintenance" problem that we ran into with the suites was that several of the key-cards stopped working halfway through the week. The staff at was very helpful with this and got us new key cards immediately upon request. NOTE: The worst part of the resort were the elevators. They are UNBELIEVABLY slow and the one in our building broke down at least twice during our stay. Unless you have luggage, use the stairs. Location For those who do not wish to stay at the Walt Disney Resort or the Universal Studios Resort, this was a great location. The resort is located west of Orlando just off of Route 192 and is approximately 10-15 minutes from Walt Disney World and approximately 20-25 minutes from Sea World and Universal Studios. We had virtually no trouble getting to the parks and back again in the evenings although I will admit that we went during an "off-peak" time of the year and I suppose traffic could be heavier during other times of the year. We found the trip to and from the park to be quite reasonable. The resort has the feel of being "off the beaten path" but is still very closely situated to several shopping centers where you can buy groceries or clothing as needed. Amenities Truthfully, we spend almost all of our time at the Parks and only came back to the resorts to sleep. I will note that the resort had a very nice playground for children as well as some athletic areas (tennis court, basketball court). The nicest part of the resort is the small waterpark which is generally situated in the middle of the resort area. We went to the park in November and although the weather was beautiful, it wasn't really great swimming weather. We took the kids to the waterpark the first evening we arrived and they had a really great time. There was also a bar area for the grownups to get a drink while the kids played in the pool area. I know that there was a restaurant attached to the main building at the resort, however, we did not eat there and opted to either cook food in our kitchen or eat fast food. Overall I thought that the resort was a great place to stay and really worked to our advantage. We saved a lot of money by eating breakfast (and many of our dinners) at the resort instead of inside of the Disney Parks. As stated above, there are a number of shopping centers which are located in close proximity to the resort so that we could easily pick up groceries, ect... There are also a large number of stores which line Route 192 on your way into the parks where you can get Disney and Harry Potter souvenirs which are cheaper than those you will find in the parks. I would certainly recommend this hotel/resort to any family that is vacationing in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Roberto_11
Reviews.Content: We chose Liki Tiki Village for its price. It was the lowest on a long list of hotels in the Orlando area. Fortunately, we made an excellent choice. Our 12-day-staying in a 2-bedroom condo was great! We took our 3-year-old daughter that had a lot of fun in the water park, pedal boats, mini-golf and several other activities provided in the complex. The apartment was spaciously well divided, comfortable and fully equipped. I mean FULLY equipped with all the appliances you may need and some you may not need. The hotel is a little bit far from International Dr and Florida Mall, so don’t even consider the possibility of not renting a car during your staying. Wi-Fi internet was painfully slow and difficult to connect on our room. Just make it clear that there’s no room service included on the base rate. They don’t clean the apartment, change sheets and towels, provide toilet paper, soap and supplies, unless you call for it and pay for it separately.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: cindyiowa
Reviews.Content: The rooms are decent, if you choose the newer units, newly remodeled! We were forced to pay for ammenities, which I have never before paid here. The ammenities stunk!!! I asked the front desk, what these were for- the replied: ammentities" Ok!! The pools were ok The miniature golf, was a joke, the paddle boats, are in a small little area, that took a whole 5 min. to get around it all I would suggest to let everyone know of the ammentity fee before booking, or you are going to lose a lot of clients, like me!!] never again!!! I do not stay somewhere, where you pay for nothing!! Terrible!! Also the breakfast was terrible as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: ms305gee
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant after reading some of the reviews... We enjoyed our stay. We had a two bedroom townhouse 306 b & it was perfect. The only con was that we didn't have a tv in the second room ( with two twins which was kids room) pros : lots to do.. Close to publix & papa johns, full kitchen , huge bed in master bedroom, patio, & our room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: epoirier
Reviews.Content: Booked this place spur of the moment on Expedia and then read reviews so was worried about what we would find. Luckily we were more than happy with this hotel. We were in room 742E, two bedroom suite. It was very clean, lovely balcony with view of the pond area. Every amenity we needed. Loved having a washer/dryer in our suite with did away with the need for maid service. We only used the "adult" salt water pool but it was clean, warm, and never too busy. The hot tub was nice after a long day at the park. Hubby and I would go each morning around 7:30 and have the pool to ourselves and we'd all go again after visiting the parks in the evening. It would get busy when the kids pool area closed at dusk. We were never bothered with time share sales pitches but perhaps because I told them at check in we already had park tickets. They did leave a message each day about a free photo but I never called back about it. I rated service 4/5 only because we never needed any service so couldn't rate it 5/5. We all would go back again. We were about 20 minutes from the Disney parks. Lots of restaurants within 10 minutes (Olive Garden, Applebees, Miller's Ale House). One bedroom had king size bed, one had 2 3/4 size beds. Master bedroom had whirlpool tub and a large walk in shower. All very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Tovi2012
Reviews.Content: The staff bent over backwards in meeting my requests. My only complaint was the resort fee which seemed out of line for what you get and things seemed well worn. This is a decent place but definitely not worth Intervalworlds Gold rating considering some of the other resorts we have been to in Orlando. I would not recommend only because there are so many other nicer places in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TamaraMc
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Liki Tiki. The condo was dated but had everything we needed. Liki Tiki supplies you with the necessities, to cook, clean and do laundry. Everything was kept so clean throughout the entire resort. We found all the staff extremely friendly and helpful. We spent the majority of time at the pool; it was great for all ages. Liki Tiki is close to everything (Disney, restaurants, grocery stores & shopping). Our family enjoyed our time there so much that we have decided to go back.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Good hotel/rental”
Reviews.Author: sstitely
Reviews.Content: Nice suite/room - no frills, but comfortable. Quiet pool for adults is nice, separate pool for kids to play. Overall good place.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2011”
Reviews.Author: EvilOpie
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my wife and 3 kids, ages 11, 9 & 6, and a great time was had by all. The room was very clean and well supplied. The location to Disney was excellent. We gave the kids the choice of another day at Disney, Sea World or stay and hang at the pool they chose the pool. Shipwreck Sally's was great! Tad is an awesome bartender. We met a great bunch of people around the bar. We would definatley return and will certainly recommend Liki Tiki to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Picture is not as pretty as it seems!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mperez83
Reviews.Content: Service is horrible, first night saw huge bug and they were like its Florida. Not a proper way of talking to your customers. They moved us to a new room with non working ac and old fashion tvs as well. Also found Bed Bugs, husband got all bitten up. The picture of the village is pretty, convenient, and all you can ask in one place but I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BBKING1776
Reviews.Content: I read alot of negative reviews before arriving at Liki Tiki and when i got there what i found did not jive with what i was reading.The rooms were clean and the service was good for the kind of money i spent.My kids had fun at the pools and the property was well maintained.My only complaint was the wifi which was ridiculously slow.....other than that it was a pretty enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased”
Reviews.Author: meandthe5boys
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews and being leary about our stay I felt compelled to write this. We stayed in the 1300 building and it was very clean and spacious. Only exception was the carpet, all of our socks were completely black. The pools, landscaping and amenities were very well kept up. I called one night for an extra blanket and received it within 10 minutes. The check-in went very smoothly. I had read the walls were very thin, we could hear the neighbors however the bedrooms were placed so we were never interruted during the night and I have little ones who deperately need sleep. We would very much enjoy going back! The internet connection was very slow however. We did not pay extra for any amenities they were all included in our rate.

Reviews.Title: “beware bugs, insects and more bugs”
Reviews.Author: tommuss10
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a sat nite, place looked good, mosquitos flying in front door as soon as it was opened due to large bright lite outside the door, large gap under door invited roach looking creatures which ended up in suitcases upon our arrival home after out trip. I called to speak with mgmt and not much sympathy at all.. was told its a part of florida enviroment.... you get what you get....some of staff..not too friendly ..wall tooo thin heard neighbors all nite and lots of flushing or running water all nite...was given free internet but had to take laptop outside to parking lot to get it connected and working

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cofield3
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 4 pm, there was no wait, they had 4 people working the front desk, and the person handling my check-in was very friendly. We were told we were going to be on the 5th flr., so I requested a ground floor room. Not only were we given a ground floor room, but it was closer to the pool area. 1 bedroom condo was a perfect size for family of four. Grounds were kept clean everyday. The highspeed internet was hardly a bleep on the screen. Pool was nice, but we only used it the first evening; we were at Disney all day and night, and pool closed at 8pm. We were told the pool closest to office was open later. The property is about 15 to 20 minute drive to Disney; not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Ady1219
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time at Liki Tiki Village...it is a wonderful resort, specially for children. Besides having two great pools, it has its own small water park plus activities for children, my sister loved it. It has a basketball court, canoes available for canoeing on the lakes, and tennis court. Wonderful staff, and very clean! Definitely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Will come back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sproetjes
Reviews.Content: We are fromt the Netherlands and coming to this resort for years. And yes of course we do have complaints sometimes but it was always taking care of really quick. Reading some of the reviews make me think what kind of people are they who are complaining about everything ? Are they eating from golden plates at home? Do they live in a mansion where they come from? This resort is WONDERFUL. The staff is really nice and helpfull. I am looking forward to our next vacation in september. Liki Tiki thanks for many happy vacations and see you in september!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: Moramare
Reviews.Content: We're currently staying at LikiTiki to have a chill vacation under the sun. Booked through Expedia it was a bit unclear what exactly we had booked, and whether it would all be delivered too. Well, it was delivered, for sure! We booked a two-bedroom condo and ended up in one of the two-floor townhouses; this really feels like having a home. Inside the house however tha upstairs airconditioning is not delivering what it should and the kids' bedroom is rather hot. They don't care however so I won't either. The resort itself is a bit 'Hidihi Hodiho' - the early eighties show abut a resort staff. It irritates me that I have a daily voicemail message with an over-excited staff member telling me what I am missing or should not miss. I'm not here to be entertained, I'll entertain myself, thank you. The waterpark was fun for one hour but after that my kids (8 and 7 years old) decided they wanted an old-fashioned swim so we (luckily) moved to the 'normal' pool. That pool - by the way - is a salt-water pool... The location of the resort is about at the end of Irlo Bronson Highway, where the 'markers' have already stopped. The 7Eleven has a small selection of groceries and is only a 5 minutes walk away. 5 Minutes by car from the resort you'l find a Publix and Target grocery store. I haven't seen the continental breakfast offered in the hotel lobby on any day so it seems that they have stopped this service. In short; a great resort when you travel with kids and don't want to bother going out for dinner every day. Should you wish to be more centrally located; find another place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Lots Of Fun At Your Fingertips!”
Reviews.Author: BBG37
Reviews.Content: The resort offered so many activities to do as a family or on your own, and were all included with your stay. The resort was spacious and well equiped with everything you needed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The resort was well kept, clean and appealing. The condo unit was really nice, clean, and well equiped with all the ammenities of home! It's located close to Disney and all shopping and eating as well. A wonderful place to stay! I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous for anyone”
Reviews.Author: ssmudge33
Reviews.Content: Considering I booked the resort from my work base in Middle East, and family all come from UK, was overwhelmed on how clean with beautiful surroundings the resort was. It was classed as 3* on website where I found it, but this does NOT do it justice, The Condos were very well fitted out & very clean & comfortable, including everything you would need to have a wonderful stay. ALL the staff were extremely helpful & friendly....and very efficient & informative.....this even included the security gate staff (Angel). We were so impressed we became an owner!!!

Reviews.Title: “This travel agent was very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: tksgirl68
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I just returned from 4 glorious nights at the Liki Tiki resort in Orlando. I loved this place!. We had a 2 bedroom townhouse building 102D & after 3 busy days onsite at Disney, this was a great way to unwind & enjoy the Florida sun. We loved the Liki Tiki waterpark, the play park & all the amenities they offered. I was a little worried after reading some reviews, but honestly, this resort was amazing!. The kids loved the waterpark & the salt water pool near the central building was open until midnight.We rode the surry bikes. played mini golf & used the water pedal boats. They even have a little gator who like to hang out under the bridge by the play park. My kids thought he was awesome - but not so big that he was scary. The resort was so clean & well maintained. We chatted with a staff memeber who gave us lots of info on gators & the area. Everyone was very friendly & helpful. I noticed the resort was mostly families with smaller children. If you get a chance, eat lunch at shipwreck Sally's - awesome food & not too expensive. Although I highly recommend clients that are doing Disney, to stay at Disney, if you are looking for a great, clean & friendly resort that is only about a10 min drive to many attractions, this place is worth it. We found a Publix grocery store nearby & stocked up on breakfast & dinner stuff. We ate lunch at the waterpark because the food was so good. I would definatly stay here again, & trust me - I have seen many hotel & resorts in my +20yrs as a travel agent, this resort was really clean & well worth the money. Way to go Liki Tiki resort! This travel agent was very impressed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with Children? U will Love Liki Tiki!”
Reviews.Author: miranda94fire
Reviews.Content: Just got home from Kissimmee. Let me just say this is the best place to stay if you have small children. The staff was very helpful and pleasent. The grounds was very clean and nice! Our room was great, very clean! We stayed in 732F, 700 building...3rd floor. The condo was a 1 bedroom with a pull ou couch, kitchen, 1 bathroom, washer and dryer. They also had limited dishes and cooking ware. Overall it was a wonderful place and we will return this summer! Wal-mart is right around the corner, Take 192 towards Clermont get off on the Clermont exit. Wal-mart is about a mile or so on the right hand side. From the Resort it's about 2.4 miles total. I had a guest ask me where was the nearest Walmart, she was very greatful to know it was right around the corner. Over all our stay I give this Resort an A++++

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks later and still can't put an end to my experience!”
Reviews.Author: randalstacie
Reviews.Content: We saved and planned this trip 3 months in advance. Out of all the resorts in Orlando, we chose this one. A vacation is just that, a vacation away from the day in and day out stresses at home. Repairs, isssues, dealing with people issues. Our first night was great and then we woke up for our first full day.....storm came through in a.m. and cleared out by 2pm. Tried to rent a bike (we paid fees in advance) and all rentals were closed. Water slides did not work and lots of repairs were taking place on property. These are things that stand out the second you have one bad experience. Same day, later in the afternoon we go down to grill (grills that we were told to use) and 2 of 4 would not light, egnitor broken. The other 2 were being used by 1 family....so, up I go to call again about my frustration (starting to feel like I am not on vaca). They send maintenance to light the grill. After drinking a couple glasses of wine I was able to relax. Day 2....we go out for the day and come back to make dinner and end the day with American Idol, NOT SO FAST! The hot water in the kitchen sink would not turn off...continuous flow. We shut it down from the main valve, and again!! called for maintenance. After 2 hours they replaced the faucet. I had enough at this point. My husband and I agreed that we wanted to check out the next day and go where we could enjoy what was left of our vacation! Talked to the Ops Mgr and after being told that it would be our choice to leave so no refund, I argued as any person would and finally after a long debate, he agreed to give the credit. As I stated in my "Title"....2 weeks and still NO REFUND on those two nights. When I called last Thursday (week after we left) the credit had not even been initiated! Now after being "promised" again for a credit (expedited) still NOTHING! I have left him another message! I have been a store manager for 15 years and honestly could not imagine what customer base I would have with this type of service! Beyond frustrated and definitely the worst experience I have EVER had and I paid for it!!!! They are doing nothing "extra" just simply (at some point) refunding for the 2 nights we DID NOT stay! I advise anyone to go elsewhere, there are too many to choose from and I suggest any by RCI! We stayed twice at an RCI resort and both times were awesome, not one issue!

Reviews.Title: “Condo not so bad but the amenities stink!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover1969
Reviews.Content: Ok so, here is how it went.... Check in was a quick but only because we told the girl at the parking permit/ timeshare hoopla we needed to go check in because I wasn't feeling well which was the truth. She was very reluctant to let us go and never showed any sympathy for my ill state, but that's ok no harm. If we had stayed to listen to her talk, it would have been much longer judging form the others in front of us. We had a 1 br 1 bath in the 700 building. Everything was renovated and the condo was clean. No signs of bug problems, but remember this was April not July. :) We had a very nice view of the lake and the balcony was peaceful and good sized. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was fine. The pull out sofa bed was new, in fact, I would say probably never slept on. Nice flat screen tvs in the living room and bedroom. They provided us with enough supplies (tp,soap, etc) to last us our whole stay of 6 nights. The only real negative of the condo was the adjoining door to the next condo. Yes, they have adjoining condos like some hotels do. I was quite surprised when we were sitting in the living room and could hear everything the people next door were saying! I mean they might as well have been in the same room as us. Which leads me to my observation... we got a great deal on this condo and so do most others that rent here so you may want to think about that as far as who you are renting with. I mean the clientele was not the most savory I must admit. Some families, but also some people who enjoyed drinking it up at the tiki bar and being very loud and obnoxious, Just an observation I made :) Anyway, the location is good because you have plenty of shopping close by yet you are not in the heart of the crazy traffic. The Sherberth Rd shortcut is a lifesaver for Disney. The amenities were a joke. The swimming pool with the slides was closed most of our stay and at least one or two slides closed the whole time. Things were faded and you could tell in need of some work. They do have lifeguards present which is a nice touch. The mini golf was just terrible and I think it must have flooded recently because it was wet and sand was washed up all over the green areas. One of the docks was sunk as well which was quite an eyesore. Since the water park pool wasn't working properly, we spent most of our time at the pool at the front office. It was nice and they had a small tiki bar and music playing. This is where we experienced the loud patrons that were seemingly quite inebriated. The pool was not terribly clean, but not terrible and the hot tub was being replaced while we were there so construction was going on which kind of squelched most relaxation. I know this is long, but I wanted to explain what we experienced because these are things I would want to know. We are not terribly picky people and I knew this would not be a 5 star resort when we got there, but some things don't have to be this way. Over all we had a good stay, but I do feel this "resort" is far from a resort and while they seem to be trying to upgrade some things they still have a long way to go before it meets the standards they are claiming. Maybe in a couple of years if they get everything upgraded. If you are wanting to stay here just for a place to lay your head between Disney parks, this place would be fine. If you are planning to use the amenities and stay at a resort, you may want to look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vaca Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: JmcNY72
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying we did stay in a two bedroom condo in the 1400 block. We were told this was the newer of the blocks. We stayed in 1411E, if you can request that room you won't be sorry. I just want to start by saying how wonderful this place was, after reading the negative reviews that may I say I stressed over so thank you for all of those nay sayers out there who obviously are extremely picky. Our condo was spotless, I couldn't even find a spec of dust anywhere like some people reported. It was nicely tiled with neutral colors, there were LCD tv's in each of the bedrooms and one in the living room. The master bedroom had an awesome shower, that had three shower heads one being a rain drop style. The second bedroom had two full size beds with a full bathroom next to it. The bathroom had a jacuzzi style bathtub with shower. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed from pots and pans to silverware. They also included dishsoap and garbage bags for your trash. Washer and dryer were behind two paneled doors with detergent. There was a little enclosed porch with a table so you could sit out. The view was nothing to write home about but we didn't care. We didn't use it at all actually. The staff was wonderful, from the gate security guards to the front desk to the actual maids you encountered from time to time. We did not encounter miserable workers like some had stated. Noone acted like we were bothering them at all. We felt safe because it was a gated resort, that they seemed to be very strict with who came in. The waterpark area, was wonderful!! It was on the smaller side, but it was perfect for my daughter (8) and my son (4). It didn't seem overly crowded and we were always able to get a lounger right up front. You didn't need to get up early and put your towels down, which by the way if you are not down there and you try doing that they will take your towels away and put them off to the side. We found that out, guess that's a no no. Which I can understand it isn't really fair. Like I said you really don't even need to do that. Sunday afternoon seemed to be the busiest there, they have a Dj that gets people movin and dancing. That was the only time you might have an issue getting a chair. Shipwreck Sally's was nice. Food was your typical, burger and fries. Full bar as well, with nice frozen drinks to sip on by the pool. Close to Disney, about a 10-15 min drive. I consider that close I guess, staying on the actual Disney property would have doubled our cost and for just a simple hotel room. Maybe we just lucked out, but we did not see one bug in our condo. The grounds were well maintained. We had no issue with our internet service it was not slow at all. Our room keys never failed us. Ohhhh and not ONE and I mean not ONE person talked to us about a time share. We had three messages the whole time we were there on our phone and they were inviting us to a Karoake night, fish fry, and to get a complimentary photo of our family. I have to say that we didn't pick up the welcome package at the front desk so maybe we would have encountered someone asking about a time share but some people said they had constant phone calls asking them to come to a seminar. Didn't happen to us. A couple we spoke to at the pool said they were asked once and when they politely declined that was the last time they were asked. We also were not charged any "resort fee" Unless it was bundled into our price, we were not charged any. All and all we had a wonderful time and plan on staying there again. I wish that I wouldn't have taken all of the negative reviews to heart, I would have saved myself alot of stress and was very close to not staying here. If I can answer anyones questions please let me know, I would be happy to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay! would go again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: steelersfan58
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on here. But i quickly realized that some people you just can't please(probably rich snobs) Liki tiki was great! my 5 year old and 12 year old were thrilled. They have 2 pools, one is just a pool and the other is a mini water park. The water park was great! the black slide (which i rode about 50 times myself) was super fast! The water was warm and my 5 year old who was usually afraid of the water actually learned to swim at liki tiki! The 2 bedroom villa was huge! and CLEAN! No bugs,no dirty sheets nothing! It is NOT in the middle of nowhere either, it's just off route192 which is a major road loaded with places to eat, shop, and have a blast! I don't understand what people are talking about. Security was friendly, helpful and took their job's seriously. One in fact greeted me with "welcome back" every time i returned to ltv. The only real problem we had was at check in. After you check in they tell you to go to the desk behind you for your parking permit for the week. It's actually a time share thing and the rude girl behind the desk tried to get her to buy something and after my wife informed her that we were a low income family and could not afford a time share, the rude girl replied,"well then you will be treated badly if you don't buy something here" They will treat you bad if you don't buy a time share. Who say's that? The only other issue was the hot tub being closed for allmost our entire stay, but with a lot of teens there we only had one shot at the hot tub anyway. They tend to "hog" it. Ha ha...but anyway. Our villa was super clean and the a.c. was amazing as it was hot during our stay. Washer and dryer were great, the master bedroom was big and the bed was huge! we loved our stay in liki tiki and would go back tomorrow if we could. After reading some bad reviews before we left we were a little worried, but my wife called down there before we went and asked the girl if they had a bed bug problem and she was honest with my wife and did say they had a outbreak about 2 years ago but so did all of the resorts in florida. She assured my wife the rooms are inspected regularly and we believe they do. Overall our stay was amazing and liki tiki was an amazing place to stay! I highly recomend it to anybody. We paid $330 a person for air,and 7 day's in liki tiki and sea world and discovery cove( discovery cove was awesome, sea world was a rip off though) For the price we paid we got way more then we thought we would get. If you have a family stay at liki tiki village you will not be disappointed. Safe,clean,spacious. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: PBKN
Reviews.Content: The trip started out great at check in.The desk clerk moved us to an even better room than the one we had reserved (did not even request it). We were on an 8 night family vacation. We were notifed that my mother was dying two days into our stay, and we had to leave immediately. The front desk staff, Theresa Fernandez, was so helpful and supportive. She faxed the funeral arrangements for us and took it upon herself to contact us later to check on us. This was above and beyond the call of duty. Even the lifeguards were friendly and played with my disabled son in the pool. We look forward to returning to enjoy another family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One chance to make a lasting impression”
Reviews.Author: Jack2u095
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Orlando. I had heard about the Liki Tiki from friends. First of all the place was damn near impossible to find. No signs and my gps got side tracked. When I finally got there I was greeted warmly by security who I found funny as it was late and he was all smiles. Check in was quick and easy. When we got to our room we found there were no towels or extra bedding. We called the front desk and received our items in about 15 minutes. Later on we asked the guard where we can get a good steak and some supplies. He was able to direct us to both and his directions were spot on. After this great time it then fell apart. The next guard we encountered acted as if we were bothering him, no smile, unshaven, smelling and dirty clothes. Next the water park was a joke. They made a big deal about a wave pool and We were told it was not working. The food was overpriced and tasted nasty. We got up in the morning to find a broken sprinkler drenching our car with water that smelled as if it came from a sewer. When We asked we were told it was reclaimed water. We had no idea what that was but It smelled like poop. My wife reminded the kids that we were not there for the resort but for Mickey. In short the resort was average at best. The cost was ok but 2 people were helpful while the rest were rude or nowhere to be found. Spend the extra money and enjoy a real water park. Eat out or make your own found as the one you get there is horrible. Hopefully they get signs or you will be driving around for a while.

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dancingKim824
Reviews.Content: I stay here almost every year because I get a 2 bedroom apartment instead of a room which is more comfortable after the rigors of a 3 day conference. The location is convenient enough, close to Disney and lots of shopping and dining. There is enough to do without ever leaving Liki Tiki Village! I have never had a glitch until this year when my room lock did not work and had to be reprogrammed by Security Officer Jase Morgan who did a top notch job. Kudos to a great service team!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made our 5 year old's day!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sippigrl7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LTV over spring break, and we had a wonderful stay- absolutely loved it. The kids really had a ball at the on site water park. Unfortunately, when we packed up to go home, we did not do a very good job of checking our room for stray items. About 5 hrs into a 7 hr trip home driving, our 5 year old said she couldn't find her Nintendo DSI. After searching and thinking, we determined that it probably got left in the room. We called LTV, and spoke to Angel Nieves. He was so helpful and concerned right away. He dispatched Art Kordyuk to our room to check for the DSi. Before long, we got a phone call back saying they had found it, and 2 other items we left behind! Our little girl was SO happy! We cannot thank your wonderful staff enough- thank you for saving the ending of our great trip. The package with our missing items arrived at our house Saturday- and they had been carefully wrapped as well. Thank you Angel and Art! We also really loved Shipwreck Sally's the on-site restaurant. The food was great and in great portions, and the staff was excellent- very helpful and friendly. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed, some issues, "mandatory" fee a joke”
Reviews.Author: thepiratemorgan
Reviews.Content: Our stay was March 19th - March 26th, 2011. Last year we stayed at the Marriott Harbour Lake (see my profile for review) near Seaworld, so I will use last years experience as a fair comparison. I stayed here by exchanging my owner week in Aruba. Location - A little off the beaten path, but pleasantly so. You could scoot "around the corner" on Route 27 North for Wal-Mart, Fast Food places, and a couple of sit down dinner joints without the heavy traffic of the Irlo Bronson between World Drive and Route 429. Convenient to Disney, not too bad to Seaworld as long as you realize time of day for traffic considerations on the I-4. Although you could probably travel "surface" streets to bypass the I-4 to get there (International Drive). Check-in - Way too long, just about a half hour, and on top of it all our room wasn't "ready". Amazing, another reviewer said they were rushing people to check out, but they certainly weren't rushing to check them in. After waiting a half hour (it wasn't busy at the desk either) to "pre" check-in, and being told a "resort fee" of $55 was mandatory (more on that later), they send you over to the "concierge" desk for your "parking pass", submitting you to a timeshare selling agent whom was quite persistent even when I said I had no interest in buying a timeshare at this property as I own a week in Aruba. I pretty much had to demand my parking permit. Do you really think that I am interested in buying into your resort when you treat your first timers / exchange customers like this? Not a good first impression, and there are no second chances. Finally got a room at 3:30pm, having to be reminded once that they had until 4pm to get us a room. Really? You have until 4pm? Not ONCE have I ever been denied a room in all my travels at 1pm and I certainly have NEVER been denied a room until a half hour before actual check-in. Every resort and hotel I have ever been to have always allowed a courtesy early check in, especially those that are "fly-in" locations. The Room - Decent size for a 1 bedroom, somewhat freshly painted, but with old TV's. Don't get me wrong, I don't care about TV's when in Orlando, but LCD's are pretty cheap these days, especially when buying in bulk. The bed in the bedroom was comfortable, although the furniture in the room could have used some updating (drawers didn't line up well). The bathroom was large and had a jacuzzi tub, a nice feature. The pull out sofabed in the living room was in poor shape. The mattress was very thin and one corner of the frame was no longer supporting it. It was good enough for my 4 yr. old to sleep on, but barely good enough. I almost called to get it replaced, but she only needed half of it to sleep on. There were adequate utensils and appliances, nothing spectacular. Everything passed muster with my wife as far as cleanliness, so that's something to be said for the housekeeping crew. We were on the 5th floor and had a view of the Florida scrub brush and swamp, which I thought was great. I felt as though I was overlooking the Amazon rain forest. Better view than some parking lot, street, or another building. The balcony was large, although it wasn't screened. Which could be a good or bad thing, depending on the person. Personally, we didn't use it much so we didn't care. The Restaurant - Shipwreck Sally's, we had our last meal from this restaurant. The food was very good and the price was reasonable. Didn't have any interactions with the staff (take out), so I have no other comments. The Pool(s) - The "waterpark" is a great idea. But there is one caveat. You better have child(ren) who can hold their own against against other children. When I say "hold their own", I mean they better be able to fend for themselves against the CHAOS that entails this complex. And please, I'm no prude by any stretch of the imagination, just honest observations. There were several life guards around the "lagoons", but NOT ONE at the top of any slide to stop children from piling up on each other (as kids would do). I stood right next to one slide and watched my 4 yr. old get run over by another child on her FIRST slide!! I had to jump in and "rescue" her, and she is a GREAT swimmer, until she gets "wiped out" and disoriented by a careless kid (as kids would be). I give credit to a life guard who saw this unfold, as I did, and was just a fraction of a second off of dad's reaction time of jumping in. This is a management problem, not a kid problem. Kids will be kids, but they need to be "reeled in" by some kind of authoritative figure, be it life guard or parent and it seemed neither were doing their job. The life guards were hesitant to apply most rules, save running on the pool deck (they ignored the kids running feverishly across the "bridge" or up the waterslide tower, go figure). Needless to say we immediately packed up our stuff and found the main pool (by check-in) to be MUCH quieter and conducive to a small child. There is one more pool on site that looked to be quieter also, although we rarely went over there. All were nicely heated and the main pool had good music on in the background. On the weekend late afternoons, as I walked through to get to our unit, I noticed that the waterpark get's INSANELY busy, raucous even. The problem with this resort, in my opinion, is that they rent to the general public and this resort gets "top heavy" on weekend nights with "weekenders". Nothing wrong with that concept if you don't mind, as a timeshare owner, your weekend nights being inundated with tons of people. Marriott Harbour Lake does not rent to anyone but timeshare owners and their family members (using guest certificates). There's no "Summer Getaway" or "Central Florida Family Getaway" available at Marriott as opposed to what is listed on the Liki Tiki website's main page. The Activities - An ABSOLUTE rip off. I, as I hope others did, got slammed into a "mandatory" resort fee. If the fee was "mandatory", as I was told, twice, then why is there pricing listed for all the activities? (Bicycles $12 - half hour, ect.) If EVERYBODY is paying the "mandatory" resort fee, then who is paying $12 to ride bikes? I was told that the fee was even included on those people who were booking rooms through Expedia, Travelocity, etc. The fee is for wireless internet (no desire or need for), basketball, tennis, paddle boats, bicycle surrey's, and mini-golf. But the activities "shack" was only open from 11am - 6pm !!! Who wants to do "active" activities or play mini-golf in the middle of 85 degree "Sunshine" Florida days? Don't show up 10 mins. early (wasn't paying attention to time) to the activities "shack", because some male employee sharply reminded the small crowd that, "The activities shack doesn't open until 11am." That was the only time we tried to do any of the "activities". So they got $55 and I got squat for it. Although they had poolside activities like tattoos, painting shirts, ect., "those" activities cost extra of course. Go figure. Marriott Harbour Lake did NOT have this fee, at least not last year. Most activities were free, and the ones that were not were reasonably priced ($2 to paint a rubber ducky, ect.). Sad, because after dinner, and as the day was cooling, you would always think about doing an activity and yet the "shack" was closed up solid and promptly at 6pm Conclusion - Liki Tiki may very well respond to my review with a "canned" response as I have seen on other reviews, but don't let them fool you. Complaints about check-in have been numerous, and I still lived it. There have been complaints, longstanding, about the rooms needing updating, a fresh coat of paint worked nice, but the TV's are still badly outdated, as well as the sofabed and dressers. And instead of treating an "owner", albeit, an exchange owner, as an owner, I felt as though I was just another "motel room guest". Hell, an exchange owner is an excellent opportunity to steal business from another property. If I want to buy into your property, check me in quickly, don't slam me with "fees", and treat me like I own at your property. Then maybe I will seek out information to buy into your resort. At that point you would know you would have someone who is actually interested in the property, and not $70 worth of food vouchers to Shipwreck Sally's!! (That's what some guy by the pool bragged about getting for attending a sales pitch to which he knew he was absolutely not interested in beforehand). What a great business model, should work well during these hard economic times. Last year I was never slammed with ANY fees and NEVER approached to buy a timeshare or made to retrieve my "parking pass" from the "concierge" (Sales) desk at Marriott Harbour Lake. And now, I am seriously considering adding another week to my portfolio over at Marriott or one of their sister properties nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bcbythesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki for 8 nights and were very happy with the experience. The rooms were larger than expected and for our family of 5 it was great. We stayed near the smaller pool and had a swim and hot tub every night after returning from our Disney or Universal adventures. The rooms were dated but were clean and comfortable. The location of the Liki Tiki made it an easy trek to Disney and Universal. We did a timeshare presentation to get a discount on the Disney tickets and it took about 1hr 45min to finish. It was worth the time to get the savings on the tickets and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing to happen to Orlando since Mickey Mouse!!!”
Reviews.Author: GU1DO23
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Liki Tiki numerous times over the past 4 - 5 years. By "numerous" times I mean at least 12 - 15!! This resort has become the main reason we take family trips to Orlando!! Everything about Liki Tiki is top notch!! On our last visit, my 3 year old daughter lost her "blankie" and was heartbroken to the point that we were considering driving back up to get it! After 3 weeks of searching for a new one (with no luck), my wife finally came up with the brilliant idea, "Why not call the resort and see if they found it?" I was 100% sure that there was NO WAY they had located it...so imagine my surprise when it arrived in the mail today!!! That's right, not only did the staff find the fluffy pink heart warmer...but they mailed it back down to us! The look on my daughter's face was PRICELESS as she opened up the package, and realized that her blankie had found it's way back to her loving arms!! That being said, I'd like to send a special thanks to Jennie Morales in the lost & found security department for making my lil' princess a happy lil' dreamer again! . . . maybe after 4 weeks now, I might FINALLY get a full nights sleep! =0)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: DebO44
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews of bed bugs here but the beds appeared new and were clean. The facility were spotless, service was impeccable, and the experience was memorable. There were gas grills at the South Oasis pool so we had 2 relaxing days at the pool and grilled our lunch! Our teenagers enjoyed minature golf, the pools and tried to ride a slurry bike. Overall, we had a great time! Our 11year old had a fantastic time, too!

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be an owner”
Reviews.Author: NickyMac_11
Reviews.Content: As a timeshare owner, I return to Liki Tiki VIllage regularly. It's a welcoming, comfortable place to be. The two story villas are as peaceful as the big building units. It's a bit out of the way (15 minutes) compared to other places closer to the Disney craze, but if you don't want to visit them, it's ideal because of it's location. Grocery stores close by (Publix)...a variety of dining choices and a Super Target a few minutes down the road. There are three pools. Choose depending on your tolerance of children. I wish that the activity crew was more visible. Recycling bins in the units would help with sorting. Staff is friendly, helpful and social. The older units are being renovated. Everything is clean. The grounds are well-tended. The gym is really small so go early if you want a machine. They charge (approx.$50.00) to use the extras like fishing, paddleboats, mini-golf, bikes...unless you are an owner. I'm not sure if it's optional. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rkptwife
Reviews.Content: Check in took almost 2 hours! First night there called to ask whether the generator turning on and off every 10 minutes was going to go all night.."WHAT GENERATOR!!" said the front desk person. There was ripped blankets on our bed. They had put one of the rags used to clean in place of a washcloth..GROSSS!!! Room was soo dirty. There was a nail sticking out of the siding right at eye level of my 1 year old. The sink had an awful smell in it the water was brown and smelled. The piping from the toilet to the wall was falling out! We rented a one bedroom unit and it had a full sized bed in it...the most awful bed I have ever slept in. The pillows were stained and flat.Dresser draws would not open or close without major work. Dishwasher smelled. We checked in on fri and realized on tuesday that there was heat coming out of our oven YUP it was on and NO we never cooked once in the whole time we were there!!!!! The walls are paper thin. Our neighbors TV kept us up at night...along with the generator. Could here the neighbors cough and sneeze even during the day. Dried urine and pubic hairs around the toilet. I wanted to throw up. The balcony door didnt lock so my 1 year old kept opening it and getting out on the patio on the 4th floor. Even after being told no by my husband on check in they still continued to call and ask us to do the timeshare tour...at 8 AM. we had to pay a 55$ resort fee at check in for the use of the pool and other activities and the wifi that i couldnt get to work for more than a few minutes here and there. On check out day it says 10 am check out. There was someone knocking at 845 am and she knocked really fast 3 times then let herself in I didnt have time to get from the bedroom to the door and there is maybe 7 steps in between. She said Oh its day you leave..I said WHAT? as I didnt know what she meant and she said you leave today yes? i said yes..AT 10 am I leave. she said they tell me come now you can leave now? I said NO 10 am I will leave and I closed the door in her face. We used a pack and play that looked older than me (29) and we called to have it picked up when we left and within 5 mins they were there to get it ( took 5 hours to get it!) guy came in and said I will break it down for you and I said well could you let me take the sleeping baby out of it first please. He was in such a rush to get out he knocked over all our luggage on the luggage cart said sorry 10 times and ran out. we were already to leave the unit at 925 and when we opened the door there were 2 men sitting there waiting to get into our room. They said Oh good they are leaving early we can get outa here early!! we left the resort and realized a few minutes down 192 we forgot our babies sippy cup in the fridge. so we turned around to get it. we found it in a trash bag outside the room my husband looked in and the room already had a made bed and towels and was ready to go for the next people.....IN A MATTER OF MINUTES...I dont think so! OK I am done now I need a vacation from this nightmare..ONLY one plus I got lunch by the pool one day and the girl working at ship wreck sallys was amazing. So sweet to talk with and very friendly and efficient. she helped everyone quickly and kept a big smile on her face while she cleaned and chatted with all the guests. wish I remembered her name. took the baby in the pool once but it wasnt made for a one year old. the kiddy pool was cold and empty all the time. We stayed here on a family members timeshare swap and they stayed down the street at orange lake.. needless to say we spent ALL OUR TIME at orange lake. I can promise you this family will NEVER be back. OH and I took pics of a few things so others could see the grossness we experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids!!”
Reviews.Author: TwinsMomVA
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at Liki Tiki Village!!!! The rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. We were a little worried based on the other reviews being so-so but this place more than convinced us that this is a great place to stay for the family. Easy to get to the parks, grocery store close by and a friendly staff (hi Lexi and Rose!!). They made the trip so much fun with suggestions and information. For instance, we were there during Halloween and they let us know about the Halloween activities at Celebration which was an experience! Our kids loved the water park and would have happily spent the entire vacation there. In fact one day we were scheduled for a theme park and they just begged to stay at the water park. Yes, it's not huge or anything but it's just the right size to keep an eye on the kids and let them have fun. Our kids are 9 and had a blast. The only strange part of the room is that in the master bedroom there is a floor to ceiling clear view window in the shower which is right next to the bed! So a person lying on the bed watching TV also has the performance of the person in the shower to look at as well!! Not a problem for the hubby and I but I could see some families who are more modest thinking this is a little strange. We''ll be going back to the Liki Tiki!

Reviews.Title: “Liki Cheapy !”
Reviews.Author: joey7777777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our vacation to get a cheaper room while in Orlando which we had to attend a timeshare meeting for about 2 1/2 hours. The place was better than a hotel room because it had more room and a balcony, but that would be the extent of it. Everything reminded me of the Brady Bunch with the old outdated look of everything. The couch was hard as a park bench and the pull out bed in it had a bare old thin as paper matteress on it. The old fashion t.v. was in the kitchen dining room so you have to look over the table to see it! Strange set up. Full size kitchen was nice but stocked very scarce. We also had a ton of dead bugs in the kitchen light. If they were trying to impress us with this so called 5 star resort, they failed big time! Maybe a .5 star resort! We had to change our room key 4 times because they kept becoming demagnitized! While we were down in lobby getting another new key, there was another person down there with the same problem. Couldnt use paddle boats because the seat top kept comming off! We got a quad bike and they said to stay off the sidewalks because they get in the way of people......so ride in the parking lot with the cars they said! We just laughed and went for a half hour ride with the cars. The miniture golf is so dated and non exciting the kids wanted to quit after 15 minutes. The game room consisted of a closet on the side of the building that was stocked with about 7 very outdated vidio games and a air hockey game. The whole time we were there, they were cutting down trees all day. Im not sure why but we had a big ol stub right by our entrance. The place just seems like it was nice years ago, but now it looks like they ran out of money or something and just did not keep up with the times. It also is kind of sucluded so you cant really walk anywhere. The pool was ok, nothing fancy. A couple simple slides but good size for all ages. Seemed like more of a drinking pool for adults than anything. But everyone was very nice here. And we got some nice pictures with the kids and the wooden tiki's they have scattered by the front. The beds were comfortable and they have a safe in the room which is nice. We didnt keep the sliding glass door open because there was no screen and the door sounded like it was going to fall off the rail! I know.....I may be just fussy, but honestly they are trying to sell me this place? For fifty dollars a night I can't complain, but don't go expecting this big amazing resort because you and your kids will be let down I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Super Resort Staff with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: amc_wog
Reviews.Content: Though our room was not one of the renovated ones, it was clean and tidy at all times. Staff at the resort were thorough and responsive, and made the stay for us - we were super impressed with the security staff specifically, as their efforts and hard work in resolving a situation that could have been an unfortunate ending to an otherwise wonderful vacation made all the difference in our experience. While cooking out at the South Oasis grills, I made the mistake of getting distracted by conversation and the task at hand, resulting in leaving an eReader behind. Though we immediately realized my oversight, it was too late and my devise was gone. The security team at the resort, including Angel Nieves and Lance Temple, worked together over the next 24 hours to review video tape, alert staff and monitor guests. We were updated with progress reports regularly throughout the next day. My eReader was returned at the end of the day, and needless to say we were thrilled. Angel and Lance both (at different times) demonstrated skill in communicating to us, as well as clearly to the other staff at Liki Tiki. We were impressed with the resort team’s strong customer service skills, and emphasis on guest satisfaction. During an age when so many individuals go through the motions at work, it was obvious to us that the staff at Liki Tiki Village Resort are dedicated to their job. They are not just a “group” - they are a team.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy your stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: momof3qtees
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was very nervous about staying at this resort!! I am pleased to say that I experienced nothing negative at all during our stay and we had a wonderful time. If you do a little research beforehand you can avoid any potential problems and make the most of your vacation. Check-in was quick and easy. We received the "Harbour Pass" as part of our package so all amenities were included. I don't know if I would have paid for these otherwise...they didn't seem like great value for the money. We were out at theme parks most of the time anyway so think about it before you invest. No pressure to attend a time-share meeting. We were asked about it but politely declined because our trip was short and we had a lot that we had to do. Did not hear anything about it after the initial check in. Room was clean and had everything that we needed. We went to the Publix and Target which are close by for food and beverages etc. There is a pool that is open until midnight. If you ask for a room in the 400, 500 or 600 area you will have easy access to this and the hot tub and the exercise room. Disney, Universal and Sea World are close by and not difficult to get to at all. Make sure upon arrival in Orlando you have change for the tolls that you go through coming out of the airport.
