Staff were friendly and happy to answer any questions you may have. I would recommend this resort to friends. My kids loved the water park also. We only used it for one day but there was plenty for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, Above and Beyond our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: xgozx
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first stay at Liki Tiki. We weren't owners or on a "timeshare" trip. We booked a 2 bedroom unit for $89 a night for 6 nights. The first comment would be a huge positive as we traveled down a day early to avoid a coming weather system. We called ahead and they said they were completely booked. We felt like we were talking to a call center, so we just showed up and asked and they were very accomodating. They set us up with the extra night and we checked in right at 4pm on a friday. A very minor sales pitch about discounted park and show tickets at check-in, but all I said was we were ok and that was all that was mentioned the entire stay. We got to our room in building 1200 in the north village and found it to be clean and comfortable. The furnishings were a dated style, but plenty comfortable for our stay. Beds and jet tub were great! The location within the resort was perfect for us and exactly what we requested when booking our reservation. Close to the main lagoon pool, but far enough away to avoid the night time noise of the bar and karoke. We ended up with not much view from the screened in balcony(even on the top floor), but we were more concerned about the night time noise. Buildings 700, 800 and 900 in the north village would have the lagoon pool view but would be extremely noisy most of the day from your balconies. We never used maid service as we did laundry in the included washer/dryer within the unit. Liki Tiki lagoon pool was much more than expected. Very large pool area and very well heated. Weather was warm during our stay, but I can imagine being comfortable hanging out in that warm water when it was much colder. Separate kids pool and many slides and activities for all to enjoy. This pool complex was more than expected, and has a bar with reasonably priced lunches and dinners and night time karoke. The staff from top to bottom was the best we've seen in the Orlando area. Everyone greeted you and wanted to know how your stay was, even owners at the resort approached us to make sure everything was to our liking. Other activities in the pool/lagoon area were mini golf, paddle boats, basketball, tennis, bike rentals, shuffleboard and fishing. These activities were free to us with our "harbor fun card" but I did see some guests pay cash for them. Not sure what the circumstances are with the activities being included or not, but we enjoyed all these extra benefits. There are also planned kids activities, reptile zoo night, movie nights and nightly scheduled activities in and around the outdoor bar. Internet was a potential issue, but I have a verizon wifi card and we used that all week for our internet needs. Service was a little slow in this location, but no real problem. Sprint phones worked fine too. We never tried or asked about the resort's internet service. Connections were available in the unit, but it didn't appear to be free(not sure). The resort location was farther west from the Disney area on 192 than we've ever really explored. I rather enjoyed this location, even with the 15 minute drive to Disney property. Plenty of restaurants, Publix and super Target within 5 minutes. Great Indian restaurant called "Clay Oven" is close by and is highly recommended! Minor issues were as follows: extremely slow elevator in building 1200, main lagoon pool closed way too early and opened way too late for a resort area(other resort pools had longer hours), dated furniture and decor. Bugs had been mentioned in previous reviews as a concern, but we didn't see any issues, although it was March not summer time. Please don't let any of these issues discourage you from staying, but I had to mention these in fairness to the review. Overall a wonderful stay with a wonderful resort. Clean grounds, friendly people, plenty of activities and a great price for an early spring stay. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property near Disney :)”
Reviews.Author: jacdolfin
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom condo four our family of four (kids age 6 and 4) at Liki Tiki and we were very happy. The price was great and it was a nice property. The room was clean, loved the kitchen, big tub, and washer/drier in the unit. It was nice to be able to go home with clean clothes. My kids lived in the pool they absolutely loved the water slides and decor. We really liked it there. My kids ask when we can go back :). The only negative was when we checked in late on our arrival day. The front desk staff told us we had to attend the timeshare meeting. Upon goin to the timeshare we were told it was not mandatory it was up to the individual family. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: wellrested2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in January. 4 adults & 3 kids (8,5,4) Had a three bedroom unit (lock-off)with 2 full kitchens. Plenty of room to hang out, or close door and you had privacy. Kids loved the Pool area, plenty of Life Guards, adults enjoyed the Bar area. Close to all Disney Parks, 20 minutes away. Wal-Mart (and any other store you can think of) closeby. Resort was very clean, no issues with anything. Just a great relaxing week. Free Wi-fi if you own (friends did).

Reviews.Title: “Would never return”
Reviews.Author: l00kinforsun
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week at Liki Tiki. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit and I found it absolutely disgusting. The carpets were stained with grime- I didnt feel like I could walk around inside without wearing my shoes. I had to request a new mattress on 3 different occasions. The first night there was a urine order on the mattress with tons of urine stains. I went to the front desk and was told I would get a replacement. The following night after a long day I came back to find I still had a urine mattress. I called to the front desk. They said they didnt have a mattress available, after lots of insisting that it was unsanitary and I refused to sleep in that matress they came to my room with a mattress retrieved from another unit which was also soaked in urine and covered in stains. I refused that mattress as well. Then after lots of searching through other units and 45 minutes later and the help of Teresa Fernandez they found 1 mattress that was ladled with urine. All in all I think there are much better places to stay. This was a absolutelty filthy resort and I would never return. I find that they tell you what you want to hear and pretend to take care of the problem just to make you go away.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: CantWaitForVaca23
Reviews.Content: We bought a week at this resort through Interval International. Great deal for a week on the off season. I feel we got a good deal and got great value for our $. The resort as a whole was nice, but does not compare to the Marriott resort that we own. Don't get me wrong, if your are used to hotels, this place is amazing, but if you are used to nice timeshare resorts, this one does not really cut it. I would go back if it was priced right, but would probably explore another resort just to see what else is out there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Fun”
Reviews.Author: ce_wyant
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a week at Liki Tiki. We stayed in 1114 E. It was great!!! My entire family had a wonderful time. Along with my husband and children 7, 4 and 20 months, we also took along my mother and had room for everyone. They loved the water park and all of the amenties. I was prepared to pay for the $6.99 a day resort fee for all of the amenites, but when I arrived I had to ask about it. I was assuming that you were required to pay like other resorts, but it was completely up to you, which I really liked. You were not forced into anything, although we did pay the resort fee which came out to be $55 for the week because it included internet and was a good deal to be able to do all of the activities there. My children also loved gator night. I was very impressed with everything they had to do there. I went into this vacation very leary after reading all of the reviews, but I was more than impressed. There was a large spider in our room, but it is Florida, there are going to be bugs. We checked our beds and there was no evidence of bed bugs. We have a family friend who stayed last June and was also very impressed. I am planning on returning next February and hope to make it an annual vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: vacationhelper
Reviews.Content: my family stayed for 2 weeks starting February 5, 2011 in a 2 bedroom total members in are party was 5. i have to say for the money it is a clean place with confortable beds. 95 % of our time was spent at the parks so we really didn't have time to do alot in the village itself but for what we did do, the village needs some inprovment and upgrading of the ammenities but you can see that they are trying to update we stayed in the 900 area thats seems to be an older section but it was very clean and had al the stuff you would need in the room. over all if you want a nice confortable safe place to stay that is not so hard on the wallet i highly recommend this place geat please for family with younger children.

Reviews.Title: “Property is too big!”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: We booked this through my brother-in-law who does not own here but owns in the group affilated with this resort. I got a great price and paid an additional transfer fee as we are not the owners. Our travel group consisted of myself and my hubby (who have been to probably 10 different time share type properties in Florida) and my parents who had never been to Florida before. We had a 2 bedroom in the 1300 building. I would like to point out that this building is the furthest from everything execpt the waterpark area. Firstly the positives-- -The actual unit was nice--updated and large. It was on par with other higher end/new time shares we have been to. -People did not bug you to go to timeshare meetings--this was also nice. -Waterpark--this was actaully fun--we are all adults in our group but we all went to the waterpark and used the slide at least once. If you brought kids I am sure they would LOVE this feature (and one of the few features that was actually free). Negatives: -Too far from everything--it was a 10 minute walk to the gym, 6 minute walk to the lobby etc. I know it does sound like much but if you walk somewhere in the rain then realize you forgot something it gets annoying. -The gym was too small--there was always a wait to get on a machine. -I like to recycle and I found that people who do not want to put the effort in would never do it at this property. You have to walk to the main areas (waterpark, lobby, or other pool area) to recycle--It would be so easy to put some recycling bins in our building but it is not done. Furthermore the closest one to us got locked up after dusk--we found this out the hard way after lugging our recycling all the way there. -As we are not owners, (but already paid a fee becuase of this) many things were not included for us. There was a charge for the internet (I mean really the $20 a night hotel includes this), a charge for paddleboat, charge for the bikes, charge for minigolf etc etc. There was even a charge to use a BASKETBALL! I just found this was nickle and diming at its finest. -There was also nothing around this property--if you like to drive that would be ok for you but if you wanted to walk anywhere you can't. Overall, I would not return to this property--just too big.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Phatman277
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki Village is great, the amenities there are great. There are lots to do and it is in good distance of Disney and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SmithFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village and had a wonderful time, my kids loved the waterpark and we found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. We actually forgot our passports and Jennie Morales went and got them from our room right away and called us back to confirm she had them. We really appreciated how quickly she responded to our call.

Reviews.Title: “motel 8 feeling”
Reviews.Author: jennchris6969
Reviews.Content: As a Mom of five children, I get a chance to get away with my husband and our two small children. Not so often, I went with sister and other family Lots of us.. Arrived at 6 pm. Got checked in and got keys. went to room,,,wrong key! Went back got a new key. Next day same thing happen agian. About 9pm time to bath kids pull back shower and other peoples stuff. and bath was very dirty. Then had to wait 45 minutes for them to come clean. Kids were falling asleep in my arms. Then next morning went to make coffee cups were dirty. Bugs everywhere...dirty....service was not so great....Seem to not really care....Some one walked in on a family member not dressed.....everyones keys stop working.....husband got stuck in elevater....what a crappy time we had here.....

Reviews.Title: “I was a local who felt like a tourist”
Reviews.Author: whipy04
Reviews.Content: Being from florida I decided to take a mini vacation wit my family for some much needed r & r, during my stay we did it all at liki tiki, from paddle boats to mini golf to tennis, whatever they offered we did. I felt as if I was visiting from another state and was a tourist, not to mention the weather was perfect. Will definately come back very soon and pass on how great my stay was to friends

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for except ... there own theme park shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: WWH0g
Reviews.Content: The liki Tiki was clean, no bugs, no hassle, no problems. Check in was quick, 2 minutes. We stayed for ten days, would have loved to stay longer. The suite was huge, we had a two bedroom, two bathroom, living room, dining room, kitchen, whirlpool tub. Kids loved the water park, we loved the three pools, kids pool, 2 hot tubs, gas grills. charcoal grills. Rooms were well equipped, we were missing a DVD player and once we informed them we had it in 10 minutes. Wish there was a non stick pan in the room. Quiet , except for the coyote one night making himself known in the woods. We did not rent a car so had to rely on private transportation, not really a problem if you ask lots of questions, expensive but cheaper than car rental for the size of our family. This resort would be perfect if they had there own transportation to the theme parks. We loved it and would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condo Bargain in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParkLover
Reviews.Content: We rented this condo for a week because of the low price. Nicest Orlando hotel in which I've ever stayed! Separate bedroom, living room, kitchen, dining room and bath, sleeps 4 (2 in bedroom, 2 on fold-out couch). Had full frig, stove (with oven), washer, dryer, dish washer, microwave, toaster, blender, iron & board - all for less than $80 per day! Private balcony had table & chairs. Only way to make it better is to add a screen door on the patio, to keep those pesky Florida misquitos out. Also, jacuzzi (as shown in ad photos) was just a bath tub with water jets in our condo. But staff was wonderful. Grounds were well kept. Parking is ample and free. Note: Best food in the area was at Perkins Restaurant and Bakery (all around the area) - the closest one was on Highway 192 on the way to Disney World Drive. For us healthy eaters, Perkins has fresh asparagas, buttered brocolli, & fresh spinach as veggi choices on the menu. Another note: If you want cheap theme park tickets, Liki Tiki offers a great bargain - listen to their condo time-share promo (90 minutes) and you can buy tickets through them at really reduced prices. For example, we bought 7 day passes to Universal (both parks and 14 days to use) for $125 each. Highly recommend Liki Tiki and Perkins Restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Three words: Fab U Lous!”
Reviews.Author: MrsReba
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 kids, found room and resort to be spotless and beautiful. Stayed on ground floor of high rise building. Had wonderful spa in main bedroom, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen fully stocked with necessities. I was very impressed that there was dishwasher soap, laundry powder etc all provided, they send more over to your room when you need it for $.25! The harbour activities were all free, so we took out a surrey bike a couple days, they had also paddleboats, fishing, playground, sports etc. We visited the pools, hottubs, waterpark lots of times. Never ate at the restaurant, just a few drinks and fries-pub fare...we like a better meal. The resort is close enough to get to places quickly but away from the neon signs and busyness of the main drag. Didn't do the resort tour, but we would happily go here many times over. A note: the palmetto bugs (cockroaches) are like mosquitoes here, and different from the german cockroaches so popular in yucky motels. But they don't bother you, don't come home with you, and don't get into your food etc. so don't worry about it...Gift shop is well equipped with drugstore items, frozen dinners, bathing suits etc. Staff were all friendly and helpful! In short, loved it, and we will go back in a heartbeat. Also, try Bruno's Italian restaurant nearby for authentic Italian and order the Tiramisu for dessert. Oh, and one caveat: the king size bed was not really all that comfortable, they should upgrade to really nice mattresses, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expect - Almost rural setting in suburbia”
Reviews.Author: FootPrincess
Reviews.Content: We were not here for a disney experience, but were pleasantly surprised when we exchanged our mexico timeshare for this resort. There were beautiful birds surrounding the lagoon and even alligators! The suite was perfect for our family, with two bedrooms and two bathrooms and a full kitchen. The room was clean and we loved having a 2nd floor open air terrace and a screened-in porch. The pools were great for kids and there was great warm kiddie pool. The staff was fantastic, we would call down for a high chair or more towels, they would bring them immediately, and call back to make sure that we'd received the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surpised”
Reviews.Author: bronx129
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, good & bad, I was apprehensive about staying here, but, we were all pleasantly surprised!!!. We checked in January 1/11, check in was quick and easy, free internet included, and we were given the harbour pass that included fishing, mini golf, all the activities except bike rentals. My husband, my daughter, & myself stayed in the 1300 building, room 1313E. It was a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo, full size fridge & stove, full size washer & dryer, large flat screen tv in the livingroom, smaller flat screen tv in each bedroom. It was not a noisy building, even though we were on the first floor. We chose not to have maid service because we were able to do laundry, wash dishes, make meals, and use the full size dishwasher. Towel exchange day was on Wednesday. We had one phone call regarding the time share, we said we were not interested, & we were never bothered again. I read reviews indicating troubles with the front desk personnell, we didn't experience this. My parents stayed in the same building, 2nd floor, room 1323F. Their room was a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, full size fridge & stove, over/under washer dryer combo, flat screen tv in livingroom, smaller flat screen tv in the bedroom, comfortable beds., dish detergent included, rooms came with 2 single use laundry detergent packages, more was available by calling the front desk, .25 per package, there was a nice play area. The name does not do it justice, don't be afraid of the bad reviews, stay here, it is well worth it. It is a little hard to find, but, get good directions before you go. Pictures to follow at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “Save your Money better Resorts”
Reviews.Author: AtouchofclassbyRizzo
Reviews.Content: I live in Kissimmee Fl. so I know the area. Looked great on outside and I am from this area. But I would never stay again.1 if you like bugs this is the place for u. Roaches.Palmenttos,Ants.I had in 1 week exterminator come 2 times and still lights go on bugs everywhere,Waterpark a joke closes at 5PM one of the main reasons I went for the kids.While my stay your cell phones don't work over 80 cents to call local. Free WiFi not true only if you own it.You get towels only 1 time week no room cleaning.Or you can pay extra.There is a washer if you need laundry detergent or soap 25 cents each. It is such a joke> I had a flood in my home so went there to relax. Oh I forgot we did not have water for a whole day Water Main broke. And the heater in the pool broke for water park. So I suggests if you like bugs and dirty rugs and no housecleaning this is for you. But my standards are higher for the price there is tomany places to stay in Orlando and Kissimmee close to all Parks. I will not go back best part was Music but even Tiki Bar and Music ends at 9PM .And all cell phones did not work Verizion,Sprint,Tracfone tried all. Never again. Trust me you want bugs this is the place for you. All in my food had to throw it out. If anyone calls for you they get put on hold for about 15 minutes before transfer to your room

Reviews.Title: “Going back Again!!”
Reviews.Author: daisiegirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki in May 2010. With two ten years old boys, the Lagoon was a God sent! Our two bedroom condo was in great shape, building 700, and we used all the activites. Basketball, Tennis, paddle boats and mini golf were all included with our package. I do think that the lagoon should have been open later.The other pool is open later, but Shipwreck Sally's is a nice place to sit while the kids played in the Lagoon. We have already booked again for March Break!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to Disney, fun”
Reviews.Author: familyfun001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights In October of 2010.. I have a lot of postive comments about this place, one negative and a few advice comments. We stayed in a two bedroom/two bath unit. We had a decent sized master bedroom with a king bed, our own tv and a huge bathroom that had a large spa tub, a gorgeous glass shower and a closet in it. There was a small safe in the closet, a few extra pillows and an ironing board. I thought the pillows were very small in the master bedroom but there was a few more in the closet. Plenty of space. Our girls had their own bedroom with twin beds in it, their own tv, a decent size closet and a quick access to their own bathroom that had a strange shower in it, probably meant for wheel chair access, located in the hallway.. The bathroom was fine and large, but had no counter space at all. We just had to teach the girls not to soak the floor since there wasn't any walls in the shower. It did have a shower curtain. We thought the place was spacious for a family of four, a really nice dining area near the living area where they could turn the large tv around fi they wanted to. There was a tiny porch out back facing woods but nice enough for us, we liked having our own washer and dryer in the unit and the kitchen was stocked ok for you to bring in your own food and cook. We can't comment on grilling outside as we didn't try that and didn't want to get to the main level with food, etc. and have to travel back and forth from a grill. I will say there was only 1 tiny frying pan and no plastic glasses for children in the kitchen. Just large glass ware. There wasn't enough pot holders to get hot stuff out of the oven or microwave. We loved our building location as it was quiet, peaceful and an easy walk to the pool area. We stayed in building 1330E. IF, like us you don't want to hear loud music or the loud karoki at night by the pools, please check which building and where it's located at before checking in. A few buildings around the pools area would not be where we would want to stay. The pool - lagoons are a lot of fun for children, they were awesome and it wasn't crowded for us early in the day. It does get crowded quickly and then would be hard just to find lounge chairs but the pool - lagoons are so big they didn't seem to get too crowded with kids. There were life guards there and you do have to watch children near some of the slides. Plus you can order lunch right there by the pool and eat outside. Keep track of your towels that you take to the pool area and return them to your condo so your not charged for them. The only negative was that we saw a few roaches in our condo. So keep your suitcases closed. That is not too unusual for many places in humid, hot & sunny Florida. We know they clean the place well because we could see that it was clean and unfortunately smell bleach in the hallway when we went outside one day. There is a publix grocery store near by and using the toll road 429 will get you to Disney easily enough. Although the toll road can be confusing getting off and on. We would definitely go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: jamestoomey
Reviews.Content: From the moment i arrived I felt at home. The rooms are amazing and the waterpark was great. The sport facilities are great. It's a good distance away from the theme parks. Walmart is close by and as an English man I am fascinated at the shear size of it. Once again I love this place

Reviews.Title: “I would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: handsanitizer
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Located in a great place! NOT in the hubbub of everything but within 20 minutes! We have gone to Florida for 20 years...this week was the coldest, but Liki Tiki was a great place to spend it. Clean everywhere...even while they were updating, very clean. Staff is wonderful! My hubby doesn't like to stay anywhere twice, but I bet he would do Liki Tiki again! VERY SATISFIED! I have kids from 10 to 17 and they loved it too!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time with the kids.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSnowman
Reviews.Content: It amazes me at how many people write bad reviews. They didn't book the Waldorf Astoria when they made the reservation. What did they expect when you only spend $800-900 for a week stay in the Orlando area with a kitchen? Anyways, enough of that. My wife and I and our two kids (9 and 13) stayed at the Liki Tiki over the holidays. Even though the weather could have been warmer, we still had a wonderful time. Yeah, maybe some of the units are approaching renovation stage, but the two bedroom unit we were in was very clean and I never seen an insect inside a building. It was very nice to have a washer and dryer in the unit as my daughter went through 4 outfits a day. We never tried the continental breakfast during our stay because we usually made use of our kitchen in the mornings. When it was warm enough, the pools were in very nice shape and as others have said, the pool with the slides and stuff were a big hit with the kids. I personally thought that Shipreck Sally's made a great tasting hamburger and the kids loved the boneless chicken wings. The onsight activities were alot of fun, especially the 4 person surrey bikes. If anything the mini golf course could be updated. And I wish the activities were open later on in the evening. After getting back from Universal Studios or Busch Gardens, my wife and I might have been pooped out but the kids always have energy. To sum it up, would I recommend this to a couple looking for romance on their honeymoon? No. But, for a family looking for fun with all the amentities in Central Florida....absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get carried away by the Room Pictures on the website”
Reviews.Author: TRIO789
Reviews.Content: We are a party of five and stayed at one of their two bedroom condos. Please do not get carried away by the pictures on the condos on the website. They are probably graphic images. The condo we are given LOOKED atleast 10 years old - showers were not working properly in the bathrooms - found dead cockroaches in the kitchen area - floor carpets are dirty. We attended their Time Share promotion presentation - which is not all that bad - but did not save us much.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, Bit outdated.”
Reviews.Author: Lifsgud
Reviews.Content: Went Thanksgiving week. We paid an extra $100 for joining rooms. The rooms were very out dated. Washing Machine extremely loud. Dryer knob broken, but someone quickly came to fix it. Changed air conditioner filter while there....unfortunately found out one was not in unit at all. Continental Breakfast.... very sparse only one toaster. Not worth the trip down to the office area. Loved the activities available on property that was the reason to stay on this property.....but EXTREMELY disappointed because nothing was free! Did not do any activities on property because TOO EXPENSIVE!!! No free internet service very costly for SLOW service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: daxg1
Reviews.Content: Nice townhouse style rooms with washer and dryer in units. Rooms are a little outdated and the carpet needs to go. Grounds are very nice and there is a small "water park" with fountains and slides. Kids enjoyed it more than Disney. They offer wifi, but it will cost you $25/week; but good luck with reception. Ended up getting my money back.

Reviews.Title: “millions of ants”
Reviews.Author: NancyIzumi
Reviews.Content: The room is terrible. A lot of ants for all places. I try to use the telephone but impossible. The ants live inside all places. The sanitary is clogged all time. Even no paper there. The shower is terrific. Few water and few hot water all day. I do not recommend for anybody. I imagine children living there. Disgusting place.

Reviews.Title: “Was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mickid9
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was in a state of panic, turns out it was a great place and loved it. Check in was pretty quick (we stayed in November), they did ask about the timeshare seminar, we turned it down, with out a hassle. We stayed in the new building room 1431. Very nice room, large kitchen, nice bedroom with flat screen tv, huge bathroom with very small washer and dryer (but useful). I saw two bugs while I was there. Our whirlpool tub was clean my kid loved taking a bath. The living room was nice also with a screened in balcony. The pull out couch was great for my 5 year old but I would NOT want to sleep on it. The bed was nice but the pillows were pancakes so if you want a fluffy pillow run down the street to Target or walmart and buy a $5 pillow. The grounds were nicely kept and clean. One morning while waiting for mini golf to open I watched them wipe down all the paddle boats and sweep the golf course. The water park was great for my 5 year old but would see how a 10 year old might get bored. The life guards at the pool are truly guards they pace around the pool and look for kids in distress. Great job to the life guards!! As for the people that say the place is run down...I did see some of the villas in the center were older but the 3 villas across from us were getting an upgrade, we watched as they emptied them and started to rip out the carpet, etc. We had lunch at Shipwreck Sally's twice...it was good but only bar food. Great for a quick snack while at the pools. All the pools were heated, even the waterpark which was a nice touch. November was a great time of year to visit as the parks (were to both Universal and Disney) neither had long lines....the longest thing we waited for was the new Harry Potter ride (20 minute wait). The Disney Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party was tops...the fireworks were the best I ever seen. The Village is far enough away from the parks (about a 12 minute drive to Disney) and about a 25 minute from Universal. The great thing is close enough to great restaurants (try Miller's)and to grocery stores and Target or Walmart. Need food ideas- Try Boston's Seafood Buffet on International drive....well worth the price the lobster was superb. Also my husband and I visited the Ice Bar on International drive...it was alot of fun (and cold).

Reviews.Title: “Happy, happy, happy”
Reviews.Author: MaggieLiberty123
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much, the staff was very friendly. The kids enjoyed the playground, miniture golf, fishing, heated pool. We were in the 600 block and our room was clean. Would highly recommend and ready to go stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. Got what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: jan1015
Reviews.Content: I had done my research on this hotel as I do with all hotels so I knew what I was getting into. It seems to me the complainers of this hotel havent done any research to figure out what they are getting into before they arrive. The hotel was very clean. We stayed in the 1300 building and it was very clean. This is a time share resort so they will give you a "free" gift for going to their presentation. We chose to go to the presentation because they offered us $100 at the Bar/Lagoon. We figured it was worth 90 mins of our time to attend for the $100. Be forwarned.... 90 mins was 2 hours. There is a lot of pressure to sign up but as long as you are strong willed you can get in and out and not let the pressure get to you. The breakfast was good and getting $100 at the lagoon was worth it for us. There isnt free wifi at this hotel. You must pay for it. We opted to use the week to enjoy no emails!! The food at Shipwreck Sallys is ok. We had the pizza and onion rings. Both were ok but not the best we've had. My son had the fish for the Friday fish fry and said it was delicious! The drinks were over priced but with $100 free money we didnt mind too much. You cant take coolers, drinks, food etc into the lagoon pool but you can in the other 2 pools. We took snacks, drinks to the other pools and would go to our room when enjoying the lagoon pool. We received a harbour pass when we checked in that gave us free access to many activities including paddle boats, shuffle board, mini golf, tennis, basketball, etc. The only thing it didnt include was bike rentals. Which was only $12. The water park is great for children of all ages. My kids were 8 and 13 and enjoyed it. I saw many younger kids enjoying it as well. The villa is located close to shopping (clothing and food) as well as many restuarants. You are provided with dish, dishwasher and laundry soap upon arrival. The villa was stocked with most items we needed. There isnt housekeeping but we honestly didnt need it. You can do the towel exchange however we washed our own towels. They do have a garbage shut to take out your own garbage which we didnt mind either. They provide bags. The lifeguards at the lagoon pool did an efficent job of making me feel at eas relaxing with my book and ipod while knowing my kids were in good hands. If anything I would say the lifeguards were too serious. They were doing their job 100% but lacked any personality. They seemed like robots. Villa is located nicely to Orlando airport as well as all theme parks. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for families with younger kids.”
Reviews.Author: treearch
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a last minute travel site for $50.00/night taxes included for a one-bedroom condo and stayed four nights. I was a little concerned about the reviews but for that price we couldn't pass it up and we were pleasantly surprised. Room: The room was a bit dated (kids loved the mirrored walls) but it was incredibly clean and well stocked. It was nice to have a washer and dryer you didn't have to pay for. The pull out couch bed was not comfortable but our three and five year old didn't complain. The master bed was great. My major complaint was it was really noisy, but I think that had to do with the fact we were on the ground floor and right by the elevators so all the noise was from people coming back late at night and waiting for the elevator. My other complaint was they changed for wifi, seriously? Pool: The kids loved it, it is geared for pre-teens and younger. It was chilly the week we were there but its heated so the kids could still swim. For the comments of having to pay for the pool, there was not charge for the water park or the pool or hot tube. They did charge for boats, mini golf (the course is tiny but there are some great mini golf places down the street starting at $3.99/ with coupon) and bikes. Staff: Wonderful! Breakfast: Nothing special, but enough to get you started for the morning. Final thoughts, we'll stay there again. We'll worth the money is you are paying under $80.00/night.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and Roaches”
Reviews.Author: WmaximusD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 3 children checked in on Sat. 10/30/2010. Our first room was in the 1100 building, first floor. It was worn and old and not very clean, garbage can under the kitchen sink was full when we checked in and the ceiling fan in the kids room was about to fall off the ceiling. That night we noticed several small bugs in the room including roaches. When we woke up Sun morning my wife noticed several blood spots on the sheets in our room,we noticed even more blood spots on the kids sheets when we woke them up. What is even worse is that those blood spots hadn't come from us and, as confirmed by the head of housekeeping, appeared to be relatively fresh and had not been through the wash. It was very upsetting to watch the staff remove all the bedding that we just slept on wearing protective gloves. We complained and were moved to the 1200 building, fourth floor. This room appeared much cleaner and newer. That night however, every time we woke up to use the bathroom we found at least one, inch sized, cockroach somewhere in the master bathroom. I was able to kill several but some escaped through a tiny gap in the wall at the base of the shower door. When we woke up the next morning, my older daughter had well over one hundred bites all over her body and she was itching like mad, my wife and I had several bites also, these turned out to be bed bug bites. After complaining again, they attempted to move us to the 1300 building, but we had friends staying in the owner suites who hadn't had any problems yet so we convinced them to move us there. After we were there we didn't have any further problems, but unfortunately the damage was already done. We spent the first two nights there looking for and worrying about what else we were going to find, and every morning my daughter seemed to have more and more bites on her. So we lost several days at Disney and Universal trying to get this mess straightened out and my daughter has been on Benadryl every few hours for the last week to control the itching.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Resort a place for family”
Reviews.Author: jjortiz422
Reviews.Content: My wife this resort through tripadvisor and in reading the reviews it seemed that a lot of people were having issues such as: bugs and location. In reviewing liki tiki resort, I think it was a great place to take kids. We had a blast at the pool and slides, the rooms were bigger than anticipated and the service at the pool restaurant was amazing. Our server was great, we called in advanced and asked if we could take a cake downstairs to sing happy birthday to my 4 year old son and the manager had no problem with it. We split our time between this resort and an unnamed resort. I can tell you we wish we would have done our entire stay at Liki Tiki. The only draw back is that its about 20 mins from all the parks. Other than that everything was great. Note: If you have teenagers as we do. They probably won't like the fact that you have to pay for internet service. Which they need the parents to control. I believe it should be free, but I guess it makes family's get away from the technology world and enjoy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOUR RESEARCH !!!”
Reviews.Author: LBIBeachBum13
Reviews.Content: Friends had Bed Bugs! And Roaches in 2 different rooms. Don't believe me? Google - "Liki Tiki, Bed Bugs". If you're still interested you might want to know. Everything costs extra! Water Park, Internet, Bikes, boats, golf balls, basketballs... The Water park was for children under 12 and a rip off for $20. We spent $85 dollars ($15 adults/$10 children) for a pathetic BBQ Buffet. Dried out burgers & dogs. No Ketchup or mustard. If you're going on an exchange from a timeshare or have been invited by Great Escapes Vacation Club (Interval Int). Beware of the Snake Pit !!! They offer you discounted tickets for you to listen to their sales pitch. We PAID for discounted tickets and they screwed up our tickets. On the phone we got no satisfaction and the manager, Khalid hung up on us. It was only when we went to the Snake Pit (across the street) and started raising our voices in front of the new batch of victims that they corrected their mistake. They gave us a 2 day pass for Universal instead of a 1 day pass for Universal and a 1 day pass for Islands of Adventure. You would have thought we wanted season passes rather than what we paid for. And they made it sound like they were doing us a favor rather than just doing the right thing and correcting THEIR mistake! Rude and disrespectful ! If he had talked to us in person the way he talked to my wife on the phone I would have...... As a result of our various situations, our plans for the trip had to be drastically changed. We did not get to do everything we wanted to. And we lost tons of time getting these situations straightened out. We wanted to go to Universal on Sunday but it was Tuesday before we got everything straightened out and got to the parks!! Oh yeah, and there's a little girl coming home COVERED with bed bug bites and her family too a lesser degree as well. Like I said you don't have to beleive me. Do your own research!!! There's so many other places in Orlando why would you chance it? But if this all sounds like fun than Liki Tiki is just the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Village - just go. We would definitely recommend this place.”
Reviews.Author: I-Know-Florida
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Liki Tiki Village, with my Wife and two Sons - 17 and 9. If you are expecting the Hilton, it isn't - we weren't expecting the Hilton. I am a Hilton Honors Member (have been for years) and have travelled and stayed in most of the best Hotels throughout Florida (and beyond) - that qualifies me for knowing a thing or two about staying in Hotels, etc. We bought 7 days in a two bedroom apartment through Expedia. That was what we got, in the 900 Block, very close to the water park. The Apartment was a great size and equipped with what we needed. Everything was clean and presentable. The Boys shared one bedroom, we had the Master which came with a Spa Bath, which the Boys used more than us... The waterpark was great for the youngest and our eldest enjoyed it too. The other pools were cooler and less crowded. We had fun in them all. As the resort is right along US 192, near the junction to US 27, you will need a car. We picked the place because we knew where it was and wanted to be away from all the crowds, but still only 10 minutes by car from Disney's World Drive. I am currently recovering from a serious accident and I told reception that I had no interest in being bothered with the timeshare offer. They did not bother me once. I read loads of reviews before I parted with my money and I have concluded that everyone is entitled to their own opinion. Whether I agree with the nit picking petty ones from people who rarely travel is also a matter of opinion. All things considered, if you are looking for good value, spacious accommodation with good facilities - give this place a go. You won't be disappointed - we weren't.

Reviews.Title: “worth a try”
Reviews.Author: billcampbell1960
Reviews.Content: we were a party of 7 our 10yr old daughter is a wheelchair user the liki tiki village was able to accomadate her. it is in kissemee and only a 10min drive away from international drive and disney the rooms are big and you have a washing machine and dryer the main bedroom in on suit. but they are in need of a good referb. you will be told that they can get you cut price tkts but be aware you will have to sit through a timeshare meeting to get them but they do save you money but againg be careful we got 3 day tickts only to find out that when we tried to use them on day 3 we were refused entry and the people at liki tiki village refused to admit there fault . apart from that the liki tiki is a good base there are lots of pools a fitness room the water park is fun to try the lagoon pool bar you get a nice meal and drink there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LIKI TIKI”
Reviews.Author: lifesabeach25
Reviews.Content: My friends who are owners at Liki Tiki had refered me to staying there when i was making vacation plans. I am big on reading reviews for any kind of resorts/hotels we stay at. There were mixed reviews so i had mixed feelings but went ahead to make the reservations. I first called to make my plans with their reservations center, of the bat the lady i spoke to was so helpful in answering questions for me and was very patient....i can be picky. At check in the Front desk agents were so friendly and were helpful in accomodating my needs when i had requested a 1st floor. The unit was very nice, very spacious, and enjoyed the full kitchen we had. My kids loved the water park, even though a bit small....I think they had more fun there than at disney. The grounds and were so clean, my husband and I looked forward to our morning walks every morning, the staff would greet us also as they drove past on their golf carts. I highly suggest staying here, it may not be the Hilton, but with nice comfortable rooms and a friendly staff...what else do you need. Great job Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hollyoman
Reviews.Content: Just like most, I read alot of the reviews before I left and was a bit worried. But we had a very enjoyable stay at the village and would stay there again. The staff on the grounds, at the front desk, at the gate, and at the mini golf desk were all very nice and helpful. My children, who are ages 8 and 10 enjoyed the lagoon but also loved the salt water pool. I enjoyed the jacuzzi tub and my husband enjoyed the large flat screen t.v.'s. For the amount of time that you stay in your room on these vacations I would say it is "well worth the money" to stay at the liki tiki village. They made our vacation even more enjoyable. It is not a five star accommodation but we did not pay "five star prices" either. Great time was had by all. Thanks again liki tiki!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: jtigerm
Reviews.Content: Really LOVED this hotel! It was 5 miles from Disney which was perfect for us! The rooms were VERY spacious and comfortable! The only down side was the kids pool closed at 7 because they do not have lights in the pool and the restaurant closes at 8 during the week and 10 on the weekend. Barely enough time to get back after Disney closes. So I would say they need to keep the restaurant opwn until 10 during the week and 12 on the weekend. The adult pool closes at 12 and they promptly visit at 1130 to let you know that. Otherwise we had a GREAT time on our family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “really loved this place”
Reviews.Author: finnsteinarruslan
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back. Had a renovated, bright , very clean 1 BR condo. Plenty of room for 2-3 people. Loved the full sized appliances. Loved the decor, and balcony. My son liked the game room, pool (wow, great) and walking the grounds. Ceiling fans didn't make noise! Bed comfy. Security at gate was nice. Walmart 5 minutes away, as are all the $1.99 all you can eat breakfast places, and the dinner buffets and souvenier places. Nice for famlies. I got lost going to the parks, but so what! Lots to see and do very close.

Reviews.Title: “Little things give this resort a thumbs down!”
Reviews.Author: pc9117142010
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the size of our two bedroom condo. However, little things make this resort thumbs down! We traveled with a group that required two condos for our seven night stay. Our condon was nicley stocked with items needed in the kitchen and was well decorated in a FL them. The kitchen table had seating for six but had one miss matched chair. When we would call the front desk to ask about activities that we were instructed to check with the front desk, it appeared that it bothered them they had to answer the phone. On another day, we had called the front desk and told them that we did not require maid service but it was done anyway. We had pushed back our check out time untill 11 o'clock but we got a call from the desk at 09:10, 09:30, 10:00 and 4 times housekeeping came to the room wanting to know when we were checking out. Our travel friends had a much worse experince with a stopped up toilet as soon as they arrived that maintance refused to fix, saying they would have to "pull the toilet" after they leave and the next day having water running down the light in the bathroom ceiling from an upper floor condo. With all this being said, they did offer 3 pools, one that had a grill for cooking out while the kids where swimming which would have been nicer if the fountains were working. The kids did enjoy the kids pool that offer 5 water slides. This resort has everything it needs to be a repeat stay EXCEPT customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bran530mel
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple reviews for Liki Tiki Village I was a bit nervous about staying there. We loved every minute. I wish that we had more time to enjoy the pools, but we were visiting the parks most of the time. The rooms were clean and the kitchen well stocked. We did go to the time share presentation but we left almost immediately since we are owners elsewhere. I guess they figured out that they would be wasting their time. Great to have a washer and dryer. Also great to have a seperate room for the kids. The grounds were clean and we felt safe. Checkin was a little confusing since they gave us a map of the property and then wrote all over it in black pen so that you could not see the map. Overall it was a great experience. Close to the grocery store and to Target. A little difficult to find but the GPS got us there. Great for the price and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Village of fun”
Reviews.Author: WyldOrchid
Reviews.Content: If you have small children like we do,then this is the place to be! They have a water park right on the resort with golf,paddle boats,and fishing for all to do. It was nice staying in a 2br condo with nice tvs,however the placemats and blankets needed to be replaced. I wished Wifi was free,but it wasn't too bad of a fee.You do not have to pay a fortune to go to a water park nearby.Liki Tiki have 5 waterslides and so much to do at the resort.My two sons especially loved the reptile show they had on Wednesday. If you don;t mind the blankets being a lil ragged then Liki Tiki is just a beautiful fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweett2k2
Reviews.Content: Our trip was almost ruined because of this place. It took us 7 hours to get into our room after we were told that we could check in early. Origional check in is at 4pm...we checked in at 3:50. So much for early. Next, we arrive in our "jacuzzi" suite which was nothing but a moldy bathtub with 2 jets in it. It was absolutely disgusting. Disappointed by the room, I went to the front desk to complain. I was told that I have to request the "nicer suite"to get the jacuzzi tub, but they will upgrade me to the deluxe suite. Relieved that my trip was finally turning around, I arrived in my deluxe suite and it was okay. The room was a little musty and old looking but I didn't mind, as long as I got my tub. I go to the bathroom to find that the light above my jacuzzi was leaking water. (Actually, a leak is an understatement. It was more like a waterfall.) I had to go back to the front desk and I was told that they would fix the leak in the morning. Needless to say, we had to put a towel down to muzzle the noise so that we could sleep. The next day we found that the leak was fixed and I was getting excited that I FINALLY get to use the jacuzzi. My fiance cleans the tub because they left the soaked towel in the bath and then I start to draw the bath water. While the tub was filling up, I noticed little dried pieces of dirty water coming out of the jets. The last straw when I saw the bubbles in the tub were brown as well. After that, we spent the whole night trying to find another resort. We will never again book at any Club Navigo resorts. Also, do not fall for any of the gifts or giveaways that they offer. You have to wake up early in the morning to be harrassed by salesmen that do not take no for an answer and make you feel very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions 'fantastic', on reflection 'average'”
Reviews.Author: moll734
Reviews.Content: We chose to begin our holiday early September in Florida based on the knowledge that the majority of children will be back at school. To a degree this was the case but when the parks were open until 10pm, the parks were flooded – particularly Magic Kingdom. It happened to be my daughters third birthday while on holiday and I hope it will be something she will remember, we chose the Liki Tiki resort based on facilities and price but was concerned over the mixed reviews. We were accommodated in building 500 which was clean, tidy and well maintained. There is a communal swimming pool located in front of the block which also serves block 400 and 600. This wasn’t a major issue to start however as our holiday progressed the noise from the pool became ever more irritating as it is open until midnight. Thankfully our room was located at the front of the property (pool to rear) so we couldn’t hear anything. We stayed in a one bed apartment but my daughter be ever so inquisitive managed to open the patio door. Although safe, I was not happy that she can access the balcony and front door without our knowledge in the early hours. During our induction meeting (Time Share brief) I was able to negotiate a foldup bed (saving of $60) which I was more than happy with. If you have no interest in time share’s then avoid this, however just for listening we were give $80 of vouchers to spend at the pool side bar. I was half interested in acquiring the shares where I made them earn their money however they tired the ‘hard sale’ and wouldn’t provide me with any information that I could sleep over – I didn’t but the shares. My biggest gripe was that the water park pool bar advertised that it was open until 10pm, unfortunately it closed at 8.30pm. admittedly, we were about the only people in the bar using our vouchers but the facilities were great – baby area, baby slides (although a little fast for a three year old) and somewhere to eat and drink which was a nice break from the parks. Would I stay there again? Probably not based on the noise of the communal pool, cost of internet access ($7.99 day or $30 week) and the overall cost of the holiday. Friends of ours booked a villa over the same period as us which cost an additional £500 to ours. Based on the comfort etc… I would prefer to stay in a villa however proximity to Disney was great – only 15 min.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money (Ignore Bad Reviews)”
Reviews.Author: traceyb182
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village from the 22nd Aug to 5th Sept we were a party of 15, 7 adults and 8 children ages range 7 to 16 we had a fantastic time stayed in block 600 on the ground floor right outside the swimming pool and had a 2 bedroom condo. Rooms a FANTASTIC size with a full kitchen washing maching and tumble dryer. The hotel staff could not do enough for you and were always friendley and polite. Would also like to comment on the reception staff who were wonderfull and always willing to answer any questions and help in anyway nothing was too much trouble. The Liki Tiki is close to all the dysney parks about 20 mins and a short drive from the airport, unfortunatley we got a bit lost as it is not signposted very well. These condo are great value for money and a great place to lay your head after a hard day at the many theme parks and water parks, don't listen to the bad reviews for the price you pay you won't be disapointed well done staff and management and the Liki Tiki keep up the good work we are already saving for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Was nervous about the reviews but wanted to see for myself”
Reviews.Author: Family60795
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay here for my husband and I and our two young boys. After I booked the trip, I really started researching and started getting really nervous about the bad reviews. I figure people usually leave bad reviews only when they have bad experiences so maybe this place isn't that bad. We stayed 7 nights in the new section. It was great!!! Our room was very clean & big. The staff was very helpful. We only received one call for the time share. I would definately stay here again. I was soooo relieved to see how the place kept up w/ the outside & inside of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SG5
Reviews.Content: This resort gives you an excellent "bang for your buck." Liki Tiki’s personnel are friendly, have comfortable rooms, kid friendly and have plenty of activities for the family. Our son loved the water park. There are 3 pools located on site. There is a small fee for some of the activities but you can buy a pass for you entire stay (includes the entire family). The only down fall to this resort is its location. It's off a main street (very close to Disney) but at the very end of the road (it seems like a residential area). This fitness center is extremely small & there's a fee for wifi (internet). Overall...Great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nora2172
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Liki Tiki in Aug 2010 for 5 nights, great place for kids the waterpark was wonderful. Kitchen equipped with all you need. The only negative thing I saw was that there was discarded cups and plates around the pool area (not staff faults) from the guests. Also, guests left garbage outside the room over night and some animals got to it. Overall a very nice vacation place.

Reviews.Title: “massive apartment”
Reviews.Author: lyonsm
Reviews.Content: went to liki tiki with my other half and my wee boy who is 8 for a 2 week holiday. We LOVED this place .We had read the reviews and on arrival we asked for one of the newer apartments. The woman on reception was lovely and said we had not been allocated a newer style but she had placed us in the 400 building , which is right beside a pool which she thought we would like. She told us to have a look at it and if we didnt like it , she could give us an apt in the 1200 new building . I thought this was extremely helpful. We decided to stay in the 400 block as the apt was enormous with a fully equipped kitchen, dishwasher washing machine and dryer. There was also a spa bath which was so great after a day at the parks.We had a terrace and it was great to sit out and enjoy my morning coffee. The rooms were quite old but very clean and we didnt see a single bug the whole time.The furniture again wasnt new but very comfortable. We got a few calls re the timeshare talk but we declined and they didnt push us. The water park is quite crowded but younger kids like it , my son preferred the other 2 pools. Shipwreck Sallys was fine for abite to eat and prices were very reasonable.On the negative side The luau wasnt that great and Liki Tiki is not well signposted especially in the dark , but overall a fantastic place and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: eliro
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel it was quiet, staff were friendly and helpful. We had an excellent tour guide who picked us up daily and took us to the parks for a price but it was worth it. The hotel serves free breakfast of bagels, freshfruit, juices, coffee, and tea. You can also make toast. We had a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen, living room, and bedrooms, 3 bathrooms. We had internet but you have to pay for internet. We had originally booked 2 of the one bedroom units but changed to one 2 bedroom unit when we had our friend come up to stay with us from Fort Myers.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MKyper
Reviews.Content: Great for family with small children. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews but took my chances and glad that I did! Arrived 2 hours early, we were told that our room was ready and they let us check in early. They asked about the time share, we declined and that was it, they never nagged us about it at all. Everyone of the staff members that I talked to was very nice and helpful. Stayed in a 2 bedroom condo style in the 900 building. Room was not what was pictured on the website, but we were very pleased. Big, clean and never saw a single bug. You do not get maid service at this resort but our room was well stocked and we never needed to call for anything. When trash was full I just walked the bag to the elevator and dropped in the trash shoot. The pools were clean. The kids loved the wave pool, my husband and I even went down the water slides a few times :) Lots of life guards there. When the wave pool was closed at night we went to the big pool that was open until midnight(No life guards at that pool). We got to use the paddle boats and mini golf for free. They only charged for bikes and fishing poles(You can use your own). The continental breakfast is not really worth the trip, we went once and not ever again during our stay, but free is better than nothing I guess. My only complaint is that the rooms are not very sound proof. I could hear the people above us very easily and the staff on the golf carts speed around faster then they should considering that there are a lot of small children running around this resort. We loved our stay and the grounds of the resort are very beautifully landscaped. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we will never stay agian”
Reviews.Author: fluttrbug320
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were broken into twice and a day manager was supposed to contact me. They never did until I went down to the front desk upoon check out, and then nothing was still done about it. We crammed our family of 8 into a one bedroom condo because of the break ins so we did not even use both rooms. Also when I was checking in the front desk was more worried about their pizza for lunch then giving me any proper assistance. The wave pool was busted and the water park was not that great. Also if you are not a time share owner they try to sale you on it more then once. You will get solicitation phone calls. Through out your stay. also the bath tub was filthy

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: rob161269
Reviews.Content: My family which included 3 young children stayed at Liki Tiki from the 28th July to the 5th August 2010, from the recent reviews that i have read this does not sound like the place that i stayed. The check in procedure was quick and after we had told the guy on reception that we already had our park tickets and were not intersted in time share every thing was ok. Granted that they still phone most mornings regarding the presentation but after quickly rebutting their advances no problems. Our accomdation was a 2 bedroom and 2 floored apartment, I must admit after seeing some of the reviews before we went I was a bit hesitant but to my surprise the apartment was very spacious and clean, i noticed some negative reviews regarding the TV's but in all honstety the flat screen in the main room and a small TV in the bedroom was ample. The kitchen which had all the appliances that most kitchens have was spacious and well set out. We did not see any bugs in our apartment as it was very clean. If you have small children even teenage children the waterpark is hard to beat, there are many lifeguards on duty and seems to be well run with many activities to keep the kids amused. All the activities apart from the bicycle hire and fishing were all included within the original cost, this allowed our children to use the mini golf and paddle boats as often as there like and at no cost. In summary you get what you pay for and in my opinion this represents good vlaue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, you will NOT get rooms which are pictured without a fight!”
Reviews.Author: Bouf155
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village from 7/31/10-8/6/10. I traveled with my boyfriend and two teenage girls. I booked this resort, WITHOUT reading the reviews and I really wished I had read them all before I booked. I chose this resort because of the "waterpark". If you have children 10 and under, then I would recommend this waterpark, but if you have children over 10, then they will be bored out of their minds. It is definately made for smaller children. The water didn't go past my waist. A few small water slides and other water attractions will keep the little ones happy for a long time. There were life guards which was a nice addition. I can't comment on how crowded it was because we were there only once. The other "pool" was small (for a resort that size) and the water was soooo warm. If you wanted to cool off, you were better off getting into the outdoor hot tub, I'm not kidding. Left me wondering if they ever put fresh water into the pool. I also booked this resort based on the PICTURES shown on their web site of what the rooms look like. But, beware, you will have to FIGHT to get those rooms. I booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath, paid in full through their web site. (***important to note that, because they will ask you who you booked it through***) When I arrived, I was told that those rooms were all booked and I had been given a "newly remolded room" in the older section. I asked if it was the same as I booked and was told it was. So, all of us carried our luggage into building 103. This place was NOTHING like what you see in the pictures. It was two levels, with the living room, small kitchen with a table in it and a full bath downstairs and two bedrooms and one bathroom upstairs. The master bathroom did NOT have a hot tub, nor did it have a flat screen tv (as advertised). The 2nd bedroom had two twin beds and thats it. No second TV as adverstised. The living room had one small flat screen up in the corner. I was furious, so I went back to the check in area and voiced my complaints. Again I was told there were no other rooms available. I stood firm and after speaking with THREE different people and telling them I wanted my money back if I could not get the room as pictured, they *poof* found a room. Funny how that works, isn't it? I kept asking them, why did they only have pictures of the NEW rooms, and not the old ones, but no one could answer that. I really felt like it is false advertising on their part. If they know in advance when you are BOOKING and PAYING for your room that the newer ones are all full, why don't they have some sort of disclaimer on their web site stating you may not get the room pictured and actually have pictures of the older ones? At least you would know what you might get, and if you didn't like it, you could cancel BEFORE they took your money! After the long flight, getting lost on the way to the resort, and fighting for our rooms, it was so nice to finally be able to go and unpack. Once we got the the rooms, it was very much as pictured, except there are NOT flat screen tv's in every room. You have two little tv's in each of the bedrooms. The stools for the breakfast bar were torn and although the living room furniture looks nice, it is the most UNCOMFORTABLE furniture to sit on. It was really disheartening to know that after a long day, we were coming back to the most uncomfortable furniture. We did not get any maid service, nor clean towels during our week. They do provide laundry and dishwasher soap, so we were able to wash clothes while we were there. The dryer did take forever to dry the clothes. We also got daily calls with the list of "activities" pool side every day, even after I told them I had two teenage girls who would not be interested in them. We also were called every day to sit in for their 90 minute breakfast and we would receive $80 for the "restaurant.", by the waterpark that we weren't going to. I kept telling them no, but they kept calling every day anyway. Would I recommend this to a friend? Only if they had small children and if they are prepared to the fight to get the room that is pictured. P.S. If you are driving to the resort from the airport, their mailing address is 1777 Bali BLVD Kissimmee, FL. Their ACTUAL address is Winter Garden, FL. If you put KIssimmee into your GPS, you will never find it!

Reviews.Title: “It's definitely NOT the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: mjcorros
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Liki Tiki. My husband and I traveled from PA with our 2 young children and my parents. Based on reviews, I was nervous to open the door!! My first impression was "ok, this isn't soooo bad." It appeared to be clean and somewhat updated (we were in a townhouse style in the 100 block). It was spacious enough and had a nice screened in porch. To simplify, I will list Pros and Cons: Pros: The water park! My kids loved it! It was sometimes crowded but I found the lifeguards to be on top of everyone and it helped squash any rowdy behavior (unlike at the other pools in the resort). The staff was helpful with whatever we asked for. We were only a short drive from the Disney theme parks - maybe about 15 minutes. It was inexpensive - we utilized my sister-in-laws timeshare exchange so we got the room for a steal! Cons: The room was not as clean as I would have liked. After settling in, we realized there were some small bugs crawling around in the kitchen. I tried to keep in mind that this is typical for FL in August, but it started to creep me out after awhile. I would suggest buying some Clorox wipes and doing a once over on the counters, toilets, tubs, etc when you get there. This helped me feel a little better, I guess! Don't expect daily maid service. I read after I left that we could have exchanged towels on Wednesday by coordinating with the desk, but when I asked the lady who came in for our Wednesday "cleaning", she barely spoke english. I feel this should be automatic, but we washed our own mid-week. The "cleaning" consisted of emptying bathroom trash and making beds... kind of pointless in my opinion, but oh well. Aside from the pools, water park and play ground, none of the other amenities are free. You'll pay for mini golf, bikes, and paddle boats. I found the grounds around the water park to be littered with trash - that should be addressed by the resort. It looks horrible. And the water park pools looked pretty dirty by the end of the week. Oh, and one other thing... keep in mind that this is a timeshare resort. They WILL try to sign you up for a presentation when you get there by telling you it's a free buffet style breakfast with the option to buy discounted theme park tickets at the end. I was exhausted and agreed when checking in at 10pm (I also had to hand over a $20 deposit for my "ticket" purchase). The next morning we asked to cancel the breakfast reservation and get our money back. We had to go down the street to get our deposit back. My husband is a no BS kind of guy and made it VERY clear we weren't interested and got our money back. However, if you want to avoid a run around, tell them you've already purchased your tickets (even if you haven't) and stand your ground! That is, unless you don't mind spending a whole morning listening to one of their presentations. My husband and I agreed that while the resort could have been much worse, it definitely could have been better! But again, you get what you pay for and we paid very little! After previously staying at the Marriott, we realized that this resort was not our best option. By the time we rented a van, paid for tickets and parking, gas, food, etc, etc... we probably could have stayed on Disney property for just a little more. Or... we could have returned to the Marriott and had a superior room and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “If bad reviews don't bother you- then maybe BEDBUGS will!!”
Reviews.Author: gonzaleztchr
Reviews.Content: Do not trade in your time share or you will be disappointed. I too, read all the positive and negative reviews and booked this place anyways due to the water park. Yes, if that's all you care about then this is the place for you. The waterpark was really cool- but very overcrowded for the amount of guests staying there. I figured since the place was renovated earlier this year, that everything would be great! Wrong! It began with the resort knowing that my reservation had not been payed for (1-800-HOTELS went bankrupt- but that's another story) and not telling me until Thursday so that of course I had to pay again without the courtesy of making that decision at check-in. I went to relax in the jacuzzi and found myself in a pool of dirt! Even after the hotel staff did a cleaning, the jets were still putting out dirt. Oh well- so no jaccuzzi. Don't count on the continental breakfast. One other reviewer was right when they said tiny bagels and large fig newton. Wow, that's worse than many lower star hotels. They should save the change and use it towards more important things. The fitness center has 2 machines in it. The only one on site restaurant was more expensive than a dinner at Disney for four. Now- these are little complaints and many can overlook them- just as I did! BUT my next complaint should make you think twice and STOP you from booking! My 3 year old daughter began showing tiny bups on her arms 5 days into our stay. They progressed to inflammed red soars all over her arms, face, and legs. We thought contact dermatitis from the sheets and towels and felt bad but didn't worry. Until we got home and started researching possible bed bug bites. Yes, the straight line 3 bites in a row was what she was showing. Then my son, husband, and I also began showing bites. Doctor confirmed that's indeed what it was. She has over 200 bites on her. Now we feel extremely upset and sorry for our little girl. I called to complain and to let them know so they can do something before the next guest arrives, but I'm still waiting for a call back since the housekeeping manager was dealing with another guest at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: angel80anna
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Liki Tiki. Room was nice, clean & had everything we needed. Been staying here for about 5 yrs. & never saw any bugs...guess it could happen, with all the people that come & go. We did see an aligator in the pond this time! Parking can be really bad at times, lots of people visiting! The pools were clean & beautiful! Kids loved the water park! The lifeguards really do their job! The food is really good at the snack bar. This really is a nice resort! Can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: proudmamma2816
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before going to liki tiki. I was a little scared cause some people had some horror stories. I had read a review where someone said you should request a room in the 1200 or 1300 building so i did.My sister was also traveling with us but staying in a different room and we requested to be close. Well check in was a breeze, we had a 2 bedroom condo in the 1200 building and they put my sister right next door. The place was very clean and beautiful. It has everything you need to make your trip easy. Dish washer, washer, dryer,coffee maker, blender,microwave,toaster. The porch was screened in which was nice cause there is a lot of bugs in florida. Whenever i called for toilet paper or paper towels they were there within 5 mins and 5 mins after that they called to make sure i got it. I have 11 and 13 yr old boys and they loved it. The water park was sooooo much fun. The whole family had a blast. There is a walmart about 5 mins away which me and sis spent a lot of time in. We did all the food shopping for the whole 9 days we were there which helps to save money. They also have a ton of disney stuff there which saves you money since you dont have to buy them in the parks. It really became our home away from home. We loved it. I heard the higher the building # the newer it is. The buildings go up to 1400 so keep that in mind when booking. I called a few times before we arrived to make sure they had my request for a newer building and i got it. I would go back. TY liki tiki for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “BUGS BUGS BUGS”
Reviews.Author: nothatpicky
Reviews.Content: Bugs one word i have to say is cockroachs!!!!!! i walk in to the bath room and go to go and i see 3 cockroachs just chilling there then 2 run away no one is awake in are party of 6 and at 2 am in the morning know nothing to do and so i closed the door and blocked it with a towel... I like the place its nice been coming here since i was little and it looks nice here just seeing the roachs in the bathroom made it not a fun stay....

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: graciemay79
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 102D Villa. It was 2 story, full kitchen, 2 bedroom, 2 bath, screened patio. Very nice, older but updated look. Had a problem with AC in master, maintence came out ASAP and fixed it, also didnt have linens for sofa bed (didnt realize until 11:00 at night) and the office had some delivered within 20 minutes. Also had no telephone book (had to call office to get pizza #'s).Waterpark was great, paddleboats fun but hard. mini golf was kinda boring. Loved the late night swimming. The fishing pond is gross and really has aligators. Didnt do bikes, but they look really fun. They have activites for kids to do daily, but I found the employees a little boring and rude.(we did not participate after the 1st day). Overall had a great time. Location was hard to find and a little far from hot spots. Just said no to timeshare and they didnt push too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: LoreenNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days in a 2 bedroom condo in the 800 building. When we arrived, we originally were given a handicap accessible room in the 1200 building. The handicap showerhead was broken and the carpets were badly stained in this room. I called down to the front desk and was switched to the 800 building. Everything in the 800 room was brand new and the carpets were clean. Our room had a full kitchen and included a dishwasher. It was stocked with soap for the dishwasher and for the sink. The washer & dryer also came with soap to use. We were on the 2nd floor facing the pool and we had a balcony (without screens so the bugs would eat you alive if you stayed out there for long). I went over the counters and drawers with a lysol wipe and it came up clean with no dirt. The waterpark pool was awesome. My five year old really enjoyed herself.
