The entire waterpark pool was not more than four feet (and less feet in other areas of it) so it was very easy for a small child to navigate. Most of the slides were moderate and there was one bigger slide that my little one loved. Close by, was an even smaller baby pool that had a sprinkler type of octopus. I have never seen more vigilant lifeguards on duty in my life. They really did a great job at supervising the pool area. Each room is given 6 beach towels for use at the pool, but you must wash the towels yourself and be responsible for it during your stay. The pool area also has scheduled activities each day of the week for the kids and the adults. We ate and had drinks at the restaurant by the pool. The specialty dinners were reasonably priced and tasted good. The frozen drinks were awesome. I thought for Florida, the price of the drinks were a bit high ($8). The hotel is located within close proximity to the Disney parks. One of the hotel reps in guest services told us a shortcut to get to the parks using toll road 429. That was a definite time saver. When we checked in, we were asked if we were interested in attending the timeshare presentation and we declined. There was no pressure at all after we said no and we never received any follow-up calls to attend (thankfully). We also received a Harbour pass to do activities at the resort, but we ran out of time. The hotel has boats and bikes to rent, minature golf, a playground for kids, etc. If you have any problems or need supplies, you just dial zero and they will take care of you. I requested fresh towels on a day that they do not do towel exchanges and I was accommodated. We needed more toilet paper and garbage bags; it arrived within five minutes of the request and they even did a follow-up call to make sure it got there & that we were satisfied. All of the wakeup calls that I requested came on time. I was surprised that the resort charged to use the internet. It cost $7.99 a day or $29.99 for the week to use the internet. I used the business center once while I was there and Jesaida at the front desk was very helpful. The Publix, Walgreens, Denny's, and 7-11 with a gas station were all close by. The hotel also offers free continental breakfast on weekdays; the food was basic, but for free you cannot complain about it. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again. My cousin stayed here and suggested the place to us. He also enjoyed his stay here. I was hesistant about some of the bad reviews before booking it, but we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: cbce1pjb
Reviews.Content: Had a two bedroom unit from a time share swap,The new units looked nice.We got an old unit from the early 80sDated,but evrything worked.Staff was outstanding.If you need something dial 0 and within 3 minutes it was there. The maintenace staff rides around on golf carts is very quick with the service. There are two pools and a waterpark.The waterpark is too small.Too many big kids.Our two were 3 and 5.The other two pools were very nice,peacefull compared to the waterpark. WDW is no bargain in the second week of July'Without a fast pass forgrt it.Even at night just too crowded.Disney needs to build another theme park to reduce the number of people in the existing parks,Is there a good time to come to WDW?maybe the first two weeks of January.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back every year....”
Reviews.Author: Crisirey
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reiviews on tripadvisor, we were pleasantly surprised at how much there was to do at Liki Tiki Village. We spent 3 nights over 4th of July weekend, and even though the weather was not the best, we still had a blast at the water park, even with the light rain. The service was great, the staff was friendly and the accomodations were very comfortable. The condos are spacious and offers all the amenities to travel comfortably with young children. We would definitely return to this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we are used to at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: deniseiowa
Reviews.Content: We have been here at least 3 other times- this time was horrible!!!!! TO top things off we are owners and spent alot of money on this place, needless to say!!!! We were actually lied to about how the family wanted to upgrade to a 3 Br and wanted to sell the 2 Br at what they had left to owe on it!! It's awful funny, when I went to try and sell our share, they didn't believe us, and said they would have never said this!!!! Well guess what they didn't have the same courtesy to us, wanting to sell ours!!! SO we have every other yr. at this resort- we always request the newer builings- they always tell us they can't guarntee it everytime, even though we spent tons of thousands of dollars for this place!! We came in and they told us we had to go into the 7 or 800 building. I kind of threw a fit, but they said everything else was booked, which I found it hard to believe in Dec.(1st week) so we had to take it!! The first day we bought tons of food to find it was all destroyed by sugar ants?????? Then found cockroaches also in room. I immediately called the front desk, they did refund our food cost, after we found all our receipts, thank God we found them. Then they still didn't have any other room for us- then the next evening the fire alarm went off at midnight and would not shut off for over one hr!!!!! It took forever to get a maintenance in our room in the first place, then he couldn't fix it, so finally by GOd there was a room available for us!!! What a nightmare!!! We cannot sell our timeshare, so here we are back every other yr.- this yr. and every yr. we will be in the 12 or 1300 bldg. or else????? Not a cool trip, it actually ruined our entire trip!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Teenagers' point of view...”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl4Ever
Reviews.Content: After doing a ton of research and reading a numerous amount of mixed reviews, my family and I decided on Liki Tiki for it's price and amenities. Being a Palm Beach, Florida resident already, our party of four just wanted to get away for a short weekend. We booked a two-bedroom, that was very clean and located in the Mago(700) building on the fourth floor. We also booked with my sister and her spouse with their 7 and 8 year old boys. The front desk had no problem with connecting are rooms together which was great. Both rooms were spacious and well put together. Staff was very attentive and helpful. The resort is very child oriented and not a good place for older teens, but perfect younger children. The waterpark was a great feature. We never got a chance to try the paddle boats or mini golf that was provided but mini golf looked like a five minute game, and after explaining that there was no alligators in the lake, sure enough some animal comes lingering on by, and a couple came paddling up to the dock saying theres an alligator in the water, so be careful. Guests must wash there own linens, and six pool towels are provided in each room that you must keep track of. New wash cloths and bath towels are available on Tuesdays. Each room is provided with laundry detergeant along with washer and dryer. Housekeeping is available upon request for an additional forty dollars, I think. Ice also must be brought up from a hotel employee. Overall, it was a nice stay, but mostly for small kids.

Reviews.Title: “great location and size of room, but some things should have been better”
Reviews.Author: bbtravelingmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newest building. A 2 bedroom/2 bath unit on the ground floor. The master had a huge whirlpool bath that was very nice. It was only about 10 min. to Disney parks and there were store close by. The carpet in our room was absolutely filthy, to the point we did not go barefoot.. The staff told us it had just been shampooed? The resort itself was fun for my 11 and 3 year olds. Great playground, nice clean pools and mini golf. For the prices and how full they were and the number of maintence staff we saw, I was surprised about the neglected repairs around the resort. The dock on the lake was dangerous with broken boards all over. Overall for our purpose of visiting Disney with a group of 6 i fit our purposes and was a nice spacious retreat.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nikki1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was older and had an odd smell.The first couple of days we had cockroaches,had our room sprayed only to have them back in a couple of days.We requested a room in a newer building when we had booked but when we arrived there wasn't any record of our requests.Even after the bugs they still would not move us to a better room.The elevator in the building we stayed in was out of order so we had to bring our luggage and groceries up 5 floors to our room.However I have to give a big thumbs up to one employee in particular..jesus who worked security there.He helped us when the elevator was not working and when one of the kids changed the code on the safe and we could not open it,he was right there to help us.We would give him a 10 out of 10 for the service he gave us.If you are looking for anything above a 2 or 3 star this is not the place for you.The pools were nice however only one had lifeguard supervision,which meant a free for all in the other pools.The only restaurant on site really did not offer much for lunch or supper options so be prepared for having to go of the resort for a good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort!”
Reviews.Author: aandgande
Reviews.Content: When we got to our room, there was hair everywhere and the carpet was filthy. So many things did not work- dvd player, boom box, vacuum cleaner, bathroom light and dryer. My daughter cut her foot on the bed frame that they pieced together. The people above us were spitting and throwing stuff off their balcony while we were outside on ours. At 1230am, there were a bunch of guys hanging out outside my son's window yelling and partying. Security did take care of this. The community pool, was pretty disgusting. We were very happy to be able to afford a resort for a quickly planned vacation. Next time, we will not skimp on the resort. I think the only thing that made it a resort was the fact that they had a community pool, paddle boats and other activities. It really was more like a cheap apartment complex with activities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Very Crowded Waterpark/Pool - Beware of Timeshare Sales”
Reviews.Author: scarletfire75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 3 days. When we checked in we had to wait until 4pm to get our room. While receiving our parking pass, the lady tried to persuade or trick us into a free breakfast & $80 if we attended a meeting the next morning - a timeshare sales plot. We declined & once we did, oh boy! did the pleasant demeanor change! The kids were excited about the water park but it was SO CROWDED!! They had fun but my husband and I did not enjoy it at all. There is a bar at the water park. We decided to go to the other pool close to the office, which was less crowded and nice but the water was so warm, it was like taking a bath. The room was good. Loved having the kitchen & washer/dryer. The bathroom was roomy & clean. The beds were not comfortable and had those horrible motel blankets. They provide you with pool towels but don't lose one or they will charge you $10 per towel!! Internet is not free here & cost $7.99 for 24 hours. About 20 minutes away from Disney. Other than having the kitchen & washer/dryer - we were not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at Liki Tiki!”
Reviews.Author: bjlegal
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews, I was nervous about our stay at Liki Tiki, however, it was wonderful! My husband and I stayed with our two boys, 17 and 11. My 11 year old loved the waterpark and my 17 year old was happy, which if you have teenagers is not an easy task! They have water volleyball at the waterpark which was great fun. The Liki Tiki bar and grill is pretty good typical bar food. They have activities for the kids, air brush tatooing, ect. Our condo was nice and well equipped, very clean. We stayed in the 900 building which was right next door to the waterpark. The only problem we had was locating Liki Tiki, as there is no sign on the main road, which I understand they are in the process of rectifying.

Reviews.Title: “Reserved Room Not Available”
Reviews.Author: Buffy714
Reviews.Content: Unable to get the reserved 2 bedroom that we requested "not available" could only be downgraded to a 1 bedroom. Horrible service. Of course they say either they are the manager when you request to talk to someone else or that person isn't available. Reservation/Confirmation # doesn't mean anything.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Whitepinesdog
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport around 9p.m. We had directions from Yahoo maps, "what a joke" we were lost for hours. This resort is hard to find at night in the rain. Our cell phones would not work for at least an hour after our flght landed. We called the resort and spoke with Miriam, she gave us clear concise directions to the resort. After getting there she was so helpful and even told us where we could get something to eat delivered to our condo. We ordered Dominos Pizza it was hot and delecius. Delivered in about 30 minutes. I was concerned after I read some of the reviews, somebody had said there were roaches in their bed. I don't know how that happened, maybe they brought the roaches with them. I am a very picky person, when I got in the room I checked everything from the mattress to the bathroom and the fridge. We stayed 4 nights and I saw not one bug. The condo is supplied with just about everything you need, soap, diswashing liquid, toilet paper, and the works, even a blender. The best way to describle the location is 192 East from the airport. Take 192 East to Avalon. Turn right on Avolon and a quick left onto Balli. There is a walmart off of 192, take exit 27 , wich is virtuallly around the corner. The staff was great and helpful including the grounds and housekeeping staff. My only conpaint was that I didn't get to atttend the Luiau it was sold out, and the fitted sheets didn't fit the thick mattress, they kept coming off the bed at night. My 12 year old loved the water park, we loved the pool and hot tub. We played miniture golf, basketball, and rode the bikes. We had a great time and can't wait to go back. Souveniers are much cheaper at the walmart.

Reviews.Title: “small family reuion”
Reviews.Author: mommahagan
Reviews.Content: overall very nice place to vacation with small kids.My grandkids had a ball at the water park.The only thing negative i have to say about this resort is if you need handicap access their are none on the first floor .we were told the all are on their 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Review60
Reviews.Content: We traveled in April 2010 with family (ages 5-79) and stayed in (2) two bedroom units by Shipwreck Sally's bar and grill. The kids were in the pool everyday. The kids tie dyed t-shirts, got spray on tatoos. Gatorland came to the resort one night (free). The food and drinks were good. We bought groceries at Target and Publix they were very close to the resort. We ate out for suppers, like- Shogun(6327 International Ave), Bonefish(7830 Sand Lake Rd), Salt Island Chop House (7500 International Dr). all very good. Shopped at two of the outlet malls, went to downton Disney (free) kids loved the lego store. we were concerned whether we made a good decision to stay here after we read some of the reviews. But had a great time, the resort was clean, staff was pleasant/friendly, lots to do in the area!! We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations....”
Reviews.Author: writeon28
Reviews.Content: My family(wife 3 kids) stayed here for three nights at a pretty good deal. However it was not what we expected after looking at their website. My 13 year old even commented "It looked better in the pictures." When we got there to check in at 4:00pm they told us the room wasn't ready and to "check back." Why do I have to check back? I gave them my number and asked to be called when it was ready. A half an hour later, still no call. So we went back in and they found us a different room that was ready. They also tried to sell us the "free breakfast with a $20.00 deposit." How is it free if I have to pay a deposit? Of course this was part of their timeshare selling shpiel. The experienced really didn't sit well with us. When we got to our room it was spacious enough, however, it was a little dated and definately not as clean as it should/could've been. The whirlpool tub that was so advertised by them was filthy and I was afraid to use it. The waterpark was a lot smaller than we anticipated but the kids loved it the whole time we were there. The restaurant they advertised is more of a poolside bar that happens to serve food. Their gift shop was closed everytime we went to see if we could look around in it. The lagoons they have to paddle boat and fish in are more like stagnant ponds. Very murky and full of floating plant matter. Also the putt-putt course they have on site is a joke. Its 9 holes that they have doubled up to make 18 and its mostly flat astroturf. Suffice to say were very disappointed. We made it through the vacation though as there is plenty to do in the surrounding area and its pretty close to all of the theme parks. I will say we usually stay at the Universal or Disney resorts and have probably been spoiled by our experiences. If you are used to staying at those places, I wouldn't recommend staying here, it will just let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hassle free nice pools”
Reviews.Author: DadinNH
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki is a resort offered with lots of activities for the kids, for what turned out to be only a 3 night stay at $50 per night... Since we only had one day at Discovery Cove and a second at Seaworld, I could have spent 2 weeks at the Liki Tiki and had a wonderful time! A bonus is that with the Discovery Cove tickets, you get 14 days free admission to Seaworld, but alas my new job only offered us to stay the 3 nights. The room was clean, we had the one bedroom with the pullout queen. Kitchen was nice with all the amenities. Trash bags, TP and towels were all there so no need to buy that stuff.. Walmart is around the corner,, and there are tons of restaurants on 192 if your up to just eat out. The balcony is small and fenced in, but it is a nice touch if you awake early and want to listen to nature before the rest of the gang wakes up. The pools are nice, the main one is open till 11:00..... There is hottub which is nice cause it did get down to 60 at night. With our room, came an unlimited pass for mini golf, bumper boats etc..... the kids loved it... We did ask for the 1300 or 1400 units and we were given then with no hassles, also having a room face the glades in the back was nice and peaceful. I would plan on returning on my next trip! I only gave a 4 on Location cause it was a 30 minute drive from the airport. Also a 4 on sleep quality, they could have given larger/more pillows pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Kids will Love,Adults: it's a coin flip”
Reviews.Author: MrMikeBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: I must say the whole water park theme is a great thing, the kids loved it. I was just not too happy with the way they try to get you to pay for everything. If you wanted to fish,paddle boat,basketball..etc, it was not included with what you already pay. I think that is very Sad. They tell you about a welcome breakfast which is a TimeShare pitch and they keep you there and all you get for it is Discount Tickets to the Dinner Show on Thursday, If you have to go to the presentation the Dinner show should be Free ( Make sure you ask them about your drinks at the show, they only wanted to give us either 1 soda, glass of wine or beer, then they want to charge you for any additional). The staff is great if you call they will come. All in All it was okay, it is not as nice as WestGate. If you are in Bld 1000 and go on the back patio bring BUG Spray, there are these FLY type insects that will bite the heck out of you. I brought my own grill and had the smoke going and that wouldn't even stop these creatures.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Banam_69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 1000 building. Two bedroom. Very pleasently surprised when we walked in at how clean and nice the room was. As an owner else where I tend to be picky. No problem here. Not sure where the other people who said the pool was dirty stayed, because from the water park to the main pool everything was top notch. The kids loved the activities and even won $17 at Bingo! Would definitely trade into again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in my choice...when there are so many other options available”
Reviews.Author: psmcfarland
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed. When we arrived our room was not very clean. It was old and dated. We were in the 400 building. We asked for a cleaner, newer room, closer to the pool. We were told there was nothing available. The staff was too the point, and not overly friendly. We accepted this and moved our belongings into the room. The next day we went to the Magic Kingdom. We returned late and tried to make a pizza in the oven. There was no temperature gauge, and the oven did not work. We had no way to cook our pizza. I tried to take a shower, but the shower would not pump out enough water for me to even get my hair wet. We were invited to a timeshare talk the next day. We accepted because we were promised free tickets to a Luau. We were asked about our accomodations. I told the representative about our problems and they agreed to move us to a newer, bigger room. We went back and packed up everything and moved rooms. This room was much better than the last, but still not that clean! A lot of mold in the bathroom. We then attended the Luau, which was not really a Luau at all. It was more like a buffet dinner with a show. It was inside a banquet room. The food was so salty we could not eat anything. Also, I happended to be walking by the pool bar earlier that day and saw the food in the back of a truck of one of the employees. I asked him if he was getting ready for the Luau and he said yes. The food was not refrigerated. It was almost 90 degrees that day. Coleslaw, potato salad, etc. sitting out in the back of someone's truck does not sound appetizing to me. Also, they will not allow you to take your own food and drinks to the pool, because they want you to buy theirs. The pool was dirty, crowded and the water was cold. I was happy to get to move to the second room, but not happy that I had to go to a timeshare meeting before they were willing to do anything about it. Why was there suddenly a room available when there hadn't been before? I have stayed a Disney owned properties in the past and will do so again in the future. This was such a disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: luvmyemily
Reviews.Content: I was a little afraid, after having read mixed reviews but was pleasantly surprised! The people at check in were very friendly, and helpful. We had a 1 room condo in building 400. It was very spacious, and stocked with everything from toiletries to laundry soap! The pools and waterpark are all great. We loved everhting about it and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “4th Time as good as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: chindley
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel , especially for families. The water park is great and the rooms were clean and well equipped. I don't know what people expect when they book these resorts, of course you can hear other people "YOUR IN A HOTEL" book a villa in the middle of nowhere if you want solitude but Florida is not the place for a quiet time, 90% of people there are families with kids, and guess what kids like to have fun... That said, you wont be dissapointed..

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend this place to anyone!!”
Reviews.Author: kc2010_10
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying this is NO 5 star hotel. The 2 reasons I booked this place is 1) the pool for the kids & 2) it was a 5 star hotel. I checked in to find out the the kids pool would be closed for 3 days and they didn't seem to care that I was upset. Then when I get to my room it's very outdated and I didn't get a clean feeling. The couch was horrible, the beds were terrible and the pillows were so flat I needed to pile up 4 just to make one. I don't think the sheets were clean because when I undid the bed there was a hair on the sheets. When the kids and I swam in the other pool it was filthy dirty. Kids were taking off there goggles because they didn't want to see what was floating in the pool. Then the website says how many things there are to do with the kids, fish, paddle boat, mini golf, etc. they forget to tell you that everything cost money and it's only open till 7pm. The food was terrible and pricey. I will leave you with this last comment and you decide it you want to stay here. When I was packing to leave guess what was crawling on the bedroom door frame... a big fat roach!!

Reviews.Title: “I found the LEAK at the Liki Tiki.”
Reviews.Author: joejup
Reviews.Content: In Central FL, you usually get what you pay for. We paid $69 a night. We weren't expecting much. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit on the bottom floor of the Tahiti building, and we heard every toilet flush and shower taken in every unit above us. Yep -- all 5 floors. Check in and out were not awful, but I've come to expect more courtesy from desk staff. The truth is we are not really into the whole timeshare drama, so we won't be returning to the Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaratwin
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at Liki Tiki and were happy with the resort like feel. We stayed in the 2 bedroom condo and it was very spacious for 5 people. We enjoyed our experience but our only complaint was the lack of supervision of the pools. We realize there were no lifeguards watching the pools and adults were responsible for their children but there were many kids without adults in the pool and hot tub. I got hit hard with a football in the forehead from kids in the pool. This was around 10:00 pm. The stated rules say no children under 12 in the hot tub without adults. There were kids about 8 in the hot tub without parents and yes this may not be the sole responsibility of the hotel but routine checks should be made. When we made a complaint, they were very nice and responsive and went out to stop the kids from throwing the football. Otherwise we loved our stay and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Milodar
Reviews.Content: We visited Liki Tiki with our extended family which included members aging from 3-75. We rented three condo units in the Bali building. The high rise condos are a bit newer - but the low rise units were undergoing renovations and looked really great from what we could see. Our specific family group had a two bedroom condo - plenty of room for the kids and adults to seperate. The unit had a fully stocked kitchen, washer and dryer in the unit, two bathrooms, patio, and multiple TV's (great for post-Disney downtime.) The property had multiple pools including a water park like pool, playground, mini-golf, paddleboats (most were broken), tiki bar, and other amenities. The property is close to supermarkets, Target, Walmart and, of course, Disney. Several things to think about : 1)We would suggest requesting an end unit away from the pool - ours was right across from the pool and quite loud until the pool closing time of 12am. 2) If you have very young children and are visiting specifically for Disney - you may be better off in a Disney property - the back and forth for nap time is easier with the Disney bus system. 3) This property is not the place for a romantic getaway or quite downtime. There are kids at every turn - and kids are inherently loud.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else??”
Reviews.Author: natureswild
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time here. The rooms are spacious, dishes, towels, soap and all the stuff you'd find in a hotel were available in your room. We had more fun spending the day at the resort than we did at Disney World. We will definately be back. Publix is just a couple minutes away to stock up on groceries. There are dinner themes for every night. Luau, fish fry, pizza and wings etc or you can order pizza from the bar and eat it in your room. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: wil62
Reviews.Content: After all the good reviews we booked this resort for two nights. If you book this and need the fold able bed then be aware that this is a small very uncomfortable bed. Our mattress was terrible and it took us a hole day before it was fixed. Breakfast is very poor. Swimming pool is great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “More than we paid for”
Reviews.Author: fielin
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I requested an updated unit. This request was not granted, but it did not matter. The condo was bigger than I expected, the balcony was huge, and the three swimming pools we visited were clean, warm, and not too crowded. The condo itself was clean, the kitchen was well equipped, and we really enjoyed the place. Only negative : the main TV is small and far from the sofa (the one in the bedroom is bigger, go figure !). The landscape was lush, and well maintained. We will probably be back in one or two years !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: StormFan76
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eight night stay at the Liki Tiki. I really do have mixed feelings about the overall experience. First, the pros- We stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath condo on the third floor of the 1300 building. We were told this was a newly renovated room. The rooms were extremely spacious and at a very good price. It was nice to have three flat screen tvs to enjoy. Service was great. When we called for extra coffee and trashbags, they were delivered within ten minutes both times. The lifeguards were awesome at the pool. They kept a constant eye on all the kids and even jumped in twice to help little ones who were struggling after using the slides. The front desk personnel were very helpful and we too received a free harbor pass, which we never got around to using. Kevin at the front desk was helpful in getting my boarding passes printed off before we flew home, as the business center printer was not working. Security on site was a plus too. My kids loved the lagoon (kids' pool). They wanted to swim more than they wanted to go to the parks. The downside is that the lagoon area closes at 8:00pm. The Cons- Our condo was a little dirty. There was (a small amount of) mold in both showers and both toilets. There were dirt smudges on several of the walls. I thought I had read the 1300 rooms had the nice marble countertops in the kitchen but ours were basic (maybe it was the 1400 rooms?). We could easily hear the neighbors on either side of us...who were extremely loud during the day. Because they quieted down at bedtime we didn't call to complain. One night they cooked something that smelled awful and the smell came into our condo and reeked up the whole place. The worst part was the mosquitoes. I'm used to a few mosquitoes in the room, it is Florida after all. But we had dozens and dozens of mosquitoes. We called the front desk who sent an off-site company to spray the next day. When we got back from the parks there were dozens of dead mosquitoes all over the counters (gross). Later that night, there were dozens more in our room. We finally figured out to plug the drains in the tubs and that seemed to help. The pool at the clubhouse had a lot of bugs in the water, like it hadn't been skimmed for a few days. My kids, who are not picky, refused to swim in that pool a second night. Overall it was a lot of space for a low price. We did get asked to attend a time share presentation but I politely said no thank you. We received calls daily from the front desk asking us to attend their presentations, but we just deleted the messages. If/when we return to Orlando, probably in 2012, I'll consider the Liki Tiki, but I can't 100% say for sure that's where we'll end up.

Reviews.Title: “Owner - Interval Int'l”
Reviews.Author: buminthesun66
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Loved our stay. The grounds are VERY clean and so are the pools, with that amount of people they did a wonderful job keeping everything perfect. Cool decor around very "Hawaiian" I loved it! Allot of activities everyday for every age. And they left messages on your phone to update/remind you. The first room we had was just ok so we upgraded and what a difference. We'll never go for the 1 bed. Try to get the new buildings we had rooms in the 700 section very beautiful and had the lake right at our balcony. Take the upgrade for $100 if you can it's well worth it! Shipwreck Sally's can be allot of fun and provides good food and drink while @ the pool. There's poolside bingo, and other activities as well. Or if you wish try the other 2 heated pools for quieter swims. Has just about something for everyone. We are owners so they do treat you first class and nothing is "extra" there were absolutely no charges when we checked out. We will stay there again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, but a lot of noise”
Reviews.Author: cathym87
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised at how clean and updated the condo was. Based on other reviews I've read, I must have lucked out with a recently renovated 2 bedroom condo in the 700 bldg. The ammenities were great, my 11 year old loved the mini water park. I couldn't get over the noise though. We could hear the radio from the condo next door. And people's voices echoed off of the other buildings when they were on the balcony. We were 2 buildings away from the water park but could hear the karaoke singing inside our condo. As long as you don't mind the noise you'll be fine. Check-in seemed to take forever, but I was tired and just wanted to get to my room. All in all, it was a good experience. I liked charging anything we ate or drank from the tiki-bar right to our room so we didn't have to carry cash. Lifeguards were very diligent too!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! good value”
Reviews.Author: hcms
Reviews.Content: Stayed in single bed condo. Room was neat and facilities good with a full kitchen and washer drier. Kids enjoyed the pool. Complementary breakfast is not that good, had just bagels. One minor issue is there is no daily room service. Otherwise stay was good, all the parks are within 6~10 miles. Got a good deal from expedia. Paid $30 for internet for a week, speed wasn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “loved it would love to o back in 2011”
Reviews.Author: mikesball67
Reviews.Content: wow what a great place to stay we will be back in 2011 don't know why the negative reviews i could not falt it.not to far from the Disney parks about 10 to 15 mins by car.my daughter loved the pool great place if u have young children.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: mrsdinophillips
Reviews.Content: This place was more than what we expected, the rooms were great and spacious. I traveld with my husband and three small children, when we got their friday the kids did not want to leave the water park, we went to disney on sat and the kids kept asking when are we leaving and going back to the water park. The onsite activites are great there is always something for the kids to do, what impressed me the most was that i left my cell phone in the room after we checked out and when we went back to get it the clenaing lady was cleaning from top to bottom, she pulled the fridge out from the wall the stove from the wall, took all eyes out of the stove had all the dishes in the dishwasher, the linne was in the washing machine, I can honestly say that she cleaned the rooms very well, will be back this summer, but will stay for longer

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - again wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyLi
Reviews.Content: We had such a great vacation in 2009, that we decided to book Liki Tiki for 2010. We again requested building 1100, or 1200. I didn't realize I was booking at the tail end of spring break so it was busier than when we went the first week in May last year. However, they accommodated us with building 1000 (basically the same as 1100) and put us on the top floor. The view was great...not quite as perfect as building 1100 or 1200, but still very nice. The room was not quite as updated as last years, but again, clean and very very nice. The service was great and this year were weren't called daily to pick up our "welcome' package..which is just a bid to get you down and talk you in to a time share. We were never bothered about time shares. The food was great at Ship Wreck Sally's. We could hear a little noise through the wall in the evening a couple of nights, but nothing really loud and it was quiet by 9:00. I think if you had a partying group beside you, it could be a bit noisier...but we brought a noise machine for the kids rooms and ear plugs for myself...which I never had to use. It is quite peaceful in the newer buildings as you back on to the lush tropical forest. We loved Liki Tiki and will likely stay again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Loved it even some more”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaJoe73
Reviews.Content: Well I purchased a week here off ebay sight unseen. Just got back from our week and we are very happy with the unit. We stayed in one of the updated townhouse 2 bedroom units. Anything in the 200 buildings will have you right in between the laggon ( kids water park) and the more adult friendly heated pool. Literally a 2 minute walk to either pool area. The unit was very clean and "quiet". The staff were all very friendly and ready to help with anything you may need. We needed an extra blanket and sheet set for the sofa bed and they brought it right away. You are only 10 minutes right up the street from Disney/Animal Kingdom/Epcot/Hollywood Studios. Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure/Sea World are all about a 20 minute drive right up I-4 East from the hotel. Very very convenient easy access to the Disney parks.. Universal is more of a drive. Lots of restaurants to choose from on hwy 192 ( this is the road Liki Tiki is on). I would recommend Houlihans for a nice inexpensive breakfast buffet.. All in all I would highly recommend to my friends to stay at the Liki Tiki. Glad I purchased here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Fun for Kids”
Reviews.Author: tyoungs
Reviews.Content: This is definately a nice place to stay if traveling with kids who love the water! The small waterpark was a blast for our kids aged 4 and 9, and the lifeguards working the waterpark did a great job! Our 1-bedroom condo was nice, a couple of little things wrong, like the patio door made noise, but really small stuff not even worth mentioning. I loved having a washer/dryer and all the amenities of home! The Super Walmart down the road was a great addition. I didn't like that the waterpark closed so early - it said closes at 8:30pm, but it seemed to have closed by 8pm. Could have been the time of year, not sure. There is another pool open until midnight, but it doesn't have a bar :-(

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit and Still A Great Place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sybock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki for 1 week for our March Break vacation and once again we found the resort excellent. We stayed in a one bedroom unit in the 1000 BLDG and found it very comfortable. The unit was in great condition and we found the property itself very tidy. The building and the property in general was very quiet. The check-in process was very quick. Their security at the front gate is very pleasant and always say "welcome back" to the resort with a smile. With all the development on U.S 27 and 192 there is a fair bit of restaurants and shopping close by including Olive Garden, Long Horn Steak House, Target and Super Walmart etc. The pools at Liki Tiki seems to make it a blast for the kids and Ship Wreck Sally's Pool Bar/Restaurant is excellent for parents for the most part. Other nice feature is the internet service is free for owners and has pretty good wireless signal. My complaints about Liki Tiki would be the following: They now hit you up for a 20 buck deposit for your appointment for a "tour". I suppose you could just say NO! but we were tired and for 20 bucks it was worth it to shut them up. You get it back if you show up for you appointment. We never did show up for the tour appointment and they did call to reschedule but when we didn't show up the 2nd time they never called again. 2nd complaint would be that they don't keep the pool bar "Ship Wreck Sally's" open late enough. 9PM is tooooo early in my opinion and 11PM would be more reasonable. They weather was chilly at night but owner pay a fair buck for maintenance and taxes for this resort so they could be open later. JMHO. 3rd complaint is they need better pillows they are just horrible! Bring your own. Last complaint have more than one movie night. They have it one night "Monday"..seems rather silly. Not really a complaint for me but some day that giant step to make it into the tub could be troublesome some day. Too high from the floor. This was our 2nd stay at Liki Tiki since purchasing a week and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun.”
Reviews.Author: FLfamofsix
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a long weekened @ Liki Tiki Village. Our children had a blast, there were lost of activities for them. We stayed in a two bedroom condo in the 1200 block, it was very clean and had all of the amenities of a home. Some of the negatives about the resort are check in time is 4:00 but our room was not ready until 5:00. Also, the food @ the pool side grill was a bit pricey and not that great. Overall we had fun and will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: terrible2
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a seven day stay at the Liki Tiki Village in Winter Garden, Florida. I first just want to say that it was a WONDEFUL vacation, and the Liki Tiki Village helped make it great!!! I do want to say after reading a few of the reviews, I was getting kind of nervous about the place! I am very meticulous when it comes to hotels/resorts etc. I do have high expectations of our "home" away from "home". To my surprise, this place was GREAT. It was just what our family needed. We stayed in a one bedroom villa w/ a sleeper sofa(for our kids). This one bedroom had plenty of space. It was just enough space for what we needed. A living room with an attached dining room, fully equipped kitchen, and the grounds of the village was very nice. Our children loved the pools, which are very kid friendly, as well as the play area and the Harbor. It is located in a wonderful spot with plenty of places to eat, a Super Target down the road, and only about 8-10 minutes to Disney. Seriously, if you were having doubts, DON'T...it truly is a nice place. Also, some good advice we received froma previous writer was to request the 1300 or 1400 rooms. We were able to get in the 1300 and it was nice. We were able to see rooms in the 800 building as well, which all of those have been recently remodeled. If you are going with a family, this is a great family resort!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - ok”
Reviews.Author: alvarezbla
Reviews.Content: The 1 bedroom was spacious and clean. Thematresses needed to be replaced. Room cleaning service is not daily. We didnt request it (addt'l cost) since it was a short visit. The pool area was run down. I am used to nicer hotels and dont plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Family Traveling to Orlando on Budget”
Reviews.Author: OrangeCharles
Reviews.Content: Recently, my family of four stayed in a two bedroom condo at Liki Tiki Village. The resort has three pools -- one heated, one kiddie pool, and one with small waterslides and other accessories. The resort also offered paddleboat rides in its ponds, and bicycle rides on the premises. The rooms were clean, but not all rooms had been upgraded to the specifications given at the front desk. For instance, the kids' bedroom did not have a television. The large flat screen TV in the living room made up for that. The kitchen was well enough equipped to let us eat some meals that we prepared ourselves. Finally, the resort staff found the wallet that my son lost very early during the trip. His money was still in the wallet. Of course, I am recommending this hotel to any family traveling to Orlando and the Disney area on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I would probably stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ivfmommy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 6 nights (just got home) and were quite happy with the place. The waterpark is great for kids and adults. We stayed in unit 900. There are 6 5 storey buildings. We rented a 1 bedroom unit. Full kitchen, laundry and dishwasher. Clean and tidy. Flat screen in main living room where the coach pulls out (very uncomfortable!!) and an older model tv in bedroom. The sheets were too small for the bed and the pillows were flat. We paid $69.00 canadian through travelocity. The internet cost extra and was almost useless. Too slow. It was cheap and that is what we got. If we went back we would request a newer building and a 2 bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “talk about feeling like your trash!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacavill
Reviews.Content: wellto start off my wife son and i had stayed at this resort two timesprior to this and had a good experience, we went again under the gaurantee of having a new room because we were frequent there and looking to buy. well we never got the up graded room and went to the 90 minute sales pitch.we were told they would upgrade the room and they wanted us to be happy and well taking care of, this all turned out to be false. we told them we had old style tv and an old room we were argued with and told we would not get a different room, i had put down a lump sum of money to purchase and had them refund it i would never go back we were told they take care of some people like owners not just anyone. well how do you get owners when you treat 26 year old familys just starting out? not like that. they made me and my family seem like we were looking for a hand out... on the other hand if you do like the place and are looking to buy there is a sales rep named Rick very professional gets right to the point (he wont try to sell u one for 40,000 thenoffer 8,000 at the end) he had me sold until the hi up started treating us like they did. so give this rick a try he is legit and will hook you up with the best they can get, until i took my 2,000 deposit back he had me with a free week inmexico and double points the first year. all in all resort is a mid class at best with horrible management that doesnt care about the customer.... never again

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: Rochester1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April so maybe that is a really bad season to go. Upon arriving it seemed fine, We went to Disney for the day and when we came back it was dark. Upon turning on the lights in the bathroom many little cockroaches ran away! Yuck! We also could hear our neighbors very well clear enough to hear their conversations while in the middle of our room(not leaning against the wall). Before going to bed, eww we saw a huge cockroach in the master bedroom. We called the office about 1 am (we have 5,8, and 12 year old) the office said they would come spray, he showed up with a can of raid haha, what is that going to do? So they switched our room. In the new room there was a few smashed cockroaches on the wall, and a dead frog under the coffee table. We left and stayed somewhere else for the week. The water area for the kids was cute though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: HereWeComeFlorida
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Liki Tiki Village with my husband and children 18, 3 & 5. I have to say reading some of the reviews I was nervous to come here but I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. I have to start off with checkin just be prepared for pressure to attend a timeshare sales pitch even if you are already owners. We rented the 3 bedroom which is a full 2 bedroom unit and a full 1 bedroom unit connected but it was so big we only used the 2 bedroom unit and was very clean. I thought The resort had a lot to offer guests, they had a gator show which was great and only $3 a person to go to, they offered movie night and a kids program they also had a luau we went to which was a lot of fun and had great food. The prices were $27.50 an adult and around $17.50 for children. They ended up having it inside because of weather and my understanding it usually is outside by one of the pools which would of made it better but it was still fun. They had mini golf, a playground, paddle boats and bike rentals, tennis and basketball and a small game room. There were 3 pool areas which were all great of course the pool with the waterslides was more packed but never felt too busy and there was a bar and restaurant there as well. The only thing is if I go back I would want to stay in a room closer to the waterslide pool because the unit we were in which was in the 500 building was a little far away from that pool and all the other activities. There were lots of restaurants, grocery stores, and a Super Target close by but it was a little drive to anywhere else. There was one thing I did not like about the room itself was the rooms did not have high locks on the doors so my little 3 year old was just big enough to be able to open any door and unlock the deadbolts. It made me nervous to be cooking and think maybe he would get out on the patio from the master bedroom and climb on a chair and fall over because there is no screen for protection or to think he could of done the same thing at the front door and head down the hallway. So higher locks on all the doors that go to the outside would be very good. They do charge for internet if you are not owners but the connection was terrible 90% of the time but I would recommend this resort to people we had a lot of fun there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TaraLily
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Liki Tiki. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. It provided all the amenities we could have needed for our stay in FL. The only downside is that it was a bit of a drive from Orlando and its attractions. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, especially when we have kids. Great activites for children at this hotel, too bad we are a little old to participate.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: desnichol
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely clean place to stay the staff are quick at dealing with requests if i was to moan about any thing it would be the bedsheets as the wife said they were too small and you did wake up with them wrapped around your legs .Get new sheets and see you next year liki tiki.

Reviews.Title: “sometimes you get more for what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ImonVACATIONdangit
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews before going to the Liki Tiki I was a little nervous becuase I bookded the room for my family and my sister and neice. I found a lot of great idea's from prevoius posting: 1. after booking call ahead of time and request a room in the 1300 block and 1400 block. There is a big difference in the age of the units. My in-laws came to visit 1 night and they ended up in the 1000 block and they did not have as nice of room as we did in the 1300 block. 2. when you are done checking in they will send you over to there "other desk" to get a parking pass. This is were they try and talk to you about a "free breakfast and cheap Disney tickets". This is a time share, I just told them I was not intrested and was only on vacation (even though if i could afford it, this place would not be a bad one to own). The week was a little over $500.00 for us and was worth every penny and a lot more. 3. There is a Wal-Mart that is only about 3 miles away, do not make the mistake we did and end up over by the airport to get grocery because thats were are stupid GPS sent us to!! 4. The only negative is everyhthing looks and sounds so much nicer on the web site. It's a little run down by the pools and Harbor but I did not spend $200.00 plus a night to have the very best. Over all read a few of the post prevoiuus, they are very helpful. We had a fantastic time and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the low cost. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: B-and-J31
Reviews.Content: My 4yr old, my husband and myself stayed at the Liki Tiki in Feb. 2008. We got a one bedroom suite with a kitchen. The room itself seemed outdated, but otherwise clean. As far as the furniture and decorations go, its Florida, what do you expect? The beds were comfortable, the sofa bed was not overly comfortable, but my daughter was so worn out after Disney that I don't think she really minded. The tvs were older, not flat screens, but we went to Florida to go to Disney and swim in the pool... not watch TV. Our balcony over looked the pool and we enjoyed having breakfast there in the mornings. The kitchen was great, had everything we needed for meals and drinks, even a blender for margaritas. We rented a car while we were there and just used that for getting around. The front desk staff were very helpful, when I told them the day we were planning on going to the Magic Kingdom, they recommended we go to a different park as the Magic Kingdom closed early that day and did not have fire works. The Gator show was awesome!! One of the high lights of our trip. If you have the opportunity to attend, DO!! The luau was good, food was great, the show was pretty good too. The pool outside our room was clean and comfortable. We didn't use the fitness center, so I don't know about the state of it. We only went to the water park one day, and it was very nice. The grounds themselves were really nice. We enjoyed walking by the lake and seeing the birds and people attempting to fish. Hopefully we make it back to florida soon, and if we do, we could possibly stay here again. And would I recommend it to a friend? I already have.

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler319
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki for one week through a timeshare. The room we had was a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo in one of the buildings that seemed to be newly renovated. It was very clean, spacious and the resort had a lot of activities. We didn't participate in many activities since the weather was cooler than usual but we loved the resort still.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place...”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime23
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed Liki Tiki. Great pools and all kinds of activities for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family resort”
Reviews.Author: StPaulMommy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week for a Disney Vacation. One of the plus for us was having a full Kitchen cutting down the cost of not having to eat out everynight. Check in was great, we arrived late at night and had no problems at all. Our one bedroom unit was nice, clean without any problems. The sofa bed was not very comfortable, but really are any? The pools, hot tub and all of the daily activities that are called to your voice mail a day in advance were nice advantages to the resort. The weather was not very nice for the week but we were able to use the pool a couple of times at least. It was nice and close to all the parks. It only took us about 10 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom and less than that for Animal Kingdom. Having a GPS was an added bonus! We didn't use the internet service that they have and charge for, we have our own sprint card. Super Walmart is a couple miles away, and where we got our groceries. Overall we had no complaints with the resort at all. I have found it hard to believe others have found so many negatives!! I was traveling with my husband and 4 1/2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Kids”
Reviews.Author: devy69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. It is located in a gated resort. I'd recommend it for a a place to stay in the Orlando/Kissimmee are as it is a great place to stay for families. It is appx. 15-25 mins. from Disney depending on the traffic. Which, at certain times of the day is very busy. There are several apartment style buildings and some cottage style units. The newer units are the apartment style buildings. Most, if not all units have kitchens. There are two pools. One with a waterpark and one without, but the one without does have a hot tub in the pool area and is also located right beside the fitness center. The one with the water park has a bar/grill. The other does not. It is best if you can get a room near the pool with the waterpark or possibly in between it and the main building. They do sell timeshares for the units here and you will be asked if you want to sit through a timeshare presentation for a discount on your room or some other perk. They are not pushy and a simple "no thanks" and you are left alone from that point forward. The only complaint I have about the Liki Tiki is that the main pool closes around dinner time, and there is ABSOLUTELY no nightlife. (Although on one of our stays they held a Hawaiian Luau. But even that ended around 8:00. Btw, I would highly recommend buying tickets to this if they have it while you're there.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with family. Things I wish I knew before arrival.”
Reviews.Author: graciediane
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed the Liki Tiki Resort. Our 2bd/2bth unit was very spacious. 1 king bed, 2nd bedroom had 2 full sized beds, & living room had sofa/bed we never opened. Laundry in the unit & a full kitchen. The outdated decor is not that bad. It's Florida "Golden Girls" style. The counters are peach-colored laminate which I can imagine people dislike. The unit was clean overall, but had signs of wear. We got a great package price so we didn't mind little scuffs on walls or chipped paint on the occasional corner, etc. We visited during Orlando's longest "cold snap" and it took over 24 hours for our heater to start working, but we lived. What I wish I had known before arrival: 1) Paper Towels, Toilet Paper, Shampoo, Bath Soap, toothpaste, Dish soap & laundry soap is provided in your unit. I spent money mailing these items ahead of time so I wouldn't have to shop our first night. 2) The sneaky Time Share sales pitch is presented to you upon arrival. The check-in attendant sends you across the desk to pick up your "parking pass" -which is really their opportunity to "invite" you to the time share tour. They mask it as a complimentary "warm breakfast" tomorrow morning. Don't fall for it, please. Unless you actually WANT a time share. After traveling all day with an exhausted family and a wet baby waiting in the car, I told the woman to "STOP, STOP, STOP", "Please don't waste another second, I am completely NOT interested in anyway." (yes, I was a little rude, but it got me out of there quickly) Plus, there's a million people selling off their time shares. If you really want one, buy it resale and save a fortune. 3) Crib, Pack & Play is an extra cost. $7 per day, or $30 a week + tax. If I had known this ahead of time, I probably would not have picked this location. 4) The Resort has TONS of Activities they don't advertise on their website. Upon arrival, I learned about Movie Night, Kids Kamp, Daily Bingo, Family games. Unfortunately we did not get a chance to enjoy these because all the activities were scheduled when I had planned for something else. I'm a MOM, and MOMS plan vacations. PLANNING in advance is what moms do. If I had known about MOVIE night in advance, we would have done that. If I had known about the KIDS KAMP on Tuesdays and other activities. We wouldn't have spent $350 on a theme park for that day. IMO, they should list that on their website so visitors can plan to enjoy those things. 5) Smoking is allowed on your private balcony / porch. You may not be a smoker, but my husband is still a smoker. Obviously nobody smokes indoors anymore, but vacationers want a place to smoke outside that is comfortable. This resort doesn't force you to exit the building and walk 30 feet away where people gawk or give you a disgusting look. You can comfortably smoke on your private balcony without bothering anyone. That was nice. 6) Paddle boats, mini golf, fishing are extra cost. $25 per day with a family harbor pass or $50 for a full week. We got a 1 day pass and enjoyed the resort. The next day while visiting the playground, the person at the mini golf gave us a free game so we left a nice tip in the tip jar. 7) There's an internet charge per day or per week + tax. We didn't bring our laptop on this visit so it wasn't an issue. But, if you do bring a laptop the Wi-Fi is about $8 a day. Other things to know before you go: You'll need to make your own bed here, but you won't be bothered by a daily maid which was great and very relaxing. The jacuzzi splashes a lot. It was too cold to enjoy the pools, so the kids appreciated their own little water park tub. The full kitchen has everything you need for making meals. The nearby Publix & Super Target are overpriced, but I wasn't going to waste a day looking for cheaper markets. This resort is the farthest away from the Universal area or International drive. Only about 10 minutes from Disney entrance. This resort is located on the farthest side of Westbound 192 in a different county. Expect to drive a lot. If you don't have a rental car you don't want to stay here. The employees give you lots of privacy & are very helpful. Just stay away from the guest relations desk to avoid the time share sales pitch. We enjoyed our weekly stay here and hope you'll enjoy your stay too. Hopefully my review will give you more info you can't find on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not what we had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMamaMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the resort are nice and it does have some nice ammenties for families. The 6 seater bikes were really fun for the kids and the kids pool was pretty cool but not heated. Unfortunately the units are really in need of a good remodel and update. After our 2nd night of hardly any sleep we headed to Target for some pillows to help out in the very hard flat bed. We called the front desk right away and requested pillows but they were only allowed to deliver two extra pillows for a two bedroom unit. The resort was advertised as having flat screen T.V.'s in all the bedrooms and that was false. When I asked about this I was simply told that they cannot guarantee the unit and ours did not have a T.V. in the 2nd bedroom. We were not spending our entire vacation at The Liki Tike Village and we were glad to move when we did but it did meet our needs and that of the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice kid friendly vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: TLNMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 2 bedroom, kids ages 8 & 5 loved the waterpark. Looked like they were remodeling the older units near the waterpark. Had a wonderful time, kids didn't want to leave. Going again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “This is what I traded my timeshare for?? Are you kidding?”
Reviews.Author: chougrayson
Reviews.Content: Brutal. I stayed at Westgate last time - way better. Why? We were in 911 E. When I checked in, a "Trainee" checked me in and he actually asked my husband, "is she always like this?" just because I asked (o.k. repetitively) for an updated room. I read reviews and knew I didn't want an old style suite. Well, they didn't give me a refurbished one. The couch sucked big time, after a loooong day at the Parks, you want to watch t.v. comfortably. The couch and 2 bamboo chairs were so uncomfortable. I had to call Guest Services about 7 times to get stuff for our suite that was supposed to be in there -either it wasn't or it was broken. They were very good that way, but that's about it. The pool - the ones for the kids - had no heater! The lifeguards were saying it was broken for 2 or 3 days, but people who had been staying there for 2 weeks said it was broken back then. It was brutal cold! Noise! Tons, the upstairs and room beside ours? We could clearly hear them. Fitness center? NOT! 2 treadmills that squeak like crazy and a broken "in repair" nautilus maching. I didn't get to work out for the 7 days. You have to pay for EVERYTHING - including internet, balls, bingo, etc. We had a room that faced the pool - but the view was of the back of this hideous old stage type of thing that was all rusted up. Westgate has nice screened in porces. Honestly, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the 1 bedroom units.....outdated and run down.”
Reviews.Author: chicagodave15
Reviews.Content: Right when we walked in the unit, we wanted to walk out. Our unit smelled like mildew, the carpet and couch were stained, bathtub was dirty, toaster was filthy, and the room just looked like it had never been maintained at all. We asked about switching rooms, and the front desk said they were totally booked. We had pre-paid for the room for a week, so we were stuck with it. How bad was it? We paid for 7 nights.......we left after 3. Also, the wi-fi is not free, but that did not matter because the signal didn't seem to reach our unit. The resort does have some good points: nice water park pool with slides, bar at pool area with NFL package, mini golf, paddle boats, playground, lots of stuff for kids to do. From other reviews I have read, believe that some of the rooms must be nice. If you get a good room, it could be a nice place to stay. But beware........some rooms at this resort are not good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort for families with children”
Reviews.Author: alicatDorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki resort from 17th -26thDecember and we loved it. We have two boys aged 10 and 13 and they really enjoyed all the activities on offer which are free with a Resort Pass card which you are given when you check in. The water park pool kept them busy for a morning but it was a little cold the second time they tried it. They preferred the main pool with the hot tub as it was warmer and the older kids tended to hang out there. There are so many activities for sporty children to get involved in, e.g. paddle boats, mini golf, bikes, tennis, basketball. They really enjoyed the basketball and often got involved in games with other children. The 2 bedroom apartment was ideal. It was spacious, clean and well equipped. The main bedroom had a kingsize bed and a wonderful spa bath. The boys room had plenty of space and they had their own TV. The kitchen had a large fridge, microwave, hob and an oven big enough to cook the christmas turkey. There was a slight lack of kitchen equipement but enough to get by with a bit of improvisation! The washing machine and tumble dryer were really useful too. We got a good rate from Travel Republic, but watch out because if you contact the resort direct you get a much higher rate. The resort is in Kissimmee and there are supermarkets, restaurants, golf courses nearby but you do need a car as everything is driving distance away. It is about a 10 min drive to Disney and 20 to universal. The staff were generally helpful, but there was a bit of a hard sell on check in to attend a 'free' breakfast to hear about timeshare. After a long flight we were not really wanting to hear about this, we just wanted the room keys. There is wi fi available but you have to pay for it and it did not work very well the week we were there. Overall I would recommend this resort to families who want plenty of space at a good price and with lots of activities for children available on site

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: collegegirl49
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view. Great Staff. Beautiful Pool. Lots to do. Spacious Rooms. WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Tots - Not for Teens”
Reviews.Author: rjandmj
Reviews.Content: We made a return trip to Orlando as wanted to take advantage of our annual pass to SeaWorld. We thought we would try staying on the far end of the Kississimee strip and found this to be the VERY far end; so far that there are no sidewalks along the streets which was disappointing as I like a morning run. The resort itself would be perfect for a family with toddlers. The "waterpark" is quite entertaining and ideally designed for the little ones. I must say I was very impressed with the lifeguards who kept a close watch on everyone. The only drawback is that this pool is right near the restaurant so you would continually hear the loudspeaker blaring out that someone's order was ready. We were pleased to find 2 other pools which were much less populated. The one had piped in music and the other was a small pool near the workout room. The workout facility was quite disappointing but had no problem getting in as very few people seemed to take advantage of it. The breakfast is somewhat embarrassing and I do not know why they waste their time with it. I would suggest an ice cream social or some other such activity and skip the mini bagels and granola bars. The elderly folk seemed to appreciate the instant oatmeal! We stayed in the 1400 building which had been refurbished. It had the granite countertops which everyone seems to sing about. The beds were comfortable and the screened porch overlooked the neighboring resort which was fine by us. No complaints with regard to the unit itself. We are Interval members and the facility seemed similar to others we had stayed at in the Orlando area, most recently Star Island just up the road. Basically the resort serves as a good resting spot if you have sites you are trying to take in. The staff is pleasant, the resort is a bit tired but it is clear that they are making an effort to update the facility. I would recommend it to families with small children but think others could probably find better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYlovesStlucia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the liki tiki village back in feburary with our 3 young children. We highly recommend the 2 bedroom townhouse style. We had plenty of room and overlooked the pool. The waterpark was great and a hit with the whole family. The rooms were clean, had a full kitchen which we cooked most of our meals to save money and a washer and dryer which was a great bonus. We would recommend buying your groceries far away from the tourist area because the grocery store closest to the resort was EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE!!!! Overall, I look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Love Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: BertieMark
Reviews.Content: We have done all of the time share places - most are very high pressure, but not Liki Tiki - we had pretty much been turned off to time share by the others, but what a pleasant surprise - so much so that we bought about 8 years ago. We had an every other year plan and this time we went ahead and took the plunge - our upgrade to every year (new points system is awesome) went off without a hitch. Now on to the facilities - we love SHipwreck Sally's - we really enjoy the lagoon pool area and the activites for the kiddies are perfect for our grandchildren (8 & 9 years) - my borther in law took advantage of the fishing - the wife and I enjoyed the spa in room - we love it so much we are all coming back Thanksgiving week 2009

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Trevupfold
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in the Liki-Tiki, the apartments are clean, comfortable and well stocked with any item you may need from pillows to ice-maker, we used the liki tiki as our base both years and will definitely stay here again. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the service is first class, for example I phoned reception to report a fault on our oven, the engineer who called within 15mins could not fix it, but within 1hr we had a complete new oven. It is secure with a manned gated entrance and the facilities are excellent although we did not use them. Why stay in a motel room when for a little extra you can have seperate bedroom with TV, Fully equipped kitchen, lounge area and bathroom with shower and spa bath.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Liki Tiki- will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kktracy
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous staying here after reading some bad reviews. But a 3 bedroom for the 7 of us at this price was nowhere else to be found...so we went. And...we love the Liki Tiki! Our kids (ages 5 to 11) had a blast at the water park, as well as all the wonderful activities they had planned each day at the pool area. The lagoon attractions were fun as well, such as mini-golf, paddle boats, etc.. We probably could've stayed here all week with no complaints from the kids and saved a lot of money at the parks. The food at Shipwreck Sally's was great and reasonably priced as well. The unit (our 3 bedroom was a 2br/1br adjoining) was very nice, spacious. We had no problems, and the people at the front lobby were very accomodating. We will def. stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: p321rich
Reviews.Content: First off, I have been a time share owner at Liki Tiki Village since 1988, I just got back last saturday from spending a week there, we had a great time as alway's, the villa we stayed in was 301b, it is two floors, two bedrooms and a bathroom upstairs and downstairs it has a living room, eat in kitchen, bathroom and a screened in porch, the complex has three pools including a small water park that my nine year old son loves, it has miniture golf, fishing, paddle boats, tennis, basketball, bicycles and a playground area for the young kids, we enjoyed our stay there, I highly recommend Liki Tiki Village.

Reviews.Title: “we love liki tiki,loved karokee with james mitchell and the food is the best”
Reviews.Author: caliwoodw
Reviews.Content: love liki tiki--clean very--food is great and the karokee with james mitchell is the best of friday and sat. nights wish he was on wed. too ---i have bought there which, i have two weeks there--have had friends that bought there because of karokee with james mitchell--true--and the best steak dinner any where!! they are very friendly at liki tiki and have never had a problem with them!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: NmRecentguest
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was nice. The swim area was fun and had a lot to offer. The rooms were clean but daily maid service was an additional cost. I have read complaints about bugs - but I wouldn't blame them for that, there were screens where needed, there is just a lot of bugs in a humid environment. We got a week stay for a decent price, but the biggest issue is that they nickle and dime you for any other extras that most places (at least in the past) do not charge for.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend great family place to stay”
Reviews.Author: reliablemovers315
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki with two friends. My sister and her family stayed two doors down. We each rented the two bedroom condo. The rooms were VERY spacious. Fully equipped kitchen, washer dryer, sunk in tub. Normally we are cramped in a room with two double beds. This was a real pleasure. The rooms are very clean and well worth the money. It was a joy to use the washer and dryer. I actually came home with clean clothes! My family and my sisters family ended up skipping theme parks for two days just to hang out at the pool. The staff was super friendly always saying hello and asking if we needed anything. The pool side bar had reasonable drinks and good food. Our room was located second floor, our balcony overlooked a very large pond. Very nice sitting out there having a few drinks late at night when the kids were in bed. All the parks are about 10-20 miles a away, but it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle and prices. Rent a car and set the sights!

Reviews.Title: “on our way back”
Reviews.Author: sharkmossi
Reviews.Content: After visiting liki tiki last June , we had a wonderful time and cannot believe i am reading these reviews about the same place. Have no fear - the rooms are the most comfortable and spacious rooms i have stayed in. I accept that there are probably better places to stay but we paid £400 for 14 nights. We live in england and i could not stay in 1 room B & B in a town centre for that sort of money let alone a spacious appartment in liki tiki. All i can say is the people that slate liki tiki would be better suited spending £2000 and staying in a place which suits their style and expectations. The room we stayed in offered a large bedroom , on suite bathroom. A spacious kitchen. The lounge was more than enough. We saw this place as a place to sleep and when your spending every day at the theme parks , you just want somewhere to crash!! We are due to stay again next week and i for one cant wait. dont be scared off by these expentant, negative, people - just dont expect the ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable resort with appropriate amenities close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Bajan_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently in connection with my employment throughout the USA and the World. I stay in many types of hotels. We selected the facility because of its proximity to Disney World. We had never been to the area and had no idea what to expect for lodging. However, we were very impressed from the initial entrance to the facility until we departed to return home. We liked the facility so much that we wanted to spend one more day. In addition, we concluded that we could have spent the entire week just at the facility using the pool and other amenities and would have experienced a great vacation. The facility succeeds at giving the impression that one is indeed at a leisure resort. Upon entrance to the check-in area, I looked around and the atmosphere had an air of professionalism and also a sense of leisure. The desk attendant assisting us was in training but managed well to get us checked in. He performed as if following a checklist that made me felt as if management wanted guest to get all the necessary information required to have a great stay. Upon check-in completion, we met with a Concierge. The concierge provided valuable information about the facility, surrounding restaurants, saving coupons for dining, and suggestions for making the best of our time in the Orlando area. It is amazing how helpful this can be since one can never be over informed when visiting an area for the first time. We stayed in a townhouse or condo like building that was the initial building since the facility began operation. The building was a four townhouse complex building. Although the building was old, it was fully furnished, very clean, spacious, and adequate. We had a king size bed in the master suite and two full size beds in the other bedroom. The kitchen was a full sized kitchen and we prepared many meals with ease providing good meals and avoiding additional cost for dining out. The townhouse included cable television with many channels to include about three premium channels.
