The townhouse had a flat screen television and one other television that was an older type model television. We were next to the lagoon and the major water park area. We did not experience any unruly guests but liked that other guests were enjoying themselves and were very friendly. The facility was large but designed so that all amenities were within ten minutes or less walk. The hours of operation for the amenities were adequate. The townhouses are under renovation. Overall, my family and I liked the facility and plan to make it a yearly vacation location.

Reviews.Title: “LIKI TIKI OFFENSIVE & VILE”
Reviews.Author: SINY1031427
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!!!! I should have known at check-in when we were greeted by a very unpleasant front desk "staff" that had a very bad demeanor. They were wearing dirty uniforms and innapropriate language for a childrens resort. The front desk counter was extrememly high and unwelcoming as the staff could barely see over it to check us in....It was filthy and dreadful...It reminded us the movie "The shining". There were even holes in the wall. We looked at 3 rooms before giving in to just staying there as it was 10pm and the kids were exhausted. Each unit was so dreadful that they had given us that I almost cried because it was unconsonscionable to think that kids would have to sleep in that place. The cleanliness was severe and horrendous!!!!! The bathrooms were so FILTHY...not because I am so particuliar but there was dust and hair stuck to the floor and there was clearly dried urine on one of the toilet seats. The master bathroom had mold growing from the shower and when I asked to get house cleaning to come and take care of this dreadful situation I came to find that as soon as we turned the shower on we were standing in pieces of mold....I was going to vomit! The doors were so dusty that the air conditioner was moving the dust back and forth and that has to be a hazard to anyone with any sort of health condition...GROSS! Each and every unit that we saw had so much soiled and staining on the dining room chairs and couches that my children were not allowed to sit on them....#1 we had a fear of what the staining was and #2 we had a fear of ruining our clothes. The couches were so dirty that in one unit when we opened it up there was still food left in it from the previous guest. The coffee table was moved so we can open the bed and we found money and food and wrappers....clearly it was not vacuumed because the money would have been gone!!! My kids were required to wear shoes during our visit. Moving on to the bedrooms...the dust was so incredibly disgusting and the hair that was on my sheet (wavey and black) I have long and blonde hair really skeeved me out!!!!!!! My son slept on the couch bed and up until the last day I did not realize he was literally sleeping on a spring...poor baby! HORRIFYING ROOM!!! I almost forgot to mention that when we called for additional (white) towels they came with random hairs folded into it neatly in a plastic bag!!!! We should have ran but didn't! Moving on to the pool area....are you ready....STAY AWAY!!!! The tiki's are all missing the heads they have corroded off the tiki's and they are so neglected. The pool has sprinklers and they are all rusted....The concrete going into the pool was black.... two words...DIRTY & HEINOUS! There is only one place to get food during the day which is at the pool/bar area...soooo dirty and undesirable. The pool staff was so loud and obnoxious and the activities area for the kids was so filthy. My daughter got a cut at the pool area and we asked the lifeguard for a bandaid...guess what....YEP NO BANDAIDS!!! The management was so unhelpful but AGREED that it was a disgrace...big help that did for me while I am on vacation at their resort!!! The room was old and poorly maintained!!!! I thought it would be a nice experience to change resorts but NO THANK YOU....I am staying at the beautiful clean and welcoming VISTANA SHERATON RESORT FROM NOW ON. Oh I almost forgot the fitness center was a complete disaster...very old and dangerous machines...from the look of the resort I would not trust the ancient looking eliptical machine!!!!! We stayed away and out as much as we could due to the nature of the circumstances we did not have much of a choice. feel free to contact me if you have any questions. I stayed from 8-22 thru 8-29....

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki needs a Lick of Paint”
Reviews.Author: RogerBann
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki is 18 miles from upscale Winter Garden. In fact it is on the Western end of the 192, only 5 miles from Disney, close to the end of the 192 that is rapidly replacing the Kissimmee end of the 192 as the main tourist drag, so you are well located for family restaurants and tourist stuff. It is set back off the highway which makes it ideal in many ways. The hotel itself is an older apartment/resort hotel complex, probably dating from the early '90s, which has been taken over and renamed. Rooms are being modernized (they need it) so make sure you get a refurbished unit. We stayed in a 2 story apartment in block of 4 apartments. The rooms were large and the apartment well appointed, including the kitchen. You don't get daily maid service but it suits self catering vacationers. Each of these apartments has an outdoor screened patio. Unfortunately, many of the guests sit out on their patio way into the night, drinking and getting rowdy. It can be a bit intimidating with screen doors slamming and music into the early hours. The complimentary breakfast is a joke. You queue up in a line to receive a small donut or mini bagel doled out onto paper plates and help yourself to coffee and creamer. That's it. One or two steps up from a soup kitchen and the serving staff behave the same way. Avoid at all costs. The pool is nothing like it appears in the photos - it is crowded, noisy and a bit tired. Think Butlins, beer and chips (if you are British) - that's the pool, but then a good proportion of the guests are obviously happy with that kind of facility. The check-in staff were very courteous although you quickly get handed over to "Guest Services" who immediately try to sell you time share (the resort is now owned by a time share vacation company). The "welcome pack" consists of a few photocopy sheets of paper. Internet access costs you $30 for a week. Our advice: Use the Liki Tiki as an apartment hotel for its good location and forget the facilities. It's still good value. The new owners are slowly doing it up and it would be no surprise if the clientele gradually moves up market. In the meantime, if you don't mind a packed and noisy pool and mini bagels then you'll probably enjoy the Liki Tiki very much.

Reviews.Title: “Could not pay me to go back”
Reviews.Author: yankees0308
Reviews.Content: The beds are small, they say they are queen but they really are full, i took the measurments and measured my queen bed and didnt come close. Their is a flat screen in one room but if you want to relax in your bedroom there is an outdated tv in there. Then there are bugs in your room and the walls and connecting door are thin so you can hear everything in the room next store. The people next to us had three screaming kids and would blare the tv until 12am and managment wanted to charge me 65 dollars to move to a different location. The dryer took forever to dry, the bath tub jets didnt work all the time, managment takes forever to fix things or to respond to things. Very far away from disney unless you pay a 1.00 for the toll each time which still takes you 10 miles out of your way. I just wanted to get away for a vacation but this was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected it to be ::::::”
Reviews.Author: princeNewYork
Reviews.Content: once we got to the recpt area the carpet very very dirty no one to help us to our rooms 2brd not updated very old furniture no flat tv in rooms like they said 1200 building must be very old the pools omg dirty need to be clean my family and I very disapponted would not recommed this place to anyone .For being a resort it should be more updated and cleaner i would never ever go back,.......oh yea they have two huts for drinks but only one open with guest drinking beer next to the water parks everyday not good sign for young kids to see guest getting drunk.....they need to updated a lot of stuff i heard alot of guest very upset with this........sorry not for our family been to must better places my first and last time i would come to this pace,,,,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gtlmosher
Reviews.Content: We chose Liki Tiki because of its close proximity to Disney World. It is a quick drive to all the parks and to Downtown Disney. The resort is very nice with lush landscaping, clean pools, lots of activities free of charge (mini golf, peddle boats, etc.) and most importantly a small waterpark. The waterpark is staffed with several lifeguards and that is comforting with small children. The slides are geared more towards young children but it was fun for even the adults. I would highly recommend a villa on the second floor or higher. We had a 8" snake in our first floor villa and ended up getting moved to a 4th floor villa. The units vary from early 90's decor to brand new updated furnishings. The restuarant Shipwreck Sally's was fairly decent and not too overpriced. There were activities beginning at 10am each morning and they called your unit with a recording of the day's activities, which was very convenient. The villas were very clean and it was certainly nice to have a washer/dryer and full kitchen with two small children. I would recommend this resort to families who are looking for an affordable resort in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: cizquier00
Reviews.Content: My family and my friends were so happy with liki tiki village, we were in 302 B, the house was clean, and the bedrooms were perfect and the kitchen was very clean and with all necessary for cook. I love the laundry machine, and my kids like the swimming pool area. We received our room immediately when we arrived, and was really comfortable for two families. I really recommend, is really near to the Disney area and universal studios, the outdoor area was clean, and when we put the garbage out side, in 5 minutes the maintenance people pit up. Thanks, in the future we really recommend and come back. Thanks for all and for be the best place for good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: VacationMomma13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location several times. Most stays are great. The beds are consistently uncomfortable, but the space is awesome. We like the 2 bedroom condo for the space & fantastic tub. At this visit, the master bedroom bed had a stained comforter. The beds are made with two fitted sheets, so the one wrapped around the mattress comes off very easily-a real pain. Kitchen floor was dirty. Front desk service was a little slow due to them having to take phone calls and see people face to face. The continental breakfast was just that. Juice & Doughnuts. Even a little cereal would have been nice. The pool around the 600 building stays open till midnight, which is great...only people leave their kids there to scream at the top of their lungs. The Lagoon is fantastic. Kids and adults love it. The restaurant is okay. Fishing is only open from 11am-8pm, not so good for fishing in the heat of the day. Advertisements show bumper boats, which are no longer available. Playground is very nice. The grounds are cared for properly. Very fast response on requests. Gift shop is adequate for quick stops and Publix is right around the corner. Excellent location on the best side of 192. Alot easier to get onto the road and very close to shopping and parks.

Reviews.Title: “A few hiccups but overall good”
Reviews.Author: berlinfan82
Reviews.Content: My first thought was oh no here we go as check in took 25 minutes and I was the only one at the desk. My guy was having all kinds of problems finding our reservation then we found out our room wasn't ready and it was after 6 pm. He finally got us another 3 bedroom in the 1100 building. Please note a 3 bedroom is 2 and 1 with an adjoining inner door. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. If staying a while go buy automatic dishwashing powder and washing detergent. Kid play pool area is somewhat small but they will enjoy it and two other pools are open until midnight. No problems with the staff they were helpful and smiling. Only other problem were kids running wild at midnight making lots of noise the last night there. Overall a nice place to stay a little dated but kept up nicely. Probably better if you have smaller children and not older teens.

Reviews.Title: “Still great 2nd time around!”
Reviews.Author: aotni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki for a 2nd time this year, again for a week- husband and 2 kids, 8 and 10yrs. Got a room in a newer block again but it looks like some of the older blocks have been renovated as they have been repainted and there was a delivery of new matresses while we were there. It was just as good if not better than last year. The room was immaculate and had a lovely clean smell. Towels and even the kitchen rolls were arranged in fan shapes! Good facilities with full kitchen, washer, dryer. They even provide wash cloth, tea towel, a couple of sachets of coffee, 2/3 dishwasher sachets and washing soap. There were 8 bath towels, 4 hand towels and face cloths. Four of the bath towels are to be used for the pool (peach striped) and there is a charge if these are lost. Last year they provided towels at the pool but this works ok as there is a washing machine in each apartment. Staff are friendly. It is a resort which sells timeshares but we booked through alpha rooms (for about £300 for the week) and did not have to do the tour. It is offered but not under pressure. We chose not to both years with no problem. If you do it you can get free theme park tickets. Pool is great- slides for kids and lots of life guards. Very handy to Disney. We had also stayed at Disney and were able to get to the front gates of the park in the same time as leaving the Disney resort as we had a hire car at Liki Tiki rather than using the Disney bus (about 20 mins journey). There is a 7-11 just outside and a SuperWalmart on the 27 N about 5 mins drive away. There is a security gate and each guest is given a parking pass (free) so it feels safe. There is a free breakfast in the main building- juice, coffee and donuts but we just did our own thing. We did take some juice on the last morning and it was fresh not processed which was good. On the 192 it is convenient to I4, International drive and all the shopping malls without being in a really hectic area. Would recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sdoyle75
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2 night stay at Liki Tiki. We have stayed here before and will definitely stay again. The service was good, the room was good and the amenities were good. They are in the process of renovating the older buildings so those should be really nice when they are done. We stayed here for my son's 7th birthday. We also had an 8 yr old and 3 yr old. All of the kids had a great time. No need to ever leave the resort, everything you need is right there. Great resort for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ktsouth
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was nervous about our trip to Liki Tiki Village. We traded our timeshare through Interval International to stay here. When we arrived we were directed to a check in desk apparently for those who trade in. The people were friendly and helpful. Very smooth process. We were in the 1200 building. The room smelled of Lysol and seemed very clean. The cleaning materials smell was so strong we had to buy air fresheners. To me, this is a good thing! The only bugs we saw were outdoors. The beds were a little hard, but that would be my only complaint about the inside of the room. We had a one bedroom and had plenty of space (there were three of us). We had a great kitchen and Super Walmart is right up the road though I would not recommend going there on Sunday night! It was a zoo. No problems with our shower...we always had enough hot water. The pool with the waterslides is definitely worn and showing age. My only complaint was that the pool was dirty. There was algae growing on the bottom and no one could be bothered to skim the junk floating on top of the water. My husband almost asked if he could skim the pool! After our stay at Liki Tiki, we checked into a Disney resort hotel and the pool was immaculate. The day we checked in there, one of the lifeguards was cleaning the pool tile with a toothbrush! Also, if you work out, don't expect to find a good fitness center. They have one, but it is the size of a closet and the equipment was broken. Literally 5 people could fit into the space. That was a little disappointing. If it weren't for the dirty pool and poor fitness facility, I would have given Liki Tiki a better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, I would recommend to anyong with a family.”
Reviews.Author: kdfclewis
Reviews.Content: The service that Liki Tiki provided while we where on vacation in Florida was wonderful! We appreciated being able to checkin early and all the staff were very friendly and always asked if we needed anything and if we thought of anything we needed just to press "0" on our phones. Our boys loved the water park on site, it was a nice break from going to the parks for the kids. A very relaxing place to visit because it felt like a home away from home. It made you not want to leave the resort. Great place for kids for sure. The personnel at the front desk where extremely helpful with directions and advise on where to go for dinner and anything else we asked about. I would definely recomment this place to anyone with a family. It is located pretry close to Disney if you interested.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Floridabusybee
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of researching before deciding to book here, so I felt I generally knew what to expect. The resort is located off of the main road down a quite street. I was very pleased with the location. The welcome/check in area was nice. We were immediately greeted and offered a water and cookies. It was July 4th weekend, so the lobby was busy but we checked in quickly, Nancy at the counter was very nice. We stayed in a one bedroom in the 1300 building. We enjoyed the screened in balcony. The room was very clean. I actually enjoyed not being bothered with housekeeping. I had no problem washing my own clothes. The pool was nice, a lot of chlorine, but it was needed. There were a lot of people in the pool. We used the paddle boats and putt putt. The putt putt was very small and run down looking. Although I didn't eat at the on site restaurant, my relatives did and said it was very good. The prices were good, about $7-$10 for a meal. The fitness center was small, but did the job. We asked for an extra blanket at about 11 pm and security brought it right away. We called again because there was no remote for the bedroom tv, but we never received it, and all the rooms appeared to be adjoining and the doors are thin. I could hear the small children in the next room early in the morning. Guest services were helpful. They gave us locations and directions of different places to watch the fireworks. My family of 4 had no issues with our room but some of my family members and friends who also stayed here over the weekend (there were about 24 of us in different rooms and buildings) had some minor issues with their air conditioning and doors, but maintenance fixed them, although it took awhile. The kids had a blast. They really enjoyed the water park. I was able to lay out on the chairs the resort provided and see the kids at all times. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise Very Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: alinaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Liki Tiki for the week of the fourth of July and I must say it was absolutely fantastik! From the beginning to the end everything was perfect. Customer care was was very attentive and anything I needed they immediately assisted me. The waterpark was a wonderful experience for my two boys. My younger child is autistic and he just loved the water slides (my heart bubbled with joy to watch him laugh and smile each time he went down). My twelve year old loved playing water volleyball as well as engage in the various activities they had for kids (tattoo, face painting, watermellon eating contest). The rooms were also very accomodating and very spacious (we had the two bedroom) it has everything you need to feel comfortable and right at home , including a blender if you like to make your own mixed drinks! I will definitely return to Liki Tiki again! ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Great place Lots to do We all loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jefcape
Reviews.Content: My husband myself .two children age 12 & 20 Grandparents, brother & sister inlaw & some great friends stayed at Liki tiki. Grandparents first trip to Florida we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. We thought the people were very friendly and helpful. Place was clean and lots to do for all ages. Felt very safe and it was close to Disney, dinner theaters ect... Just say maybe 10 minute drive

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - loved the aquarium in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: family1078
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 19th to 26th. The weather was extremely hot, pools crowded, but the resort was great! My family loved greeting the large eel in the aquarium everyday at breakfast. He seems to have a personality! The 2 bedroom condo was super - air conditioning worked fine and more than kept up with the 100 degree temps each day. The screened in porch was nice, wish it had a ceiling fan. The elevator in building 1300 had a problem with the button for the 5th floor, it had to be pressed up to 10 times, until it would light (minor greivance). The guest relations helped us purchase Disney tickets, so we didn't have to bother at the parks. Breakfast of donuts and juice was highlight for our kids.(age 10 and 12 - preteen). My kids preferred the more relaxed pool by the front, instead of the water park, but we have great videos of them also enjoying the water slides. Less than 90 minutes to Tampa to enjoy the Phillies game. Would return again - thanks to the staff for helping me re-enter my room, when my kids locked me out, as we were going to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: HomeMomOf2
Reviews.Content: If you leave ANYTHING behind do not think you will get it back. Write it off because they do not really take things to "lost and found". They should just call it lost and gone forever. I contacted the hotel right away (the day we left) to let them know we DID leave something in the room. I left several messages and each time no help. My iem was worth over $100 and being a stay at home mom with 2 small kids, this is a lot of money to replace something. I just wanted my things returned and instead they were stolen by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a young family”
Reviews.Author: SuperPlanner98
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading the bad reviews. However, I found check-in simple and all of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. One night I hadn't requested the towel exchange and when I called to inquire about it, they said no problem and had new towels sent within 5 minutes. My kids, 7 and 12, loved the water park! We also loved the pool right by our condo - it was open til midnight! The condo was very clean and we loved having the washer/dryer in our room. The drive to the Disney parks was very simple and we loved being away from the Disney mania! Our only complaint was a wailing cat in the middle night, but I don't know how much you can hold the resort accountable for that.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Canadianmom2
Reviews.Content: We thought the Like Tiki was great. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to assist us whenever we had a question or concern. Pools were great, especially the water park pool for the kids - We never saw our 8 year old and his friend and the 5 & 6 year olds loved it too. We loved that the bar and restaurant were right there for our days off from Disney (parks nice and close), and the food at Ship Wreck Sally's was super. Rooms were awesome - spacious and had everything you needed including laundry so we went home with clean clothes!!

Reviews.Title: “was good for the $$”
Reviews.Author: MidwestJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to purchased a time-share week from my aunt/uncle. Check -in was mildly slow, but we were probably there at prime-time around 3:45 on Sunday. We stayed in the 1300 building. Room was very big, clean, loved the master suite with large king-size bed and huge jacuzzi tub that we all enjoyed. It was great to have a kitchen and washer/dryer. Was near Disney, a bit more of a drive to Universal and Sea world, but stil convenient. Lagoon pool is large, crowded this time of year but to be expected. Bar at the pool actuallly had some pretty good food, salads and pizza were good and reasonable price. Our building was all-in-all quite, although you can hear your neighbors through the adjoining door. I would ask for a condo with no adjoining door. Down sides were I didn't find the staff particularly helpful. Examples such as asked front gate attendant if there was a place to mail Father's Day cards on property and he said "no". Proceded to main check-in lobby and found stamp machine and mailbox. Also called and asked where fitness room was, was told it was in building of main check-in lobby, when it is actually in the pool building near the front entrance (nothing to brag about, 2 treadmills, bike, elliptical, old school weight machine I couldn't figure out, no free-weights). It stormed alot in the evenings when we were there, and alot of debris got in the pool as expected. I felt like they could've done a better job cleaning out the pools, but I think they were just waiting for the filters to do their job. I never saw anyone with a net cleaning. Pool chemistry seemed good. Also, our master bath smelled like marijuana on a daily basis, obviously some others were embibing that shared our ventilation, suppose to be non-smoking. There is no maid service for week , which would have been nice once or twice for the week. You basically just have to tidy up after yourself just like at home. All in all good place for the price, I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service-nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcdefgNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I thought my room in the 1200 building was beautiful. It was spacious and appeared to be clean. The front desk provided refills on laundry soap, dish soap and garbage bags throughout the week. There were plenty of dishes and cookware for us to use daily. My only complaints about the room (which was very clean and smelled good) is that the tile floor kept turning my feet/socks black (even after I mopped it twice) and there was no mid-week maid service. I would suggest using a steamer for the floor or possibly a stronger cleaner and make sure it is rinsed properly-sometimes residue from cleaners can cause this too. There is a complimentary continental breakfast M-F consisting of mini bagels and donuts, coffee, juice or soft drinks. The pools are nice although they could be skimmed more-there are a lot of beetles and love bugs in Florida that end up drowning in the pool (my son caught over 30 in the pool). There are fun activities pool side at the lagoon pool. The hot tub was a little too hot and honestly needs to be emptied daily-people don't remove sunscreens and lotions prior to going in which makes the water cloudy. I was never bothered about a timeshare purchase and was pleased with the excellent customer service and hospitality from the front desk. My friends also stayed with us in a room down the hall. Their room had a strong odor of curry (from previous guests). They came in and sprayed their room and removed the extra bedding form the closet and replaced it with fresh pillows, sheets and blankets. They even called to follow up and make sure that everything was fine. When they asked for the room to be sprayed again, a team came up to address the problem. The gentleman at the guest services desk was so helpful when I needed to find a local pharmacy to get a prescription filled. I would return to the Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: BettyOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the Liki Tiki and I must say I was wonderfully surprised. The facility is a family oriented resort/water park. Although, it was only me and my husband we enjoyed the water park while we were there. We played water volleyball with almost daily. We had a beautiful spacious colorful one bedroom unit in bldg 400 which included a king size bed and 2 seater jacuzzi tub. My only complaint was that it didn't have the flat screen TV's. But I soon got over that small problem and focused on the privacy of the location after spending a day at the lagoon (water park). Our bldg had a beautiful view of the pool and we would go and sit and talk with the older adults in the hot tub, go swimming again and relax on the chaise lounges until closing (12 midnight). The area made you feel like you were in the tropics. We are II owners/exchangers and normally you would have to attend a 90 minute presentation exchanging into other resorts, although you already own at another resort. Not at this resort. We were told about their presentation but were not force to attend. There were no gimmicks to get you in to sell their resort. Either you loved the place and wanted to buy into or you would be a frequent guest or exchanger. I loved that part. I won't name the other resorts we stayed in while visiting Orlando, but they are very plush resorts with good amenities but the pressure of the sales drives you away. But they were booked. At first I was a little nervous but after visiting Liki Tiki Resort, those properties will have to do a lot more to get our business after visiting Liki Tiki Resort. The staff were very friendly and accommodating to all our needs. The staff at Skally's restaurant were awesome too. Kudos to Sarah, who made you feel like family, she would remember your room number, who was in your party and your name. This woman was great. The food was awesome and they gave you plenty of it. There was a staff woman who was solely in charge the life guards and looking at the weather reports for the safety of the guests while being in the lagoon, I have to give her kudos as well, she was on top of her game. The life guards were on top of their game and made sure that everyone was safe while enjoying themselves. We have visited and cruised a lot of places and when we returned home, we feel a need to take another vacation for the vacation. I can honestly tell you that I feel so relaxed and ready to get back into reality now. I feel great!!!!! Thanks to everyone at Liki Tiki including security team, maintenance and housekeeping staff for making this a relaxing and enjoyable stay. GG (Cincinnati, OH) (also known as BettyOH)

Reviews.Title: “I've never had the experience of being somewhere that was like home!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diana64
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many places but the way I felt in Liki Tiki even surprised myself. From the staff to the cleanliness of the rooms where unbelievable. The staff were able to answer your questions and would be at your door with a moments notice. The grounds were very clean and well kept. I've been to Hawaii and it really had that kind of presentation. I would without a doubt return if I was to go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Great value”
Reviews.Author: dickaub
Reviews.Content: Everthing about the Liki Tiki was fantastic. the apartment and the grounds were immaculate. The kids loved the pool with the water slides and the adult pool was large and very comfortable. Only a 10 minute drive to Disney. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in the Disney Area !!!”
Reviews.Author: gnsednie
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was friendly,outgoing, helpful & polite. The room was clean, spacious, & beautifully decorated. My children (5 & 7) loved the water park they had. Plenty of amenities for everyone. Can't say enough. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Value at the right price”
Reviews.Author: tonyruthm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at liki tiki for a week in may and found this place to be of value. The room we had was a one bedroom in the 400 building. It was large and comfortable with a king size bed and a jacuzzi. The room did show some signs of ware but It didn't detract from our enjoyment. The pools were fun and the hot tubs were hot. The front desk staff were very nice especially Theresa who treated us like family! All other staff we encountered were very cordial. I found this place to be a good value because we only paid $59 a night ! you can't get a cheap hotel for that never mind a mini apartment like we had. Make sure when you make your reservations that you have them include a harbour pass or you will pay extra for things like bike rentals and mini golf. Also beware that things that are mentioned in there brochure for spring of 2009 like bumper boats , wave pool, and volley ball do not exist and have not existed for some time. ( the staff had never even heard of these things). All in all I would return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “The kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: orangeorangepurple
Reviews.Content: *Make sure you have quarters for the toll road. We were never told to have change and we were traveling at midnight with 2 young children so it became quite a scramble. *The kids loved the pool and the whole set up was wonderful. *If you have small children make sure your room is away from people that want to stay up all night and party. Also, make sure you are not next to an "adjoining room" as it sounds like the people are in your living quarters with you. *Having a room right next to the stairs is convenient, but it is loud and echos when people come and go at night. *You bring your own trash to the dumpster. *We did find 2 big bugs scurrying on the kitchen floor on 2 different nights...pretty yucky. *There is a small store on sight which is nice for the usual things you might forget to buy and they have some souveniors. *The staff are great and only announce the time-share opportunity just once to you and they never bother you again about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing negative about this stay!”
Reviews.Author: VacationLover26
Reviews.Content: Like many others, after reading multiple negative reviews, I was very nervous about my pending pre-paid stay at Liki Tiki. Thankfully I had nothing to be concerned about. This is a wonderful property for families. The service was great. (Theresa at check-in was so warm and attentive to all guests she interacted with, including myself) The pools, grounds, activities, restaurant, location to Disney parks and cost make this property a winner. It's not a 5-star resort, but you are not paying 5-star rates.To quote my 6 yr old "Mom, they should have a sign that says 'Best Hotel in the World'at the front desk." That says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki was a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ella003
Reviews.Content: We arrived for the last week of April into the first week of May 2009. Our arrival was very late at night and staff was pleasant and helpful. Liki Tiki is a beautiful resort. All staff were friendly. They did not push a "time share presentation" and we politely declined the offer. The pools were spacious and clean. The kids had a great time. It was close to everything Disney. We had a 2 bedroom which was large and clean with no noise in the 1100 building. The food at the bar and grill was good. I would definitely recommend Liki Tiki and would happily come again.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxer09
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried after reading all the bad reviews. When I went to check in everything was fine until I asked about the bumper boats and mini golf. They informed me that all of those amenities were extra, WHAT, I only called the resort twice to ask about that and any extra fees!!! Each time I was told everything is included in the price of the room. WRONG. I think they wanted $75.00 for the week to use anything extra. The bumper boats were out of the pond. The main thing my kids were excited about. The pool was fine. Lifeguards did a great job. $8.00 for a pina colada with not much taste. The rooms were pretty good. Loved the screened in porch. Asked for a newer condo and was sooooooo happy I did. The older ones look pretty run down from the outside. Asked for a later check out on departure day and they could only give us until 11:00. No big deal right? We went back to our room at 10:30 to get ready and we were already locked out. Went to front office 2 times before we finally got a card that we could get into our room with. I will not return to this resort again. Orange Lake is way better. Should have stayed there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time at the Liki Tiki - WOWED the family:)”
Reviews.Author: jawga
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading reviews of this resort, however WE had a grand time!! Fantastic memories were made!! We did a timeshare exchange for a 3 BR. Check in was a breeze with a very pleasant, helpful attitude. Concierge needs some help - we knew more about area than they did:( We stayed in the 1300 bldg./5th floor in the back of complex. WONDERFUL - the unit was spacious, well equipped and very clean. Grounds are immaculate and well landscaped. Great amenities. Pool was a blast, with slides and waterpark setting. Fireworks from Magic Kingdom visible every night from our balcony!! Extremely convenient location. We celebrated my Dad's 85th birthday and WOWED my Aunts and Uncle!! We had a lunch party with 22 family and friends from the area in our unit -- more than enough room!! There are some older bungalow type units that do not look as nice as the high rise but do not know who gets these!! Before going, call and request a newer unit with a view!! I'd go back in a heartbeat!! Hope you have a GRAND time, also:)

Reviews.Title: “OKAY, be prepared to pay for all the "extras"”
Reviews.Author: KEEfolks
Reviews.Content: Internet is poor and you have to pay for it. Paying to use the phone is another cash grab. No mid week clean and towel refresh is poor service. Balls and games etc are pay for use our home resort is sign and go for these basics, don't return it you bought. Lifeguards are at times inattentive, one tossed a ball at a kids head. The 6 calls to book the Luau smells of desperation for my money. Kids water-park opens too late, earlier opening would be nice. We stayed in a new unit which was nice, but friends stayed in an older one that was very dated and tired. Can hear too much from the neighbors. Timeshare guy and gift is a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough”
Reviews.Author: beach1983
Reviews.Content: We came to Florida for 9 days and stayed 7 in Liki TIki. The hotel we stayed at before and after offered more services for no charge than Liki Tiki did. At check in we were given a voucher for a "free gift". Soon as we left the registration desk we were ushered over to the welcome desk, or should I say Timeshare presales desk. We explained that we already own a unit somewhere else and were using an exchange to visit. They said if we came to a short presentation, we could get our Universal and IOA tickets at a great discount. We indicated we would be willing to go for the tickets, but we would not be buying, and they said they just wanted to show us other properties we could stay at. Well all they did was try and sell us another unit, and when we said we were not interested, the meeting went on for 2 and half hours. They keep trying to sell you packages at different rates, no matter how hard you tell them that your are not buying. I understand sales, and I know why people go, but when you tell them you are not interested and they keep at you, it gets a little annoying. The final comment from the sales person when we left was, " you guys look like you have money", was the most insulting thing I had ever heard while I was on vacation. Would never go back there again beacause of the comment. As far as the resort, we stayed in new section, the unit was nice, but under equipped with regards to dishes. We stay at many condos for skiing and they are much better equipped than Liki Tiki. The internet is terrible, when it works, and for $25 a week, it should be much better. I travel lots for buisness and free quality interenet is the norm. You can hear the people in other condos, and when we go skiing maid service in the middle of a 7 day stay is included. They come and change your towels and sheets, and do some light cleaning. The water park is ok, but the lifeguards need to focus on thier job, not chatting it up with the pretty girls. There are lots of small children in the pool, and I have been involved first hand with a child at the bottom of a pool when the lifeguards were too busy with each other than the pool. The female lifeguards were very attentive to there job, so its not all. The place was clean, but if you go, ask for newer section. All in all, you can find as good or better with more include than Liki Tiki, and stay away from welcome desk and free gift, unless you really want a timeshare. The sales pitch can ruin your whole vacation. Also it is a little far from attractions, so if you don't like 1/2 hr travel at begining and end of day, find someplace closer.

Reviews.Title: “A rough start, but overall a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: nymx5793
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki Village for 4 nights in April of 2009. The grounds were absolutely beautiful, and there were high and low points of the vacation. We traveled with 3 adults, 2 teens, and 1 kid. The Bad: Check-in was a disaster. We asked for adjoining rooms, they placed us on opposite sides of the property. We had two rooms because one member of the party was a time share owner so we ended up being put on the other side of the resort. Eventually they put is in the same building, right down the hall from each other. So after the long check-in, we went over to the welcome desk/resort service to ask a question. I asked if they knew of anything to do on a rainy day (it was pouring the day we arrived and we wanted to kill time with something.) Their answer: "No." On Disney property they would bend over backwards for you if you asked this. Here, not so much. Another issue was with the phone in one of our rooms. It could make calls, but not receive. So we went down and they said it was a computerized error and that they would have someone fix it. We went down numerous times and when we left, the phone was never fixed. The Good: The grounds were beautiful. We stayed in Room 700, not far from the main building and our balcony had a PERFECT view of the lake/beachfront, and the pool/lagoon! It was awesome! On the balcony was a table and chairs. We had a one bedroom. The one bedroom had a bedroom, kitchenette complete with dishwasher and large fridge, kitchen table in living room, pullout couch to sleep on, two chairs in living room, and flatscreen tv. Also a washer and dryer in room. The pool was also very nice. The lagoon was fun with some slides and water spewing fountains, and the main pool was also nice. The outdoor restaurant/poolside bar was good. We ate for dinner one night, very good food. They print your airline boarding passes up to 24 hours upon request. We were very happy they did this. Place to eat: On the main road we ate at a Denny's, which was good, Shoney's Buffety, EXCELLENT FOOD HERE, Cracker Barrel, and Cici's Pizza. (These are the places we ate offsite.) The resort is within 5 minutes of most of these places. Also a Publix and a 7/11 2 minutes away. A Super Target was also 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, many features not available”
Reviews.Author: kcgrefka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and landscaping welcomed us as we arrived. While checking in I saw the first of several cats scamper across the doorway of the reservation center. I laughed to myself as I thought of the reviews that I read before traveling. There were several locations where plates of food were put out for the cats. No one seemed bothered by them at all. They keep to themselves. There was an interesting picture in our condo entitled Heminway House which pictured several cats near the key west style villas much like those at the resort. Perhaps the cats were intentionally brought onto the grounds? Our unit was perfect except for the dirty carpet. It was vacuumed but needed to be steam cleaned. We had to wear and change socks frequently. The balcony patio was cleaner than our floor. My husband suggested I vacuum and mop when we arrived. Yea right, anyways... We were here 4 years ago and had the same issue so I came prepared. Next we tried to utilize the fitness center. We were told where it was located and how to get in. We tried and couldn't. We called down to verify the location. Talked to someone different they told us where it was located and how to get in. We tried again and no luck. We called again told them we couldn't get in. They asked soemone and they said that it was closed and would not reopen for the entire day and they were not sure when it would open. We utilized the pool and hot tub. It was nice, the bathroom was clean and the temperature was perfect. They have grills available for guest use in this area which is awesome. While coming back from the pool our key was somehow demagnetized. Myself and my kids treked back to the reservation center in our swimgear to get a new key. While there we were caught in terrential rain. It was not going to let up. The customer service rep who helped us with our key offered to take us in a golf cart back to our room but warned it was going to be wet. We had our suits on, no matter to us. But he got soaked. Both guys at the counter were so great. The other prrovided us with enough towels to keep dry from head to toe during our ride, I felt bad for our driver, he had to go back to work, soaked. If it weren't for him I'm sure my kids would have gotten sick. The golf cart ride through the huge puddles of rain were the highlight of my kids rainy day. On Thursday we tried to use the water park for the first time. When we arrived there was a note that said it closed at 5:30 for an event (a "for pay" event). My kids were disappointed but had fun on the awesome play structure and swings instead. The next day we used the water park, which is open from 10 am - dusk. I was disappointed when I found there were no slides for younger kids (a 5 year old and 3 year old). The slides they have there you must be 48 inches. The kids also better be able to swim because it lets them out in every bit of 3 1/2 foot deep water. This is not a wimpy water park. The twisty tube slide was used predominantly by teenagers and adults, and they were quite enjoying it. The water volcano was neat, but again in the deep water wear my kids would not venture. My kids did not like the mushroom waterfall or sprayer, which were the only features in the shallow water, because the water was too hard. The bumper boats were not working while we were there. Perhaps they only work during the warmer season? The associate did seem hesitant enough to ask another person when she told me they were not running, She suggested the paddle boats instead. There were no bugs except for the flying variety that came in because of the lights right outside the door and oen came off the luggage cart into our unit. All in all a good trip, if you take it for what it is and not what is advertised. I would return again when both of my kids are over 48 inches tall.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: loneymeat
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Liki Tiki for vaction for 5 nights. we had the 2 bedroom condo. Place was a little dated but all in all the kids had fun at the water park. You may have to pay extra for other resort activities so ask at check in. It is a nice place to stay if you going to parks all day long. It is on a main strip and easy access to stores. The Lobby was small and dated. The condo we had was on the older side of the resort. The master had a regular size tub not the spa tubs like the newer buildings have, so be clear on what you are getting, There was no TV in the second bedroom so the kids had to share the tv downstairs in the living area. The kitchen was fully equipped and there was a small washer/ dryer unit in our condo. There is also more that one pool so if you don't want to hang out at the water park with the kids you can head to another area. The water park was a bit crowded and if you have little kids I would suggest you keep an eye on them. They did provide life gaurds. Furniture in the living area was basically wicker so be careful of no heavy duty use. Take your own towels to the water park, it may take a minute for them to clean and dry them for recycling. Our family has stayed at 5 star resorts and 1 star motels in orlando. This was not the worst or the best but it was very livable for an extended stay. Would stay again for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean Place.”
Reviews.Author: kylewda
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful and very clean. Close to all the attractions like Disney or Universal, but in a quiet area. Lots of restaurants near by to choose from. The kids loved the pools and the waterpark they have (which is included). Water was a little cold, but wasn't too bad. I would stay here again. We stayed in the two bedroom condo which was HUGE and very clean. It was nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki was a great”
Reviews.Author: kiki69Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki villiage was a blast for the kids. This is a family oriented resort. Lots of activities for the kids. I have three boys age 10 and the resort caters to families. The mini water park was terrific with several life guards on duty around the clock. Most resort the kids swim at there own risk. Great food and terrific drinks at the bar! All the pool area very clean staff very professional. The down side its about 7-10 miles away from the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “awsome”
Reviews.Author: iesuesalpal
Reviews.Content: we had a great time and the villa was beautiful. everything we needed and the service and employees were great.....will come again...we all loved it.....great place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here, or you will regret it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Specv1973
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say we are avid travelers and vacation at least three times or more or year. This place has PAY ONLY internet service that sucks worse than dial up when it does work at all, the people are extremely fake and rude that work and manage this place, and the pool area for "FAMILY'S" is not so family friendly nor are the people who attend this area. Case in point: Technically you can't save chairs poolside. OK. But we all know we have things that can't go in the water, like flip flops, shoes, sunglasses, towels, money, sunblock, whatever, So you put this stuff on a chair when you get there, because what else are you going to do with everything. There are no lockers and leaving everything in your room is not practical is it. So we do this and not even 5 minutes later we return from the water to sit down, and seven teenage girls and a mother of one of them I assume had dumped everything we had on the ground and moved the chairs. So, I said hey, why did you girls do this to our stuff and one of the says [--] You, and shut up, to me in front of my family and seven year old. The mom just says, hey watch your mouth and keeps reading her book. WHAT!!!! So I go tell a manager and she looks at me and says sorry you can't save chairs. That's it. WHAT!!!! ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME!!! I PAID 800 BUCKS TO STAY HERE FOR A WEEK AND THAT ALL YOU CAN DO IS QUOTE A POLICY LIKE A ROBOT TO ME. So I guess theses kids and there mom also dumped some other peoples stuff too and they were complaining to the same manager with the same responses. Needless to say, we will NEVER EVER be going back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: tdbeach
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews and don't understand why we really enjoyed this resort so much, but we really did. We were very pleased with everything we came across, clean, grounds well kept, spacious and comfortable rooms. There was lots to do with the kids and everything was easy to get to and spread out well. The food at the Tiki Bar I can not recomend but we all had a great time at all the other amenities! We stayed for 3 nights and didn't leave the resort - only for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra for the 2 bedroom”
Reviews.Author: nickstang40
Reviews.Content: My family decided to meet at this condo I got a 1 bedroom for my wife and I and our two children, because the livingroom has a pull out and our youngest sleeps in a travel crib. My other family that I met there had a 2 bedroom, much nicer and bigger and had a big jetted tub compared to the small tub with jets in our room. This place is great for kids, but probably not for older teens, the water park is fairly small, but nice. My only real complaint s are that if you want maid service it costs like 29$ each time and when you run out of toilet paper, paper towels, dishsoap ect. you have to buy your own. I've stayed at cheaper hotels where they come everyday for free and replace all these items. Also you can hear through the walls pretty easily our daughter got woken by the neighbors early one morning. Overall a good stay just wish I had the 2 bedroom after seeing it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: KhakiPed
Reviews.Content: I purchased a time share at this resort in 1997. This is the first time that I stayed there because they gave me a special offer. Of course the property did not look the same as it did when I purchased it. They added many, many things to make it child friendly. When I purchased it I was a single woman. They put us in a condo unit that faced the putt putt golf. We stayed for 4 nights. We did not have hot water from day 1. We went and complained, and day 2 still did not have hot water. My husband phoned and spoke with the Property Supervisor, and he was told that they had done all that they could for us. By day 4 we still did not have hot water. After arriving home and unpacking my suitcase, I realized that I had left my prescription glasses and prescription sunglasses in the night stand. I phoned right away and I was told that these things had been located. I had to pay for 2nd day air shipping, and opened the box yesterday. Imagine my surprise when all I had was my prescription glasses, and my prescription sunglasses had been stolen. It cost me another $190.00 to replace them yesterday. Never again.......................

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, stupid guests!”
Reviews.Author: mwood1978
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at Liki Tiki March 13-16. After I booked, I read the "cockroach" reviews and decided, although I couldn't get my money back, there was no way I could expect my 3 children, 8,10,and 16 months to stay there. I booked less than 15 days prior to vacation, so the money was not refundable. I made a request to be in one of the newer condos, not because of roaches, but because I have a baby and COULD NOT have a two-story villa. We don't have stairs in our house, so the baby isn't used to them, and if we did, we would certainly use baby gates. Although we booked another hotel room, we figured we would check in at Liki Tiki and use the pedal boats and water park. So, here is what happened. First of all, we were supposed to check in on the 13 and didn't until the 14. We were told our room wasn't ready. I said, "Our room better be ready, we were supposed to check in yesterday!" The room ended up being ready. I would have bet my life on the fact that "We are very busy this week and are completely filled up, so all we have to offer is one of our two story townhouse villas. No, we don't have baby gates." I just rolled my eyes and thought, "It figures." So, we checked in and went to see our room. The townhouse was old, but it was nice and clean. The kitchen was very well stocked, even having infant plates and bowls. I paid extra to have a high chair, which wasn't in the room. I called the front desk to ask for the highchair, which was brought to us in about 30 minutes. The straps of the highchair were COVERED with food. It was so gross. I did my best to clean it, but food in fabric is hard to get rid of. I made my husband check the whole place for signs of bugs, which he didn't find. We got ready to go to use the waterpark and pedalbikes. We were not allowed to use the pedalbikes because we had sandals on. It was 80 degrees, what did they expect? But whatever, not really a big deal. We went to the waterpark instead, which was very crowded, but nice for the kids. I would definetely recommend that you stay away from the kiddie pool with the octopus. I stepped into it with the baby, and the water was SLIMY! There were about 50 toddlers in it, probably all peeing! It was disgusting. We just took him in the big pool with his float. On the way back from the pool, as we went through the gate, a little girl, no more than 6 or 7 at the most, exited the pool by herself. We stopped and looked around for her parents, who were nowhere to be seen. We stood there talking amongst ourselves, saying "Where is she going, is anyone looking for her?" She turned around and saw us looking at her and kept going. We watched her to see where she was going, and she walked a REALLY long way and went into one of the condos. We couldn't believe that someone would actually let this little girl wander by herself. Liki Tiki is a nice property, but not safe enough to let your little girl roam around by herself! We ended up staying at Liki Tiki for one night, which was fine. We didn't see any sign of bugs. After we checked out, who did we see? The little girl again wandering around by herself. I looked at my husband and shook my head. I just think people are stupid! So, that's it for my Liki Tiki review. Nothing good and nothing horrible. Just a hotel with a cool pool for the kids. But, if you want a great resort, try Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. THAT is a nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Nice Resort, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: thompmik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our 10 year. We traded our Breckenridge timeshare so we enede up in a three bedroom at Liki Tiki. While we had way more room than we could use I will say that our condo was very nice. All three bedrooms were nice and clean. The bathrooms were clean and bright. All appliances we tried worked. There was a nice big flat screen in the main living room. The balconies were large and screened in. One day we saw a cockroach, I called the front desk and the next morning an exterminator showed up and sprayed. We never saw another roach all week. The resorte was clean and nice. We sat around the kids pool most of the time since it was near our room and had the bar. We played volleyball and cooled off in that pool. It was never crowded. The drinks were priced OK for a resort and the food was good. Especially the pizza. We shopped at the grocerie store about 1/2 mile down hwy. 192 and ate most of our meals in the condo. One night we took a bus from the resort to a gambling cruise at Port Canavrial. The shuttle was supposed to launch and we were told this was a great way to see it. However, the launch was posponed so we played blackjack instead. All in all it was still a fun excursion. I have stayed at nicer places and much worse places. For us this resort lived up to any claims made on the website. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: wrbluewrx2004
Reviews.Content: After searching and looking at all the places that Interval International had to offer , my wife and i chose Liki Tiki resort. From the description it sounded and looked like a great resort. We gave this resort an average rating. Reason # 1 we requested a room by the pool and were told no problem. When we arrived they told us the could not place us in the building they said but would place us in a newer building. Reason # 2 the building was newer but the unit had stains on the rug, not a big deal seeing we would be going in and out anyways. Reason #3 the water pressure was horrible. The shower was like soft rain. We have had better pressure at a 3 star hotel. Reason #4 no free Wi-Fi. This is supposed to be a 5 star resort and it has no free Wi-fi . I called the front desk and asked why and they said they are looking into it. Our choices for the weak signal my Power book could find on the property were $9.95 for 24hours, or Dial up that they said would be 86 cents a minute. The other option they gave was 5.95 to connect in the lobby. This was just ridiculous. Reason #5 the walls seemed to be paper thin and were kept up all night by people going in and out of there rooms. On a brighter note the pool was clean and the water park feature was fun. Shipwreck Sallys Bar and resturant was great the food was good and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: keeperof4
Reviews.Content: Myself , my wife and 3 children stayed from February 22 til March 1st of 2009. I was actually terrified before I arrived because I payed upfront and had read some bad reviews. From the moment we arrived we were treated with the upmost respect and friendliness. I had requested a room in the newer building. Our checkin only took minutes. We stayed in a two bedroom unit which was absolutely spotless and very luxerious.. The pools and the waterpark although a little worn, were spotless except for a few leaves. The pools were extremely warm and the hottub was almost too hot, most relaxing. The staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. There was no hard sell , unlike a previous trip to another location down the road. In my opinion , the grounds crew worked extra hard to keep the location clean, and I was always greeted with a friendly wave and smile. There were on site gas barbeques that were kept absolutely spotless, and we made well use of. I guess my only complaint would be the one bedroom unit next to us had a connecting door. I felt obligated with a party of five to get a two bedroom unit, but the unit next to us at one point , I believe had 9 people staying in it (I am not a nosey person) . They were a little noisy at times. After 11pm the only noise that was heard was the security golf carts going by. Although there are some older buildings on site , while we were there, they were busy installing new furniture and it is quite obvious that their commitment to upgrade those buildings is of the utmost importance to them. I would highly recommend this location to anyone with small children , we loved it . I am sorry that some people did not have the experience we had, but perhaps if they try again they may have a better experience. I know we will be returning again to the Liki Tiki. Thank you all for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbrite3333
Reviews.Content: My husband found this resort through an exchange thing with is parents condo that they have. He booked it for our honeymoon. We arrived very late after driving 15 hours from Arkansas. The front desk were friendly and showed us how to get to our condo. It wasn't to hard to find. We got in and i thought it was cute. My husband had other thoughts. The bedrooom was nice, had a tv, a somewhat comfy bed a closet and a few lamps. The bathroom was big and it has to different entrances. It also had a washer and dryer in tia s well. The kitchen was stocked with everything we'd need to cook, like pans, dishes and things like that. The living room had a couch and chair and we also had a dining room table. There was a patio with a table and that was it.. .Our room was connected to another room with the ajoining door and the people got pretty loud and drunk a few nights. so that was a turn off. The water park was more for kids. Very small and there were so many wasps things around. We went and sat on their "beach" if you could call it that, but it was nice and peaceful. We did enjoy the hot tubs. They were so welcome after walking all day at the parks. The draw back was that they want you to go to the meeteing to try to get a timshare there. So we signed up because you got free tickets or cash just for doing it. So we get there and are waiting to get our name called and when it is, it's to tell us that we don't make enough money to even be considered to look at a condo. How lame is that! So we left and went to DisneyWorld. Other than that inicident, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, book it now....... I have (again) !!”
Reviews.Author: Woody2807
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but felt i had to, to help belance out the negative ones that Liki Tiki has attracted. We stay in a 2 bed condo which hads loads of room inc. 2 good size bedrooms, sitting room and diner, 2 bathrooms and a fullsize kitchen. The main bathroom had a jaccuzi tub and sperate shower. The kitchen had fullsize cooker, fridge and dishwasher. There's also a washer and dryer for your clothes. You can read in the brochures about the pools and paddle boats and bbqs etc that are there for your use so i'll not go into that. Most of the negative reviews I have read are from people who have swapped their (probably.. very expensive) timeshare to go here, and I can see why they were dissapointed as the timeshare resorts tend to sell you on the newer places which ARE fantastic but I have just booked 15 nights in a 1 bed condo at Liki Tiki for Oct 09 for...... wait for it ....... £491 yes £491 for 15 nights. THAT makes LIKI TIKI ........ ABSOLUTELYBL**DYAMAZING !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, great value”
Reviews.Author: sarn03
Reviews.Content: Took the kids for a quick winter getaway, to get away from the cold, snowy, icy weather we have been having. The Liki Tiki was awesome. I read several reviews before I booked. I am glad I didn't listen to the negatives people had about the place. The room was beautiful. The swimming lagoon the kids loved and all the activities they had for them. The other two pools, which they only swam in at night time were very nice as well. We didn't see any bugs in our rooms at all. Of course, when you are going to a warm location for vacation that is known for large bugs, such as cocroaches, and palemeto bugs you take that with a grain of salt. Everyone there was very respectful, I always treat people with respect and seem to get that in return. Even though they don't have maid service daily (as most time share places do not, unless you pay a fee for it)the washer and dryer worked wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jaejang25
Reviews.Content: No housekeeping, no linen change (unless u stay there for 2-weeks). First thing to welcome us to the room was a gigantic roach (my wife almost fainted). The door frame to the entrance to the room had cobwebs and spider eggs aIl over. Saw a lizard going up and down the stairs. Also, if you're doing disney, universal and seaworld, stay somewhere else. It's quite a trip to go back and forth. One more thing, you could hear everything from people next door. The partition of each room must be paper thin...so don't lean on the walls...you might fall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place-Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Mr2Day
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki during the week of 1/21-1/28/2009. I was a little leery about coming here from California, after reading all the negative reviews, after I booked. I was pleasantly surprised, however. The staff was very friendly and we got our 1 bedroom unit in the 1400 building. The grounds were very well kept and I hardly saw anyone around the complex. Our unit was very clean and well supplied with soap, towels, paper supplies, dishes, pots--you name it. It had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, 2 big screen tv's and a screened patio deck. The walls are paper thin, unfortunately. There is no maid service, unless you want to pay for it, so keep your unit clean. No free "wifi," but where I was, I could get free access from the resort next to us. There was coffee and donuts at the main pool, Monday-Friday. Overall security seemed good. Guard at the main gate, small safe in the unit. The complex is on the outskirts of town, so you will probably need a car. Disney World is about 6 miles away. It took us about 10 minutes to get there everyday. There are plenty of stores, places to eat along the way. Kennedy Space Center is about 45 min away and easy to get to, but I did not think it is worth the $38.00/person it costs to get in. Keep in mind, we were there during the "slow" season. No traffic jams, no waiting at Disney World, etc. Customers always get "better service" when things are slow. I did not see anyone using the pools at Liki Tiki. Temp was 80-85F during the day, most of the week, we were there. I'd probably think twice about coming here during the "busy" season. It's probably a zoo!! It's a hugh complex.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Firedigga001
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I spent 8 nights at Liki Tiki in December 2008. We had traded a week with Interval and booked and extra night ourselves due to travel plans. Friends of ours had recommended Liki Tiki. We were not disappointed! Booking the extra night was flawless and the staff made efforts to make sure we didn't have to switch rooms. We had some trouble initially with gaining access to the unit as there was obviously a problem with the security lock. We contacted the front desk and they had security come to our room, let us in and repaired the lock. No problem. Our room was big, clean and comfortable. The pool area was exceptional including the lifeguard staff on site who had clearly been very well trained. We have stayed at other timeshare type properties in the Orlando area in the past and found Liki Tiki near the top of the list. We will definitely stay at Liki Tiki again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: meredithj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I drove from NH to the Liki Tiki Village in Orlando July 2007. Our suite was huge! Had I known, I would have invited 6 of my friends to help us fill it up! It had two bedrooms (one master suite with jacuzzi), two bathrooms, washer/dryer, full kitchen, living room/dining room, balcony with jungle views. We actually brought a queen mattress out from the spare bedroom out onto the balcony and slept out there a few times (it is screened-in). It was very nice to fall asleep to the sound of crickets and frogs, and wake up to the sound of birds. Resort grounds are large- lots of walking to do. One restaurant by the "water park" (more just for little kids), which is okay, but we only ate there once (when we arrived, our room wasn't ready yet, so they gave us a $5 off coupon for the restaurant). Pools were great and located throughout the property, which was nice to have a change of scenery every once and a while. Continental breakfast was nice, donuts, bagels, coffee/tea and juice. Lobby was very nice, and staff were friendly. We spent most of our time at Disney World. I have lots of photos so please feel free to contact me if you have any other questions about Liki Tiki Village!

Reviews.Title: “liki tiki needs improvement!!!”
Reviews.Author: kjisales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at liki tiki on Aug, 2008. We are marriott vacation club owners so we got this through an exchange from interval international. Well I've learned my lesson next time I'll stick with my marriotts locations cause then I'll know for sure I'm getting something good. Not with this place I was so nervous after reading all the negative reviews on tripadvisor but I had already booked it. So I was just hoping for the best, I did call like four or five times to request a new unit wich we got but only after all that hastle. Overall our stay wasn't that bad to me, but my husband hated it. We had a new unit in bldg. 1300 on the second floor it was a two bedroom two bath villa they were 7 of us and there was enough room for all of us. Our villa was really nice so i was happy about that. We didn't have a nice view from our balcony just of woods and a really huge spider hanging on the outside of the screen, and i mean really huge spider so we didn't go out there that much. The only problem we had in our room was the really big roach we found in our master bedroom on our last night there. My husband was so discusted he called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager but they said he wasn't "available at the moment" so they took our info and said they would have him get back to us but he never did. The surroundings were ok, the "water park" area was not all that. The water was dirty, it was always very crowded all the time and it wasn't heated so it was really cold. I have a ten year old, a three year old and a teenage brother that was with us and none of them found the "water park" interesting. We spend most it the time in the adult pool. It was alot less crowded a warmer but it was a pretty long walk to get there and it wasn't that clean either. We didn't use any of the things they had like, bumper boat, tennis, baseket ball, bikes or fishing cause if your not an owner there then you have to pay for eveything. There is lots of restaurants and a publix really close by just a few minutes drive from the resort, and a supper walmart less than a five minute drive, and a 7-11 you can walk to just around the corner. So overall not a bad stay, just because we try to make the best of everything but I wouln't go back to liki tiki again. The whole trying to get a new unit hastle was to much of a pain in the butt for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dladygrand
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Liki Tiki 12/13 through 12/20. We had a great time. There were 10 of us and we had 2 condos that had 2 bedrooms each. The condos were both in the 800 building. Both were clean and well kept. The decor was definitely outdated but was in great shape and clean. No complaints there. The kids water park was really nice and had something for every age not just little kids. The water was warm and wonderful and there were lifeguards watching over the pools very diligently. While we were there my mother had some health issues. Normal check out was 10 o'clock but the staff told us if we needed more time to let my mother rest we could stay without charge until it was time to leave for the airport. They were so nice and were so genuinely concerned that they actually made me cry. All in all the place is great. There was an older section that may not have been as nice as the 800 building but I really don't know what those villas are like inside. Nevertheless I would highly recommend Liki Tiki. The location was great. (about 10 minutes from Disney) No high pressure sales pitches, clean rooms, great staff, nice pools, nice grounds. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: garyrogers_1
Reviews.Content: my family and i have just returned from our holiday at the liki tiki resort and loved everything about it the staff the facilities, it has to be the most friendly place we have been our appartment was very spacious ideal for four adults with everything you require to make your holiday comfortable.The sites facilities are exellent both for adults on their own or for families, my biggest praise has to be for the staff irelivent of their position within the resorts structure every one of them was always polite pleasant and always ready to help and not because they had to it was because they wanted to and i would recommend the resort to anyone. Gary south wales uk.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sdoyle75
Reviews.Content: I really didn't know what to expect after reading so many mixed reviews, but we had an excellent time. Check in took less than 5 minutes, our 2b/2b room in the 1100 building was perfect, the water park was so much fun for my kids (2 & 6yrs). All the staff that we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. I cannot rave enough about how great our stay was. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, loved the place”
Reviews.Author: grannyto7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at Liki Tiki & had a very nice time. I was very hesitant to do the exchange after reading previous reviews about the place. Well let's begin with the condo itself: We had a 2 bedroom unit in building 1300, it was very clean upon arrival, the beds were comfortable & everything was in excellent shape. There was more than enough room for the 6 of us, 4 adults & 2 children. The staff was helpful & cheerful at all times. The water park is very good for young children but would probably be a dissapointment for teenagers, however they do have 2 other pools. The little bar/restaurant in the lagoon area is very nice & the food was on par with bar food I have had at other places. We had lunch & a couple of drinks for 4 adults & 2 children & the bill was around $50 which I thought was average. I would definitely recommend Liki Tiki. The timeshare I own is just down highway 192 a little bit & that is what I used to exchange into Liki Tiki. I must say I was very happy with the exchange & would not hesitate to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad time”
Reviews.Author: dlg454
Reviews.Content: I went to Liki Tiki Village early this month for the second time and had a very bad experience. My first trip was great. I did not have any of the problems like I experienced on my second trip. Let me first say that the service of the employees was good. My problem was with the security and the cleanness of the room. My second night was Halloween night. At around 2:00 am, I was woken by a soft knock on the door followed by a harder knock. My girlfriend gets up thinking it was some one in our room who might of went out side and locked them selves out. As my girlfriend goes walking to the door, the door suddenly begins to open by a security guard from the out side. The security guard claims that he was following up on a report that some was screaming and slamming door. At this point we confirmed that every one was asleep and that the noise was not from our room. The security then just left. The next day, after parking the car, while walking to the room, my girlfriend see’s the security guard as he stairs at us as we walk back to our room. I Think the actions that the security guard did was inappropriate. He should have called the room first to see if everything was ok and then asked if some one could come by the room to verify.
