He also could of come by the room and just listened from the outside and see that the noise was not from my room. Not for nothing, but it was Halloween and they should of figured that kids would do jokes. I was very bothered by this because my girlfriend was not appropriately dressed when the security guard opened the door unannounced. My room had three children in the second bed room and this situation made it uneasy to sleep worrying that some one could just open the door at any time. When I was checking out, I told the manager in charged that morning what happened. He took my contact info down and said he will follow up on it and some one should get back to me. When I got back, I wrote a letter to the resort management about the situation. I get a response from the security manager thru an e-mail which states that he looked into the situation and finds in the records that some one requested a lock out. He states that’s when some gets locked out of there room. Nothing was mentioned about some one screaming or slamming doors. I called a number that he leaves, and he apologies about what happened and says he talked to all his security guards about there security policies. But seamed not to believe that the security did anything wrong since nothing was reported about screams or slamming doors. He also tells me that the person that I saw the next day could not be the same security guard because he was not working that day according to scheduling records. He feels that my girlfriend mistaken the security guard for some one else. I feel at this point that he is just covering up for his security guards. I feel it was the same person and maybe the name on the records was actually of another employee to cover up. My other problem was while in bed, I fund a roach on the beds back board followed by a second one on the night stand. Another was found in the bathroom my last night. If you decide to go, just be aware of your surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TiffyDoosMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day stay. It was our first time traveling with our new family addition (2yr old boy). My husband and I took him and our 11yr old daughter. We wanted a place that would give both children enough to do and we picked the right place! We did not do any of the Disney stuff. Mainly hung-out. Two bedroom was large, clean and nicely equipped. Several items were missing from the inventory sheet and I called the main desk and the items were sent up immediately. Check-in and out were quick and easy. Nice flat screen TV and comfy master bed. The kids LOVED the whirl-pool master bath and it was a great way for them to relax while I fixed supper. A Super Walmart is about 5 minutes away so save your money and skip Publix and the high priced gift shops. We did go to Green Meadows Farm which both kids loved. About 20 minutes away. Lots of hands on, hayride, pony ride and train ride , plus three pumpkins included in ticket price($19 for Fl residents & 2 and under free). We were there about 3 hours. This was our second trip to Liki Tiki. Both times I was concerned after reading some negative reviews but I am glad we went. Well worth what we paid ($94 per night). The water park is great for younger kids. Teens would find the water slides too small. Go ahead and book it and have a great time with your family. I did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lae1964
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 3 teenagers) stayed at Liki Tiki the week of October 4 - 11. Like some of the others I was a bit leary after reading some of the reviews BUT we had none of these problems. Our check in was a breeze, the staff were VERY friendly. When I told her I wasn't interested in a timeshare presentation I never heard another word about it. This was our first trip to Disney ever and our main use for the resort was sleeping there as we were gone to the parks most all the day. My kids did hit the hot tub and pools a couple times and the water park once. It was okay but not all that big. There wasn't much of a crowd there the day we went so it was good. It couldn't accomodate too many....One of my disappointments was the 'continental' breakfast which consisted of mini bagels and donuts and juice and that's it.....needless to say, we only did this one day. My MAIN disappointment was there was no free internet for you to use in the units. But this probably wouldn't be an issue with most and it wouldn't keep me from staying there again. Over all it was a great place to stay. We were in the newest building -1400 and everything was very clean, nice and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time but won't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: carraquenia
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Liki Tiki. I must admit that I would never stay there again because it appears to be a crap shoot. Here's how I got to stay in a beautiful condo. When I booked a year ago, I did so without reading the trip advisor ratings. I freaked when I saw the ratings, so I called the resort and asked to be guaranteed a stay in the new 1200 or 1300 towers. They told me to contact again closer to my arrival. I did so 6 months later. They still said it was too early to make any guantantees. Then I tried again three months, but I got the same answer. Then, two days before arrival, very worried that I would get a crappy old condo, I wrote and requested a newly renovated place. This time, I received a phone message saying that my request would be accomodated. I SAVED THE PHONE MESSAGE! When my fam and I arrived, they of course initially said that they could not honor the request, especially given that it was an Orbitz sale price. I kept saying, "Here, do you want to listen to the voice message I saved? Do you want to see my call log? YOu promised." Well, they not only booked me in a newly renovated condo, they also upgraded (I don't think they had any one bedrooms left). The condo was wonderful. Clean, huge, with a two person jacuzzi and walk in glass shower, a nice and new kitchen well stocked, a gorgeous open dining room. This was a place I would expect to pay 300-400 dollars for. My kids loved coming back from the parks and going to the little water park. Then we would have late night swims in the pool open until midnight. I really can';t say enough how much we enjoyed Liki Tiki. The thing is, I would never want to go through that process of fighting to stay in the newly renovated condos. What a bummer to have such extreme differences in the condos. And the management realizes this. As soon as I said, "Hey, look at my requests. I have been making them for a year because trip advisor comments show you guys to be so uneven," they knew I was onto their situation. Anyway, I would rent from them again in a heartbeat if I could ensure staying in a nice condo. Because of the risk I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: miamisiren
Reviews.Content: Me, hubby, baby and our friends stayed here sept. 26-28. We requested a newer building and were fortunate to get a 2 bedroom 2 bath room at the 1300 building(it's close to the lagoon waterpark). Our suite was perfect! Had pots, pans, utensils,etc. Even had a broom and vaccum-washer and dryer. We decided to book here because we were a party of 4 adults with 3 children and wanted spacious yet budget friendly accomodations. I was a tad nervous after reading the bad reviews-but the only gripe I had was we arrived in love bug season. PLEASE READ-AUGUST THRU SEPT. AND APRIL-MAY IS LOVE BUG SEASON IN THIS AREA-THEY ARE EVERYWHERE!!!!! When we went to the tiki bar for a drink, we had to cover them so the bugs wont get in. They resemble flies but don't bite-they just fly around mating like crazy-hence the name "love bugs". They were the only thing that put a damper to our stay. It's a pity, the weather was gorgeous, and the pool lokked fantastic. But me and my frien were busy running around trying to avoid these insects that are literally all over the place. Would stay here again but definately NOT during the months mentioned above...I guess that's why we got the cheap rates. PS-me hubby and baby slept in the master bedroom and the king sized bed was huge! The spa tub fit the three of us perfectly-the closet is really big. They put plasma tvs in each bedroom and in the living room. Also has a radio/cd player. A plus!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: wholden25
Reviews.Content: I must say that this was the worst experience we have ever had while on vacation. Fist of all, we agreed to a timeshare package to get the Touch of Magic tickets that are not available at Disney. Well, our tour was scheduled for 815 on Thurs. morning only to find that there were no tours on that day and we could not get our tickets. Our room was 30 years old, and smelt like it with a nest of LoveBugs in the bed and dead ones lined the corner of the room in cobwebs. The carpet was so dirty it was sticky and our feet stayed black! There was so much water damage in the attic that there was a steady drip of water the whole time. When it rained and that was every evening there was a constant sound of running water in the walls and into our porch from the crappy metal roof that leaked. When I addressed these issues with the desk the next morning....nothing was done about it. Finally our ceiling was about to fall in and the maintenace supervisor came and told us we had to move the day before we checked out. I explained that we had already wasted enough of our 3 kids time there I wasn't spending the day moving. Well, they were suppose to do it for us and that didn't happen either. Then the unit we were being moved to stood in 6 inches of water on the porch and they had just moved someone out of that one the day before! This place is ridiculous! I now have two charges on my credit card for who knows what... that I have to fight! These people are money hungry and could care less about your time spent there. I never once got anything other than two dinner cards with 10.00 a piece on them!! How funny, 20.00 in dinner cards when we spent well over 1000.00 to stay there. I would rather stay at the Holiday Inn! I highly recommend staying at Bahama Bay Resort and Spa. We stayed there Tues. night before we checked in at Liki Tiki and it was wonderful! don't waste your time and the water park isn't all that either!

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: blondiekat45
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki was great fun for our tot and would recommend for kids of most ages. Not much for teens though.... Accomodations were nice. We stayed on the 5th floor 2 bedroom condo unit. The beds were horrible; rolled to the edge or the middle if anyone else was in the bed. Rug was worn in areas. TV's in all rooms - Big plasma in the living area; allowed all guests to be entertained. We did experience cock roaches and a plethera of love bugs but we are in Florida... The pools were NOT heated but tons of fun for the kids with several water slides and mini wave pool. Kids pool only open 10-7. Adult pools stayed open later. Playground, putt putt golf, bicycles and paddle boats available for a price. Daily activities for the kids and poolside bar (avg price) for the adults. Comparing to some of our previous timeshare experiences; it is safe to say that Liki TIki is not quite so organized. It did appear that the resort was going through a makeover so conditions should be better....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebellious
Reviews.Content: I booked this through HolidayGenie.Com and then came on tripadvisor to check reviews. I was a bit worried after reading some of the bad reviews and was even trying to get my booking changed because of them but in the end im glad i didnt. My husband and 3 year old son stayed here for 2 weeks from sept 11th to sept 25th. Absolutely fantastic place to stay. Home from home I would stay. It had everything in the apartment we stayed in. Blender, every pot and pan required, every utensil required, just an absolute pleasure to stay here. The staff were very polite and helpful. The only bad thing I would say about it was that it was a little further out than I expected. But hey that wasnt a major problem because we had a car but if you have to bus it then it could be a bit of a nightmare. Especially if you want to get up to I Drive area, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nelsonfamily1
Reviews.Content: Well I heard a lot of bad stuff but there is a lot I dont agree with. When we got there we were greated by very friendly staff. They put us in the 1100 building and it was beautiful We could see the disney fireworks out the balcony. The room was clean and the pools were great. The childrens play area was wonderful and the only Problems we had with the extra stuff was that you have to pay for the bikes and the fishing. Everything else was free with the harbour pass. They did have a hold of $50 on my credit card but when we checked out they didnt take anything out thats just a hold they dont take it out inless their is something gone wronge like you destroye the room. Anyways we had 2 teens with us they had a great time they met some friends and they did their own thing while we went to the bar and sang kareoke. It was wonderful. They could do some clean up on the put put golf area and the paddle boats are only for skinny people my husband and step son are on the little heavy side and the seats kept breaking. Also dont wash any white clothes in their washers your stuff will turn a nasty yellow color and it dont come out. The water in the room taste nasty so dont drink it bring your own! Well other than that everything was ok. Also the bed was very confortable we slept like babies. And there was no bugs in the room. But even if there was 1 or 2 its Florida what do you expect they will fly in when you open the door.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Love”
Reviews.Author: wee_k
Reviews.Content: The condo we stayed in was very clean and spacious. Air-con was great! We were somewhat apprehensive after reading reviews of the Liki Tiki being dirty and the staff unfriendly. It gives me pleasure to say that it is neither. The staff were great and very helpful to us as we had never been to Florida before and helped us out with attraction tickets and places to go and eat etc. The condo was clean as was the main hotel. We were in the older appartments but they were well maintained and is exactly what you're paying for and then some! Can't say enough about this place and I really hope that the bad reviews don't put people off like they almost did to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation I had in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: dr4culax
Reviews.Content: When I got to liki Tiki I was not very impressed on the fact that I had stayed at more fancy resorts but ended up loving this place because we had great family time and enjoyed more this resort than others. I rather have ok resort + lots of fun (thanks to the waterpark they have ) than fancy resort + nothing to do except playing golf. I liked it so much that I ended up buying a timeshare but not from the sale reps at the presentation but from www.ebay.com . I got it for $475 closing cost and transfer fee included for ONE week Floating 1-50 week / 1 bed . I wanted to buy a timeshare for Orange lake which is a more fancy resort and has lots of fun as well but the maintnance fees were over $750 for 1 week while the maintnance fees on liki tiki were only $560. taxes included. Cant beat the price .

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: MNMother
Reviews.Content: Liki tiki was a great place to stay at. My girls(age 8 and 5) enjoyed the water park. I loved the location also. It was only mins. away from all attractions. We stayed in the 1200 building. The one bedroom condo fit us very well. It was very clean and there were some minor wear and tear but it wasn't big enough to ruin my vacation. Our room faced the forest and the lani had a hole which let in 2 big bugs. It might of been beetles but my husband did mention that it might be German coch roaches. Not to sure. It only happend once and that was because my husband stepped outside in the dark just to take a peek outside.After that incident we didn't go out to the lani anymore. I double check the cabinets and the sofa to make sure there wasn't anymore in our unit and there wasn't. Over all the kids had fun, I had a relaxing vacation. We'll most likely stay at liki tiki again. Maybe in a two bedroom condo next time.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Dummpline
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Liki Tiki Village. Our family stayed on the property from July 27-August 28, 2008 and our family truly enjoyed the property. When we checked in I was looking for any and everything to go wrong after reading the reviews. But after I relaxed and truly give the property a chance it was wonderful. The staff was pleasant. Our villa had all new flat screen televisions in both bedrooms and on the living room wall. I requested clean bedding daily which I received within 15mins of my request and a follow up call to make sure the bedding was delivered. We received follow up calls from housekeeping after each full cleaning of the villa inquiring if the cleaning was done properly. We took our 9 year old, 7 year old, 2 year old and my 14 year old little brother and there was something to do for everyone. My kids noticed the DJ, that hosted the weekly karaoke event at the pool side restaurant was also a professional wrestle from TV and they took pictures with him and he was very personable. The Luau Show was similar to a luau that you would see in Hawaii and the food at the show was great. My husband and the kids loved the meals at the pool side restaurant and they spent every other day there eating and swimming. The prices and daily specials were very fair. The pools were never over crowed and very clean. My 9 year old went as far as stating the property was a 5 star in his book. We plan to stay at Liki Tiki next year. The Harris Family of Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Pickles2188
Reviews.Content: The location is out of the way. Check in took forever. The gal who completed the check in process was very nice, subsequent employees were rude. The room was old, with permanently dirty tile flooring. The Jacuzzi jets were very dirty. Even after bleaching the tub, I could not bring myself to use the jacuzzi. The tub is also very high- difficult for younger kids to get in & out. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable. The mattress was worn and the support bar was much like sleeping across a tree limb. Faye brought rain for the majority of the week. Although the resort caters to families, there are no activities (or space outside of sales areas) for children during the rain. We spent most of our time driving to find something for the kids to do outside of room! The arcade is a hoax. The air hockey table was missing the puck, which we discovered only after buying/using tokens. The pinball machines wouldn’t work. The few other games available were a bit violent for our young girls. We were told the game room is run by a separate company & we must contact them for a refund & to exchange the tokens we could not use. The fitness room was also locked during the rain. Hello? It is indoors! What else can folks do? Free breakfast was to start at 8 AM. By 8:20, they were still not serving. This is a major planning glitch when trying to get to the parks at gate open. Plan to purchase breakfast food. The kids did love the water park! The life guards were great, paying close attention to smaller kids. Towels are hard to come by, but who needs them in the rain? Bring your own cleaning supplies. TC RM 1011F

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!! A+++”
Reviews.Author: tamarama_4
Reviews.Content: After reading some really bad reviews I was expecting the worst of this place! We arrived at Liki Tiki - our check in took about 5 minutes and everyone at the front desk was very friendly. We were given our room keys, a map as well as some other helpful info and off we went ... still expecting the worst I walked into our unit which was not a new one so I was very scared but I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean... you could see the wear and tear on the unit since it was in one of the older buildings... but nothing made me feel uncomfortable about staying. The beds were clean, the bathrooms were clean and the kitchen was clean so....who cares if the carpet is a little outdated and old! The Water park was very nice, it wasn't over crowded...we did have a bit of a hard time finding chairs for everyone to sit on, but we spent 90% of the time in the water so that didn't bother us. The kids really had fun at the Water Park!! It's a great time for a family. Liki Tiki is not a "romantic getaway" as there are tons of kids and families running around. They asked us once if we'd like to do the 90 minute time share tour...I turned it down and we weren't bothered again. Their free breatkfast is nothing special (donuts, bagels, coffee). I'd suggest going to the grocery store and supplying your own food - that worked really well for my family. It's location is superb - located only about 15 minutes from the Disney World Parks and there's tons of shops and restaurants on the main highway. It's a great place for a family vacation. I will definitely recommend Liki Tiki Village to others. I will totally stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Why the Negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Scotcgb
Reviews.Content: We (couple with 13 year old daughter) did have trepidations after reading the reviews but we found everything to be excellent. The grounds are very luscious and well maintained. After the reading the reviews we requested and received a room in the newer 1300 building. The condo was excellent. All the facilities including fridge freezer, LCD TVs, jacuzzi bath were excellent. If I was to nitpick the sofa bed was a little lumpy but sofa beds always are lumpy. The pool was thoroughly enjoyed by all of us. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Our only downside was other guests being inconsiderate which was dealt worth by the resort staff. It is a little out of the main area (15 minutes to Disney, 20 to Seaworld, 30 minutes to Universal) but we preferred it that way. We would return there when visiting the Orlando Area again

Reviews.Title: “Great family place to go”
Reviews.Author: lacey619
Reviews.Content: Great place to take the kids......Lots of things to keep them busy....I was a little concerned after reading the NEGATIVE reviews it received from some people but then again, U can't please everyone, all the time....We found the place clean, the staff more than helpful and friendly.....We stayed there for 3 days and the kids were kept busy all the time..We would go back again, for sure....It is conveniently located to almost anything U care to do in Orlando..

Reviews.Title: “Mistake of a life time”
Reviews.Author: dealer64
Reviews.Content: Yes I did see that Liki TIki have new rooms but we stayed in the town house RM. The unit were older which would have been all right if when we arrived there were not dirty towles left behind. The door to the washer/dryer was falling off and the globe that was broke and balancing on top of the dryer unit thank god that it did not fall off and hit one of our kids. The 2nd bedroom has no bath, no TV and twin beds. The master has a larger TV then the living RM and if you are use to a large master BR no you get a tube and shower that is it. The TV in the Living RM is a I think a 19 inch. I did let the front desk know about the towels the first day, but no one came and pick them up or anything. We were asked if we wanted to attend a dinner show adults 27.50 kids 17.50 which was going to be at the pool well let me tell you we left the night after the show. They ran out of some of the food so the kids would night eat the fish & the ran out of deserts. The staff at the pool side bar let just say were not famiy friendly! It was our vactaion its there job. The paddle boats need repair bad we about fell over back words. The pool was nice a little crowded at times. the grounds were for the most clean. The staff that ride golf carts were rude to my children they siad they did not give kids ride only adults and drove off. I have tried to talk to someone about our stay for 6 days no response I was promised a call back Monday well that did not happen. It is not a 5 star resort just becauese you have water pool does not mean you are. It is also about service. We left early becaue of issues every day we only take one vacation a year with the kids and to resort because of cost and trade our time share. I would not recomend this resort for anyone !

Reviews.Title: “One Word - GHETTO”
Reviews.Author: Multitronix
Reviews.Content: Let me just say this resort is one of the WORST we have ever stayed. We belong to the Marriott Vacation Club, and we exchanged through Interval International. Interval International gave this resort 5 stars in 2007. Well, don't believe it! This resort is 25 years old and it shows! The rooms have been upgraded, but, each room is a 1 star at best! The "water park" pool is overcrowded, and dirty. The ONE bar and grill onsite (Shipwreck Sally's) is worst than a shipwreck. It is old, dirty, smelly, falling apart, moldly, slimely, and fly infested. What's more, Shipwreck Sally's (did I mention it's the ONLY place to get food or drink at the resort?) closes at 9:00 pm!!! There are 2 other "quiet" pools, but, they have no access to food, drink, or other things you would come to expect at such a "resort." The clientel is third rate. We witnessed TWO different families having picnics in the parking lot after being asked to leave the "water park" because they brought food and coolers. They actually took the sheets off their beds to make picnic blankets IN THE PARKING LOT. This will give you an idea of the type of clientel that Liki Tiki caters to. The resort is clearly not interested in catering to the existing guests, but more interested in selling additional timeshares. A 2 bedroom will run you $29K, and a 3 bedroom will run you $39K - AFTER they finally break ground and begin building in 2009. In the meantime, you are stuck with a 25 year old vacation nightmare. This experience makes me question any of the other "5 star" resorts that Interval International has to offer. Do yourself a favor and find another place to stay (preferrably on a Marriott property.) This place is to be avoided AT ALL COSTS!!!!! !

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: Floridafam2
Reviews.Content: We booked first then saw some of the reviews and were worried! However we were very happy with everything there. We stayed in one of their newer buildings 1300 building. All the buildings 700-1300 are newer buildings. It was BIGGER than any other resort we have stayed at. The rooms were clean and beautiful. If you stay in 700-900 buildings you will have a view outside of the lagoon where the water park is. In the 1000-1300 buildings you have a tiny walk to get over to the lagoon, and you have a view out your balcony of beautiful Florida woodlands--wildlife. The lagoon/water park area was really nice, especially for small children and young teens. It was very crowded in the afternoon. We found that it was best to go to the water park when it first opened around 10 am. There were life guards on duty and they were very attentive. The tiki bar was great--not just a bar! It had food and sodas and everything else you might want. I have older teens and they were more interested in the activities --basketball, putt putt, golf, shuffleboard, racketball, paddleboats, and bumper boats. The whole family enjoyed the family bikes that are available. If you are an owner or an exhange visitor--most the activities are free. I think there was a small fee for the bikes and boats but it was well worth it. Now--as an adult--the water park was too loud and busy for us. So we walked over to the center pool in the park--which was quiet, warm and fun. There was also a hot tub there and it was a big hit. A small walk further lead to another pool and two more hot tubs but we never needed to go over there as we were entertained already. The whole place was clean and every staff member we encountered was professional, clean, and helpful. The only suggestions we have for the place is more hot tub areas, a bigger workout room and a much bigger archade/game room. The fitness room was very tiny and had few machines etc. The archade/game room was so small and most items did not work. So when it rained there was little for the kids to do. But overall we give this resort a 5 star as we WOULD stay there again and would recommend it to freinds and family.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it, Angela CJ. Hampshire UK”
Reviews.Author: angelacj67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki in June 2007, 2 adults, boy 19, boy 17, boy 12, girl 10. The kids had a great time and so did we. The rooms were clean, spacious and we had great view over the lakes. The two older boys spent time fishing, and we all spent time in the pool area. It was clean and had lots of sunbeds, The lifeguards were great and watching the kids all the time, which made us feel at ease. They stopped any kids mis behaving and made then stand out for a few mins. until they had calmed down. Which I thought was a good idea. The small beach area was clean. The younger kids had fun at the activity stand with arts and crafts, even tie dying t-shirts. We had no problems at all with this resort and will be going again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: tooblessed1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this trip and when I researched Liki Tiki online it scared me a bit with the negative reviews. So I speak from experience of reading both good and bad reviews. The overall grounds are well maintained. We arrived early but had no problems with checking in early. We didn't like the first room they gave us. It was in one of the older buildings on the ground floor and you could see the wear and tear of the room. But the thing that got me was all the bugs in the room. There was about a inch gap under the door that allowed the bugs to come in and out. But we were able to switch rooms (1100 building) with no problems. The young lady at the front desk was very polite and helpful. The second room was on the third floor, although the view from the balcony was of trees, it didn't bother us at all. I would say if you are considering Liki Tiki please ask for a room in one of the new buildings. I read that a lot when I was researching the resort and that would be the best advice I could give. The overall feeling of the place is, it's clean, the staff was nice an helpful and you get what you pay for. The pools during the day had a lot of kid traffic so my boyfriend and I went later on in the evening which was perfect! There are plenty of restaurants in the area and a few grocery stores. We ate out a couple of days and then bought groceries to cook the remaining time we were there. If you are looking for the Ritz this is not the place for you. I saw the good and not so good about Liki Tiki. All in all it wasn't so bad. Other than the first room we were put in and the time share people it was actually nice. I went expecting the worse because of reviews I read but it wasn't bad at all. The only thing I REALLY disliked was the time share people. We sat in on one of the meetings and at first the guy was nice and we were actually considering it. But with more thought we decided against that for right now. Well, that made the manager angry and he was down right RUDE when he knew we would not be purchasing the time share. So my advice would be to avoid the time share people. The attractions were about a fifteen minute ride from the resort but we printed out directions before we left home to all the attractions we wanted to see and that was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Do yourself a favor and do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: EMPNewYork
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Marriott's Grande Vista, a true 5-star resort. We've been to Orlando several times and decided to try a different resort. That's where we made our mistake. Liki Tiki is run down, old, dirty and grimy. Low class guests abound. The "waterpark" is small and always crowded. My 9 yr old wasn't thrilled and my 6 and 2 yr old had a good time. My husband and I were miserable. We had an incident when a group of young guests tried to steal my son's swimming goggles, even though my son was yelling at them not to take them, I had to run after them to get them back! The only positive was that the front desk was accomodating to our requests. When we first checked in they were going to put us in one of the old villas. I had called 6 months in advance requesting a new unit. They were completetly booked but the rep managed to get us into a 2BR unite in the new 1200 building. The room was fine, except for the stench of cigarette smoke coming from the adjoining studio. It's a sham, this is not a 5 star resort. Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, will return”
Reviews.Author: LeedsUK1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in December and loved it. We have been to orlando numerous times and this was our first stay in a condo rather than an hotel we had a 1bed condo in the newer buildings and it was spotless. The rooms had everything needed, plasma tvs, washer/dryer dishwasher, spa bath the works. The location was good 15 minute drive to disney although i would not stay here if i didnt have a car. The pool area was spacious and the bar was reasonable. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: gburrell
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki was a nice resort.It was in a great spot and easy access to theme parks, stores,everything. The room was o.k, we stayed in the newer unit.Loved the jacuzzi tub, and the fact theirs a full kitchen ,washer/dryer, balcony,etc. The place was clean, carpets need some replacement. The waterpark is nice and the bar is great and entertaining. Biggest complaint is when you check in they say that they are going to charge 50 dollars to your credit card temporilay and after you check out they will returned back.It's a lie ,I called the resort haven't got a return call yet and money back.

Reviews.Title: “the worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: JGVMiami
Reviews.Content: Please do not go by the pictures on the web page. . . . it is the worst hotel in Orlando, I made a reservation and from the moment i arrived i knew i had made a big mistake, the lobby is dirty, the rugs, the glass windows even the agents at the reception area look dirty. My husband went to the lobby bathroom and had to leave, unflushed toitets, dirty sinks, an awful smell. There was a lady in the reception area complaining about the loud music all night until 4:00 am. . . . at that point i decided to get my money back and we left and rented in another place.

Reviews.Title: “For the KIDS!!!”
Reviews.Author: apaez1084
Reviews.Content: The picures where way off what it really looks like. The Park is small and the rooms are not as pretty. The rooms where ok they just have a paper thin wall that i could hear when the neighboors breathe, kinda a bother when you out of your mind tire and its 7 in the mourning and the neighboors are awake. I also had an issue with a couple of roaches i found while i stay there so i dont recoment leaving any food out in the open. The water park is actually a bit smaller than you think. And there is so many little kids that i was scared to get in. The Pool was also smaller than it looks in the picture. The property looks very secure and its actually not that bad. We enjoyed the stay most of the time. I would think on renting again when ever i have kids and in a 2 bedroom suit so i wont hear my naighbors. Over all is not bad i would recomend only if you have small kids and i would recomend a 2 bedroom suit. If not doing any of this just stay home or rent somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Low income...low budget!!!”
Reviews.Author: beastiesmom
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews prior to booking, but thought it can't be THAT bad...was I wrong! The "resort" had a $79/ for 2 nights preview special running during the time we were there. We had booked in Feb at full price...179.00 per night. If I had known that they would run such a special...on a weekend no less...I would have run for the hills! ANYONE who could scrape together $79 was there...need I say more? Many had 8-10 people with them in a room designed for 6. The pool area was standing room only...every day! I would love to know the camera technique they used to make the "Lagoon" seem so large. There were no supplies...luckily we had brought the open supplies from the Hilton with us. No housekeeping...no linens...NO COFFEE!! The floors and carpet were so dirty that our feet were black. We started wearing our flip-flops inside the room for protection. Whatever idiot designed the Master bathroom should lose their architect's license! Open glass windows to the bedroom in the shower meant no privacy or opportunity to share the bathroom with family members who may need to use the "water closet". That's what the master bath had...a closet with a toilet in it. Less space than in a public stall or a port-a-potty. I should also clarify that we were in one of the newest units...1400. The hotel clerk was sooo excited to give us this room...I thought...things are going to be great! Wrong!. The bed in the master bedroom had a foam "topper" pad...torn, on top a another foam mattress type pad. The bed was HORRIBLE! My back still hurts! Nicole, from marketing called and left messages every day about doing a preview tour. Was she nuts? We could not wait to leave! I would not send my worst enemy to this place. I felt very badly for a Club Navigo member who had swapped her week at another resort for this...she was so upset and horrified. I hope she was able to reach someone who could help her out. If the time share corporation that handles this "resort" awards it 3-4 stars...I'd hate to see what a 2 star place looks like. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: bigpjh
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great family resort off of Disney property and you have pre teen children then Liki Tiki Village is the place to stay. The pool is terrific, with its slides and waterfalls and sprinklers. Our groups 5 and 7 year olds didn't want to get out when it shut down at night. We also enjoyed the paddle boats and mini golf. Check in was flawless, and quick. We arrived early, and though our rooms weren't ready they took our cell #s and called when one was finished(about 30 minutes.) Our welcome person put a request for us to get the 1300 building, which we did get, and we were not disappointed. Rooms were very clean and very nicely decorated. If you are not an owner they do ask if you would like to listen to a presentation. We did go (90 minutes.) When we said we were not interested there was no pushy sales tactics, they just gave us our gifts. In my case 75 dollars cash, and in my mom's 4 tickets to their Thursday night luau. I again would highly recommend a stay at Liki Tiki Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great for little kids”
Reviews.Author: terriLongIslandNY
Reviews.Content: It was nice close to Disney, forget about the shuttle to Universal studios only goes once a day and is never on time. Room was very nice and spacious looks like a condo, we stayed in an older one, which was fine. Check out the place across the street to buy tickets. Pool does not seem to have enough lounge chairs. The restaurant nothing to speak of and drinks very expensive. There was supposed to be a kids camp which I never saw. since the girls who run it are to busy doing henna tatoos. Pool is only 3-4 feet wave pool didn't work but the pool seemed very clean. My 5 and 7 year old loved it with slides that you can catch them from they also have other pools on the grounds did not go to see them.The boats were nice it had pedal boats for 4 people but only 5 of them and the bumper boats there was only 4. Thought there would be more activities throughout the day. The rooms were very well exquipped with everything from friges to dryers for your clothes and even a hot tub. We went for the timeshare presentation it was not to pushy. Also you can get a continental breakfast there each morning. You are off restaurant row so you have to drive if you want anything. It is Disney that you go for and that is really close by. Not a bad hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: wikiwiki2008
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I have been spoiled by years of happy timeshare exchanges at some wonderful resorts but this will be one place that we will not be returning to. When you own a timeshare and have had so many wonderful stays and you do have options, this is one place that you need to avoid. I agree, some of this is very petty but when you are a timeshare owner you begin to expect certain things from the resorts you book with. Trip was planned down to the smallest detail even thought so far as to call ahead to request a unit in a newer building so as to avoid the two level townhouses I have heard about. After waiting in line forever we were told that the only unit available was a two level townhouse. After the third spill off the stairs my 18 month old took we decided that maybe on Sunday someone would be checking out and we could get a different room. Who wants to have to worry about a kid falling down the stairs the whole trip? We didn’t get too much sleep as the townhouse units were packed and it was like living in a city. There was loud music from a car radio people partying out in the lot and the people in the unit next to us were up partying on their patio until 3 am. I go on vacation to get away from this kind of crap. I wasn’t happy with the room to begin with as it was really dumpy. There were two 19 inch TVs in only the main bedroom and the living room. Small little dinky TV’s is nothing to get excited about but we haven’t been in a timeshare condo with anything less than a 27” in ten years and most have big screens now. The bottom of the dishwasher was rusted and falling off, there were ants everywhere in the kitchen, the light on our patio was popping and flickering when you turned it on, there were burn marks from cigs everywhere, there were numerous cracked tiles in the kitchen area, the patio areas were not screened in and the list goes on. Petty stupid stuff I know but it all adds up. We called the front desk the next morning and after about a half hour of trying to get through, someone finally answered. We were told that they would see what would be opening and that we would get a call in ten minutes or so. An hour later after no call we finally got through to the front desk and they had no idea what we were talking about. So here we are wasting our vacation time trying to get an answer and to make it worse, we were supposed to be leaving to go to the beach on this day. We were wasting so much time trying to get an answer my wife finally walked over to the desk and an hour later came back and said we had gotten a condo unit in one of the newer buildings. We were to pack up our stuff and they would take it over for us while we were at the beach. The person at the front desk took our cell number and said they would call as soon as the room was set up with our stuff. At about ten o’clock that night and after trying to reach the front desk for a few hours we finally got through to them and we were told we were all set, just pick up the new keys in the morning. When we got back the next day we were set up in a room more to our standards. This place charges you for everything! It costs money to rent a crib, never had to pay for one of those. They charge for renting a highchair, never had to pay at any other places. There is no complimentary shampoo or hand/body lotion. Basically, they nickel and dime you to death at this place. The pool area is great but very crowded and for young kids like ours it was awesome. Funny thing though and this should sum up our stay and give you an idea of how this place is run….one day while at the pool and one of two days they had the kiddie pool shut down for repairs (?) we went over to get some pool towels and they were out. The day before they were out but the girl said they would have more in 15 minutes or so. It’s noon and they are out of towels and they don’t want you taking any from your room. The second day they ran out they never got any more for the whole afternoon. A very strange thing did happen right after that though. All of the sudden out of nowhere, I didn’t see this before or after, they hung up some models of towels they were selling. So no free towels on this day, only ones for purchase. Like I said in the beginning, if this is a timeshare exchange, go somewhere else because I can tell you first hand there are better places and places not so damn far off the main roads too. You expect things to be a certain way especially when you pay big bucks for a timeshare to exchange, Interval International I guess needs to revisit this place because if this is a high star rated place, I’d hate to see a three star. I wont go so far as to say it was horrible but for me there is of course a very simple fix to this. I didn’t like it so I won’t go back. There are so many nicer places, don’t waste a timeshare exchange on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At LIki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: keykey06
Reviews.Content: After reserving my room to Liki Tiki I did not read the reviews until after I had already made my reservation because as i was searching for my family a nice place to stay which is very important in a vacation Liki Tiki sounded like a wonderful place to stay. After I read some of the reviews I called to change my reservation and of course once you book it and want to cancel it was a fee so I just prayed we would have a good room and we did. We had a good experience with Liki tiki the property is well maintained and my family enjoyed the stay I could not see anyone having a bad experince with this place. Although it is not close to the attractions and shopping it was not hard to find anything.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Time At Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: applebottum82
Reviews.Content: My family and i just thought our visit with liki tiki was horrible. I visited this site and looked at others reviews before i booked my trip and it was mixed emotions. So i looked at their web page and it showed a very nice room and all the amenties but they show you only the rooms they have upgraded not the old ones. It was nasty i had roaches in my room thank god it was the night i was leaving and customer service wad bad. The only good thing i can say is my kids loved the pool area that much is real. The location of the hotel is not good for shopping so plan to travel a while for shopping and please listen to these reviews because i wish i would've. Maybe the people with the good reviews stayed in the upgraded rooms. I also asked them when i booked my trip if i would be in a upgraded room they told me yes and that was a lie. So if your willing to take chances on your vacation this is where you want to go cause you dont know what you will get. I would choose something that is for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: silvernblue
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am very surprised at the negative reviews that I see listed - I stayed here with 3 kids ages 15, 12 and 7 and we absolutely loved it - everyone was VERY polite and helpful - they were not pushy at all with the timeshare - I did not pick up the welcome package at check in so they called me the next day - I simply stated I was not interested and she very politely thanked me and told us to enjoy our stay - we were booked into the 1100 building and the ONLY thing I could say could be improved is the carpets as they could just use a good deep cleaning - otherwise, everything is fantastic - the waterpark IS slightly smaller than it appears on the website but the kids still had a great time in it - paddle boats were fun and the older kids enjoyed the little beach area - The location is great - many restaurants in the area as well as grocery stores, convenience stores, Walmart etc. - I would definately return and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Editor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Liki Tiki for four days with my husband and two young daughters. After booking, I read some of the reviews and was starting to regret my decision to stay there. Now I have to say that I love this place! We stayed in the 1200 building. The room was very clean and it had everything I needed. I got a great price online and was never asked to take a tour. The pool area was great for my 3 and 9 year olds. It never got too crowded and we spent 2 days just hanging out poolside. I was able to keep an eye on the kids from a lounge chair with a drink in hand. When we checked in we were given a free pass for all their other activities and tried the paddle boats which were fun. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in FL”
Reviews.Author: aletta78
Reviews.Content: This place is the best! It's cheaper then a hotel room plus you get sooo much more. Instead of a hotel room we pretty much got a 1 bedroom apartment. We had a kitchen, dining room, living room, one bedroom, bathroom. We had shower and hot tub, washer/dryer, dishwasher. Everything you can imagine was there. Flat screen tv in the living room, tv in the bedroom, dvd and cd player in the living room. The place was amazing. It had all the dishes to cook any meal you wanted. all for only $79.00 a night (september rate). This place was awesome. It had two swimming pools and a mini water park, outside bar and i guess they just added mini golf and bumper and paddle boats. I cant wait till we get to go back in September. It'll be my boyfriends first time staying there, i'm just dying to see his face. The place is awesome. It is a timeshare but if you tell them you're not interested when you get there you wont hear another word from them. They give you no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “"TIMESHARE"”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMary
Reviews.Content: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE! I booked Liki Tiki through Toolin Travel back in September 2007. My partner and I stayed for 4 days and we couldn't bear it any longer and demanded our hotel rep to move us. It's nothing but timeshare, the staff didn't have a clue what they were doing and were quite rude. Some of the resort was as old as my granddad! Because i looked at trip advisor before i left, i demanded to stay in one of the new tower blocks; we had a lovely room but it wasn't cleaned the 4 days we were there. We were told that the resort was walking distance from International Drive - IT IS NOT; it's about 20 miles away and to get a taxi there and back would cost you about $100 There are no tourists there when we stayed (UK or Irish). The bar and grill shut whenever the staff wanted it to, 9pm one night and 8pm another night! If you are a young couple, this is not the best place to stay and you need a car if you are staying here. We demanded to be moved the fourth day we were there and the rep put us up in the Clarion Hotel International, near Wet & Wild and enjoyed the rest of the holiday!

Reviews.Title: “A review of one of the resorts”
Reviews.Author: 1stJohn47
Reviews.Content: This resort is out of the way from most of the craziness, yet within an easy drive of everywhere. Definately rent a car if you plan to stay at this resort. I really loved the older townhouse style rooms. They were 2 stories with a screened in porch and a balcony joining both upstairs bedrooms. Our room was actually closed for renovations and accidently given to us. We noticed and notified the front desk of our concerns. The manager was very friendly and accomodating. They even offered to help us pack and move. She gave me a walk through of my choice of rooms before renting out the new one. I give the staff "two thumbs up" for helpfulness and friendliness! There are newer rooms in a more hotel like environment. So, when you make your reservation, be sure to state which type of room you would like. Personally, I loved the cabin! The water park was a lot of fun and easy to watch your kids. It was hard to get the kids out of the waterpark long enough to visit Universal Studios! If you have the time, I would recommend going through the tour. They offer a variety of choices as your "reward" for listening. However, I said "No thank you" and the staff was not too pushy and let me know I could change my mind at any time.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for the money..”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Play
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this place based on the pictures. The waterpark was not as big as I thought it would be based on the photographs. I think this place is suited for a very young family. My kids are 9 and 10 and were not impressed. Check in was fast and efficient but unfriendly and uninformative. Having said that we did not do the welcome packet because we did not want to get into a timshare presentation. We had a call both days we were there and we did not answer. We knew they would keep calling until we agreed. The pool staff was friendly as was the bartendar at the beach bar. Our room was clean and tidy. It was worth what we spent but we won't go back. Good for young kids who will be impressed by their first waterslide.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Just a "Fair" Resort”
Reviews.Author: jjjcMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Liki Tiki Village through Hotels.com for our Disney vacation April 28 - May 8, 2008. We stayed 5 days inside Disney at the Old Key West Resort and then trying to save some money, reserved the last 5 days at Liki Tiki Village as it looks so beautiful on their website. Well lets just say, "you get what you pay for. " I can't say it was all terrible, but this was our experience: I had checked many reviews and done much research before booking and was a little nervous due to all of the negative reviews but went for it as I did get a great rate. As all of the reviews had stated to make sure to get a "condo" in the 800, 900, 1000, 1100, 1200 or 1300 section (5 stories) because these are the new condos and the other townhouse units are old, falling apart, dirty, etc, I made sure to reserve a "condo" in one of the new buildings. I made sure Hotels.com called the resort to ask if we would be getting one of the new units and they assured us that yes, this would be the case. I also called the resort myself to make sure this would be the case and they told me yes, my request was down and was all set. Upon check-in, they checked us all in and then handed me the keys with room number "209". I told her that I had requested a "condo" in one of the new buildings and not a townhouse which was one of the old buildings. She told me that my request was just that, a request and not a guarantee and that they had 200 people checking in that day (Saturday). So I said we would look at it. Well all we had to do was walk in and walk out. The townhouses are 2 floors with the bedrooms and bath on the second floor. They are dark, dingy, old and dirty. You could tell that no one had stayed there for quite some time because there were dead flies on the kitchen floor. So back we went to the desk asking to speak to the manager on duty. We spoke with a different rep. at the desk and not wanting to bring the manager into it she said she could offer us a condo in the 800 unit which she said had been newly renovated, etc. and was very nice. So we were very pleased with that. She said she would call us on our cell when it was ready. We waited about 4 hours and when we went in to get the keys, we were given yet a different unit. We were given a condo in the 700 building which had obviously not been updated within the last 5 years. But we were exhaused and said fine, and it was a lot better than the townhouse. It was very spacious, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths on the 5th floor. The inside windows were very sticky and dirty with kids fingerprints all over them and the couch was very stained. Other than that, it was clean and comfortable. As far as the main waterpark pool goes, don't go there with your kids on the weekends!!!!!!!! It is soooooo crowded that we could hardly see our kids, they have karokee in the afternoons on Saturdays and the music is soooo loud and there was a girl laying on the ground in the tiki bar at 5:00 in the afternoon. Not a great place to go with your kids on the weekends. Believe me, we are no prudes, we love a good time, but geeeeze. It was much better come Monday, a lot quieter and we did find another pool that was a lot quieter as well. We were ready to check out though on Sat. night, but it did get better after the weekend. Also, don't let the "free continental breakfast" fool you. It consists of a donut, period!!!!!!!!!! Unless of course you are willing to sit through a 45 minute timesharing speal and then they would give you a full and wonderful breakfast. We said forget it and went somewhere else for breakfasts or just ate in the condo.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: SeaBrzJo
Reviews.Content: My family (8-yr-old boy, parents, grandma) stayed at Liki Tiki from April 6 - 11, 2008. We booked the 2-bdrm suite on the Liki Tiki website in March, and received our request to be near the main waterpark pool. I originally called the resort to book, but the very kind reservation rep advised that I could get the same rate by booking on the website PLUS get a Resort Pass that entitled us to unlimited free use of the pedal boats, bumper boats, bicycles, and putt-putt golf during our stay. Sunday afternoon check-in was a breeze and we were thrilled with our 2nd floor suite in Building 800. It was HUGE, spotless, nicely decorated, well-appointed, had a big balcony with table and chairs overlooking the lake, and was just steps to the waterpark pool and Tiki Bar. My family has been staying in similar accommodations for years for family vacations (including Marriott and Hilton timeshare properties) and this suite equaled or exceeded any that we've stayed in. It also had the BIGGEST indoor jacuzzi tub I've ever seen. Ok, so there are going to be downsides to every stay, regardless of the property and cost, so here are ours (off the top of my head and in no order of priority): 1. The doors between adjoining suites are regular interior hollow doors. Although they are locked very securely, even two of these doors back-to-back, provide very little soundproofing. Luckily, we had a noisy 8-yr-old and the adjoining room had a couple of delightful toddlers so the noise didn't bother either family (I met the other family daily in the hallway), and all was quiet after 9 pm. I mention this because a family without kids might be disturbed. 2. Donuts, coffee, tea, and juice are served every morning except Sunday at another one of the pools (approx a 5 minute walk from Bldg 800), but the setup is ridiculous. Two women in a tiny shed attempt to serve as fast as possible, but we stood in a 30-minute line on a Thursday morning at 8 a.m. Luckily, we only tried this on our last day of the vacation. 3. Had read reviews of limited towels poolside so we brought our own beach towels. These worked well to mark our pool chairs and were glad we brought them because. the couple times I thought of checking, the clean towel bins were empty. 4. I had also read critical reviews here about the bar staff at the Tiki Bar and have to agree somewhat. However, what is strange is my (daily) experience was that the female bartenders were very rude, but the male bartenders were extremely friendly. Because I knew I was going to post back here, I paid particular attention and it didn't seem to matter the age or gender of the guest. The lady bartenders had as little patience for the kids as they did for the cute 20-something guys, and the guy bartenders made us all feel welcome and on vacation. One exception: the table waitresses (all female) were all great. Also, I found the drink and food prices very reasonable, especially if you asked about specials. One female bartender failed to tell me that drinks were two-for-one one evening (either double shots or get two separate drinks), but the male bartender mentioned it when he served me a second drink and gave it to me free. 5. Our free Resort Pass seemed useless the first three days (Sunday - Tuesday) as none of the boats were running, nor were any bicycles available. I had read here that others had experienced that so I called and got the same excuse - "alligator in the lake". Well, I'm an over-50 Florida native so I challenged them with "I have a balcony overlooking the lake and I've seen no trappers out here to get the gator for the past three days." We went to Aquatica the next day so not sure if the boats were back open, but the following day they were, and remained so the rest of our stay. Never did see any bicycles though, and we were too busy to ask. 6. Some of the resort info pages inside the room are outdated. Example: One page in the binder says towels are only exchanged by housekeeping on Tuesdays, but that is no longer the case. Just call Housekeeping, tell them what you need, and leave your dirty towels in a bag outside your door; new towels will arrive within an hour or two. 7. The waterpark pool closes every Thursday night at 5:30 pm for the rest of the night for a big Luau Party. Tickets for the Luau are approximately $42 per adult, less for kids, and swimming is not allowed during that 3-hour show either. Big disappointment for the 8-yr-old. We didn't attend but could hear the music from our balcony. Also didn't get any feedback on the show from the other guests since we checked out the next morning. 8. Traffic on 192 eastbound... oh my gosh, WHEN did this road get SO busy??!!! Because I live on the coast directly east of Kissimmee, I rarely do a touristy thing like this trip, so the last time I was this far west on 192 was over 20 years ago. One day during this trip we decided to go to Epcot (big mistake - forgot it was still Spring Break and we don't do lines well) and it took us 1-1/2 HOURS to get 7 MILES to the EPCOT gate, and we left at 9:15 AM. Not sure what the problem was because we saw no wrecks or other road blockage, but the same stretch of highway for our Aquatica trip a few days later only took 30 minutes. It's still a nightmare traffic jam at most times, and many guests were complaining about it at the pool. 9. No Internet connections in the room, but my laptop found a wireless signal from an adjacent resort while on my balcony. I didn't opt in for the $9.00 daily fee, but the signal strength was excellent. 10. Newspapers: I'm a morning newspaper freak and, for the rate, I didn't expect morning suite delivery, but I did expect the ability to go to the main building and buy one. Unfortunately, no newspapers are available until the Gift Shop opens at 8 or 9 am (can't remember exact time). Luckily, a 7-11 convenience store is a very short, light traffic, walk from the resort. Those minor things are all I can think of for on entire stay. On the PLUS side, here's what was right: 1. Great parking (at least for buildings 700, 800, 900) and security. I reported a pair of lost prescription glasses one day (later found them in the room) and the front desk had Security at my side within two minutes. Also, plenty of luggage carts (at least in Bldg 800) and the center building elevator (closest to our suite) was quick and always operational. 2. Lifeguards are plentiful, alert, and fair to the kids that just want to have fun. We've been to other resorts with overly power-happy guards that just love blowing whistles. Except for one day, we LIVED at the waterpark pool and never saw a child hurt or crying. 3. A brand new full-service Publix supermarket has opened just 3/4 miles WEST of the resort, and it's super-easy to get everything you could possibly need in a quick, easy drive. 4. Except for the rude female Tiki Bar bartenders, EVERYONE at Liki Tiki from the front desk to the janitors were extremely friendly, happy, and helpful. 5. If you can't stand to sleep on anything other than 300+ count thread sheets or use only Egyptian cotton towels, you might want to bring your own, but everything, including the bedspreads and blankets smelled clean and fresh. 6. Timeshare Sales: I received an evening call on Night 3 asking if I was enjoying the resort. Realizing that it was a timeshare salesperson, I quickly (and nicely) told him that I was very happy, but not interested in buying. Our call lasted only 20 seconds, he wished me well, and I was never contacted again. 7. I loved that the kitchen amenties included a blender and a full-sized 12 cup coffee pot. Would we stay here again? Absolutely YES, but only to stay on property to relax and use the pool and other amenities. I will not fight the 192 traffic again to get to the parks, especially since I can get to them in the same amount of time from my east coast home 50 miles away. Happy Vacation and thanks so much to all of you who post reviews from other places. This is a great community.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fugere1
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 night/ 5 days at the LIKI TiKi village and had a wonderful time. We stayed in the 900 building overlooking the Pool/ Waterpark. My 5 year old was in heaven the whole time. We knew about the towel situation, so we brought our own. easy.... The waterpark itself is perfect. It does get crowded but it was very manageable. the food at the poolside restaurant was very good. The resort is very well maintained and the room was clean and very comfortable. the only drawback was the pullout couch wasn't the most comfortable- but really they never are, anywhere! and they do have Kareoke wednesday and Fridays that can get a bit loud. if you want quiet I would ask for a room in the 1100 building and upwards. The resort is about 20 - 35 minutes away depending on the traffic and it's convenient to lots of stores and restaurants. This is a great family resort with all the ammenities to keep everyone happy and occupied. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints, it was ideal in every aspect, I would return”
Reviews.Author: John_the_travel_guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new section and every aspect of our stay was favourable! Registration was smooth as silk, the staff was friendly, helpful and not at all pushy about purchasing time. Parking was always available even though they were busy. The grounds were clean and well maintained. The Pool was perfect for our family! There are slides and fountains and jets and sprayers. The water park was just delightful. Only small complaint...the pool was so busy that the towels quickly ran out...but they did manage to get more before we needed drying off! THe rooms are large and spacious. Beds were comfortable and our nights sleep were sound. In Building 1100 our balcony faced a lush forest that was very pleasant and quiet! In the Evenings our vantage allowed us to see some of the fireworks coming from Disney. Yes, you are 8 miles from Disney. We knew this in advance and in reality it was not inconvient in the least. the 192 (Irlo Bronson Blvd) is fun no matter where you are on it. Everything was close, Walmart, Walgreens, Publix. Some people have complained of bugs in the rooms...this is typical of 1) Florida and 2) Any ground floor hotel. We were on the 5th floor and we was one bug during our 7 night stay. THis is a great family resort and in my humble opinion it is worth a visit...I would happily return! John

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Austin520
Reviews.Content: I am always interested in staying at a different resort when vacationing...the seach is over!!!! Liki Tiki was AMAZING!!! Many people say to be prepared to be heckled for time-share tours...the only time I was asked about attending a tour was when we checked in. The room was great! We stayed in the 1300 Building. When we arrived, there were two (2) luggage carts on every floor. This was a great help, esp. after driving 16+hrs frpm Philly. We had a 2 Bedroom/2 Bathroom Condo; I attached pics of the room. If you have a child, plan to stay @ the waterpark for at least one of the days, very clean, plenty of seats; bring your own towel from the room, they are hard to come by @ the pool...not a big deal. We will not stay anywhere else again...Liki Tiki was that good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gwennb
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Orlando. I, too was skeptical on the Liki Tiki from reading reviews, but decided to give it a try since there seemed to be so much to do there. BAD IDEA. First of all, the villa we stayed in is extremely outdated. I'm not picky about new new furnishings, but even the tile in the bathroom was rotting. The third day we woke to find bugs in the bathroom. Complained to front desk, given a room up two flights. Okay, but we were in orlando to do things, not unpack, repack etc.... SEcondly, i have never stayed anywhere less equipped. I mean, these place don't have coffee cups, almost all the cubboards are bare!! Then, the pool/lagoon area. So crowded you had to be there at 10 am to get a place to sit. The so-called wave pool I did not see in action once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: MattyBo
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Liki Tiki from Apr. 20 through 24. We have 2 boys, ages 5 and 8. Great stay. Definitely request the newer buildings as they are very clean. Washer/dryer and full kitchen are bonuses. Plenty of room for a family of 4. All employees were helpful, courteous and friendly. Water park was very nice but did get crowded. If you want a lounge chair, you need to get there early and claim a spot. Water seemed cold in the morning but warmed up by afternoon. Plenty of other non-water activities to keep you busy. We will definitely stay at the Liki Tiki again.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen expensive Coach Wallet”
Reviews.Author: tlc3a1b2c3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki from April 9 - 13 of 2008. My daughters' Coach Wallet was stolen from our condo. Although security and the front desk administrators were pleasant and tried to be helpful; someone with an unregisterd key came into our condo while we were out and stole the Coach Wallet. According to security, they ran a key check and then confirmed with me the times of entry into the condo. I confirmed our entry into the condo with them, but I am positive that someone had been in our condo and removed the wallet. Security asked me to verify all the keys to the condo and I did, but there has to be an unregistered key to the condo. The wallet was taken out of my condo by someone other than my family. We had no guest in our condo and the door firmly shut each time we came into and left the condo. If you decide to stay at the resort, I'd full secure my entire valuables by using the safe in the rooms, because I strongly believe that there is a thief, at the resort, with an unregistered key to the condos. Other than that, the condo was clean and everything worked . We stayed in the 1000 buliding. Stay in the 1000 buliding on up to 1400 building.

Reviews.Title: “Water park is worth it”
Reviews.Author: meseginger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newer condos it was great they thought of everything to the dishdrainer. To stay in a full accomodation for so little is great. I love the fact you have a washer and dryer for a family the amenities are great. The water park is a perk there was a cold snap when we came so we only played at the water park 1 day but the heated pools were nice. I would definitely stay again and will try to come when can fully enjoy the pools. Only draw back was finding towels at the pool so bring your own from your room. No place is perfect!! Convenient to restaurants, groceries and Walmart is around the corner. Easy to get to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Place”
Reviews.Author: finleyt
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Liki Tiki was fantastic. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Our condo was clean and very comfortable. It was great to be able to enjoy the water park and not have to go far. We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Vacation So Far!”
Reviews.Author: jbenns
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful Stay! Again other's poor comments were a worry before we went, but you go with a positive attitude, it will all turn out great! We drove from IL. We checked in early around 2pm. We did get a newer room in the 1400's. Was in great condition! We were swimming by 2:30. The pools were great, the lifeguards were attentive and friendly. They kept en eye on the faster black slide at all times. The kiddie pool was great for even my 3 & 5 yr. old to lounge around and play. Never had a problem with the pools closing early for their functions. It was never before 5 and by that time you had enough of the pool. Plus it was only 2x at the most thru the whole week, but in itself it was for a lua or a dinner/karoke thing. It's in a wonderful location to everything. Away from the hustle of the tourist strip and right next to the cleaner, not so swarmed walmart. (taking a cab to a park is a dumb idea, considering they have buses that pick people up for parks. just got to ask people). Upon checking in, we did get talked into signing up for a tour brkfest. We had to put $20 down to hold it, but got it back of course when we went ( and would of if we changed our minds). We made it for Wednesday at 8:30. Took a little golf cart about 50 feet over to another building. Ate for 20 minutes, with our kids, then looked at a slide show. Told them off the bat this wasn't possible for us at this time. He was great & the promised time of 1 1/2 hrs. was right on. We left, picked up our dep $20 and got to pick form a list of prizes. We chose $75 in cash and away we went. The lake was closed still for one alligator they still need to catch. They did say they caught the other. It was a little deterring, but what can you do. You're in Florida, enjoy the rest of the place! We swam every day from about 10 - 3. Ate lunch from our hotel alot, bought lunch once or twice from snack bar by pool. Every evening we found things to do that the kids loved! ( ages 3, 5 and 9) We used the $75 at Old Town carnival ( wed buy one bracelet, get one free). Went golfing with a coupon. Went to the Flea market down on other end by carnival. Went to Downtown Disney (GREAT TIME) free to go, free parking. just walked around, listened to a band, played with lego's, rode the ferry. ( if you eat at rainforest, there will prb be a 3 hr. wait, ask to sit on patio and you're right in). We did drive to Cocoa Beach 2 days. bought $5 boogy boards and the kids were in heaven. It is about 75 miles, but took a bit longer b/c of disney traffic. But again, you're in Orlando, you just deal with it. ( and bring about $4 in cash for tolls each way). We did have to leave a $50 dep. on our CC when we checked in. Which they never really charge unless they had too). We did make calls using our calling card and occured a .75 /call charge, but we were never told nor saw a sign about the charge so they deducted it for the most part. ( they guy calling NY, uhh, there would prob be a long dist. charge on top of your .75 charge dont you think? and wouldn't you check your bill BEFORE you left at check out?) All in all great place, great location. Room had 2 flat screen tv's, large screened in porch, tub with blower jets. Do bring extra laundry detergent and dish soap. Besides the kid pool area, there are 2 others pools along with a hot tub. I'm sure the older buildings were in more need of care. Just request for the newer beforehand by calling and again at check in say you were told on the phone you were in a newer building. Hopefully that works! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: southSouth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two children, ages 13 and 8 to Florida for spring break. We only stayed at Liki Tiki Resort for 2 nights and that was 2nights too many! This place is a complete joke! Where to begin...firstly we arrived there around 3pm, only to be reminded that check in time was 4pm and our room was not ready. We drove around for an hour waiting for the resort to call us which is what they said they would do after a room became avaliable. Should have known that would never happen, I ended up calling the resort myself just after 4pm. Was told 'yes' when I asked why we weren't called the reply was 'I'm not sure' Ok, so we get in the room. A one bedroom unit that seemed clean on the surface! That night we could hear every word from the people and the tv from the unit next door. The bed had seen better days because we felt like we were sleeping on the floor and the sofa bed was broken! Needless to say we got no sleep and the next morning I left a message on the voice mail of the supervisor in customer service. Of course I never did get a reply! Decided to use our own plastic utensils when we discovered that the dishwasher was disgusting, filthy and rusty. The waterpark that looked so nice on the internet was packed crowded both days. The resort details that there are heated pools. We never found them! The elevators never worked and there were bugs and ants all over the entrance door to our units. Don't waste your time or money at this place. Certainly don't let the pictures of the resort fool you! When we checked out, nobody asked if everything was ok or anything!

Reviews.Title: “dont give them your credit card”
Reviews.Author: upstatenyman67
Reviews.Content: i stayed there from the 5 to the 12.rooms were ok in newer buildings but you could here they next room so clear.i gave them my credit card at check in for a 50 dollar room deposit.i made a few calls back to ny while i was there.they said in the book in the room that it was 75 cents a call.so when i got home i had discovered i had been charged 215 dollars on my credit card .i called and they said that they had charged me 5 dollars per call for some and 7 for others.they said it was not charged by minute.but per call.what a joke i am fighting this no where did it say it was over 5 dollars per call.the staff at the check in and out were so bad.they could not care about there quests.pool closes early then you have no place to go after.unless u cab it.its a 30 dollar cab ride to disney.they are not that close.if you like to email me with questions feel free to markanderica03@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our visit.”
Reviews.Author: lad45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during spring break to visit Disney. Five year old daughter loved the waterpark and my inlaws and we loved the hotel. We did request a newer room (1400) and we had granite counters, comfortable beds and a HUGE three head tiled shower. The grounds were well maintained and the staff was very friendly, the guards greeted us each day on our return from the parks. Will definately return on our next trip. By the way, they are located OFF a major highway with a ten min. drive to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not Real Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Iowagirl67
Reviews.Content: We were there because we got two free days at Disney and 2 nights at Liki Tiki for $199.
