They put us in the 300 unit, which is pretty run down - couch had a hole in it, old drapes, non-matching chairs on the patio, old looking jacuzzi, outdoor steps are rotting away You could hear everything in the room next door - luckily it was between the kitchens and not the bedrooms. The linens were terrible - wouldn't even stay on the bed - I think they were for a double bed. We took the timeshare tour and it ended up taking 6 hours! They wouldn't take no for an answer. I doubt we will ever stay here again - will stay in one of their other properties - although there aren't too many, so we will have to go to Interval properties and pay the exchange fee. The water park is nice, but the only restaurant on the property is at the pool - an outdoor bar/"greasy spoon" and if you walk over late in the day - it's not very well lit. All in all - pretty average. When they took us on the tour they showed us a beautiful room - wish we had gotten that - a much better selling point.

Reviews.Title: “great fun”
Reviews.Author: princess079
Reviews.Content: booked through holidayrooms direct on the net. Very impressed. Apartments are clean and large with every extra you could want e.g. washer, dryer, iron, safe etc. The three of us had plenty of room. No maid service but hey saved some money. Resort has lots of things to do, the small water park was very popular with my son (aged12) basketball, tennis, crazy golf, food and drinks from the bar even some entertainment for the kids. Great will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place for a good price but not 5 Star.”
Reviews.Author: sixpack069
Reviews.Content: MY girlfriend and I and her two kids stayed here from 3/25-3/30. For the most part this is a nice place to stay. Our room was on the 5th floor 1051E, which was a two bedroom. The buildings 1000-1300 are more recently built and are more modern. The room was nice as it had a jettison tub and nice balcony. Very roomy with a full kitchen. There were only a few things that I did not thrill me about this place that made it less than a 5-star resort. One being there is NO WIFI in the rooms only dial up, that was a total joke as it did not even work. I was told the resort does have WiFi in the main building but it cost like $6.00 a day. A second thing that wasn't great was the pool while being very kid friendly offers not much for anyone over 10 or 4 ft tall. The resort stresses its a water park and it indeed is but a waterpark for small kids. Another thing is there are alot of kids running all over the place here and I mean ALOT. If you are trying to find a quiet place for RR this is not it. Its not a real problem and most of the kids are in the pool are all the time. We were disappointed that the paddle boats and bumper boats they have on the lake were not in operation the entire time due to fact they said a gator was residing in the lake. Not sure how accurate this was since noone we talked to ever seen it and the lake looked pretty shallow. The staff at the front deskwho check you in and out are half dead and not very friendly at all!! They almost seemed annoyed at the fact of having to check us in when we arrived. Not sure what was going on with that. The final thing that was annoying about the resort was the SALES PITCH on the timeshare tour presentation. We have been to many timeshare tours and we are timeshare owners but this tour is very LONG and the sales pitch is VERY PUSHY.. They say its a 90 min presentation , but took us 3 hours and the staff was visibly annoyed at the fact we kept saying NO we did not want to buy the resort. This is a high pressure sales tour despite what they tell you! Avoid this if you can. BUt all in all we had a great time as we spent most of our time at the disney parks and the beach. The resort is a great place to go and just let the kids run around. The rooms are nice..and they have alot of activities for kids and families. Also you can get some free disney world tickets buy attending the timeshare presentation. I would consider comiing back again next year as for the price its a good deal but IMO Liki tiki is not a 5-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the LIki Tiki!”
Reviews.Author: sjidzior
Reviews.Content: This review will sound like many others who liked the Liki Tiki. Like others, I read the mixed reviews about this place. Either people loved it or hated it. I even apologized to my wife ahead of time if the place was a dive since I made the arrangements. This place was perfect for a family of four with a 6 and 9 year old. It was clean, lots of space, and had the amenities that we needed. Here's the summary: The good: The room was huge. We got the 2 bed/2 bath for a few extra bucks. It was absolutely worth it. We were able to spread out after a long day at Disney and have our own space. There was even a day when my son had terrible stomach flu. It was nice to be able to "quarantine" him in a different bedroom. This is something that we could never have done at a comparably priced Disney Resort. There was a kitchen with dishes, silverware, breakfast nook, coffee maker, etc. We were able to eat breakfast there daily as well as a few dinners. The kids preferred eating in after a long day at the park. The room was indeed clean, contrary to other reviews. Do not expect laundry/cleaning service though. They will clean the room for an additional charge and you must call guest services for extra towels. I personally can go a week without cleaning services. Big deal. The kids LOVED the 50 inch flat screen TV and whirlpool tub. It was very nice after a long day of walking. The pool was great for smaller kids. The waterpark was definitely for smaller kids. They had smaller slides and the wave pool produced 6-12 inch waves. Nothing to get too excited about. They also had karaoke at the pool 3 out of the 7 nights we were there. The kids had a great time with that. They also like the playground near the pool. My older son preferred the playground to the pool. There was also basketball and putty golf that we did not use but they appeared nice. WE WERE NEVER CALLED OR EVEN APPROACHED about going on a timeshare tour. I really appreciated that. The staff were friendly and helpful although slow at times. THere were security vehicles all over the grounds. THE BAD: The check in was horrible. We came in at 6:00 after a long day of travel and it took 40 minutes to check in with only 5 people in front of me. It appeared that 2 of the 4 desk staff were struggling with the computers and were maybe new as they were asking other staff alot of questions. I was also delayed as I had asked for a newer building back in January as well as 3 days before check in. However, upon arrival I was in an old building. It took her 20 minutes to get me in to the newer building for a week. (It was worth it!). The bumber boats and paddle boats were closed the whole week. We may have been upset by this if we spent more time at the resort, but it was no big deal. The room seemed to have been made poorly. While this was no big deal now, I can see in a few years that there will be problems. The tub had no caulk around the edges to the point that there was bare, unpainted drywall exposed at the top of the tub wall. There were two large cracks in the ceiling over our bed along the drywall seams. It looks like someone tried to repair it with spackle and a different color paint very poorly. All the doors squeeked and one would not stay shut. The lock to the bedroom seemed to work but did not. The elevator control panel was smaller than the opening and had large gaps around it. It looked bad. Even one of the staff commented to me about it when we were waiting for the elevator. He said "makes you wonder where all those maintenance dues and taxes go..." Overall we had a great time at the Liki Tiki. The positives far outweiged the negatives. I would definitely stay there again. However, I would never consider purchasing due to the poor construction.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would not go back”
Reviews.Author: jlawrence79
Reviews.Content: We picked the Liki Tiki because of all the great activities for kids there: waterpark, paddleboats, bumper boats, etc. We were disappointed when we arrived because the paddleboats and bumperboats were closed "because of an alligator in the pond" (the pond is so small I have no idea where an alligator could possibly hide...it sounded like an excuse not to run the free boats to me). Waterpark was OK, but water was cold, and they didn't operate it during one of the 3 days we were there either. The 2 bedroom condo was big, but a bit worn-out...the one bedroom was nicer, but the building it was in (Building 700) looked very old and the stairs looked almost dangerous (rust had eaten away at large portions of the stairs). All in all, the Liki Tiki did not meet our expectations and we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Time”
Reviews.Author: Leaffan14
Reviews.Content: My whole family stayed here for a Family get together. Make sure you stay in the new condo's as the old section is dated. The rooms were great, but the best part of the place is the pool area. It is great for the kids and keeps them very busy. The pool bar area is quite exspensive but a lot of fun during the planned events. You are not permitted to bring your own drinks down so if you can get a ground floor room close to the pool area it helps. I would definately recommend this for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask for the new condos!!!”
Reviews.Author: kamp5
Reviews.Content: We booked Liki Tiki through our timeshare as it is listed as a 5 star resort. There are very old and rundown townhomes and condos on this property. The 5 star rating pertains to the newer condo towers, units #1100-1400. We requested the newer units when we booked in 10/07, and reconfirmed this request two weeks before travel, as well as day of travel. We arrived at 1am and were told there were no newer units available and spent the night in unit 308 which was a true throw back to 1970, complete with buckled carpet, a 16 inch tv, and screen door that did not fit the door frame. The next morning I headed back to the front desk to speak to a manager who informed me there in fact had been a unit available the night before, the person on duty did not check the sheet. She was very nice and moved us to unit 1314E which was a time warp from the night before-new tile, carpet, flat screen tv's, etc. So do not accept that new units are not available. Front desk staff not very friendly or helpful with the exception of the manager who called later to check on us. Aside from that it is a nice resort, water park was clean, although they could not keep towels in stock so bring your own. Workout facility is tiny but was also clean. Good place for families, although traffic to get to any attractions is ridiculous! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Fun”
Reviews.Author: r0ach16
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Liki Tiki and did not have any complaints. We were lodged in the 400 building in a one bedroom villa. This was plenty of space for me, my husband, and two children ages 5 and 7. The villa was clean and well maintenenced. We had everything we needed for the entire week. The kitchen utensils were well stocked and they provided laundry and dish soap. We never heard noise from our neighbors through the walls, however in the front bedroom, you could hear the hustle and bustle of people moving around in the mornings. Nothing out of the ordinary though. Continental breakfast was provided at the club house Mon-Fri and there were children activities each day in the water park area. We were wishing we had more days to enjoy the property amenities, but we were booked with activities already. I would definately stay here again. I booked this room through TNT resorts and would recommend them for cheap prices. We did have to attend a sales presentation, that went well over 3 hours,-they need to learn no means no. That would be the only negative experience of the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: just3travelers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ my mother's timeshare at Liki Tiki and were very disappointed. Most all the staff was extremely rude .. with the exception of the bartender's at the pool. I suppose they have a vested interest in being polite. After checking in last Friday night (and standing in line for 35 minutes to do so), we encountered numerous rude staff members. A few days after getting there, I returned to the check in desk to ask where I could find a postbox .... the girl behind the counter looked up at me and said "Do you need something?" -- rather than "Can I help you." The elevator in our building was broken for nearly 5 days .. we felt so badly for the people on the 5th floor. It was 80 degrees all week. Imagine climbing 5 sets of stairs each and every time you go to the pool. The door to our room was open multiple times when we returned from the pool or from being out. I thought it was my absent-mindedness or due to my chasing my toddler out the door. I noticed someone else said they were certain someone had been in their room. Seems very strange that on at least 5 occasions we'd return to find our door open. On most of those occasions, I remember the door slamming behind me. Makes me wonder now. The housekeeping staff rides around the complex on bicycles that resemble the Wicked Witch of the East on The Wizard of Oz. Talk about exploitation. We felt terrible for them .... 88 degree heat with all their cleaning supplies, riding a delapitated bicycle around. The clubhouse is a joke .... it's a boiler plate for timeshare sales. Just know that if you are considering purchasing a timeshare here, stay as a guest first and do your research. My mom is an owner and for all intents and purposes, they thought I was my mom. Trust me, I didn't get any special treatment. Apparently, after you sign that purchase agreement, your stock goes way down. When you go into the clubhouse on any given day, it sounds like you are on Wall Street. Business transactions, loud sales conversations ... ridiculous. We avoided the clubhouse at all costs. My husband had to pay $29.00 for the use of high speed internet which could only be used at the clubhouse. For God's sake, even the "no tell-motel" offers high speed internet. OH ... and then their is the donut story. Monday through Friday they offer donuts and coffee out by the pool. We hadn't utilized this "service" until Friday (the day we were leaving). To make it easy (and because my toddler had an ear infection), I went "poolside" to "fetch" breakfast. I approached a woman in this little makeshift tiki hut who was apparently manning the donuts. When I asked her for a few to take back to my room for my family, I was interrogated and made to feel like a bank robber. I almost told her to keep her crusty old donuts but before I could get the words out, she slapped three donuts down on a styrofoam plate and handed them to me. You would have thought she had paid for them out of her own pocket. Perhaps if there is a problem with handing out three donuts to a person you've never seen before, it shouldn't be a service provided. I was actually really embarrassed for even asking for enough to take back to my family. Do your research .... especially before you buy there.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a great stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I can't really understand why Liki Tiki has so many detractors on Tripadvisor. We stayed there for two full weeks for the second time in two years and had a simply great time. The one bedroom units are larger than most in their class, are kept reasonably clean by housekeeping and are very well equipped. You get a welcome pack with coffee, dishwasher and washing machine detergent and, on a two week stay we got a complimentary clean mid-stay including sheet and towel change. The water park is well supervised with plenty of lifeguards on duty and people with kids would find they really enjoyed their time there away from the theme parks. Two small negative incidents are worth a mention though: the paddle boats and bumper boats were unavailable during our stay as an alligator (or more than one) has taken up residence in the Liki Tiki Lake; and we had no fewer than 5 false alarms from the fire alarm in the 900 building one day including a 2.00am wakeup call with fire trucks present.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for KIDS!! 5 Stars on Things to do!!”
Reviews.Author: jrjl2002
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki is one of the best resorts I"ve been to. Been there 3 times in 6 years and I'm going back in May 08 I have 4 kids 3-11, and they all loved it. Waterpark for kids of all ages is there for you on your days off from Disney, full kitchen with everything you need. Washer and Dryer so you can pack light. Tons of stuff to do for the kids, Waterpark is Free, but there is a cost of $75.00 for 6 people for the whole week or 25$ for day you can use everything else. Dinner shows @ condo park..and Grocery close, Tiki Bar is a bit expensive but its a vaction right. Pools are great, staff is always great. Check in can be slow at times depends on the day..Disney close..but LT is not exactly close to Universal and Sea World, but the ammenities far outweigh this inconvienience. New building have been built there in the past 3-4 years Ask for a new unit when you check in!!! Some units aren't in the best condition or have some damage due to everyday wear and tear..BUT HEY!! be realistic these places are used everyday by tourists some with no respect for others property.., check out the room before you carry your stuff in, and if you aren't happy with the one you get LET THEM KNOW . I do everywhere I go,most of the time they will move you if you ask nicely.. If you have to take the tour, (which I have done twice) just say NO, NO, NO, if you dont want to buy..let the sales person know up front your not going to and to make it short and sweet..I always book through Interval International getaways or Island One, non tour reservations, for best deals look on Ebay, check CouponSeven for discount codes all online sites you'll pay less for a full condo than a hotel room with two beds and nothing else!! Even if you have to take the tour, Its worth the 90 minute tour..Small travel tip..Condo is not right on 192 (530), it has a u shaped side street (which I seem to pass everytime..)you take to get to it so check Mapquest.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sara418
Reviews.Content: Like others, I was a little nervous after reading the very bipolar reviews on this resort. People either seem to love it or hate it, no in between! But I have to say that our stay was wonderful. I requested a room in the newer buildings when the reservation was made and that was honored with no problem. We were in the 1200 building, which was perfect. Beautiful facilities, very clean and well kept. The front desk staff was so sweet. They made a point to engage my kids (2 and 4), telling them to go find the Nemo fish in the big tank in the lobby. Upon check-out, a little boy had lost his mom and went running out the front door calling for her. One of the receptionists BOLTED from her seat and ran around to catch him and return him to his mom. We were so impressed with her level of caring! The pool was a blast - perfect for the one day that the adults needed to laze around and recover from hitting the Disney parks all week. The kids were thrilled with staying at the resort that day since they got to play on the slides and then attend the luau that night (my 4 year old went on stage for a hula lesson!) In terms of location, this site is awesome. If you head over to 27 and go North, there's a huge SuperWal-Mart right there on the right. We stocked up the kitchen so we were able to cook several meals ourselves and save $. Also, it was the perfect location for getting to the Disney Parks. If you head north on Avalon, turn right onto Hartzog, it takes you straight into the western Disney entrance, which practically no one uses. That way has zero traffic and few stoplights, so we breezed in and out, avoiding the masses on 192 and the main entrance. I would absolutely stay at this resort again. We had zero complaints!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: CN1215
Reviews.Content: My experience with Liki tiki village was horrible. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. The hotel room was dingy, there was trash around the grounds. There was definetly someone in our room while we were out. My son got hurt on the waterslide, and the lifeguards had no first aid supplies not even an icepack. The staff was rude and and unhelpful. We were phoned by a staff member about timeshare and when I told them I was not interested she hung up on me. To top it all off My credit card was charged with an unauthorized fee and none of the staff has helped to straighten out the matter. They will not even get back to me. It is so sad that we had to put up with such horrible antics of a lousy mis-managed and unprofessional group of people . This place has nothing to offer but stress and frustration. Please stay clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bitdot
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, we just got back from spending two weeks there. Loads of facilities, so many we didn't have time to use all of them. There were three pools I believe (only really used the one outside our hotel room), a water park and a 'lagoon' where there were pedalos to hire and various other activities going on. The on-site restaurant/bar was good, reasonably priced food and drinks with a choice of eating in the seated area or taking your food to sit round the pool. Would definatley recomend this hotel, especially for families. There were only adults in our party though and we felt suitably catered for. All of the staff were friendly and helpful which added to the experience. Only one minor complaint about the bath in the master bathroom - it was rather 'grubby'. Not really an issue though as I had a shower instead!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: 4kidz
Reviews.Content: It's apparent that different people have different experiences at Liki Tiki. However, for my children, my husband and myself, it was quite enjoyable. We were there from 12/22-25/07. We arrived in the evening. When we were checking in, there was a gentleman who came in complaining about the condition of his room and he demanded another room. This got me concerned. However, when we got to our room, it was neat, clean and modern. We had all the amenities of home including a washer and dryer which is really a plus when you have children. The children were able to visit the waterpark and ride on the paddle boats which they really enjoyed. Everything in the room was in working order. The only turn off was a roach that one of the children discovered in the bathroom. But hey, it's Florida, it was wet out and there were trees around. As a Florida native I wasn't that surprised. We did not get to spend as much time as I would have liked on the actual property because we were "park hopping". I plan to go again when the children are on Spring Break. We were in Bldg. 13. I took the advice of one of the reviews I read before going and knew to ask for one of the newer Bldgs which are bldg. 13 and up. All in all it had the comforts of home for the adults (especially mom) as well as a fun atmosphere for the children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: smetanatom
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the resort on Tuesday 2/26 around noon and were ablel to actually get into our room immediately. I had read many of the reviews on here and was concerned prior to our arrival, but those fears quickly went away as our two bedroom condo was very clean, and extremely comfortable. My family and I dropped off our luggage and headed to the parks. There were many activities for the kids throughout our stay from crafts, to tattoos and even a visit from the folks at Gatorland. The pool and waterpark area were great and our family enjoyed spending time there when we weren't running around one of the amusement parks. We used the paddle boats, bumper boats, miniature golf and the basketball courts as well. We have stayed with several timshare resorts, and found liki tiki to be as good or better than any of the other resorts we have stayed with in the past, and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Betheye
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews on this site prior to leaving for our trip. Since there were some negative reviews I emailed the manager, Richard Parks and he responded to my concerns promptly and politely. When we arrived, I was very pleased with our room. After one night we realized our next door neighbors were up late partying - we could hear their TV and the doors until the wee hours. When we asked to be moved to another room, we were quickly placed in another (bigger!) room at the end of the hall. It was extremely quiet and we were pleased. The pool areas were immaculate. The only issue we had were there were no towels at the lagoon for most of the day. The poolside restaurant was a big plus, the food was quite good and service excellent! We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “worst in the u.s”
Reviews.Author: plowmans2007
Reviews.Content: i booked my stay through tnt resorts this was suppose to be our hunnymoon. theres a manager named richard parks. he was the most rudest person i ever met. we had problems everyday with getting into our room (which they only logged once) someone was in our room twice which the manager mr. parks states noone was in there. but again our towels were replaced with new ones 2 days in a row but when he ran a security check @ the end of the week it said noone but me and my husband were in our rom. funny thing is is that he didn't even know security was in our room with there key card everyday. i was invaded and disrespected by the resort and rip off when i left. they tack on state charges for everyday you are there and whe i went to check out after a week i owed over 55.00 in taxes. i talk to corprate and liki tiki was just suppose to give me the bill. but they decided to wait 2 days after we left and charge it to my creditcard. what a place. i got them on the fox 2 hall of shame also. don't stay there, there are many many cheaper nicer places in orlando

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: CheshireRexxie
Reviews.Content: stayed here jan 08 room 430a lovely, extremely spacious rooms, Jacuzzi in room, washing machine, dryer, fully equip kitchen/appliances, dishwasher, polite/helpful staff, very enjoyable stay, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bakeaholic
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, children ages 3 and 7 and our typical hotel expectations are around the lines of a Holiday Inn. We had requested a room in the 1100-1400 buildings, but due to flight delays, didn't get in until 1am and were given a villa in the 400 building. As with many other visitors, I was a bit worried due to some very bad reviews of this property. Overall, we had a good stay, even with a few probs. So here are the pros and cons to help you make a decision. First the Cons: Inside of villa showed wear and tear, nothing major . . some chiped paint on the cabinets. Doors and shower needed a good scrub down (Hotel offered a full maid service, but we didn't want to bother). I invested in $3 lysol wipes and wiped down all handles, remotes, phones and what-not, then never gave it a second thought. (I do this anytime we stay in a hotel anyway) Toaster only toasted on one side (no big deal , we only used it once), couch had seen better days, elevator was out of service for a day, And last but the worst problem of all, No recycle bins. And now the Pros: Security guarded gated entry, we felt extremly safe! Nice exteriors, very clean and well maintained property. VERY quiet property. We almost never heard our neighbors and they tell us they were booked to capicity. Check in took less than 3 mins and check out, less than 45 seconds. Pools were nice, but slides are best for younger children, 7 or under. Great bbqs in pool area. Villa was completely stocked, even had items for baking (we made cookies several times) and a blender. Other than shower and doors, it was very clean. Floors so clean, your white socks stayed white! Loved the layout of the villa, I think it was bigger than my first apartment! Two separate bathrooms, DVD player, And enough soap for two loads of wash and dishes. All employees were very friendly and helpful. Even map quested the local Centra Care when my son came down with dual ear infections. We were asked just once to attend the tour, I said we'd think about it, but they never asked again. Overall, we liked the place. Very good deal for the price. We were perfectly happy there and the cons never effected our enjoyment. We also liked the location. Close to everything you'd need, but out of the hussle a bit.

Reviews.Title: “loved liki tiki”
Reviews.Author: Rickki27
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous because of all the bad reviews I read about liki tiki, I still took a chance and booked it. It was the best gut decision I made. We stayed week of Feb.02 til 09, The employees are great !always had a smile. the time share was offered to us very politley I must say but when we declined they accepted with a smile and left us alone. The lagoon & pools were amazing. Water was clean & heated +++ this was perfect for our daught of 24mths. Security is a +++ and friendy too made you feel right at home. We stayed in 1 bedroom villa, which was very clean & spacious. Everything was supplied +++ For the price I paid I would definatly return and recommend this place to everyone I know. I am very shocked at the bad reviews I read-- (What where you people thinking that there would be a butler in each room!!!! or a red carpet rolled out for you) Clearly the bad reviews are from individuals who expect a magic carpet ride to be real !!!! I cannot find anything negative to say about this resort. Thank you Liki Tiki for making my stay a pleasant & memorable one SEE YA SOON :):)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: jpinj2
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed a the Liki Tiki resort on Jan 17-23, 2008. Our kids are 16 and 11. We got a great rate of $89 a night plus tax. With the kids getting older, i look for a room with seperate bedrooms now. When we got there there was no one at the timeshare desk. Perfect! Check in was quick, 10pm at night. I asked if we were getting one of the new rooms at check in. The clerk said its not our newest, let me check whats available. Do you mind a bottom floor room. I said no problem so long as its the NEWEST rooms. We got a 1st floor room in section 1300. It is perfect!!! Full kitchen, everything looked like it had never been used. Large living room with a sleeper sofa. Large master bedroom with a jucuzzi tub for 2!!! With a glass shower. Kids have there own bathroom, [regular bathroom] next to there room with 2 twin beds. All three rooms have a plasma tv, living room has the largest, with lights on the side. There is also a patio, enclosed, balconey if you have upper floor rooms. Great for checking the weather, and sitting with a glass of wine or coffee in the morning. Be careful how much bubble bath you use in the jucuzzi, we almost filled the whole room up. No maid service at all. But you have a washer and dryer in your room. They provide you with packets of laundry soap and dishwasher soap for $1 each. We used it once to wash towels and go home with clean clothes. Also came in handy when we got caught in a downpour at Magic Kingdom. They said the rain would start at 8 and by 630 it was pouring nonstop. We really needed the dryer for our coats and sneakers. The time share people called the room. If you dont want to talk dont answer the phone. I answered the second time and told them i would talk to my husband about it and that was the end of it. Be careful by the pool, i stepped out the jucuzzi, which wouldnt turn on by the main pool, and stepped into an ant hill. My feet were bit up bad for over a week. It was dark out. Water shoes would have been good. The pool and jucuzzi were pretty warm for january. Don't got ot 7 11, go to Publix. Even Walgreens prices were outragous. We just got milk, eggos, banannas, cereal, and a loaf of bread, and butter. I was there to eat in the parks. Also a case of water. We each carried one bottle, or i had them in my bag. It saves a ton of money, even 4 per day. I would Love to stay there again and try the water park next time. We are planinng a trip in October to relax with no parks and sit at the hotel pool and waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “loved liki tiki”
Reviews.Author: MARLOR5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at liki tiki village 1/6/08 to 1/13/08 and LOVED IT!! I was very hot this week with temps in the 80's. We have 2 girls 7 and 9 and they loved the pools and the lagoon. We stayed in a 2 bedroom in the 500 building. room 513 c. The pool was right out side and the kids loved it. The condo was nice and clean and spacous. The bedroom were big and comfy. All the employees at Liki Tiki were very helpful and nice. If we had any questions or problems, such as needing a few more garbage bags, they were handled quickly!! We went to Univerisal studios this year and we were about 20 mins away but very very easy to get to. One of the things I really liked was it was a gated community with a guard at the front. There is a walmart up the road on rt 27 about 10 mins away. I would recomment this instead of the publix as that was very expensive. There is plenty of resturants around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the newer units at Liki Tiki Village Resort!”
Reviews.Author: zephrin
Reviews.Content: The initial unit that was reserved for us was in very poor condition! Only after we complained did the front desk put us in the 1022E unit which was awesome! The newer units are 5 Stars but the older units are very poorly maintained! It is misleading to list Liki Tiki Village as a 5 Star resort because clearly the older units are not in that category! It is very important to know your unit at Liki Tiki Village Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: BayouChica
Reviews.Content: We were booked for a one-bedroom villa. We were upgraded to the new building room 1343F. When we arrived, it looked like someone either didn’t make the bed or someone was playing on it. Also, there was trash in 2 out of 3 trashcans. We called the front desk and the cans were emptied and bed linens were changed within 10 minutes. We also got a voucher for a free meal because of this. After one night in this villa, we decided it was too small for 2 adults, a 3 1/2 year old, and an 18 month old. We requested to be upgraded to a two-bedroom. This was granted for a $100 fee. Our new room was 1351E. It was about 3 times the size of the one-bedroom. It certainly met all of our expectations. The girls had their own room and so did we. There were 2 full bathrooms and a full size washer and dryer. Some things this villa had that the one-bedroom did not have (but should have) were laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, resort directory, TV channel guide, and soap. Pros: Screened porch (the other buildings did not have this luxury when traveling with children) Nicely decorated Spacious – living room, dining room, 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, full kitchen, nice size closets, utility closet (with vacuum, mop, and broom) Mattresses – Sealy Posturpedic that were very comfortable: king-size master bed, 2 queen beds in the 2nd bedroom TV – 3 flat panel/screen TVs with a DVD player in the living room. We were able to get HBO and Showtime. Full size washer and dryer Fireworks - Able to see partial view of Disney fireworks from the balcony each night. Alarm clock Boom box with CD player Cons: Noise – from the lock-off door We did not hear neighbors from the other adjoining wall, but only from the lock-off door area. Door lock – with a push down on the door handle it would open. There was no other form of lock/security. This was a problem with my kids. Other places we have stayed have a latch for a better sense of security. Master bedroom/bathroom suite – the shower and tub are not separated from the actual bedroom. This was disruptive in the morning when my husband woke up early to shower before his meeting. Other amenities on the property were a fun pool area, bar, and a sundries/gift shop. These are amenities that we used. The main pool with the slides was generally on the cool side. It was too cold for me. We spent a lot of time in the toddler pool that was so warm like a bath. Also, there was what we called the adult pool over by the townhouses. It was a bit quieter, with very few people. The water in this pool was warm. There was also a hot tub in this area. The temperatures in January were crazy, anywhere from 45-70. So, water temperature made a big difference as to which pool you were to choose. Yes, we were the crazy ones swimming in 45 degree weather (along with many other people). A great feature the main pool had was a gradual increase in the water depth. There was an area where it started out like on a beach, it gradually got deeper. Pool towels are provided at the pool areas. Major complaint about room 1343F, which we only stayed in one night was that the front door was not plumb/square. There was a big gap on the bottom left and top right. When I say big, I mean about 2 inches. You could see the light and I am sure a great spot for pests to enter. Before moving to our final destination of the beloved room 1351E, I checked out townhouse 101 C. It was one of the oldest buildings. I was expecting a whole lot worse. It was actually very nice. Because it was a townhouse, the bedrooms were upstairs. The master bedroom had a king bed and balcony. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds. There were 2 bathrooms, one upstairs and one downstairs. It had a very nice size screened in porch downstairs. There was a living room and full kitchen. I don’t recall a dining room, but I am sure there was at least a dining room table. I would have considered staying in this villa if my kids weren’t so small. My biggest issue was safety with the stairs and the balcony was not screened in. Disney World was 20 minutes away. It was very easy to get to. If there was traffic, it could take up to 30 minutes. We did not go to Universal, but I do believe it is a bit farther. Liki Tiki is on Hwy 192 with is also called Irlo Bronson Hwy a few miles up the road. Within about 2 miles is a 24 hour Walgreens. There is also a Super Walmart nearby (I just went to the closest Publix). There are 2 Publix groceries, one east and one west. There are several restaurants, fast-food chains and gift shops within 2-7 miles. Within 10 or 15 miles was Old Town that my 3 year old absolutely loved. Just don’t eat at the Chinese restaurant there. It was horrible. Front desk information: The check in was fine. I do believe the front desk crew should take classes on customer service. Initially, they are not too friendly, but if you keep being nice to them, they finally come around. If you locked into a time-share tour, sorry. If you want less expensive amusement park tickets, then do the time-share tour. We didn’t want to be subjected to the time and hassle so, we got tickets on our own. Remember you have the right to say no to the timeshare spiel (unless it is part of your package). All in all, I would stay here again. We had a very nice and comfortable stay in the 2 bedroom villa 1351E.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever! No 5 star resort more like 1 Star”
Reviews.Author: buckeyechamp
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki has the worse customer service ever. Numerous items in Condo not working and replaced with non like items. They have known issue with all their 32 inch flatscreen tv's that they know do not work, but instead of replacing expect guests to call Maint every day to reset the tv's in order to work... After 3rd time requested replacement and they brought up a 19" very old Tv. Managers lied on several occasions about calling and/or visiting to check up/resolve issues. They never called back as promised on 3 occasions. Resort has water park advertiesed to be open at 10:00 AM and when ypou drag your kids their ready to play there are a bunch of lazy lifeguards sitting around and they do not want to open because they are chilly (65 and sunny is not cold when visiting from the north and a heated pool). When park finally opens ... No Towels and takes 4 calls by employees and myself to customer care to get towels 1.5 hours later. Manager statess someone "stole 3 racks last week" ... but I guess they could not figure that they should buy more for their guests. The Wave Pool is non operational "It just broke last week...right", but whole week there never saw any attempt to fix. When taking kids to their bumber boats, maint guys say unavailable because they are cleaning all day. I guess never occured to the report to clean during non customer use hours. Would never go back to this resort if you paid me as too much hassel trying to get the basic things that should be included in a a resort that they advertise and you have paid for. STAY AWAY FROM LIKI TIKI!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought!”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal16
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at Liki Tiki and I must say it wasn't so bad. we got a room at the 600 building even though I asked for the new building. we were in our room within 5 minutes of checking in and that was great because of our 2 year old daughter. we had a 1-bedroom, the room was a nice size with a fully functioning kitchen, washer dryer, balcony, 1 bathroom and 2 tv's. we were provided a small basic welcome package of laundry detergent, dishwasher soap, paper roll, toilet paper and tissue. the room was a little out dated with bad wallpaper and run down bathroom but the kitchen was nicely equiped with new appliances. the hotel was in nice shape, very clean and a cool water park pool. I would definitly recommend this hotel for what its worth. I definitly recommend requesting the new buildings which are much nicer ( we saw them) 1200, 1400 buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this resort and travellers beware.”
Reviews.Author: Topacer
Reviews.Content: Not what you pay for - travellers beware. The price may be a good deal, but if you want your sheets and towels changed or your room cleaned it will cost you extra. If you want shampoo, dish soap, laundry soap it too will cost you extra. If you want to print at the business office that too will cost you as will using the phone. So add it all up and just stay at a more expensive place and save the extra travel cost and the other extra charges. The accommodations were dated and worn and kitchen supplies sparce, not to mention ants. It's way out in the middle of nowhere so it's a good 5-10 minutes to get to restuarants and other emenities. We've stayed at other resorts in Orlando area on past trips and this was the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: kjrehbein
Reviews.Content: Booked 2-2bedroom suites both in the 1400 building, very nice accomodations, nice staff no problems at all. Was concerned prior to arriving but all fears were put aside upon arrival. Pool is nice for young kids 3-16 years old. A car is necessary if you choose to stay here however.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki never again”
Reviews.Author: travelinwolffpack
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low-budget type of resort to crash while going to Disney with the kids the Liki Tiki might work for you but it is not what you may be looking for if you are used to updated, clean facilities with manicured landscaping. The pool area is great for kids 5-18. We had very small kids and couldn't really make use of the facilities, although there were charcoal BBQ's which on one side of the resort which was convenient - but at night there were no lights so if you didn't bring a flashlight you need to walk your food over to an outdoor light to see. The unit itself was very dirty. We complained and they came in and mopped one day while we we were out but we couldn't tell the difference afterward. We had a crawling infant and her clothes would turn black from the dirty tile and carpet which was very old and not clean. The units were very old and need to be updated. The landscaping is tropical, but not well managed. The facilities themselves are not very clean. I noticed a dirty sock on the sidewalk the day we checked-in and it was still there 2 days later. They seem to push the timeshare sales pretty hard and on the weekend the lobby area resembles a vegas casino with all the sales activity going on. Lastly, they kill you with the little things. We asked for trash bags about 4 times in a week because with each request we would get 2 bags. Why couldn't they just give us a half dozen trash bags? They did not have packing take or masking tape so I had to make a special trip to the store to purchase tape to send a package. To their credit, the pool area was well managed and clean. The bar area was nice and bartender friendly with cool hair.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki is Icky Yucky”
Reviews.Author: Scooby26
Reviews.Content: Travel dates: Dec. 21st - 28th, 2007. Rooms are in need of remodeling. Our shower leaked into the room below us. Staff is extremely rude and unhelpfull. Hotel shuttle to parks was late every day. One day it was 2 1/2 hours late. Do not agree to "VIP Check-in" unless you want to sit through a timeshare presentation. They say the presentation is only 60 minutes, it's actually 2 hours long. Buy your Disney tickets online before you travel, much cheaper. Rent a car, don't rely on hotel shutte to parks. Hotel is too far from attractions. Taxi for 7 people to Pirate Show was $80.00 round trip. Best bet is to stay at one of the Disney Resorts and rent a car to go to other attractions. Disney has free shuttles to all their attractions from their resorts. All other attractions are close to Disney. Only good thing about Liki Tiki is the Pool/Water Park area. But all other things considered, it does not make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: leadsds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki Dec 16-23 and were very pleased with our stay. They have older 2 story villas which are updated and very clean and also several brand new high rise buildings that were very modern and comfortable. Check in was very quick and the clerk very accomodating. We requested to be placed in the new villas and she gave up the top floor in building 1200. Our garbage disposal was not working and the bathroom sink was plugged and within a few hours all was completely fixed. The villa also had a large plasma TV mounted on the wall; unfortunately we couldn't figure out how to play a DVD and again the maintenance man was at our door within 20 minutes and showed us the process. The grounds were spotless, and housekeepers always cleaning. There is a large adult pool that was clean and warm plus a whirlpool with nice contemporary music over the speakers. OR, there was the waterpark pools for families with children; always something going on there that was wonderful for the children. We exchanged into this property through Interval International and we definitely give Liki Tiki a "Thumbs Up" in all respects and we would return again. As an added note, we told the timeshare people we were not interested in their presentation and they totally left us alone for the entire stay. How impressing is that???

Reviews.Title: “Great Location////Horrible Sales PITCH!!!”
Reviews.Author: merpaul
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I returned from a wonderful vacation to Disneyworld and decided to use our timeshare. We used our exchange week at Liki Tiki Resort. I was a little hesitate to stay at Liki Tiki with all the bad reviews, but since this was the closet property that had availabily to Disneyworld, we stayed here. We stayed from 12/1-12/8. We are were in Building 1000. the room was spacious and perfect for the 2 of us. We had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, but only used one bedroom. One thing to remember is to bring a sponge for the kitchen since they don't provide one. We are also use to hosekeeping coming in at least once a week to change the towels, but they don't do this here, you have to pay extra to have them clean your room. So it was good we had 2 bathrooms, we just took the towels from that one. I don't like the way the master bedroom was set up. The toliet was separate in its own room, white the shower was spacious, but no where to put your shampoo or conditioner ( on the floor of the shower) the hot tub was in the general vicinity of the bathroom and the master bedroom was right in that room. There is a nice kitchen and a nice living room area, with enough TV stations for us. There was HBO which was cool too. Disneyworld is about 8 miles away, it is quick to get there. We rented a car too. The Resort is located on Rt 192, there is a Publix Supermarket down the street, and in the same plaza the library where you can use the internet for FREE. ( the resort charges you $5.95 for 24 hours) If you head to Route 27 there is a 24 hour Super Walmart //On Route 192 are all sorts of places to eat and Big Tourist Bargain Shops. In order to get our discounted Disney tickets we had to sit through a sales pitch to buy into the Naviago Resort Club. The Sales Agents when we checked in told us it would not be more than an hour 1/2, well we were mistaken. Even though we said NO at least 4 times, they kept pressuring us to buy, buy, buy and 3 1/2 hours later they got the hint. Needless to say I won't ever stay here again. We didn't use any of the amenities, since we were here to sleep and go to the parks only. Although we did take the tour, I think the waterpark is a little misleading through the pictures I saw. If you have any further questions, feel free to email me!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jessika_2987
Reviews.Content: So I just got back from Liki Tiki yesterday. After reading some of the reviews, I was a little bit skeptical about going. We stayed on the 5th floor of the 800 building which was right in front of the waterpark. We never encountered any problems with the suite and thought it was really nice. I loved the waterpark, the week we went was an "off week" where there wasn't tons of people there. I loved the wavepool and they have tons of activities for kids. We never got a phone call or anyone trying to persuade us into getting a time share. They never bothered us at all. The "swamp" as some call it was actually beautiful. We woke up in the morning and you could see the ducks and turtles swimming in there,I thought it was amazing. This resort is fairly close to all restaurants probably about 5-7 miles away. Also Disney is only a couple of exits away. I am already booking my room for next years vacation. I would recommend this resort to anyone who asked. Even if you don't get the newer buildings it's still very nice here. All the lifeguards are extremely friendly and up for a chat with anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: cocoanutgroove
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki is a great place for families! The dingy dust-ridden "suite" will bring your family closer than you thought possible--because it's so small you'll be crawling over each other to get around. If you're looking for recreation the resort has a lovely water park nestled between two swamps that evokes the image of what Caligula's bath house must have look like during one of Rome's famous org--... well you know. If you plan on just sleeping there, and spending the days enjoying the sites of Orlando, Universal, Disney, and all the tourist traps you'll be delighted to find that the resort is not actually in Orlando, but several towns over, and the nearest chain restaurant or shopping center is about 20-minutes off... the attractions are another ten to twenty.

Reviews.Title: “Good place and time”
Reviews.Author: suzyq9241
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) have just returned from a 8day stay at the Liki Tiki. The one bedroom condo in the 1200 is new and we have never been asked about a timeshare-not once. It was the bed mattress that I had a problem with- it was clean but it sagged a little in the middle. We had just one thing to complain about... the outside walkway to get to the condo from the elevator-dirty- the breakfast in the morning is lovely..continental spread with bagels, donuts etc. Liki Tiki is about a 10-15 minutes drive to go to the theme parks. The pool is lovely, not as big as some of the others. The pool lifeguards were friendly, they would say good morning to you when you walked in. The lagoon area-good even if you are only with your husband. We paid $200 for thanksgiving week through Island One on Ebay-my thought- excellent value. If I had the chance to rent it again I would .....

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent place for adults AND kids!- - Perfect can't even Discibibe it!!!”
Reviews.Author: LikiTikilover
Reviews.Content: After reading past negitive reviews about liki tiki, we were quite nervous to go, but it ended up the BEST trip ever! It was great for adults and even better for kids, while the parents could go to the bar as the kids swim their hearts or, or one of the many other choices. Our room was Spacy, clean, and had every thing needs--Incuding a big TV for those nights after the pool! Peferct isn't good enough, but I guess if we triple perfect..it = Liki Tiki! If you have the chance please go! you will love it♥! AKA: The best vacation spot for family, friends, grandparents and how we enjoyed it--Cousins! If we could we would give it a mark out of 5 would be 1000000000000000000, but I guess we will have to go with 5..seeing we dont want to break the computer..even though liki tiki is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Resort was nice, but timeshare pressure higher than most. . .”
Reviews.Author: drewrox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Orlando for our honeymoon, and swapped our timeshare for a place here for the week. First of all, the place is fairly close to Disney, but far away from International Drive, or Universal Studios. The place was dressed up nice, but the condo's we stayed in had an Air Conditioner farm in front of each building that I compared to the Cadillac Ranch in Texas, only for Air Conditioner Fans. The Stopper in the whirlpool tub wouldn't seal, so we were not able to use this. When we called to talk to the maintenance staff, few could even speak English, we never got service. Walls were paper thin. (Next door, the tenants had a baby that was up every morning at 6 am. And so were we. . . . . . ) They called SEVERAL times to get us to come listen to a timeshare. I would say very inopportune times, but then again we were on our honeymoon. . . . **drops two penny's on the table and walks out of the room**

Reviews.Title: “Potential for excellence, but currently average”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer_Rob
Reviews.Content: We did an interval exchange for a week, so we were treated as owners. The room was spacious for just myself and my wife. We were in the 1200 building on the outer circle. New appliances, nice flat screen tv, but only player is in main room, so if you want to play dvds at nite on bedroom tv, bring your own. Nice Jacuzzi in the main bath, but it is INCREDIBLY noisy for 5 minutes after you finish while it dries itself, so be prepared to shut the door and vacate the bedroom until it is done. We did the timeshare presentation and got out fairly quickly by saying (truthfully) that we were DVC owners and asking to compare point values. The Disney points beat theirs hands down for Disney properties and cruises, our preferred vacation. If you are knowledgeable about timeshares and can speak intelligently, you can get out in 1.5 hours (they tell you "about" an hour;; don't believe them. We were the first ones done--most families took at least 2 hours). . The timeshare breakfast is ok. However, the resort breakfast is mini donuts and a small glass of juice, The nominal policy is that you can't bring drinks to the main pool, but we had no problem with Propel and Gatorade, and soft drinks. We ordered alcohol from Sally's, and that may be why none of the staff bothered us about the other drinks. We actually enjoyed jammin jimmy and his karaoke by the pool. This is moderately convenient to the parts. . This resort COULD be excellent--needs paint and some sharp management. Right now it is average, far below the nicest places where we have stayed in Orlando, but reasonably clean and plenty of room. Bottom line: Average place with some benefits and drawbacks. If you can get it inexpensively, its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: utopiahereicome
Reviews.Content: We are Florida residents, took our 8 year old grandson with us for a long weekend of Disney parks. Liki Tiki was a great choice for us - large, clean one bedroom apartment with a massive bathroom (even had a spa tub), well-stocked kitchen, DVD player. Check-in and check-out was speedy and uneventful. The grounds are gated with security at the gate 24/7. We were hoping to spend some time in the pool/water park, but the weather was too cold for swimming- in fact, we spent so much time at the parks that we really didn't get to take advantage of all the activities on site (paddle boats, ,mini-golf, etc). Disney was about a 10 minute ride away, which we didn't feel was far (although there was very little traffic at this time of year). Only negative - flat, skimpy pillows on the bed! We enjoyed our stay and will return, but will bring our own pillows next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 1Adventurelover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the 1300 building. It was very nice and very clean. Appliances seemed new. Great flat screen TVs. The pools were nice. The help was very nice. Our only unpleasant experience was the timeshare sale. It was very high pressure even though they assured us it would not be. They had lots of trouble hearing "no".

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but major problems”
Reviews.Author: csstrub
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fine, little out dated, but worked for 9 family members. Problems accured when security left our door wide open for 10 hours while painters painted the balcony and used out bathroom. We came home from the parks at 9pm to find out door wide open. We went around with customer care and the front desk for about 6 hours and finally got a credit on the room. Well, when getting our receipt from the front desk they tried to pay us off with free lunch, instead of a credit. What a Joke!!! After refusing and laughing at them, they gave us a free night. After checking my credit card later in the week, they actually charged us $500 more. Will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Kids absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: grusso1127
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after i booked this trip, after reading previous reviews. However, I knew to book the new towers (unit 1400) and we absolutely loved our 2 br unit. Everything was brand new. Our shower was 3 headed shower. We were with our 2 boys ages 6 and 8, who loved the pool. everyday we went to a theme park, and all they did was ask to come back to the hotel to go in the pool. My inlaws came and stayed with us from wed-sat and we still had more than enough room. Everything was very clean. The lifeguards on duty by the pool, were always walking around and we were able to relax in peace knowing they were well guarded. We did the time share for around hour, received $75 and breakfast. I did tell them, i did enjoy my stay and our unit was superb, however, I dont think i would have liked to stay in the villas. They look old and are in need of repair. As a matter of fact, when we checked in, our room was not ready, and i insisted on waiting for a room in the new tower. The services were also outstanding. our toilet clogged one day, and a maintenance person came immediately to fix it. If it were just me and my husband staying, i do not think i would have stayed here. There really are no restaurants or bars, only an outside grill and bar by the pool. But my kids absolutely loved this hotel and i would go back again, not only for the price, but they had a great time. We were a hop, skip and jump away from disney, and minutes from walmart. i would consider this a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice good service”
Reviews.Author: JimfromWI
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at liki tiki in oct .We had a great time some of the review's we read kinda made this place sound like a dump. We stayed in the 900 building and was not a dump. Very nice carpet was a little old and air cond stop working twice but both times they came right up and fixed it . Very close to D-W and traffic was not that bad. Our kids loved the pool area great for kids ages 4 to 12 or so. They never said anything to us about a timeshare. We loved it and would stay there again for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Moment at the Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1321
Reviews.Content: We just got back (10/7-10/13/07) and had the best time at the Liki Tiki. We were in the 1300 building and everything was beautiful! The water harbor activities and pools gave us a break from the scorching sun at Disney. A great place for kids of all ages! The rooms were clean and decor was up to date. Check in and out was a breeze. All of the staff members at the resort were extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this resort to everyone! Ignore all the bad reviews. And for those we really need a negative point...the resort could use a few towel bars in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki is Good.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_from_Titus
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week and it was great. It is a slightly older hotel and does have some signs of wear. But if your looking for a nice room and the amenities that include a waterpark at your hotel, this is the place. The check-in was fast and friendly. advice on the timeshare offers, just don't answer the phone and you won't have a problem......they only called me once. The waterpark was phenomenal....KIDS HAD A BLAST!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Little Ones and Privacy!”
Reviews.Author: mangomills
Reviews.Content: Was nervous about getting an older room - had read some bad reviews about upkeep, etc. so I requested one of the new buildings when I booked it. Very happy I did - the new buildings are across from the pool and far enough away from the Karaoke singers at night so it was nice and quiet. Check-in was very slow but otherwise, no problems at all. Room was clean and very nice - flat screen in living room and sanitary sheets for pull-out sofa bed. Full kitchen with plenty of dishes and dish soap, a coffee maker (no coffee), and pitcher ofr water or juice. Lots of storage space for snacks and food we brought with us. Beds were very comfortable and we slept great - the pillows weren't 2 feet high like most hotels! There was a jacuzzi tub in the master, plus glass shower, plus two bathrooms - plenty for us five. We brought soap for the kids and the showers - there was none in the room so I was happy we planned ahead. Brand new washer and dryer so we could clean clothes before heading for home. It is lovebug season so we did not spend time on the patio (somehow they get into everything, even though it was completely screened in) but it was spacious with a table and chairs for four. Pool area was great for the kids - volleyball for adults and little fountains popping up from the ground for babies. Water was cold though - I would have thought it would be heated. Fine for the kids but I'm spoiled. There is a playground for them to run around and a mini-golf course, too. One restaurant we knew of - great food and very inexpensive. Pitchers were $6.50 I think - can't beat that! Overall great hotel for the price and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling with little kids so you can have your own space, too. We were not asked once to participate in any timeshare or vacation property presentations. It was an easy 15 minute trip to Disney World and located right next to 7-11 for coffee and necessities if needed. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cuizon
Reviews.Content: After reading as many reviews as possible I must admit I was very nervous--but........we arrived and check in was very quick and painless--we were approached about time share and politely declined--not another mention of it the remainder of our stay--we were given 1200 block--we arrived to find a great room that was clean and had more than what we could possibly hope for--the entire staff was unbelievably polite and helpful--the 1 and only suggestion is that the restaurant should be open a little later--I would and have strongly reccommended liki tike to friends--it is a great place to stay and I will definitely use them again--you people and your hotel are the best of the lot--thank you for a great vacation and I look forward to seeing you all again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Nigtmare”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTina
Reviews.Content: This place is so horrible that my family and I checked out after only being there for 20 minutes!!!! Dirty Dirty Dirty!!! The staff was rude and actually tried telling me it is rated a 4 star. Yeah right. Unfortunately my sister and her family ended up staying and when we returned to see her got a second look at the dump. Pool is overcrowded with life guards sleeping behind their sunglasses and get this, at this fine 4 star resort you get your own D.J. that screams profanity when announcing what kind of beer in a pitcher you can get for $5.00. If something wasn't rusty then it is broken. Don't Go!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay i went with my fiance and my friend and her boyfriend”
Reviews.Author: cutieinsi25
Reviews.Content: me and my fiance and my friend and her boyfriend stayed there from aug 31 to sept 3. we had fun. the place was nice,clean. we got a one bedroom condo. all the amenties where great. they only problem we had was we where on the first floor the last door by a corner so we had cricket and lizards in our room. salmentar on outside. it wasnt bad at all. i would defiantely go back and recomended to my friends or other people. we also didnt spend alot of time in the room only to sleep. we where doing the parks during the day and sleeping in our room at night. the pools and hot tubs were gergerous. the kid pool was cool. there alot to do with kids at the kiddie pool

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: philnkris
Reviews.Content: We went at the last minute with our four children ages 6 through 10, we went solely on the pictures of the pool on the website. This was just a one night get away at the last minute. I never read any other reviews at this hotel which is unusual for me. Anyway, when we arrived the front desk staff was very nice and polite, after reading these other reviews I can only say this, don't stay in the center circle of buildings or the "older" buildings, spend the extra money and get into the 1300-1700 buildings, these are brand new and are gorgeous condominium units, we had a huge plasma tv in the living room, and flat screen tvs in each of the bedrooms, we had a two bedroom unit. A king bed in our bedroom, two beds in the kids room and a pulll out sofa as well. Towels by the pool were in abundance. Heres my secret tip : list twenty names and phone numbers for them to contact to sell time shares to, you will get an awesome towel gift or back pack thing by the pool at the towel concession booth, I put down goof, daffy duck, president bush etc. get it????" Our unit was not ready when we got there but the very nice clerk found one for us, the pool was interesting but very very crowded, the food at the bar was reasonable and not too bad for bar type food, the kids had a great time, I think I would go back, the time share pitch wasn't over pressured at all, they gave us a free gift upon check in and we told them we weren't interested in any more and that was that. The room we had was brand new, extremely clean and had a huge spa tub that was awesome. My only drawback of this resort was that there is no room service or in room movies. But there is a publix grocery just out the front gate to the Right and a 7-11 for whatever you need and you can cook in your own room. The bar staff by the pool are fun and nice, but the drinks are watery, and they don't carry Captain Morgan, oh well I survived. I hope this helps, just keep in mind this is an older resort with some new additions to it, just make sure you stay in the new buildings, you will be very happy and won't have any problems. But your going to spend about 100 more a night. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “IT SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: grandmaandpa
Reviews.Content: torn carpets, frayed furniture, rusty appliances, stained sheets, decaying poolside surfaces, not too clean!! Hardly a red-star place and there are far better choices in the area. Only redeeming feature is the kids will love the water park, even if the wave pool and bumper boats are not working, and you may have to wait for pool towels.

Reviews.Title: “Not Horrible....Yet”
Reviews.Author: tr109
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3yrs ago and it has definitly gone down hill. Not filthy but I wouldn't say really clean. I think the bad reviewers didn't like the hard t/s sell. we were there 7/28-8/4/07, rented 2 2bedroom villas and my 16 total family members (8kids 8adults) had a great time. We were never bothered to try to buy a t/s. Our rooms were right next door to each other in the old 300 units. They are surely worn down but the were both clean. The activities by the pool were run by very nice staff. They were friendly to everyone in our group, but we are very friendly people. Our kids LOVED it there. The other pool that was right accross the parking lot from us was nice and had gas grills you could bbq on and plenty of tables to eat outside at. My only complaint was a lot of teenagers climbing on the landscaping walls and diving into a pool that was way to shallow. Security came and told them not to over and over but my question was "where are all these kids parents". My children were taught not to act like animals whether I'm there or not!!!!! If that is the new customer base this place will be really bad soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Liki TIKI”
Reviews.Author: mz12345
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 1 week at Liki Tiki Orlando 8-4-07 thru 8-11-07,We found it to be a bit run down,we had stayed at other area resorts and they were newer and better.My family had a 2 bedroom unit in the 1300 building it was basically ok,carpet badly worn and the elevator was out of order 3 times.Beware of there high pressure time share promo,we told them we were unhappy with the property and we were treated hostily be a nasty salesman.The water park looks much nicier in photos than it actually is.Do yourself a favor and book at one of the other resorts off rte 192 there are several.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: dasf
Reviews.Content: We reviewed several comments prior to our stay and seen they went from great to poor. We now know that the good comments are probably from the timeshare salesmen, We couldnt get into the gate thanks to the new security manager who had no clue what he was doing, we finally got through and discovered our room was not ready, and the front desk was not courteous informing us. When we actually got to the room my white socks turned black in a few minutes of walking on the carpet, and our daughter found personal items on the floor that was not ours! When we asked for a hair dryer, our hair was dry by the time they arrived. Most of the staff were rude. We asked to speak to resort manager and he was not available, but the director of resorts operations was. Were sorry we waited the 45 minutes to speak with her, she was rude, arrogant, and offered no solution to the problems. SHE BLATENLY LAUGHED IN OUR FACE We will never stay at this resort again. Oh by the way staff told us that this resort has changed names around three to five times in the last couple of years, and we can see why.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for families with children”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom3Boys
Reviews.Content: We visited Liki Tiki in May 2005 and had a wonderful time. We had two children at the time, ages 4 and 1 1/2 and they had a very fun time in the water park pool area. One of my requirements for a hotel was a zero depth pool so my kids could play in the water without being held. This hotel also has an actual kiddie pool that is in the shade and is about a foot deep. There is a big slide and also slides for children as young as my cautious four year old. I think the rates for this hotel are very acceptable for what you get. We stayed in a one bedroom for $89 a night. We did have a good walk to the water park area however. We are planning another visit to Florida in November and are going to stay at the Liki Tiki again, this time a two bedroom with a rate of $151 a night and that is high because we are staying near Thanksgiving. Our children are now ages 6, 4 and 1 1/2 and I'm sure they'll love it just as much as they did before. I really reccomend this hotel if you are looking for an inexpensive hotel with a great swimming area for young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation for the kids”
Reviews.Author: jsmsmaria
Reviews.Content: Please don't go by all the negative reviews. I was pleased with this resort. My children loved it. The lagoon was just wonderful for them, shoot I even had fun swimming in it. They have 4 water slides one is even for us adults. As for it being crowed, it really wasn't that bad. The lagoon closes about 8:00 p.m. but there are about 3 other pools behind some units. I went to the pool behind the 500 units and that closes at midnight. The rooms were good. Very spacious and clean. As for the timeshare tour, well you have a choice my friends. You could either do it or don't. The minute you check in they direct you to someone who can schedule you for a tour all you have to do is say yes or no. I saved money by going to Walmart which is like 5 minutes away. I posted some pics for you to get an idea about the resort. If you have any questions please email me. I would be more than happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst EVER!”
Reviews.Author: traveloften4
Reviews.Content: First I need to say the rooms were very nice, but that is about the only good thing about this "resort". I use those words very lightly. THe walls were so thin, the neighbor and I were dueling tv's. It is a time share. They call you on the phone to bother you about coming to their "breakfast", then they give tours of the pools while you are sitting there. Very cheesy since you are on display for future buyers. The wave pool not working. The bumper boats closed. An hour wait to peddle boat. The one pool had very gross, slimy things floating in it. Filtration system not working, I guess. The fire alarm went off at 10:30 p.m., People were complaining this was the 4th time this week. Some people packed and left. No explanation for the alarm. Roach in the room. The worst thing is that they double charged my credit card and on check out would not let me leave w/o paying another night. Then the clerk lied and told me she called my bank personally and they told her the refund was issued. She could not have gotten in my accout b/c she did not have my personal info. Finally the manager on duty came out and told me she did "lie" and that they called the reservations department and got the money refunded, but they never did call my bank. The other clerk on duty was screaming at me b/c I told them they had lied to me. It was just crazy. This was a VACATION!?!?! I was so aggravated leaving there. NEVER AGAIN! This is a poorly run "resort" to say the least. You would do better going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Both Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: LaidBackDad
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Liki Tiki resort the week of June 21st 2007 (4 adults and 2 children). I must say that I was a little worried after reading all of the negative reviews online. However, for the most part, I was really suprised. The grounds were just beautiful and units were wonderful. There were the usual quirks, like not enough towels or dish soap, but a simple call to the office, and those items were taken care of very timely. The waterpark was nice, and my kid's loved the slides. Although, I do think the photos make it look a lot nicer than it actually is. The pools were fine too and the location isn't bad. Just 10 minutes from Disney and 20 minutes from other attractions. There is a close grocery store and a Wal Mart within 2 miles. There were however, a few items, which I found to be real negatives with this resort. First, it is a timeshare and as a result, they will try to preasure you into attending a timeshare sales meeting. Every morning you would see the timeshare sales reps (Vultures, as I like to call them) gathered around the pool and lobby...kind of steals some of the beauty away from the tropical landscaping!! Also, I don't know if it is the free waterpark, but this resort seemed to really draw a wild crowd, at least the week we were there. I have never been to resort in Orlando which had so many unruley kids and teenages just running wild. They would take over the pool every afternoon and break just about every posted rule. One day, my 8 year old daughter even told me that someone had even ripped the sink right off the wall at the pool changing room/bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “It depends on your expectations?”
Reviews.Author: mikeobiwan
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, children ages 8 and 4, stayed at the Liki Tiki for a week in July. I have previewed every review on this site as well as any others that I could get my hands on and came to the following conclusions: 1) Many of the complaints that you read involve the Timeshare ordeal, which we did not do. Simply put, they ask you about it at check-in and if you opt out you will not be bothered by it again..period! Sure you get a couple of free tickets to Disney, but if you have ever experienced a timeshare speech it simply isn't worth it. 2) Another common complaint is that the water park is only for smaller children or overcrowded. What do you expect? This isn't Blizzard Beach they are advertising. I challenge anyone to find another hotel complex in Orlando that has anything more than a nice pool (or several nice pools at that). The Liki Tiki does have several pools AND the water park is sufficient. If you plan on THAT being the mainstay for your vacation then yes you will be dissappointed. But for a change of pace from the parks, you can't beat it! 3) Rooms are dirty or need updating? This depends on where you get put. We stayed in unit 104 which is a 2 bedroom condo. Yes it was very outdated and paled in comparision to the newer units in the back of the complex. You will have absolutely no say so in where you get put, they will tell you that they are full no matter what the case. If you are simply staying there and have no interest in the timeshare deal then I would suspect they are going to put you in one of these units. That being said, they weren't THAT bad and I had a separate swimming pool that was right out of my door and the waterpark was a simple stroll across the street. Again, depends on YOUR expectations.
