While I am picky about some things, I also realize that you spend very little time in your unit if you are in Orlando visiting parks, swimming eating etc. It did provide us a cheap alternative for breakfast and a few dinners but we unfortunately did not take as much advantage of the kitchen facilities as originally planned. 4) Staff isn't friendly? Never really encountered this, but again people treat you like you treat them. The countless complaints about this sort of thing exist no matter what hotel you choose. I would have to say that most of these complaints usually come from people who bring it on themselves. That is my input on the usual complaints that you hear in regards to the Liki Tiki village. In addition to that, I have to say that you must have a rental car because you are about 10-15 minutes from Disney. We actually did the Seaworld/Universal Studios vacation this time around and had some reservations regarding the distance to those parks. I have read a few complaints that these 2 parks are way out of the way and to some degree they are. If you choose to drive down 192 every day you will get the usual morning traffic and lights etc. Fortunately, we were given an alternate route which puts you right on an interstate up the street from Liki Tiki and this helped avoid the snarls. It was exactly 15 minutes to Seaworld and about 20 minutes to Universal. I believe a vacation is what you make of it, and if the Liki Tiki fits your budget and you go in with reasonable expectations you should have a good time. For the money it certainly offers quite a bit at a low price. You may find other accomodations with lots to offer but the price is also going to increase accordingly. I would probably stay again if I went back, but our family likes to try different things and I may try other alternatives as well.

Reviews.Title: “I guess its all relative”
Reviews.Author: razoopicky
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. The lobby is even run down. We were supposed to get a nice two bed/two bath. We were placed in some akward villa that hadn't been renovated for the last 25 years. The bedrooms were extremely small and one bathroom was located on the first floor, which is inconvenient for the residents of the second bedroom. The matresses were pitiful. The master bath had a small piece of toilet tissue on the floor that had obviously been used. I bought one of those vacation packages where they try to sell you a time share. I couldn't believe they would put me in such a dump when they were trying to sell me a timeshare. When I complained about the room I was told that there were no other rooms available. I was also informed that I needed to understand that I was in one of the oldest units on the complex. So what!!!! All of their units should be well maintained. I ended up just leaving. I was eventually given my money back but not without a fight. If you are not really picky about hotel accomodations then you might like the place. However, most people that I know who aren't picky about accomodations don't bother to search for reviews. This place is really as bad as the negative reviews state.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good! Not Clean! Icky!”
Reviews.Author: Aleix
Reviews.Content: I certainly thought that this would be a nice place to stay. (Two years ago we visited the area and stayed at Orange Lake w/relatives that own a time share at that location. It was absolutely very clean and WONDERFUL!) Liki Tiki was not "clean." On the property we saw: cigarettes butts around our condo, DUCK POOP that we had to step over to reach the door, paper thrown about, cigarette burns on the porch/concrete. There were several items that I listed as being "wrong or missing" upon check in. The itemized list that the maid left was not at all accurate so I was sure to list what I observed. The shower was not a place that I was comfortable with. By tour day I just wanted to get it over & check out of this place. I wanted to find another hotel--anything but my DH told me to stick with it this time. I like staying in condos--because it's easier & less expensive to prepare meals (before/after park visits) for the kids/us as opposed to eating at the parks. We brought lots of things from home. I mentioned and took my list to the tour for the sales person to read. They were willing to move us to a better room (if we were to sign to buy). There were also stains n the bathroom wall that i c/not identify. I hope they were mop sloshing stains. After the sales person gave her speech, I gave my itemized list of all that was wrong and told here how could she expect me to purchase a time share with her comp. after living in the trash that they gave me. Her reply was that that maybe they wanted me to appretiate the new condos better. She was not being a smarty--she just "didn't have a clue." She was very nice in her presentation and during the tour. I replied that was a cheap and disgusting way to do business. The manager was informed, the closer was informed and the lady after the closer (from the corporate office) that visited the table to find the reason ---again that we were not willing to purchase. The main reason is that we are in the process of purchasing a home and don't want to buy a TS before we do that. The lady from the corporate office tried to convince us that to have a "mortgage" on our credit report is a good thing to have when you are about to buy a home. It shows that we "can handle two mortgages LOL. We didn't bite. We were also informed that these units (older) are the ones used for the "tours" and they are not putting money into repairing them because they are scheduled to be demolished and funds will be put into the new units to be built. There is not Wi-Fi in the rooms. We had to use the computer at the front office and be charged $5.99/day. that's the first place I've ever been to that didn't have Wi-Fi. Next year's vacation, we will just save extra to eat out for all meals & stay in a hotel--a reputable one or just pay the extra $$$ to rent for the week (i.e. Orange Lake).

Reviews.Title: “Used to be good, never going back”
Reviews.Author: Buzzkillbunny
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here when it was the Isle of Bali and as a Ron Jon Resort. It's changed hands a number of times. As a former Florida resident I would go up to Disney at least once a year. I've been here with a group of girlfriends, with family, with children, and I loved the place. I never bought into the timeshare, I'd just call up and see if there were any units available to rent. I've stayed in December, over holiday weekends and pretty much any time I felt like it. The rates were super cheap and I enjoyed having my own bedroom and bath. The last time I stayed was with my husband. I got a call at our home in Florida offering us a "customer loyalty" deal. I actually PAID to hear the timeshare pitch. What a moron I am! We were to get two nights of accomodation, breakfast and two tickets to Disney. Since we were moving out of state, I thought one last trip to Disney World would be a nice way to say goodbye. Check in was a nightmare. We had to go to one place for the vouchers, then fight traffic on Irlo Bronson Hwy to get to the resort. Then we waited around forever. Customers came up complaining about the clenliness, or lack there of, of their units. I was thinking seriously of bailing, but they already had our money, so we hung in there. Our room was a huge disappointment. I had wanted a two bedroom unit because my husband snores like a bear. We had a one bedroom with a double bed. When I called down to the desk to complain, their answer was, "if you're an owner, you can get what you want." Wow. Way to sell me on your customer service. Our plan was to do the timeshare thing early, get it out of the way and then head to the park. Our appointment was for 10:00 am. Due to a huge number of people though, we waited until nearly noon before we could sit down with a high pressure salesman and crush his dreams. I told him up front that there was no way we were going to buy his timeshare. We still had to hear the pitch and take the tour. Remember, I've been staying here for years, so I knew the place better than he did. He tried some bogus math on us to convince us that the place was worth the equivalent of a million dollars. It was cute, in a pathetic way. Finally we were free to go. We arrived at Disney in the early afternoon and tried our best to have a good time. When we arrived back to the unit, late in the evening, the family next door to us was apparently using the furniture as a trampoline. Their kids were screaming, yelling and thumping like crazy. We heard everything clearly through the tissue paper walls. Finally, their Ritalin kicked in and I was able to enjoy a few hours of sleep, on the floor, with the kitchen fan on to drown out any noise. This place has gone down hill. I can't imagine anyone thinking that it is worth even $100 per night, let alone BUYING it as a time share. The proximity to WDW is reasonable, but it's in Kissimmee, out in the wilderness practically. This visit is the one that moved me to stay on WDW property last year. To be honest, that's the only way to go if you're doing Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Been to Liki Tiki twice now!!!!”
Reviews.Author: julie020877
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village for a month over Dec/Jan 06/07. This was our 2nd visit with the first being Jan 05. So overall 7 weeks in total in 2 yrs. Both times we have stayed in the newer buildings not the older villas. Although the decor could be doing with a bit of upgrading (as far as taste goes not standards) we found our apartment to be very acceptable. It had all the comforts of home which made our stay even more enjoyable. On the nights when you wanted to relax at night we had 2 TV's, could cook our own food & relax. There was plenty to do in the resort, such as, pedal boats, crazy golf, basketbal, tennis, kids playground, waterparks, pool bar, gym etc. The staff were alwyas very helpful & could not do enough to help. On our 2nd stay we paid £800 for a month for 2 adults & 1 child - FOR APARTMENT NOT PER PERSON which was for a one bed room apartmenmt with all amenties which i think was supberb value for money. This was with [--]. I would say that it would be better hiring a car if you stay here although there is a local bus service - although you have to cross a busy road. If you want to car hire try [--] - we got an intermediate car for a month for £450!!! So for our accomodation & car for a month for 2 adults & 1 child it was £1250 + flights which is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Liki-Awful”
Reviews.Author: jsboston_7
Reviews.Content: Boy Howdy! Liki Tiki is the absolute worst place you could possibly stay in Orlando. We were fortunate to stay in one of the brand new units, but even that turned out to be sub par. The bathroom sink had two settings: scalding hot burn water and 3rd degree burn. The first time I tried to take a shower, the handle came off in my hand. As far as design goes, the master bedroom features a shower with a window looking into the bedroom. Needless to say, this is a very undesirable feature when Grandma Sophie feels the need to clean off after a long day at the pool... Speaking of which, if you like personal space, you'd better not go near the pool. I don't remember what the posted maximum capacity was, but unless it was 3,450...they don't adhere to it. lots of unattended kids running around, and other unsightly creatures. If I were buying a present for someone I hated, I would definitely consider a 3-night stay at the Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ichr4her
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at Liki Tiki. We stayed 7/2-7/5/07 and I will be very honest at first I was a little worried; check in was not that great. When we made the reservation several months ago I requested the top floor and we were told our room was on the 1st floor and that it wasn't ready and it was 10 minutes until 4 (check in time) so we asked if there were any rooms on the top floor since that's what we requested. Then the power went out due to a bad storm and we had to wait about another hour for the power to come on since the whole facility has no generators which is surprising to me because bad weather is a daily thing in Florida over the summer. Finally when the power came on another girl named Alisha helped us & she was great, she couldn't get us the top floor but she gave us the next floor down but w/a pool view so that made up for it! Other than check in the stay was great.We stayed in the 500 bldg which is right next to one of the heated pools that has several covered areas w/very nice stainless steel grills. The room was fabulous, very clean & very large. Soooo much nicer than a regular hotel room. We took our 11 yr old daughter and a friend of hers and they didn't want to leave the water park area to go to the parks so there was definetely plenty to keep them busy! The outside restaurant/bar was nice for us and Mike was great, definetely try the Liki Tiki Punch it's delish! I was very worried by reading some of the reviews but overall we were very happy and we're planning another trip in August before school starts back!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay but salespeople LIE during pitch to sell property”
Reviews.Author: beachnutmom
Reviews.Content: I feel that the resort was beautiful.. it was until we went to a seminar in which the sales person lied about the full details of the timeshare that he convinced us into buying into..i spoke with representives later on the phone from island one resorts and they admitted to me that the employees (sales team) do and say whatever it takes to make a sell... i think that is ridiculous and not the best way to do business....

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO BAD YOU MIGHT LIKE IT”
Reviews.Author: dplnortheast
Reviews.Content: we traded our timeshare to stay here, and it was basic. well it is not bad, but nothing special!! if you are not used to a nice nice nice place you might be ok here,. we have stayed at tooooooo many nice nice nice places, where they wait on you and want to go out of there way to take care of you while staying at there timeshare! this place had way tooooo many people taking tours, it felt like a salesman was on every corner, instead of letting us who do own enjoy the place...... the pool areas are small but there is one big waterpark for kids, that is fun! other then that the kid programs stink. nothing good at all! the bar is basic outside by the waterpark! but nothing special at all.......... the buildings near the check in area are very very old~~~ the ones near the water park are old, but not as old as the ones near the check in deck,, and the ones in the way way back are the newest. i knew enough to ask for one of the NEWEST ONES FROM MIN ONE OF TRADING OUR TIMESHARE!! so we didnt have to be in a old unit! altho even the new ones are not NEW NEW just basic, but again with kids its all about the waterpark and outdoor play area!!! its very far to get to disneyworld tho! so forget driving in fast, and its VERY VERY VERY FAR FROM UNIVERSAL AREA OR SEA WORLD but again, still a nice place!!! if you dont have kids i wouldnt rec. this place as we would not have enjoyed if we had been ALONE OR ON A HONEYMOON!!! tell them NO MIN ONE OF ARRIVING FOR A SALES TOUR OR THEY WILL BUG YOU ON THE PHONE we sid no and they NEVER CALLED US

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, My Family Loves it! 8 Years in Counting :)”
Reviews.Author: Shelldawg
Reviews.Content: I have to say after reading all of the Reviews on this Resort it makes me think. My family and I have been going to this Resort since 1999. I am now 24 and the youngest of the children. This is just not a Childs place to stay. My family of all ages still enjoys it year after year :) This place is great! It's clean, affordable and fun! The employees are very nice, clean and Prompt. If you are looking for this Lavish resort to stay in this is not the place. Not saying that it is not nice, its just not the place to have a Honeymoon. There are children at the Water park and even though it is 4ft only we still Play in it! We all have a blast when we come here and it's close to everything. Every year they seem to keep adding stuff for their guest's to do and it makes us keep coming back. For all the people who complain about having the timeshare meeting and it's too long...what do you expect for 2 free tickets worth over a $100. Did you think they were just going to get handed to you??? You have to work for it and guess what...You get free breakfast too! Please don't read any of the bad reviews...Obviously their standards are way too high. Please visit the Liki Tiki Village it's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “liki tiki was terrific”
Reviews.Author: star0627
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently went to Florida and stayed at the Liki Tiki Village from JUNE 15-JUNE22 and we all ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. I was a bit hesitant to go after reading some of the awful reviews. We stayed in the 900 building and our balcony overlooked the waterpark. My kids ages 3 and 9 had a ball there. Our room was very clean and tidy and the carpet was not dirty nor stained and everything functioned. There were enough activities for the kids. As for as the restaurant, who knows we never ate there, we cooked a lot in our room. They provided everything but the food!! The front desk was always fast, friendly and efficient. The only negative was the beds were a little hard. We will most definantely be going back, they are going to be expanding the waterpark and making it bigger.

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: ewhee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine and our kids in April 07. We arrived to the hotel around 1pm, two hours before the check in time, and the staff was ready to check us in no problem. We were very happy as we had traveled all day from NY. The room was in the "800" building, which was perfect as the view off the balcony was right over the lagoon, and waterpark. The room was very clean, and better than we expected after reading the negative reviews. The full equipped kitchen was just that, everything we needed was there to cook and store.( FYI there is a Super Walmart just around the corner 5 min away). We saved a lot of money by stocking our fridge and cupboards. There is a Publix grocery store also 5 min. in the other direction, but much more expensive. Having the washer/dryer combo was also great, we just washed our own towels and washcloths as they do charge for replacements, but big deal if you can throw them in while your eating, or resting. The waterpark was awesome!!! Our kids had a blast, and never got tired of the waterslides. The water was very clean and clear, and 3ft deep on one side, 4ft deep on the other. i just put my sons lifejacket on because the pressure of the waterslide pulls you under momentarily when coming out. The park was staffed with 4 lifeguards at all times, who by the way were GREAT!! I saw them jump in the water several times, many times not needed but they were very cautious, and always on the ball. The restaurant "Shipwreck Sallys" was right at the waterpark area. The menu was reasonably priced, and the food was really good. Advice to buy your own alchohol as the drinks were pricey, good but pricey. The one complaint I did have was the activity center. The employees over there were not very helpful. We took a paddleboat out for a ride and they acted as though they would rather have a nap than help us. But that wouldnt stop me from going back there. i definatley plan on going back next year. Also upon check in a woman offered to have me for a "VIP Breakfast". Of course this was a timeshare meeting and wasnt mandatory. They offer you $75 cash, or discounts off Disney tickets if you go to this. I figured why not for $75. I went alone, and had to sit through 2 hours of pure torture listening to the rep tell me how I would be silly not to buy a timeshare. Then get bullyd by his "manager" when I said I wasnt buying. But I did this at 8am, and was $75 richer by 10am in time to go to the waterpark. We just blew it on dinner at Joes Crabshack which by the way I recommend. Great seafood and the staff dances, and make balloon animals. Another FYI, I will take this with me next time, people go to the waterpark starting at 8am and save loungers with towels. I dont think this is something that is right because there are a lot of people left without chairs, and the saved ones are empty a lot of times as people go back and forth to the water and their rooms. I think next time I will join this madness though because it is nice when you dont have to be a "chair stalker" all day. If anyone has any questions please feel free to email me, ewhee18@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki is AWESOME for families--highly recommend to everyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: mhmiller99
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4-year old son and I stayed at Liki Tiki from 6/12-6/19/07. We loved it! It was SUPER clean (as I am a huge clean freak this is very important to me!!) The rooms were large. Loved the full kitchen. Washer/dryer made it very convenient to pack less since we were flying to Orlando. Just to let you know-all 1-bedroom units have a QUEEN bed and fold out sofa. We thought it had a king. The 2-bedroom units have a King bedroom, a second bedroom with 2 full size beds and also a fold out sofa. My son loved the water park. He and my husband had a blast doing karaoke by the water park at night. We did so much Disney/SeaWorld stuff that we didn't have time to do all we wanted at Liki Tiki but loved everything we did. We booked through a place online (the-vacation-store) for only $239 for the whole week. NO LIE!! We had to do the 90 minute timeshare presentation but who cares for that cheap price we did it. At the end, we just said that we weren't interested and still got 2 free Disney tickets. If I had a complaint about anything at all it would be that the water park was somewhat over-crowded at times. We learned that owners in their timeshare group can come in and use the water park even if they aren't staying there at the time. It wasn't unbareable but just keep a super close eye on kids especially if they are young. This pool area doesn't get over 4 feet deep so it's great for younger kids but still the older ones can be a little much around them if not careful. Great vacation -would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: bankerchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village May 27th through June 2nd. Overall it was a very nice hotel. We stayed in the new units which had flat screen tv's in each room and we stayed in a 1 bedroom unit. The hotel room was very clean and our unit was spacious. After reading several poor reviews we were a little hesitant but overall found this a nice place to stay. They provide free transportation to and from both Disney and Universal. The service was very good and they brought us any additional items we needed, extra blankets, toilet paper, etc for our condo unit. The pool area is nice but is really geared towards smaller children ages 12 and under. Not a lot to do for teens older than 12. They do have paddle boats and fishing gear to rent but there is a fee for this. There is a very small gameroom as well but only has a few games and an air hockey table. There is a bar and grill near the pool. Very limited menu and hours and they close early, however the bartenders were friendly. The food there is okay and the drinks a bit over priced but handy if you plan to spend the day by the pool. Some of the downsides of the hotel were that there was no phone book in the room nor any instructions on how to use the telephones. Also the sales people for timeshares can be a bit aggressive if you are not a current owner but they do give out some good freebees if you take the tour and have the breakfast. Some tips I would offer is when checking in ask for a list of restaurants in the area that deliver. They provided us with several different restaurants and coupon offers. One place I would recommend is JT's, only about 2 miles away. This restaurant provides free transportation for you and your family and the food and drinks are very affordable, much cheaper than the restaurant on site. They have a gameroom for the kids and usually entertainment nightly. I am planning to go again next year and would definitely use the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Cori1124
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here back in May 2005. We originally booked the Nick Hotel but, at the time, construction was not complete & there were no guarantees that the pool would be open in time for our vacation. I booked the Liki Tiki solely based on on-line photos of the pool. It was only a 15 minute drive to Sea World, Universal, & Discovery Cove, the one-bedroom villa was very spacious and clean, and the grounds and pool were well maintained. The employees weren't exceptionally friendly & our room wasn't available unitl 5pm, but overall, for the price and location, it was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Going back next year!”
Reviews.Author: loveflordia
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying before we stayed here I did some research. The reviews didn't sound to good. I was a bit nervous I have to say , we arrived on May 13-20 . I am so glad I didn't listen to the reviews and decided to take the chance. We loved it , my 10 year son played basketball in the pool all day long. The workers were great the lifeguards were excellant. There is nothing negative to say at all about this place. Everything is withing driving distance. All the attractions are basically 5 minutes away. I can't wait to go back next year. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the Liki Tiki and so did we”
Reviews.Author: kathiestewart
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 2 wk. stay at Liki Tiki and we absolutely enjoyed it!! I just want to do this review for those who are planning a trip there and are scared to dealth because of the reviews posted about this complex. We stayed in a one bedroom, which has a pull out couch for the second room. It wasn't bad at all but if you plan to spend more time in you room than out , than I'd suggest the two bedroom. As for service we didn't need any major help other than changing in towels and the check - in went fine. The pool is wonderful and there is plenty of room pool side for all types of travellers( lots of kids but lots of sun tanners too.)We read up on this resort AFTER purchasing the 2 wks.and all we read was negative reviews so needless to say we were nervous and scared. We aren't by any means low class travellers but if it's good enough for my kids it's good enough for me and the kids love it here. When they are asking to go home from Disney to do the water slides at the hotel that is the best feeling. We stayed in the 1000 building but there is a new building 1300. Good luck trying to make requests for a certain building ,anyone I talked to there that has been a # of times say that they have never had their request met. I still would try to request. The only thing that we read that was true and very annoying was the walls are very thin, like paper! Our first wk. wasn't bad but the second was louder ( thank goodness they kept the same schedule as us.) Hope your stay is as great as ours was. Any questions please ask, I'd love to help.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki top notch”
Reviews.Author: local2464
Reviews.Content: The liki tii was a great resort. Contrary to what you have been reading, the liki tiki was an awesome vacation. From the front desk to the wait staff to the bartenders. The pool was VERY clean as well. My 4 year old needed his medicine refrigerated before our room was availabe, and the bartender put it in the ice for us without a problem. Overall the three of us had a wonderfull time, and cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “great time!”
Reviews.Author: ukholidaymaker101
Reviews.Content: after reading several negative reviews and getting a really reasonable price on the resort, we were pleasantly surprised at how nice the liki tiki resort was! the apartment (in block 500) was very spacious and clean with plenty of room for our famly of four. the staff were all very friendly and the pools were all clean and plenty big enough. the hotel was quiet at night so no complaints there either. overall, a great place and would definitely visit again! ignore the bad revies.. i think the place must have been refurbished since some of these reviewers went as there was evidence of work being done onsite during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “One word.................AWSOME, please dont read negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: ackisle
Reviews.Content: Would denfinately go againl. All negative reviews are rediculous. Staff very friendly, lots to do and prices extremely reasonable. Very clean and anytime we needed help of any sort everyone went out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Resort”
Reviews.Author: kjmvacation
Reviews.Content: This place is RUN DOWN, old, and most incredibly FILTHY. I cannot imagine where people who liked this place have stayed in the past, but if you are travelling, this is NOT the place to feel "homey" in! From the banged up and sorely needing paint front door of our two bedroom nightmare to the grease dripping from the ceiling above the stove, the place was disgusting. Three sets of blinds, none worked, and even if they would have, expect the warm Florida sunshine to greet you in the face at some ingodly hour. Ever heard of room darlening blinds? This place has not. The King-sized bed had two queen sized sags from previous guests, the light switched and door knobs made your hands sticky, and the "fine" tin clost doors around the room were a loud pain in the... This place was TERRIBLE. Don't fall for the long TIME-SHARE presentation either. The positive reviews here must be from "time-share owners" trying desperatly to defend their impulsive investment.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail! !”
Reviews.Author: 5Buttons
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week long stay at the Liki Tiki and had a wonderful time. On arrival the staff was great about getting us into the 900 building which was right behind the lagoon-we had asked to be moved there and they were quick and helpful. (even at our late arrival hour). We loved being out on the deck on the 4th floor and watching the activity below. Surprisingly the lagoon shuts down around 9pm and it was quiet and peaceful until the next morning around 10am (even then it wasn't loud). There was a family of ducks that would swim along the lake that surrounds the lagoon. Our family LOVED the lagoon. We had a blast on all the water slides and all the families we got to know there were having fun as well. The staff helped us everytime we had a question. We had a lightbulb go out, called down to get it fixed and within 10 minutes someone was there, and then we recieved a followup call after. The rooms were large and we LOVED the jacuzzi tub in our master bathroom. They have plenty of on site activities for families, from the karaoke contests to the fish fry and even the luau which was a big hit! There's even a craft/activity area for the kids as well. Eating at Sally's Shipwreck Grill was very reasonable. The drinks were pricey (like soda's etc.) but food itself was not. Our condo was so close to the lagoon that we generally ate lunch up there and then headed down to the pool again. The beds were comfy, our kids felt at 'home' and we will DEFINATELY go back again for our next trip to Orlando. We only had a 10 minute drive from Liki Tiki to Walt Disney World...never saw any congested traffic on the roads.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Familys”
Reviews.Author: Oldskinhead
Reviews.Content: Well, I gotta say I was scared going to this resort after reading several bad reviews. On arrival, check in was quick, only one person in front of me in line. Room was nice, typical time share set up, no bugs ... When we found the VCR to be broken, they had a new on in the room within 15 minutes !! Kids loved the pool and waterslides, Me and Mom loved the poolside bar, WOO HOO !!! Bartender was awesome, we had a great time .. I'm wondering where all these bad reviews came from, we had NO issues, staff were all very nice, and we loved our rooms. We were in the 5 story buildings, 800 I think. Oh yeah, one drag, no High Speed Internet in the room, BFD!!! Thanks for a great time Liki Tiki !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What is all the whining about????”
Reviews.Author: paddington1
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Liki Tiki, and WOW! We were going to stay there last year, but the reviews were horrible and we went on a cruise instead. This time, I thought I would take a chance and I will NEVER stay anywhere else. We requested a beautiful room in the new building, 1300. There were pools everywhere and my daughter, 9, who had never been to Disney before, did not, I repeat, did NOT want to go the parks. She wanted to stay at the resort. Give it a shot. You will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Below one star”
Reviews.Author: Tanja E
Reviews.Content: BEWARE: they "hotel" lets locals use all of the facilities - this means that the pools are overrun by people who aren't staying/paying for the hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation at the Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: Disneyvacationer07
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Spring Break Vacation and we had an excellent time. I was a little leary upon reading some of the reviews, but I decided that if I was pleasant with the front desk personel, that maybe that would pay off and they would be pleasant to me, and the lady I had was great. Her name is Maritza, and she was the best. She found us a great room in the 800 building, she was able to get us first floor, we were able to check in early, and she was just as accomodating as ever. I think that if you are nice to them, they will be nice back. If someone goes in ready for a fight and problems, that is probably what you are going to get. I just tried to be as pleasant and as fun as possible, and it worked. Maritza was excellent. If you go, I would ask to speak with her, she is perfect. Our room was clean, spacious, and in a great location. It was facing the lagoon and the water area, and yes, a litte noisy, but I liked the activity around. We did not have any problems with our unit, except the vacuum cleaner did not work, and I called on it, and they brought one within 15 minutes. Just an excellent time. We had a great experience. My kids loved the water park, the water was warm, and we went swimning at the main pool by the check-in building as well, and that was warm also. I can't say enough. We want to go back again next year. We are the type of people that do not let little things bother us, so if there is crack in one of the tiles in the bathroom, and a spot on the floor, we just go with the flow. Our room was very clean and nothing to complain about. Building 800 was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: A_J_121
Reviews.Content: The Many things that make this a bad place to travel to. No one answers your phone calls at the front desk, or customer care. No one returns your calls. Dozens of mangy cats everywhere around the resort. Our Villa was very dirty! Stains on couch, carpeting, & tub bottoms, and floors looked like they were never cleaned. Beds are a joke. Mine broke the second night there. They are doing construction and put us right next to the construction site. We were woke up at 7AM every day by the noise. Construction vehicles blocked out parking almost every day, with compressors and tools everywhere. They truned the water off for over 5 hours to route the water to the "new" building. Only 2 hot tubs for everyone in the resort Drivers of golf carts don't pay attention to traffic & sometimes drive very fast. One almost ran into my vehicle, and I wasnt even moving. HUGE problem with key cards - it took 3 days of going to the office every morning to get our cards reprogrammed. Only internet access is in the main building, and costs 6 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: rogers3313
Reviews.Content: The worst, people were rude. We tried to get a refund and got a run around, the same run around as when we booked. Believe me, I am from South Florida, and there are much nicer places than this.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Jacksonville-7
Reviews.Content: Very rude employees..Our rooms were not very clean. If you were not part of the time share tour you were clearly not wanted there...the whole place was about time share,tours around the hour and please do not get in the way of them even if you are a PAYING GUEST..The entire driveway is always full of cars so you can't even check in or out with you guessed it...time share people..This hotel is clearly not interested in renting rooms..Towels are very limited and this a water park. I feel like I was robbed..Tried at check in to just get my 500 back I paid as a deposit for two rooms..they told me that was a deposit and non refundible..also it was never mentioned that I also had to put up a fifty dollar security deposit per room...This place is a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Wichita2007
Reviews.Content: We got a "Special Rate" because of our friends own here. BUYER BEWARE!!!! Apparently, unbeknownst to us there is a "NEW" section (HIGH RISE) of the resort and an old one. We originally were placed in the old villas. This room was completely dirty. In fact after further investigation with 2 managers the room was NEVER completely cleaned! We called "Customer Care" several times and were told that housekeeping would be by to clean our room...We were out the entire day at Animal Kingdom...Only to come back to an uncleaned room. After cleaning the floors myself, housekeeping finally came and we were promptly moved to the much NICER, CLEANER high rise building. Though we were NOT offered compensation for sleeping in our dirty room! I would not recommend this place for anything.

Reviews.Title: “A credit to Florida!!! dont read too much into the reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: melbeeWigan
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, I was well, very concerned to say the least. I always like to stay in a least a 4 star hotel, and I was all prepared for a fight on my hands when I got there. We even took extra money in case we had to move hotels. How wrong could we be. The staff gave us all a lovely welcome, and offered the kids sweets while we signed in. She said if there were any problems just get come straight back and she would do her best to sort it. I entered our room with caution.... to find a beautiful clean, spacious condo. With 2 plasma tv's, a whirlpool bath, a full size fridge freezer, dvd player, sterio, microwave and very large pull out bed for the kids. I also discovered in what I thought was a closet, our own private washing machine and dryer complete with washing powder! also, dishwasher, iron, hoover, & all usual utentials. My kids loved the pools, if not a little chilly, but kids are kids and dont seem to mind dithering all the way back to the room dripping wet. This place knocked spots off the Hilton where we stayed last year. Just DONT be talked into the 'free breakfast'. Its quite obvious its a timeshare talk, they dont bug, just tell them your home is currently being repossessed and you are living in temporary accomodation when you return, this did the trick for us. All in all, we will definately be returning next year. Gr8 time, super room, lovely staff. We spoke to some guests who seemed to be in the 'older rooms'. They all seemed happy enough too. To be fair, they are carrying out renovations on their older properties, so I can only assume that the bad reviews must be from non renovated rooms from last year. I'd still take the risk though, we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't reccomend to anyone!! Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetiejess83
Reviews.Content: Horribley Dissatisifed!!! I didnt stay at this property ovvernight , however some friends and I toured it and aftrer touring it and the way we where treated I would never reccomend a stay here to anyone!!! They have the worst most rude employees of any establishment II have ever visited!!! Horribly dissatisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: grena4
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Liki Tiki! Even though the weather was really, really cold! We got to mini-golf, paddle boat, and the kids even got in the heated pool! The 2 bedrooms are great for families with small kids! The location is close to Disney. The strip does get congested so it is not as convienient as if you stayed on grounds. Plan to spend a day at the hotel and enjoy what it has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alyssad
Reviews.Content: Liki Tiki Village was the location of a fun week for my three "girl" friends and I. Our two bedroom condo was nicely decorated, sufficiently stocked and very clean. Although it was cool weather on our arrival, it did warm up and we were able to use the pool and hot tub. We had a nice location overlooking the lakes and we spent alot of time out on the balcony enjoying the view and the birds singing. We plan to return next winter for another girls week away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time (again) at the Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: nascar9
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the strongly worded negative reviews of the Liki Tiki, I felt compelled to comment on my experience. This is the second time we have stayed at the Liki Tiki and had a great time. The front desk was CLEAN and the clerks were very friendly and helpful. We requested the 1200 bldg and got a 1 bedroom room. The room was clean and had everything we needed. It is directly across the parking lot from the water lagoon. Yes, the waterpark is not huge but our kids liked it (11 and 7). The water was cold (Liki Tiki: you need to make this pool warmer!) Shipwreck Sally's tiki bar was fun. Food was good and drinks prices were not out of line compared to what you would find at other resorts. There were plenty of things to do on the property. Tennis courts, bicycle rental, paddle boat rental, mini golf etc etc. My kids loved the staff supervised kids activities available at the water lagoon. The location was great. There is Publix grocery store 2 blocks away and restaurants within a 10 minute drive. Disney is about 20 minutes away. Overall, our family thoroughly enjoyed the Liki Tiki and plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: ken821
Reviews.Content: We were four adults from West Palm Beach visiting the area. We had each given a $50 deposit. When we arrived at the lobby not only did it look dirty it smelled musty. Even the fish tank had dirty water. We asked to see the room before we gave a credit card. They refused. We tried for 10 minutes to see a room before we checked in and they refused! We took a $50 loss and moved on to another place to stay in the area. I thought the receptionist was trying to help but the "manager" she was talking to on the phone was adamant that we give our credit cards before we could see a room. When we asked to see and speak to the manager on duty, she refused. Obviously we left and will NEVER go back. I believe this is part of a group of places in the area. Don't waste your money!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: VTravellerPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days for a brief trip to Disney. We had my husband and I and my mother in law, as well as two kids so we needed something beyond a standard hotel room. We had a two bedroom unit in the 600 building. The room was perfect- freshly painted, and very clean. The master bedroom had a huge garden tub and the maid had fashioned all of the towels into animals, which my kids loved. We had no complaints and would definitely stay here again. How can you beat a two bedroom condo with a full kitchen for under $100 a nite--less than many hotel rooms would cost?

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: juniorandstacy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Liki Tiki Village from 01/16-01/21, and I have to say the resort is just spectacular. We stayed in the 400 building which is in need of renovation, but it I have to say, we have no other complaints. We loved the room the minute we walked in. To our right was the very spacious bathroom; through a sliding door were the Jacuzzi; another sink and washer and dryer with a spacious closet. The master bedroom was very spacious with an entrance to the patio. The full kitchen had everything they said and more, and we saved a lot of money on eating out and just bought stuff to make from the publix which is about 1 minute away from the resort. We loved the dining area, and living room which also led to the patio. My daughter enjoyed the patio a lot because it overlooked one of the three pools, spa, fitness center and she was excited to be feeding the ducks every morning as they visited our window expecting bread. That is just the room. The resort amenities are great just too bad it was not warmer to fully enjoy them. Whatever you see on the websites about the water parks, bar, playgrounds etc.... it’s all true! Our stay was an absolute joy and money saver. You can spend the day there as opposed to going to Wet N Wild, Busch Gardens, and Disney etc... It is located on US 192 which connects you to all the parks just mentioned. Service was great. Any problems we had been taken care of. I read some bad reviews about the place and I am sorry to hear of those people's terrible time but ours was totally opposite. I read about insect problems, customer service problems, room problems etc but we just did not have that. I think a lot of the problems people have are just due to the overall upgrade needed for the place. The insect problem is due to the water park, pools, spa etc and heat bugs are attracted to heat and water. The room problems I think are just based on the fact that a lot of upgrades are needed. Whatever lack of customer service experienced is inexcusable. You don't be rude to people especially if they are guests/clients. You spend money you expect service period, so anyone who went through that it is really unfortunate as that is a vacation spoiler. We visited Sea World and are planning to go back to see Universal Studios and eventually Disney and we will stay there. It’s a nice place and I hope our second stay is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother kids had goose bumps all day at water park”
Reviews.Author: sonnyfrompa
Reviews.Content: Just got home mid Jan from the resort. The place has three pools but only one suitable for swimming and its not the harbour with the slides its the pool directly behind the sales offices where they try thier best to get you to spend your money on future visits to the resort. The heated pool was a simple round pool so keep this in mind when looking at other resorts during the winter months. The pool with the slides for the kids was around 60 degrees and when I complained they simply said that it was heated and that nothing else could me done, so we had to bundle our kids in towells while we finished our 5 dollar draft beers. By the way you cannot take your own food or drinks by the waterpark, there is a big sign on the gate leading to the waterpark stating this fact so be ready to spend lotsa cash while watching the kids with goosebumps. My suggestion look elsewhere for other better run resorts.

Reviews.Title: “cannot get any service”
Reviews.Author: FromFirstState
Reviews.Content: The room was OK/good. We just could not get the resort to respond to anything. When we got into the unit, we found the water pipe made tremendous noise when shower was on. We also found one A/C vent made noise when A/C came on. Metal vanes were loose on the A/C vent. The noise affected our sleep. We called the resort and asked for help. The help never came. On the third night, the weather became cold enough that we did not turn on A/C. We did not pursue the resort anymore. When we called resort office for something, they referred us to service manual. Our service manual had the first 15 pages missing. My wife made three phone calls and never got a new copy. On her fourth phone call, she called the front office manager. We got a new copy then. We also did not like that the two bedrooms had to share a bathroom in the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: nadisand
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Liki Tiki Dec. 30 - 31 st. We were told by the Woman on the phone check-in was 3:00 p.m. and yes the pools were heated. We did not get our room until after 4, we had to ask for the Manager, the desk clerk still told us no rooms were ready. The check-in/out staff was horrendous. Very rude, I was treated like a second rate citizen. This is because we were not owners. The pools were COLD. For a timeshare establishment they should have been much warmer. The rooms were o.k. You could hear the people next door's conversation. Overall not a good experience. Definitely will NOT go back. Dissappointed visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Camabap
Reviews.Content: If you don't like to have problems on your vacation simply don't stay here. First of all, all public areas were in extremely bad conditions (Dirty, trash in the stairs, etc). Our first problem was when we try to use the Dryer, which was not working at all. We called the front desk for repair and when the man was trying to repair that he cut his finger and left blood in the door, floor, etc; I Call the front desk asking for a new room, cause I don't feel comfortable with blood in my room, the rude manager said they do not have any available rooms although the resort was empty. After insist a lot, I got another room with another surprise: When I tried to take a shower I realize that the bathtub was flooding; I asked for another room in the front desk, caused it was 2AM and I would like to sleep and the terrible manager said I would have to wait their people to fix the bathtub. I asked for my money back and finally a good employee gave me another room on a new building. When they say they have breakfast, breakfast means a mini muffin and coffee... I Love Orlando and this is the place you should avoid on a Magical Orlando Vacations

Reviews.Title: “It started out as a simple request.....”
Reviews.Author: familygrrrrrrl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at our one bedroom in the 1200 block of the Liki Tiki, our daughters asked if they could have their own room. Why not - we'll call down and ask! After two calls to the front desk the answer was NO. The Liki Tiki was not busy. Three hours later and inquiring with every level of management the answer was still NO - you can NOT upgrade. More than once I clarified - I want to give the Liki Tiki more money but that's not possible. There were many excuses - they didn't know how to do it in the computer, the deal was made through Hotels.com so any changes needed to be made through them. I could cancel my booking with Hotels.com and pay the cancellation penalty and then book with the Liki Tiki. I realized that trying to figure this out with me standing at the desk wasn't providing the time and space needed so left to get groceries. Upon my return, still NO. So we returned to the one bedroom we noted the lack of a back behind the stove and the area covered in grease/glue? Next we had a visitor - a LARGE cockroach! We kept him captive in a sugar bowl where he relieved himslef regularly - BLLLECH!!!!! Why bother complaining, they don't want your money so they certainly wouldn't note a complaint. There are MANY choices in Orlando. This doesn't need to be one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: ClaireDrummond
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, on check in we asked for block 1200, as this was the new building. 45 minutes later they found our reservation and gave us a one bedroom apartment in this block. We could not fault the room, nice large kitchen and bathroom that included a spa bath. Washer/Dryer, nice large lounge. My only gripe was the one double bed we had was really small!! This block was just across from the Water Park but the time we got back from the parks, this was closed. It is a trek to get to one of the other pools and after a long day at the parks, to trek over put me off. The other downside is the trip up and down the 192 from the parks. It is about 20-25 mins to Disney. Last thing - be careful at check in when they give you a voucher to collect your free gifts - this is a time share hard sell!!!!! Rooms Great - Location & pools let it down! If you want to ask any other questions, give me a shout. Claire

Reviews.Title: “It took us forever to get the correct room!!!”
Reviews.Author: dizneegal
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this property for a week. Upon check in we were told that our room wasn't ready yet. (it was about 30 min before check in time). We understood .. .since we got there early. The front desk told us they would call me on my cell phone when the room was ready. We decided to go out to the car and wait there since it wasn't going to be that much of a wait. About 45 min passed and we heard nothing... so we called the front desk from my cell phone. It took us 3 tries before we could even talk to anyone ! The first call went unanswered. We tried again and this time whoever answered on the other end hung up on us.. so on the third try we were told the room was ready and to come back to the front desk. We were glad to hear the room was ready so we went back to the desk. The front desk supervisor asked for our last name and then gave us a key to the room. Piece of cake!!!! WRONG... we go over to the room which we had to enter through an enclosed porch. As we were going to put the key in the door, I saw a woman sitting on the couch inside watching tv! Immediately my sister and I walked out (with our luggage in tow) and went back to the front desk to tell them that someone was in our room!!!! Come to find out, the front desk SUPERVISOR failed to check our FIRST name and sent us to a room that was already occupied (with someone with the same last name ----not a very common last name either). She apologized and sent us to another building . Once again thinking we were going to the correct place, we dragged our luggage to the elevator to go to the top floor! When we got in the elevator, a couple guys working on the grounds also were getting in the elevator... which was fine... BUT the elevator didn't work!!! The thing wouldn't move!!! The door shut but it didn't move.... when they guys decided they weren't using the elevator, we got out !!! We dragged our luggage up to the top floor via the stairs. OK, enter room # 2 ... we were to have a 2 bdrm/2 bath . This was a one bedroom1 bathroom.... and very small . We called the front desk and were told that they saw what we were "supposed to have" and told us to come back. By now we're ready to call it a day and go someplace else. We went back to see the front desk supervisor AGAIN!!!! This time she was telling us we needed to pay an "Upgrade fee" to get the room we had already paid for ! But, she decided (good call) that since we had already been trying to checkin for more than an hour that she would talk to her supervisor and get the fee waived! We went to the CORRECT room and were pleasantly surprised. The place was 2 bdrm/2bathroom with a BIG SCREEN TV. We forgot about the ordeal we had at the front desk and had a great week here. The only problem I remember in the room was the jacuzzi tub would turn on by itself.. which freaked us out. It did it twice and then didn't do it again. Definately a great place to stay ... close to parks... fun pool area. My only advice is don't drag your luggage around until you know FOR SURE that you are going into the right room!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Kids”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline_McKenzie
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on the site i was a bit worried what i was letting myself in for. We arrived at 1230 at night and the reception girls were very nice and helpful. we were in block 900. Got to our apartment and it was really adequate to what we required. There was my husband and myself (children now too old to come hols with us!!). We have done the villas with pool, hotels with big beds and the town houses to boot. The aparment had a large bedroom, bathroom which was adjacent to the bedroom and lobby. Full kitchen area, dining table and lounge area. We did not use any facilities of the resort - but if we had kids it would have been brillant. The lagoon goes on from 8 in the morning until it is dark. There is entertainment on every day for them. Our apartment was groundfloor and we had a patio area which overlooked the lagoon which was lovely in the morning to sit out and have our coffee. Would easily go back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Kwillett
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 700 bdg from 10/26-11/2. It was great. We had no problems. The only issue we had was when we checked in our keys did not work. After about 20 mins the issue was solved and we were in. The condo was great. 2 doulble beds in one room and a king in the other. 2 bathrooms with tubs etc. It was clean and had no maitence issues at all. The water park was perfect for the 4 kids that were with us. (1,2,3 and 8 yo). I would highly recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: content266
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my two kids (10 and 12). The 2 floor townhouse (214C) 2 bedroom, 2 full baths and it was nicely appointed and very clean. My husband and I are waterbed sleepers and we found the beds to be quite comfortable. The kids had a blast. The enjoyed all three pools but liked the Lagoon the most. They had a DJ who played most of Saturday afternoon and ended about 8pm. It is very centrally located to the Parks, local resturants and markets. Check-In was quick. I did notice some disgruntled guest in the lobby and was a little scared when we opened the door to our unit. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful and nice. They handled every request quickly. We were not harrassed to buy a condo. My only complaint is the bike rentals. Most were not working and the one we did get was in need of repair. It was a nice quiet place to come back to after a day in the Park. The pools stay open late. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TheBORG
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Liki Tiki. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The place is very clean and well kept. The room was very quiet and could not tell that anyone was in any rooms near us, they were fully booked. The location is only 6 miles from Disney. The highway 192 that the resort is located on has everything you could need, groceries, fast food, fine dining, great gift shops and more. Wal-Mart is also just around the corner off 192 for those so inclined. There is a good water park for the young kids on site to enjoy if you are not in the mood to go to a theme park for the day. Mini-golf, paddle boats are available on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - the kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: knight271
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a one week's stay on a time share exchange. We had two kids with us ages 6 and 3. After reading so many horrible reviews, there was a lot of trepidation heading into this vacation, especially upon arrival seeing how busy it was. I am pleased to say that everything went beautifully, staff was friendly; rooms were clean, the pool was excellent and most importantly the kids had a blast. Upon checking in, front desk staff said they couldn't promise us a room in the newer buildings (1000, 1200, 1300), but said they'd do their best. To their word, we got a large two bedroom suite in the 1200 building with a full kitchen, plasma screen TV, full laundy facilities, very peaceful sitting area facing the forest. (it was screened - bugs weren't a problem at all). The older townhouses did look dated and i was very happy that we only got to experience the brand new suites. I think as previous people have commented - that is one of the keys to a pleasant stay at this resort. It doesn't seem you can reserve a newer suite ahead of time. when you check in, it's a first-come first-serve basis - or so it appears. As for location - I'm not sure what some of the complaints are about. Disney parks were under 10 miles by car (by Toronto commuting standards - that's heaven); publix grocery store was five minutes; wal-mart was under 10 minutes and there was a lot of restaurants close by. As for the pool - no it's not Wet n' wild. it's a hotel pool complex. A lot more elaborate than just a swimming pool for sure. The kids loved it. I read some previous reviews where the on-duty lifeguards were too strict, sometimes not strict enough in watching over the pool activities. huh? you know, complaints are getting a little carried away when you have that type of conflicting viewpoints. But to each his/her own. For a young crew, I found them to be well in control of things, while still allowing everyone to have their fun. There is not maid service every day. Personally, I have no problem with that. In fact, on a week's vac i like the fact that they're not in there every day cleaning up. How dirty can things get in 1 week? As far as clean towels, you call a number, ask, and they were delivered promptly. no problems at all. So for those planning a trip to this resort, take all of the reviews with a grain of salt please - positive and negative. This resort is definitely not the 'horror' that some make it out to be. On the contrary - in fact. Get in the newer complexes and your stay should go wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki--nice resort but don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: disneymom1973
Reviews.Content: My inlaws and ourselves stayed here for 1 week. We requested to be in the newer section and they put both suites in the same building which was very nice. We just got back. We did see two bugs while we were there but everything else about the resort was very nice. We had a 1bdrm suite and it was pretty spacious, there were some start up amenites included. The overall look of the entire resort was very nice, my kids loved the pool area(ages 7 and 3 1/2yrs). I don't think I would have been as happy if I'd payed their rate but we got decent prices through a timeshare owner so it was more than worth it to us. It is very close to everything and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: thepeters
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel and booked via Resideo.com for a stay a few years ago. The entire campus is amazing, very well-kept with lots of trees and vegetation. Staff is friendly, but the rooms are amazing. Our room had a full kitchen. The master bedroom had lots of space and a king bed. The bathroom had plenty of space as well, with a tub & shower. The balcony was great, and perfect for hanging out on first thing in the morning with a cup of coffee. It's a bit further away from Disney than we're used to, but that was easily overlooked as we were very surprised and impressed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Ronniecesmom
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, sister, brother-in-law and their 2 children stayed in a 2 bedroom villa in the "900" building. It was neat and clean. Upon check-in we asked for a newer building and the receptionist helped us tremendously. She explained it was a busy weekend and she was right. It was packed. The only down fall during our stay was the "love bugs". They were everywhere and very annoying but that's beyond the control of the resort. We were told that there's an influx of them from July until the end of September. While we were they they were putting flat screen televisions in the newer buildings. So, yes we will stay there again. I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it for timeshare reward”
Reviews.Author: Alnan101
Reviews.Content: We were promised two nights at the Liki Tiki with a time share tour and another two nights (I thought at one of their other resorts) without doing a tour. The hotel itself was nice enough although it was too crowed for our taste. The waterpark was nice but very crowed. The timeshare tour was typically tedious with a closer coming in to talk us into viewing a different type of vacation deal the next morning at a neighboring resort. She promised we would be done in one hour and would receive a free week at a timeshare resort for our trouble. She also said no sales person would talk to us unless we requested it so, imagine our surprise when we were greated by a salesman who took us to a table to watch the presentation and then drive us crazy to buy. The first "reward" for the Liki Tiki required a $15 deposit from some cheezy marketing company called Tiano Incentives. They sent a junky paper certificate to request where you want to vacation & then required another $18.50 to process the request. Over two weeks after the second check was cashed, we still don't have a confirmation and have no idea what hotel it might be - they give you no clue so they will probably ask us to upgrade for another fee. The second "free reward" for the one hour presentation (that really took two hours) requires a $100 "refundable" deposit (after you take the vacation & request the refund in writing) then a fee of $160 per person double occupancy. We aren't going to bother with it because of all the red tape involved. The Liki Tiki was an ok resort if you don't mind crowds. We didn't get to enjoy it much because we checked in after 4:00 (as required) on Sunday, the timeshare presentation was Monday and it started raining by the time we were done. They talked us into wasting our morning on Tuesday and checkout was at 10:00 am. My advise would be not to do it if you think you're going to get a free vacation by taking a tour.

Reviews.Title: “I know why it's called Leaky Tiki!!”
Reviews.Author: jenjen789
Reviews.Content: My family and I stated at the Liki Tiki the week of August 12, 2006. Even after reading the negative reviews we still decided to stay there. We should have paid attention to the reviews!!! We stayed in block 300 town homes. Big mistake! I was disappointed. It looked old and blah. On the first night, I had to call the front desk because the tissue holder in the down stairs bathroom fell off. The next night the plumbing in the kitchen came apart and there was a terible leak. No..it wasn't a leak it was a down pour. By this time I was truly angry because this put a damper on the vacation. I wanted everything to be perfect because I had invited my mother and step father to come along. On the fourth day we discover a roach in the silverware drawer and on the wall. I will never stay here again and I urge anyone that is reading this to stay away..stay far, far away!! It looks nothing like the brochure!

Reviews.Title: “This resort was great value $$$”
Reviews.Author: DJT...DJT...DJT
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned after booking Liki Tiki and reading some of the comments posted concerning this resort. It was clear that those booking the older villa accommodation were having problems with the condition of these buildings and bugs. I asked my booking agent to book a newer building and my booking was in the newer 1200 building and I was pleased with the standard of comfort. The one bedroom flat was fully equipped for a great holiday. The only complaint was the soundproofing could have been improved between the rooms. I have attached some pictures, which illustrate the level of 4 star accommodation. The pool could not be described as a full water park but it did have slides, which were great for children. The pool depth was 4ft at the deepest point and this combined with a large number of lifeguards ensured that the environment was relatively safe. This resort was booked through winter sunshine holidays and the condo cost only £35/$65 per night and I consider that this was great value.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jdtel
Reviews.Content: accommodation was in block 300 and was outstanding food was a good price at ship wreck sallys and matt and gina the bar staff were very frindly.the swimming pools are great for families with young children and the resort is just a few miles from disney

Reviews.Title: “The Joke was on us!!!!”
Reviews.Author: popparich
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at the resort, we were just appalled at the decline in the rooms and the service and the utter bull that we had to put up with. Five years ago, when the resort was under the Ron Jon name, it was really great. So good infact that we booked a second week. The rooms were great and it really was a 5 star resort. We decided to return this year with our son and his family and right from the start the difference was clear. The room we were assigned was a 2 story town-house typeithout enough linnens and a leaky patio roof with obvious mold growing in the cracks and a clothes dryer that didn't work/ . The evening of our arrival , my grandson went onto the balcony and ripped his shirt on exposed metal on the railing. They fixed the railing but offered no compensation for the torn shirt. Thank God he didn;t cut himself. Trying to get extra linens was a farce. It took 4 phone calls to an answering machine to get towels and pool towels for the family. By the time we received them we then had enough linens to open up a linen store. Yes they did fix the railing the next day and also eventually fixed the dryer. Again after multiple calls. There were three swimming pools, two of which had no lifeguard or staff supervision, which allowed all the kids to do whatever they felt like although part of this should be blamed on parental lack or indifference. The Lagoon offered minature golf( 9 holes which you got to play twice for 10 dollars), Bumper boats ( Out of commission because an alligator was in the Lagoon) A totally over-crowded wave pool and water slides with children running amok They did have a life guard there. The phone systen was another story. On Thursday evenings the resort offers a luau dinner and show for $30 per, which is nice but starting on Sunday you start getting 2 or 3 calls a day about signing up for the party. After the third day we called the operator and asked to not be disturbed about the luau any more. She could not do anything to stop these messages and basically told us to disconnect the phones, which when plugged in again had all the luau messages that we missed. To throw salt in the wound on thursday we got 4 messages for the friday night fish fry. At checkout we were billed for over $5 worth of phone calls which we made with the phones disconnected. Next they sent us a bill to our home for these calls and upon inquiry there was no manager available to help[ us. So if you wish to go to Orlando and endure the Disnet experience, which is a whole other story, Find some place else to stay. The advertisments are appealing the possibilities are excellent, The rooms stink and the management is worthless. Stay someplace else

Reviews.Title: “Don't gamble, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: mysister'skeeper
Reviews.Content: Okay, Let's face it. Everyone has an opinion. I just want to break it down based on what you are actually getting. If you are looking for a place close to Disney, don't mind a large crowd and are not looking for quality just a pool and room, than this is your place. But if you are expecting a star resort this is not the place. We are timeshare owners and have exchanged many times in the past and we were pleased. We own in Myrtle Beach at Ellington(a festiva resort) this is a first rate gold star resort. What we got in exchange, we should have stayed in a regular hotel room and saved our week. If you are seasoned traveler and are used to great resorts with a smaller crowd this is not the place for you. You will not get the quailty that you are accustomed to. I promise. The facilities are old. My first clue that this place was not top standard was the long line to check in. I thought I was at the local hotel and not a timeshare resort. Anyplace that you have to place your trash outside on the lawn is not top rate when it stays there all day. To me it was very obvious that this place have a lot of non-timeshare clients. We expect more and better facilities. The carpet was not clean, the sofa was not clean. The laundry dryer's knobs were broke, the masterbed headboard has some brown stains, the tv in the master bedroom was sitting on top of the chest, and was only 19 inches. We had a townhouse and it was in bad shape. The master suite did have a small one person whirlpool tub. Not the larger version. The paint was peeling. Compared to other 2 bedroom villas that I have stayed in, this was not spacious at all. Who want's to climb stairs all the time. The second bedroom did not even have a tv. There was an old vcr player. The very old kind. Not many people have vhs now days its dvd people!. To make a long story short, my 11 year old thought it was poor quality. Don't take the chance that I did and be disappointed. Stay some where else. I wish I had. I hate that I gave Interval my nice 3 bedroom villa in mytrle beach for this dump. I am not a high class sob. I am a pt working homeschool mom with 3 kids. I think Embassy Suites is 100% better. And they don't claim to be a star hotel much less a star resort. I tried (like some suggested) to get in the high rise buildings 1000-1200. Don't bother They will give you some excuse why its not available. The lagoon is strictly for children under the age of about 8. My 11 year old did not want any parts of it. It was like being at the city park's water sprinklers. TOO MANY KIDS AND PEOPLE! If you are a timeshare owner, Don't waste your week.

Reviews.Title: “worst place i ever stayed at, dirty, rude, ect...”
Reviews.Author: laonut1
Reviews.Content: me, my wife and 2 kids stayed there in february 2006. we never had such a missreable time since we stayed at the likki tikki resort. to start it off we went into the pool, that there are no lifeguards or any supervision, and my son 2 at the time was injured by a swing they have in the pool area. now why would you have a solid hard plastic swing in the immediate area of a pool. well to wrap it up, another child swung it smacking it into my sons face. no one did anything to even help, no lifeguards or first aid personnel around in sight. so the next step was the 6 hour wait in the hospital. to go onto another topic, the place is dirty, the people were very snotty, and unfriendly. dont let the pictures or some of the good reviews fool you. and for the price, your better off staying at a better resort, or hotel, and spending more money. toi me it was a complete waste of money. i will never stay there again. like theyt say, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lujeasem
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Liki Tiki. We were there for 7 days. We were worried because of the posts we read. We had a great time. We had a one bedroom condo, clean and stocked up with everything we needed. We even wanted to use a crock pot one night and they delivered one for us. Customer Service could not have been better. Everytime we called for something they delivered it right away. The water park was perfect for little kids, evenings when the sun went down even better. Thanks for the post about the noise in the whirpool tub - it does that because is self cleaning. What we got for the value could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Place is bad, customer service is worse”
Reviews.Author: trvler01
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3 bedroom suite, which was in poor condition. We had a broken bed in 1 room, which took 2 days to replace, and ants in the kitchen so bad, we were unable to place food in the room. We contacted the office multiple times, and finally they agreed to replace the bed, and treat for ants, and offered a lame option of leave or get a 15% credit. Constant fight our whole 3 day vacation there. The room had cobwebs, and dead bugs everywhere. It was just a dump One of our other family members were given a newer room which was much nicer, and had a plasma etc. So there is 2 or so new buildings in there which is why some people say it was clean. But overall, the place is old and dated. I would guess 855% were older buildings. Pool looks nice, and is ok, but no where near big enough for the number of people that go there. Be aware of you book here, the customer service is terrible, and you pay up front for a reason. Wouldnt go there again ever even if we could get a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki ICKY”
Reviews.Author: 2kids2love
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting place I have ever stayed! We stayed with friends who own a time-share there. Sorry Liki Tiki, but NEVER AGAIN! I have a 3 yr old and a 1yr old, and I didn't even want them to walk on the floor. I felt so bad because they weren't free to roam around the rooms since I didn't want them touching anything "dirty." The carpets were filthy...so soiled that they felt slippery! This place is in need of a renovation! Everything there just seemed so grimy and old! The walls were dingy and the window sills were so dirty that if you rubbed up against one accidentally, you would get a stain on your clothes! The sofas had stains and seemed as though they had not been cleaned for a long while. The beds were uncomfortable and the bathrooms had a weird musty scent. Come to think of it, the whole condo had an unpleasant smell. To add to my discontentment of Liki Tiki, our floor had teenagers running up and down the breezeway outside and hitting everyone's windows at 11pm!! I'm sorry, but there is nothing good I can say about this place, except that check-out was quick...thankfully!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for a family with younger kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking the units (3- 2 bedroom villas) I looked at these reviews and was expecting the worst, but for the thirteen of us it turned out to be a very good experience. Yes, there were some problems, like some of the small appliances not working, but overall we all liked it. The villas we rented were spacious, had washers/dryers and had full kitchens. In the heat of summer I don't like standing in lines at theme parks, so we spent a lot of time at the Liki Tiki Lagoon's water-park during the day, and it was awesome! They do such a great job of keeping it safe with several lifegaurds watching from different areas of the pool, and with the poolside bar/restaurant serving hot dogs, fries, mozzarella sticks, cuban sandwiches and lots of other foods, even my pickiest eaters were happy! Bottom line, if you have kids that like water parks and you want to relax poolside or join them, book a room at Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “LIKI TIKI YUCKY”
Reviews.Author: BRENDASHudsonPa
Reviews.Content: I do my homework when going on vacation & not had a bad one in 15-years +. I took a gamble on Like Tiki. The pictures looked great & perfect for kids. Liki Tiki was BAD...we did not even check into the room. The pool was sooooo crowded that it was impossible to relax. The smell of chlorine was overpowering...but with so many kids in the pool I guess it's necessary. The so-called next to the pool bar was like a picnic area in a campground.
