We love to camp, but this was Dirty & Sloppy. Better accommodations in a State Park. We did not check into our room. They charged us for one night anyway & we did not even step into a room. The front desk was very unorganized. Also, there were other people complaining. The property seemed like it tried to fit too much stuff into a small area; almost miniature. Everythig was small & narrow. The pool was so congested that there was no room to move & no place for adults. We found a room at the Sheraton Safari. The property was clean, amenities abound & pool was clean & big & no crowds. AVOID LIKI TIKI !!!!! BRENDA FROM PA

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Village of Horror”
Reviews.Author: hutch2050
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki Village has the worst customer service in Florida.The Hotel is falling apart and guests are being moved with bed sheets and towels in hand.The bugs have more rights then any consumer could get.The Director of Operations claims the hotel has integrity,but will not listen to guests.The showers are cold as hot water is out on most units.If you stay the maintanence guys will know your first name and be in your rome every day also complaining.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the liki tiki village and love it. this was my second time staying there. we requested the 1200 building and was given a room there. There is a plasma tv in the living room, nice master bedroom and bathroom. I was very hestitant about staying her again after reading the reviews but decided to give it a try. people complained about the pool closing early, but only the liki tiki lagoon closes at dusk, there are two other pools that stay open until midnight. The kids loved it and so did my husband and I. We were also able to purchase discount tickets to the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: petebelk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki Village from June 9 to June 16, and after reading all the complaints we were skeptical about staying, but had already made reservations, (lowest price for a 2 bedroom was cheaptickets.com). Arrived and was suprised to see all the people staying here despite all the bad reviews, went to check in after driving 12 hours with three kids, and asked for the 1200 building and what a suprise no problem, second floor. The young lady at the desk was very helpful and from my experience everyone that we met, who worked for the resort was very polite and helpful. Yes the place is a little dated, but from talking to a few people this was one of the first reorts built in orlando. We noticed that they were upgrading furniture, televisions and all that and are in the process of breaking ground on 50 acres that they purchased to add more condos, lake and a lazy river. our room was more than enough for the five of us, very clean when we arrived and my wife was concerned with the whirlpool tub when it kept turning on by itself so she called the front desk, and was told that it has a built in self cleaner and after all parties are finished bathing it automatically cleans itself, pretty nice. There are 3 pools at the resort, two regular and then the Liki Tiki Lagoon, which is geared toward kids, deepest is 4 feet, five slides, and water squirting everywhere, 3 to 4 lifegaurds on duty at all times, Shipwreck Sally's where food and drink is served, and activities throughout the day for anyone who does not want to swim or gets tired of swimming. The food is very good and not priced that bad. The Lagoon opens at 0900 and closes at 2045 (8:45) daily, the only exeption is the resort has a luai (?) and they will close the lagoon early for this, or during bad weather. From our experience we had a great time, great place to stay. Liki Tiki is geared toward families and do everything to ensure that you have a great time, with plenty to do and plenty to eat. Now the bad, the only thing that we did not like about the resort was that at 5pm they have happy hour and on certain days karoke at the lagoon, we do not drink, but we respect others who decide to partake in the alcohol, the problem we had (even though lifegaurds are on duty) is that some parents bellied up to the bar and commenced to get drunk while their children were running around the lagoon, we made a statement to someone in charge and we were told that the bar only serves 3 drinks to each person, but the problem is that they will drink in the room and then come down to the lagoon with kids in tow, now i do not have a problem with that its just (to me) not very good for the kids to see a bunch of drunks acting a fool, seems the resort could move that to a seperate location away from the kids (just me). But overall I would say for the money great value, if you decide to go with your children you will have a great time if you can peel the kids away from the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: ljames622002
Reviews.Content: If you look at the good reviews most are by short term renters. 2 or 3 days. If you stay the week you'll hate this place. They close the pool early, sometimes by 2 hours so if you've been to a park you come home hit the pool and they immediately say they are closing. They advertise a wave pool but it was never turned on in a week stay. The staff was rude at check in. They clsed the pool at 5:30 on Thursday to have a 25 dollar a plate dinner show. The rooms are a bit worn and very small. I wouldn't come back here for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not Gold status-worthy”
Reviews.Author: GetMeOutOfDDO
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an exchange week at Liki Tiki Village. Check-in was quick and smooth. We were in the 200 block of townhomes. Nice idea, with screened-in porch, living areas and full bath downstairs and two bedrooms including master bath ensuite upstairs. I felt bad for anyone in the 2nd bedroom who may need to use the washroom during the night - they have to go downstairs! The architect wasn't thinking, I guess. The unit was basically clean, but details were missing. The shower rod was a little (c)rusty, there were marks and stains on walls that a simple wiping down could probably remove, towel hooks were missing in one bathroom, but the frame was still screwed to the wall. The shower pressure was so poor in the master bath, we gave up and just took showers in the downstairs bathroom. If you need to sleep in total darkness, this is the wrong place for you unless you have a super-duper blackout sleep mask. The rooms are SO bright in the morning, you'd best have a pair of sunglasses on the nightstand. TVs in the living room and master bedroom were no bigger than 20"; the second BR didn't have one. And the channel choice was very limited. It would be nice if they printed new channel guides to replace the outdated, over-photocopied one you are given when you check in, especially since it isn't even accurate! There is more than adequate closet space in the 2nd bedroom, and drawer space in the master bedroom, for a one-week stay, but the opposite isn't so. The blankets and bedspreads could use an updating, but they did seem clean. Very important - unlike some others who have posted reviews - we didn't see one bug inside the unit. On a very positive note, we complained after the 1st night that the master bedroom mattress was impossible to sleep on. They sent someone from maintenance to check it out, and we got some song-and-dance about how the warehouse might not have a new one. He must have realized just how bad the mattress was, because they miraculously found one and made the change that afternoon. If you saw what they took off the bed...... AND THERE WAS A BOARD BETWEEN THE MATTRESS & BOX SPRING!!! Obviously, the dilapidated, decrepit, unfit for human sleep of a mattress was already known to be in need of replacement. Why did they have to wait for a request for free chiropractic and massage services to do it??? The so-called Water Park was great for children up to the age of 8. Can't figure out why it only opens at 11, especially since it is so incredibly hot this time of year. If you want to keep your children out of the midday sun, it's best to choose one of the other pools and get an early start. There is some effort toward resort-like activities, but they seem to fall a little short. The mini-golf is, well, miniature with about 6 holes. There is a nice playground for the younger kids. There are tennis courts and a basketball court for the older ones. We wanted to rent a surrey bike one afternoon, but they seem to have only 1 of each size, and the small one we needed was broken. Can't comment on the food or prices. Shipwreck Sally's, located at the lagoon, is open every day. At the pool behind the shilling room, I mean free breakfast where they try to sell a timeshare to you, there is a little hut which opened one day for drinks, snacks and hot dogs; business was so slow, I guess they decided to stay closed the rest of the week even though the pool got busier with every passing day. Generally speaking, the place is okay. It's not luxurious. It doesn't overwhelm with outstanding amenities. It's clean but not spotless. Service was relatively efficient, although don't bother calling the front desk 'after hours'. We wanted information about access to internet services and a printer, and got tired of waiting for someone to answer the phone after 8 p.m. 'Customer Care' will respond rather quickly between 9 and 5. If you book in here, don't expect it to compare equally to Sheraton's Vistana Villages or one of the Hilton Grande Vacation Clubs. Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Received EVER - Isn't this a hospitality business??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am confused as to where the people complimenting the place stayed?? Must've thought they were at Liki Tiki and accidently drove somewhere else. The customer service at this place is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We've had our reservations for 6 months, after trading our beautiful timeshare from Cabo through Interval Travel. I've been talking to someone via email in sales at the Liki Tiki about getting some baby products for our room, off and on, for 2 weeks prior to our trip to make sure everything was set up when we arrived late in the evening (I had to give them our confirmation number to look up our reservations to put a message requesting these items). When we got there after having a very long trip from Cali, the customer service reps say that rooms are available on a first come-first serve basis and they are SOLD OUT!!! NO ROOMS AVAILABLE. We have already traded our time share, which is paid for obviously and paid the transfer fee up front. There are no managers on duty and everyone seems to walk away because they don't know what to do. Finally about and hour later, (and let me have you know - we are on our first trip with our two children ages 9 mos and 2.5 sitting in the car with me so they do not see the anger in mine or my husbands eyes), they say they've found us a room?? So, after reading many reviews and knowing my daughter would be crawling all over, I asked for a newer room up front, and since they didn't have a room available at all, we of course got put in the sh*** section. The rooms are OK. They're are nothing compared to what we traded for. Another HUGE thing the sucked was our card keys wouldn't work work. We carry a lot of stuff w/us w/two small children and we are carrying one of them, too. We had to drive back to the lobby once to get new ones (they give you 2 and neither worked) and one time we called security to bring us new keys because we weren't going to the lobby again plus both kids were asleep on our shoulders while we stood there and waited. We tried calling the front desk for different questions and the phone would ring and ring - no answer. One time, I was on hold for so long that I hung up and called back. The person must've saw that the call was from my room, so they picked it up and then put me back on hold with out saying anything. We tried to call on Friday for a late check-out - Check out it at 10:00 AM - and we rang the front desk off and on for 2 hours and no answer. It was just one thing after another. The grounds and the rooms are kept clean, but I would never recommend this place to anyone just because of the BAD customer service. I can say that one of the manager's was able to help us once, but that is it. Everyone else was pretty much rude that worked at this place. THIS PLACE REALLY SUCKS. The pools are nice and good for small children so if you are willing to put up w/EXTREMEMLY crappy service, then go for it, otherwise, save your sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Oh please, this place is a great deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: trainmandan
Reviews.Content: I learned something a long time ago about marketing. When a customer has a good experience, they tell some of the people they know. When they have a bad experience, they tell anyone who will listen. My girlfriend attended a home show in Clearwater, FL in march 2006. For $49.95, and a promise to attend a timeshare presentation, she received a 3 days/2 nights stay at Liki Tiki. And we arrived today… About a week ago, I wanted to look at the resort so I “Googled” Liki Tiki Village and came across quite a few reviews. Know what I found amazing? The spread between absolutely wonderful and absolutely atrocious. There wasn’t anything in the middle. It seems like either you loved Liki Tiki it or hated it. So I had to say I was skeptical. But away my mind worked, from “Well, it’s easier to rave or trash than get into detail” to “these people have an ax to grind” to “these people must work for the resort”. And yes, there are 2 things I WILL NOT stand for when I travel. Rudeness and dirty or unhealthy accommodations. First, I have been coming to Orlando now for about 20 years, some years 6 or 8 times in the year. Yes, some times for 1 night, sometimes for a long weekend a few for 5 days and everything in between. So while not a travel expert, I have experienced quite a bit in the area. Don’t think this place is a Marriott, it isn’t. Marriott is in another class, up there with Hilton, Hyatt, Loews. This isn’t a full service hotel, it’s a timeshare resort that also rents rooms and sells vacations to fill space otherwise unoccupied. It’s common in the business. The only complaint in the 1st day was that my girlfriend had to check in 3 miles east of I-4 for the timeshare presentation only to be told to drive west to the resort for the presentation. She went there, her son and I wet to Disney for a couple of hours (we have annual passes). Afterwards, she said while they didn’t take the 1st or 2nd “No”, they did take the 3rd. Which is common in sales anyway. It was firm pressure, but it wasn’t “hard sell”. Afterwards, check-in took less than 10 minutes. The staff we dealt with was friendly and helpful. The room was in one of the older buildings, 200 series. 2 story townhouse. Yes, they don’t give you a lot of amenities like toilet paper, or soap, etc. They only give you clean towels when you ask for them. But again, this isn’t a 5 star, 1st class hotel. Hell, even Disney doesn’t give you clean towels every day any longer unless you toss them in the empty tub. It was clean, it was cold, the ice maker had been turned on. There wasn’t any dirt we could see or bugs around we could find. By the way, we live near Tampa, ie in FL. We know what a problem bugs are down here. It’s an unending battle to keep them out of the house. And sometimes, no matter what you do, some get inside. I have only found 1 way to keep the bugs out. Don’t keep any food or dirty clothes in the house. So if you have someone occupy a property prior to you and they left food out, housekeeping will have a hell of a time getting rid of the bugs. Don’t blame Liki Tiki because the people prior to you who used the room were slobs. Liki Tiki isn’t a traditional hotel. Look at the back of the front doors. The rooms don’t have the traditional hotel rate cards required of hotels and motels. Comparing it to Marriott is comparing Apples to Freight Trains (forget Oranges). Like I said, Marriott is a 5 star, 1st class, full service hotel. Liki Tiki isn’t that. I looked at the “regular” prices for this place. $649 for 6 days and 5 nights. And it included 2 - 4 day tickets to Disney with the Park Hopper option. I think they cost about $200 each. So, right away, you know that you’re paying $300 or less for the lodging portion. $50 a night. I have stayed at most Marriott and Hilton properties within a 10 mile radius of Disney over the years. I never paid $50 a night. I did pay $35 a night for a Best Western once, a motel, without anything except a pool. And oh, the terms for Liki Tiki? It’s a timeshare, you have to sit through the sales presentation. Don’t knock Liki Tiki because you got a steal of a deal from Marriott. Now, on to the facility itself. I found nothing wrong with it. I really didn’t. I stay at Hiltons and Marriotts when I travel for business and I have been in some a lot cleaner than here and a few a lot dirtier. And even if we had paid $50 a night here(we paid $50 for 2 nights), we got a lot. Yeah, it isn’t a “water park”. Duh, this place is a small resort, you think you’re going to get Adventure Island (Busch Gardens), Typhoon Lagoon (Disney) or Wet ‘n Wild in Orlando? Get a clue! You’re paying $50 a night! Yeah, the pools are noisy till about 9pm. Duh, at Disney, pools are noisy till midnight!!! This is a FAMILY VACATION AREA! It’s like people moving into a neighborhood with kids then getting mad that the kids play outside or make noise. Duh, this place attracts FAMILES. FAMILES COME WITH KIDS! We didn’t eat here yet, we’ll see if and when. For what you get, it is outstanding. And convenient. The 5 year old loved the pool. It was convenient to Disney, yeah, maybe a 15 min drive, but then, we’re paying a lot less than a Disney hotel (I’ve stayed in them all) and this side of I-4 is an easy drive to Disney property. Yeah, you need to bring some things, if you want to. But how many people have the chance to wash any laundry on vacation? Normally you don’t at all. Here you can if you want, just get some laundry supplies on the way in. Yeah, you only get 1 roll of paper towels and one packet of dishwasher soap. Well um, when was the last time you went to a hotel and even had the washing machine, kitchen and dishwasher in the room? Unless you’re a Marriott “Interval Vacation” owner, even 1st class hotels don’t provide that. And 3 grocery stores & Super Walmart are less than a 10 min drive. Yeah, this place probably has some rooms that are run down or in need of refurbishment. It’s old. Probably 15 or 20 years. So are most hotels up and down 192. So are many along International Drive. Every place has wear & tear. Don’t beat up this place because it has some. Again, you’re paying $50 a night. And with it’s amenities, it an outstanding bargain. You want Marriott, go stay at World Center, it starts around $200 a night. Or The Hilton at Walt Disney World, it starts around $125 a night. Again, outstanding bargain for what you pay, outstanding bargain for what you receive. I may even do the presentation just so we can come back for the $49.95. Don’t knock this place because it isn’t a Marriott, it isn’t one and it isn’t fair to compare it to one.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: amesisland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki resort in May of 2006. I booked our condo for 1 week and then read some of the reviews on this website which made me a little nervous. I did not need to worry. We had a fantastic time at the Like Tiki and I highly recommend it! We encountered only one issue during our stay which was quickly rectified by the staff. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and were assigned to stay in the 800 building. Unfortunately, our room was on the first floor right next to the entrance to the Liki Tiki Lagoon water park and bar (and there was a kareoke party going on). While inside the room, you could not hear anything but it was hard to sit on our patio without everyone seeing us and the music was a little loud. We asked the front desk to be moved to a quieter spot and they quickly moved us to the 1200 building. This building is newer and the room was a little larger than the first (bathroom was huge!). I thought both of our rooms were spotless and very nicely decorated but if you want a newer, larger room, I would recommend requesting the 1200 building. The waterpark was a blast for our son. Plenty of lifeguards on duty also. We spent 1/2 of our time at the parks and 1/2 of our time at the resort. There was so much to do at the resort, always children's activities, bar specials, kareoke parties, Luau party etc. Sometimes the waterpark was a little too busy so we would go over to one of the other pools at the resort to relax because there was hardly anyone at these pools. It was great to be able to make breakfast and supper in our room and just pay for lunch at the parks. There is a Super Walmart and Publix right down the street and plenty of restaurants nearby. (Try Houlihan's). All in all, we had a great stay and plan to go back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Room ok, but not the rest”
Reviews.Author: conda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with two small children. The apartment was large and comfortable. We had picked this resort because of the lagoon/pool area, but were very disapointed when we got there. The pool was dirty, cold, crowded and extremely noicy. We found a cockroach on the bottom the first day! The staff at the frontdesk was rude and unhelpful. The resort does not have access to the internet and generally seem very outdated. They claim they are a five star resort, we would say 2. Would not go again.

Reviews.Title: “5stars for a 3 star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the liki tiki on May 19th, it was so much better than we had expected! From check in to check out we never encountered a problem. This resort was perfect for our family. We have a seven year old daughter and she loved the water park, having her own room - [ not stuck in a 2 bed hotel rm. for 8 days with mom and dad] and having her own bathroom and a t.v. in her room she got the very much neede down time from wdw. From a moms point of view- If you are good at cleaning up after your family -making beds daily washing towels daily- washing out your dishes then you will do ok at the liki tiki. If you do not I would go somewhere else cause two days into it your place will look a mess. We never went to any seminars for timmeshares- if you avoid the desk behind the check-in desk you will never encounter these people. The food at shipwreck Sallys was real good- we ate the fish fry and had burgers and a sandwich',drinks were good and staff friendly. We stayed in the 700 bldg. was quiet and everything worked fine. I am a neat freak and I brought comet to scrub the bathrooms after reading other reviews and did not need to, very clean. We didnot use the whirlpool tub- but it was big and clean looking.We got this trip through intervale for less than 500.00 for 8 days and it was a great deal and much better than what I thought we would arrive to see.We will go again I am sure- cant wait to go back to wdw and thanks to liki tiki we have all good memories of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki during spring break 2006, based on a recommendation from a coworker. After reading a few reviews here I was somewhat apprehensive about it, but we went ahead and booked anyway. I'm so glad we did!!! We rented a 2 BR condo in one of the highrise units (as opposed to the townhomes). It was beautiful!! Great decor and immaculately clean. Having a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and 2 baths really made this place feel like home away from home. It was very cool to come home with CLEAN clothes, instead of bags packed with dirty clothes. There were 4 of us, and we had all kinds of room to spread out and relax. The location is great, too... not too close to the theme parks, yet just a short drive away. The liki tiki lagoon is great for younger kids, and really really cute. My sons, ages 9 & 13, did not like the lagoon pools...too shallow. They are more suited for younger kids. My boys really enjoyed the other two pools, though. The only down side to that, is that the tiki bar is at the liki tiki lagoon. My husband would have liked staying in one of the town homes because they have outdoor patios, and screened in porches...also no stairs or elevators to access them! It seemed to me that the townhomes were not kept up as well as the highrise condos, but I never actually went inside one. We had very minimal involvement with the staff. We checked in on a Saturday night, and the front desk was very busy, so check in took quite a while. The toaster in our room did not work, and they replaced it within an hour. I think that some of the condo's and townhomes are privately owned, and some are resort owned. That may make some difference in the upkeep of individual units, but ours was absolutely wonderful. There is a Publix grocery store just down the street, and it came in very handy. They had everything we needed, including pool supplies, film, beer and wine. I'm sure Walmart is cheaper, but it was very convenient. WARNING!!! DO NOT ATTEND THE V.I.P. BREAKFAST!! It's a complete sales pitch when they try to get you to purchase a timeshare, or something. We did not attend one, but saw them in action, and they were obnoxious! They try to lure you in by giving you free dinner show tickets. Don't do it!!! If you politely decline the invitation, they leave you alone. We highly recommend Liki Tiki Village, and we can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: MAF617
Reviews.Content: Don't walk away from this resort...RUN!!!! I just stayed at Liki Tiki last week with my family. And don't buy into the whole hype about "being kid friendly" all Orlando resorts are going to be "kid friendly". Thats like going to Las Vegas and saying this hotel had a casino in it and catered to gamblers...DUH..it's Vegas. All resorts cater to children and families, that is why people go to Orlando, Disney, Universal, if they don't then people won't stay there. Do yourself a favor, look elsewhere for a resort. I give this resort a 2 star and thats being generous. I'll give you a little sample of what to expect. We checked in on Friday, got a room in the 600 building, which is one of the older buildings, the newest being 1200. The accomodations were the worst I've ever seen, tiles cracked in the kitchen, pieces of the countertop all damaged, outside of the refrigerator all banged up. I mean this was really bad. So my wife complains and they move us to the 1100 building. We move the next day, get all our luggage unpacked ready to go out for breakfast and my wife spots a few ants on the kitchen counter top by the sink. She cleans them up and were off. We come back later that afternoon and now we have a bunch more ants, so she cleansd it up again and heads to the front desk to show them. They decide they are going to move us again, this time to the 1200 building. Now we pack all our luggage up again, take our toddlers to 1200. We get there, I am about to slide the key when a gentleman smoking a cigerette on the balcony says "Excuse me, that's my room." So I check the paper they gave my wife and its the right room. So now she goes back to the front desk with our toddlers in tow while I wait with all our luggage at the 1200 building getting eaten alive by mosquitos. They give us accomodations back in the 1100 building, the unit directly below where we had the ant problem. And to make up for all this they offered us a free lunch, and a noon check out instead of 10 am. Well, we passed on the free lunch. But I will NEVER, NEVER, NEVER waste time share or recommend thsi place to anyone. And as far as all those fun kids activities they try to sell you on, forget it. They have one 4 seat paddle boat that is broken, two single seat character boats that are always out. Then you can rent a for seat bike or two seat bike, they only have one each. the pool area is tiny, not much of a water park if you ask me. The kiddie pool was dirty, the jets didn't work, and the picture they show of the octopus with the baby seats must be ancient, there are no seats anymore. I just don't want anyone else to make the same mistake I made. Do yourself a favor and your family, find yourself a nice resort and stay away from Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the overstimulating Disney experience, you can stay at one of the Disney properties and pay a fortune. If you want a relaxing family vacation that is a great value, stay here! The resort is just past the chaos of the Maingate area, but still close enough to the Disney entrance. We have 5 children (10 and under) and this place was perfect for us! For our kids its all about the pool and the Liki Tiki pool (waterpark) is awsome! The resort was clean, the villa was beautiful and the staff was friendly. We have no complaints and would stay here again and will definately recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into the 1100 building the saturday before Easter. The room we were put in was infested with bugs. They crawling up from the drains in both the kitchen and bathroom sink. Little ants all over the counters. We immediatley called to alert a manager that we wanted to be moved and they needed to spray this room. we were toldthey only spray for bugs on Tuesdays and they would not be able to move us until tomarrow(Easter). On Easter morning I had to call a manager again to remind them of the bug situation. We were finally moved about noon on Easter. same building different room. We thought everything was great we unpacked went to the pool had a great time with the kids at the water park. When we returned to our room There were ants all over the counters in the kitchen. I again called to see if someone could spray. A manager finally came to the room with 2 cleaning ladies and said all they had was bleach to spray down the counters with. When they started to spray, bugs just started coming out of every crack in the place the manager now seeing with his own eyes how awful this was. called and had someone come to spray our room. needless to say we never seen another ant or bug the rest of our stay. The next day my son pushed the button to turn on the jets for the jacuzzi tub and then the motor wouldn't shut off. Maintance came and got so frustrated after 20 minutes he finally broke the side of the tub off to get to the motor. He then shut it off and said he would be back tomarrow to clean up all the broked tile and fix the side of the tub. This was unbelievable. We thought maybe we were on candy camera. The next day we went to mgm when we got back they had fixed the tub all right. They glued the tiles back in place and used tape for a sign that red "no touch still wet". The nest day we were to attend the timeshare presentation. We told them right from the begining that we would never ever consider buying here. They took down all the info. and hurried us out of there. Do you know we never once heard from management except when the poor manager came up with the cleaning staff. Hows that for cutomer service? I do not recommend this condo to anyone. The water park is great. the bar Ship Wreck Sallys was great. the rooms were a disgrace. I have stayed many places in florida, never have I seen anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “turned out to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Liki Tiki expecting to stay for a week, I was doubtful about booking due to bad reveiws, but on arrival was very pleasantly surprised, that was after a lengthy check in where the clerk had to be told to "be happy" by senior staff. We got to the room and was very delighted with the apartment, and believed that we had made a good choice as there was plenty of room and it was very bright and clean and fully equipped (block 300). After unpacking and having a good nights sleep we got up early and went out until about 2pm, when we got back there was a message from the local agent, Elite Vacations, telling us that we had to check out as the hotel was overbooked, I called reception who were no help so I went down, and did get a little bit further, but still ended up checking out, they told me that they had refused elite vacations request for our accomodation as they were full. We were very disappointed to have to leave, and as I was checking out, i heard the clerk who had eventually helped me, telling another guset that she would do all she could to extend his stay, she shut up when she realised that I was listening!!, However I would stay there if I were to go back as I did like the place and thought that it offered very good value for money. Would book it myself though!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bacio23
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Florida and wish we were still there,,We liked the Liki Tiki very much, but wished the staff would of be a little faster. We requested clean towels every day, expect over a 2hr wait to get them. Some times we didnt get them at all and had to call again. Our aircondition was broken, just keeped on running. I put in two calls to have someone fix it, but nobody ever came. So, we just turned it off by the braker in our room. The room was nice, didnt expect to have a handicap room, our bathroom was bigger than our bedroom. WAS TOLD WE WERE GETTING A KID SIZE BED,,,NOT EVEN CLOSE. Sheets on bed were smaller than bed! Ok, the RITZ it's not. Bring everything with you, no salt , not sprays to clean, nothing is given to you, four dishes and bowls and some pots pans and utensils. Kitchen did have everything you needed to cook. We were in the 500 building, yes the hallways need to be cleaned more often. The staff was very nice and friendly. Especially at Ship Wreck Sally's. Say hi to Randy,,,,,makes the best drinks! There is no place to eat after 8pm and no nice resturant to eat. So you will need a car! All in all, my family had a nice time, pool is great for all kids all ages.Guest like others said, are not so friendly. My 3 year old and 12 year old had a blast,Activities for the kids are soso, you have to pay for everything. I recommend the fish fry night and steak night,,,we loved it!If you are a young couple with no kids, I wouldnt recommend this place,,

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a handicap room through Orbitz and confirmed with the hotel a week prior to our arrival and the hotel assured us we had a handicap room. We arrived to find we did not have a handicap room. Since I cannot stand the shower was not an option for me but the tub would have been except that the tub would not hold water so I could not even bathe. When we would call the front desk, they would hang up without answering. We spoke with several managers and staff but they did not respond to our repeated attempts to get the situation fixed so we called Orbitz. The hotel told Orbitz they did not have handicap rooms. We called the hotel managers three or four times a day trying to get a maintenance person to fix the tub. After four days, we finally found a maintenance person who was entering our building for a different room and he said he would take care of it. We waited all day and called several times but still no one came. The fifth day of our stay maintenance put a plug in the tub and I was able to bathe. The stove did not work, the diswasher did not work, only one light in the bedroom worked. They have NO maid service unless you pay $18 to $26 more a day. Otherwise no one will clean your room or make your bed. They are building more of these buildings on the premises and it is so loud every morning with trucks, etc. This was the worst hotel we ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We drove to Orlando and upon arriving in Winter Park, FL I called the hotel to get directions. The hotel clerk told me to look for the lighted LIKI TIKI sign. I told her that their sign was not lighted. She proceeded to get perturbed and basically told me I was lying and that their sign was lighted. It wasn't. It's very annoying when as a customer "YOU" are called a liar. We had no hot water the first day and that night coming back from Disney World our keys to the room did not work. All the water faucets were switch, i.e. hot instead of cold. My son’s hand was scaled in the kitchen sink. None of the amenities in the room worked- the hair dryer and the dryer. What the hell am I paying for? There was no maid service. So I was forced to wash the towels and it took over 3.5 hours to dry. The room was beyond gross. We book it thru our friends timeshare program. They were so disgusted when they checked in that they actually left. They spent an entire day looking for another place. We just did not have the time to do that. It was stated to us that this was a 5 STAR hotel. BS! I would give this place a notch above a super 8 or Motel 6. The room was grungy and dirty. ******** I ended up with a sever eye infection and who hell knows if I did not get it from this filthy establishment. I have the doctor bills to prove it!! **********

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Dudet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Liki Tike (3/26-4/2). We were a littly leary of all the bad reviews, but we were very happy w/our accomadations. We had a 2BR 2BA in the 500 building. We had hoped for the newer buildings, but this one was just fine. It was very spacious and clean. We honestly couldn't have asked for anything else. We didn't use the pools much (too busy at Disney!), but really enjoyed them when we did. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Right Unit Makes All The Difference”
Reviews.Author: sundaddydo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Liki Tiki after spending seven nights and eight days, 3/23-30/06. Our stay at this resort contained several surprises. Some of which were awesome, some were good, and, of course, some were bad. Overall, we give this resort a very high rating because of the staff and activities planning, the quality of the food, the lay out of the water park, and, last but not least, the condition and ammenities of our room. We will begin with a chronological rundown of our stay, including a description of the two units we stayed in at the Liki Tiki. First, we arrived at the resort at 11:30 AM, and were told a unit would not be available until 2pm. We informed the front desk we needed a ground unit or elevator assessible unit due to health reasons, and we were told appropriate accommodations would be made for us. When we arrived back at the resort at about 2:15, we were informed that a glitch in our reservation had resulted in us checking out on Sunday, 3/26, and not 3/30; which is the vacation we had originally purchased through Orbitz. The staff assured us they would make the changes, they said to take the unit they had for us, and they would notify us when the corrections were made to our reservations. At first, we were more than skeptical about signing the front desk reservation agreement, and instead simply initialed the part that acknowledged we were checking in to the unit, but did not sign the stay agreement. Much to the staff's credit, they fixed the problem before we left the front desk. Our first unit was 308c. This is an older unit. We were pleased that it was ground level, and could park almost right in front of the unit. The unit itself was newly decorated with new appliances and ammentities. It was a pleasant, spacious, and a well equiped unit. However, the unit was two story, with living quarters on the first floor and sleeping quarters on the second floor! This made navigation of the unit difficult and uncomfortable for us. Aside from the fact it was two story, the unit's linai and upstairs balcony looked out across a parking lot to an 8 foot wood fence, and the towering Summer Bay Resort in the distance. On top of that, the balcony had an errie slope that made one feel they were sliding off onto the top of the linai. We decided that the unit was unacceptable for us, and called the front desk for a change. We were told no other units were available for that evening, and to call back at 10am the next day. We called down the next morning and were told another unit would be available at 2pm, and to check in at the front desk. We arrived at 2:15 and were assigned another unit, 1123e. With the exception of re-programming the keys, the transition went off rather smoothly. Another guest informed us that his party had just left the 1100 block, and the rooms were nice. One tip we will bring up here is that of manners. While waiting for our new unit, a guest began to demand a room prior to 4pm. She stated that because of her "connections", she would not wait untill 4pm, and began to verbally abuse everyone on the front desk staff. She eventually huffed and puffed her way outside, while the staff laughed at her, for good reason. The old saying comes to mind, "you attract more flies with honey, than you do with vinegar". Attacking someone's abilities based on their race and ethnicity rarely gets you preferred treatment, and is just plain wrong. WOW! 1123e proved to be a HUGE uprgrade. The room was a two bedroom single floor with a nearby elevator and an exquisite view off the single balcony of forest land. The decor, ammentities, and appliances were all beautiful and efficient. Major bonus: The huge spa tub, big screen TV, and comfortable beds. The only down side with the unit was the clothes dryer which took two, eighty minute cyles to dry an average cotton load. However, we immediately felt at home and truly enjoyed the remainder of our stay in this unit. Perhaps the best feature of the resort was the water park. All the activities are located next to Ship Wreck Sally's pool bar. Our son participated in the Kid's Kamp activity for three hours at a cost of $15 US. It was very nice and comforting to enjoy the Liki Tiki punches at the bar, while being able to see him most of the time. Becky on the activies staff was outstanding, and really went the extra steps to make all the kids fit in and feel at home, Kudos. The water park is myriad slides, fountains, bridges, and entrances, including stairs and a slow decline walk in entrance which is vital for younger and senior guests. We highly recommend the all you can eat Friday Fish Fry for dinner, if you can make it. It is delicious and an extremely good value, ($8 US and $6 US for kids). Overall, we found the lay out of the water park and it's close proximity to the activities desk and pool bar to be exceptional, convenient, and well above average for typical time shares we have stayed at in Orlando. In closing, although we are not time share owners, we have stayed at several time shares in the US and Mexico. The Liki Tiki Villages, with the exception of our first unit lay out, was a good value, a pleasant stay, and an overall excellent vacation experience. We will not hesitate to stay in Liki Tiki Villages at this unit in the future. PS One warning we can offer is the commute time between the resort and I4. The resort is on SR 192, which is bottleneck all the way to the interstate. Our average commute time just to I4 was typically 30 to 45 minutes. Keep in mind that it will take you over an hour to get to the major theme parks located "conviently minutes away", but this is the case for all the resorts southwest of the parks as road construction continues.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenYorkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: This is excellent accommodation, ideal base for Disney (5 mins drive) Universal (15 mins drive) & Busch Gardens (1 hour) My family (myself, wife & 2 kids 9 & 12) stayed in a spacious 1 bedroom unit which was superbly equipped with 2 tv's, DVD/video player, auto washer/dryer, huge fridge, microwave, dishwasher etc and a whirlpool bath. We saw the 2 bedroom units which were even better if you can afford the extra although there was plenty of room for the 4 of us in our one bed and the sofa bed was plenty big enough for the kids. This is a timeshare resort and they'll want you to take the tour but don't get worried it's not too heavy, lasts around 90 mins and they give you a good discount off a show or attractions tickets. We went with Travelcity Direct from Manchester & for what we paid it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki - good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Liki Tiki in Feb 2006 for 2 weeks. Easy to find from the 192. When we booked in we were given information booklets, maps etc. Only minus point was the reception staff trying very hard to book us onto a timeshare tour the following morning. We resisted. We had booked a 1 bed apartment and were initially allocated a room in the 400 block. We were disappointed with this room as it was small, no bath only shower and no dishwasher. There were also ants in the bathroom. Rang reception and they arranged for us to move straight away. A courier brought the key to another apartment in the 900 block. This apartment was much larger, had a dishwasher and spa bath. We had a lovely view over the Liki Tiki pool which we were informed at check in opened at 10am - 6pm (weather permitting). 3 Life guards on duty at this pool. Heated pool in centre of resort open until midnight. Rooms well equiped with full oven, large fridge freezer (with ice maker), blender, microwave, kettle, dishwasher, washer/dryer & crockery. They also give you supplies of washing powder, washing up liquid and dishwasher powder. The pull out bed was a bit of a pain and the bed linen didn't fit properly (too short). The bedding in the main bedroom also had a habit of coming off everynight. Apartment only cleaned once by maid the whole fortnight. You were expected to do your own cleaning, hoover etc provided. Also clean bed linen left for you to put on yourself. Towels were exchanged frequently. Noise from neighbouring apartments was loud. You could hear the next room TV and the stamping about from upstairs. I would stay there again as you are not in the apartment much and it's much better than a hotel. Also encountered the roped off car park. There was a message left on the room telephone answering service advising you of the forthcoming work though.

Reviews.Title: “no probs here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many reports about liki tiki i was really not looking forward to the stay.I had need not have worried.I came here with my husband and 2 boys age 3years and 6years.We all enjoyed ourselves and found the staff were quite friendly and very helpfull. I am disgusted at the way some of the people have tryed their best to turn people against this lovely resort,we had no problems at all. We will however come back next year for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at the Liki Tiki! Myself, my husband and two daughters aged 16 and 14 were looking for an economical vacation near to theme parks and away from the snow. We found that and more at the Liki-Tiki. The two bedroom villa was large and well appointed, with shopping just down the highway at the Publix, or a bit further a Walmart. Rental car a must. We travelled with a 12 year old niece, and after the first bad night were able to work with the couch cushions to make the pull out sleepable. We stayed in the 500 unit, 3rd floor, had a great view of the pool, and the resort was not busy at all. The pool hours were great, open 7:00-11:00 daily, heated with a hot tub, and the girls spent most of their off-park time there. Security was ever-present, staff were friendly, informative, and personable!!. We tried all ammenities offered, including the waterpark, and bar, and we loved it! My husband says he was nailed by the time-share folks the first day when he went to buy theme park tickets, but he survived. We checked out the night before a 6:00 a.m flight, left at 4:00 a.m. and had to return at 4:15 because the 16 year old had left her cell phone "somewhere" in the villa. Security was wonderful, and we were on our way again at 4:20. We will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice week in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: fionalcall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki Village in September 2005. We were initially concerned because of the negative reports we had read on this site. We need not have worried. Our apartment was immaculate, and looked out onto one of the pools. We found the reception staff helpful and cheerful.We would have no hesitation in staying here again. As

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during Feb Winter Break”
Reviews.Author: Albany065
Reviews.Content: The Liki Tiki had warm pools although the last day the heaters were shut off. Get your free donuts at the pool in the AM by Bldg. 600. We have 3 boys, enjoyed the water park. Traffic to Disney for the Holiday week was easy, nice that Tiki is west of Disney. We would arrive early at the parks, in time for 9 AM opening. The facility could have been cleaner, and maintained better. Since it is a timeshare facility, they probably have sold enough units. We did not do the timeshare tour or any of that stuff.

Reviews.Title: “coming back real soon!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me,my husband and 3 boys visited the liki tiki in march of 2005. Me and my husband enjoyed it so much that we went back alone in may 2005. we enjoyed walking the premises at night and we also enjoyed the hot tubs and fitness center.The staff was excellent and i definitely have no complaints. I would reccommend that anyone with kids make this a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “What a scam! ”
Reviews.Author: NoService
Reviews.Content: Refund policy is not enforced! I have repeatedly contacted and spoken to Linda and Vicki regarding my refund since 9/26/05. In each conversation, I have been told their system did not include the correct client information which delayed my refund from being processed. I would be reassured in each conversation the refund would be mailed out. To date, 2/8/06, I have not received my refund. Now phone calls go directly to a voice mailbox with no direct operator.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (husband, 3 kids and my mum) stayed for 2 weeks in unit 800. We all thought Liki Tiki was excellent and are going back this year. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which was very spacious and clean. (I have very high standards). We had no problems with any broken appliances or tatty furniture. I found the staff very helpful and was invited to a timeshare tour but not pressurised to go. My children, aged 8 and twin boys of 4 at the time, absolutely loved the lagoon. Yes, it's not like Typhoon Lagoon, but it's free and the best part was I could have a seat knowing I could see the kids more or less all the time, whereas at the large Disney Water Parks I constantly follow them around incase they get lost - not exactly relaxing. The playpark and beach area were also lovely. The only downside was that it is quite far down 192, however, we all think the extra drive was worth it. I just hope this year is as good as last year. F :-)

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki Great”
Reviews.Author: bilashk
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick, but we were asked if we would like a mid week cleaning of the room at no charge to which we agreed but no one ever showed up. We stayed in building 1200 an newer unit and it was wonderful. It was a 2 bedroom with a full kitchen. The rooms were clean and very spacious. The jet tub and the plasma tv were nice treats. We went in January so bugs were not an issue. The grounds were well kept and the pool looked great. I asked around and other guests seemed happy as well. No timeshare people ever bothered us. The free breakfast was great. You will have to purchase laundry and dishwasher detergent as they only give you enough for one load. Overall we found the Liki Tiki to be of great value and plan on staying there next January.

Reviews.Title: “I am an owner at liki tiki”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at this resort. when we first bought into it back in 1998, it was great, but the last 2 years, we have had a hard time even getting reservations,we pay our maintance fees, and taxes every year, and last year, we as owners couldnt even get in at all, everytime we called , several times, the reservation people say, sorry we are booked full, I think that is bull, we own there and couldnt even go there last year, but we still have to pay our taxes and pay maintaince fees to keep it up. Whats wrong with that picture?The customer service has been really poor the past few years, and when we did go in 2004, we had a hard time getting in then, they were rude when I kept saying, well, when do you have opening so we can come there.I said we are owners. we are hoping to take our kids there this year..well I hope they can find room for us this year. Karen Simons...from Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: llorourke
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at Liki Tiki Village - January 14 to 26. We were a bit nervous about the accomodations based upon some reviews here. Much to our surprise - WE LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT LIKI TIKI! I called a week prior to our arrival to ask for a new unit. The front desk told me they would make a note of it, so I didn't hold out much hope. When we arrived at 9:30 p.m. on the 14th, we were given a brand new unit in High Rise Building 1200 on the 4th floor. It was beautiful. By the way, we were in our room within 15 minutes of arrival at the front desk. Everything was extremely clean and in great condition. This unit was across the parking lot from Liki Tiki Lagoon and Ship Wreck Sally's Bar & Grill, which made it a great location. The lagoon area was our favorite (we have a 9 year old daughter) and even us, as adults, enjoyed the larger water slide! We did have a need to call re: hot water and maintenance was at our door in less than 15 minutes and fixed the problem. We had absolutely nothing to complain about and would definitely come again. Convenient to all parks and attractions, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the liki tiki from Jan 14th-21st and I must say everyone loved it...There were 5 adults and 2 infants(10&19month)staying in a 2 bedroom unit.We arrived at 4:10 p.m., just 10 minutes after the 4:00 p.m. check-in time and check-in was a breeze(no more than 4 minutes(no exaggeration)we declined the info package at the V.I.P.desk(time-share pitch). We stayed in unit 303,there were two bedrooms upstairs.The master bedroom had a king size bed, plenty of bureau space, a big bathroom with shower and a huge sink and vanity seperated from the toilet and shower and a entry to a small L-shaped balcony. The other bedroom consisted of twin beds, access to the same L-shaped balcony and plenty of closet and bureau space..We had the fifth person sleep on the pull-out couch downstairs.The downstairs consisted of a full kitchen(which we used everyday, a living room which has the pull-out couch, a washer and dryer in a closet and a screened in front porch(which was used often too).We only had a 21inch t.v. upstairs and downstairs but who goes on vacation to watch t.v.? The grounds are huge and have plenty of playground space for the kids, 3 pools (2 heated and one has water slides),arcade and a small fitness room. The Liki Tiki is about 7 miles from Disney, about 20 mins with traffic(no matter where you stay there is traffic) which we loved so we could bring the infants home for a nap and return to the parks later. The front desk service was excellent, the few times we called(smoke detector battery and for cribs) they responded within 15mins and called after the issues were resolved to see if we were happy. Our only criticsm was we rented 2 cribs at $34 each for the week and they gave us Pack n Play (play-pens which have no mattress and a very thin bottom) so the infants would start the night off sleeping in the pack n plays and end up in our beds( which they never do at home), so if you bring infants, bring a thick blanket or something to put in the bottom. There is no maid service(we knew that before we got there), we had plenty of towels which we washed ourselves,and there is a dishwasher in the kitchen(which was stocked with plenty of dishes), so we cleaned our dishes every 3rd night and we left our trash by the side of the road and they picked up in the morning. The bottom line is for the money you can't beat Liki Tiki. I talked with dozens of guests during the week and everyone was happy..All the people that complained in other reviews, I don't think they ever will be happy in their travels and should just stay home..

Reviews.Title: “Liked Liki Tiki”
Reviews.Author: mickyfan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 wk trip to Liki Tiki Village and we enjoyed the resort. We spent most days at theme parks and had friends join us for the 2nd wk. We are a family of 4 (2 children ages 3 & 7), our friends that joined us had the mother and her kids (ages 9 & 13). We stayed in a 2 bdrm unit at the 1200 building. I highly suggest you request this building as I have read & heard that the other buildings aren't quite as nice. Ours was gorgeous, full kitchen, full size washer/dryer,large LR/DR combo w/ large plasma tv and DVD/VCR combo. The 2nd bdrm had 2 full size beds w/ average sized 2nd bthrm. The master suite was very nice w/ a great jacuzzi in the room. The back screened in porch didn't have much of a view (just the wooded area in back of the resort which will eventually be developed by liki tiki)but still nice to have available. The water park is very nice, older kids may get bored w/ it but the younger ones/pre-teens had a blast. It's free for guests staying at the resort. I was disappointed that the resort charged for the bumper boats & mini golf though as they are kind of small and not too impressive for the price (about $15). The sandy beach by the man-made lake was nice too. Nice playground for little ones. We didn't participate in any of the events/activities as they charged too much for what we thought. The luau wasn't going on during our stay as they said it is a slow month for them, wish they would've advertised that before we went, the kids were looking forward to it. We did take a tour for discounted tickets and to learn more about the resort, very easy going, no pressure whatsoever. Check in was very easy, no problems w/ staff not being able to speak english (as I had read here previously), quick check in and out. Any requests we had were granted immediately. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. I would probably not stay again as it was a little too far out on rt. 192 for us. It took approx. 15 minutes to get to sea world or universal, very close to disney though. They offer free shuttle service but the hours didn't work for us. Very kid friendly and clean resort. I would recommend it to family/friends w/ children and don't mind a bit more of a drive than some other resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No daily maid service, unfriendly receptionists, thin walls....”
Reviews.Author: sxs0797
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki Village for 4 nights at the end of December. This place should rated 2 and half star. Where should I start? First of all, CHECK-IN process was not smooth. We arrived a little bit earlier than their check-in time, so we were told to come back later. However, we had to pre-check-in by signing all sorts of paper. Ok, fair enough. I asked for a non-smoking unit, a receptionist said we would be assigned to the non-smoking building 1200. We left to go to Disney. We came back near midnight, and we were very tired. All we wanted was a smooth check-in. No, first of all, another receptionist could not find my name on their computer, and she could not find the papers that I previously signed either. So we waited. Then, she said no non-smoking unit was no longer available. I argued a little bit, but for what? There was no more non-smoking unit, what could I do? We ended up staying at 700 building. The room was big enough, but LOUD too. We could hear TV noise from the next door. In our bed room there was a water pipe so each time someone around our room used their shower or toilette, we could hear all the sewege going down. First night we could not sleep well since someone taking shower around 4AM! No daily maid service (I think their maid service is every Wednesday). If you don't read their booklet and use their towels carefully, you will end up using the same towels over and over. If you want the daily maid service, you have to pay for it. I think Liki Tiki should provide daily service to those who are staying for more than 4 days and less than 7 days customers. Disney was not as near as we thought, but okay. The traffic between Disney and Liki Tiki was horrible during holiday season. In summer maybe this place is nicer. They have several outside swimming pools, but we were there in December, and we did not use any. I am glad that we did not pay too much money here. I would not pay more than $80/night (during high season). Some other hotels/motels even closer to Disney look much better than here. At least I am sure that Ramada, Holiday inn, Bestwester, LaQuinta, Days Inn etc. all will provide you a daily maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Disney World”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one-week stay at the Liki Tiki Village. Having read tripadvisor reviews on this resort before we left, I knew there were newer 5-story buildings in addition to the older four-plexes on the property. I had called ahead and requested to be placed in one of the new buildings. Upon check-in we were given a room in one of the four-plexes as they said the other buildings were all full. The room was spacious and clean, but definitely older and showing its age. The next morning I inquired about being moved to one of the newer buildings, and my request was immediately granted. We had a room on the second floor of the 1200 building. Wow!! Incredible room! We had a 2-bedroom unit that was very spacious and tastefully decorated. My husband LOVED the large flat screen TV mounted on the wall in the living room. The master bedroom had a king size bed, and a huge ensuite bathroom with a double jacuzzi tub, shower, and large counter on either side of the sink. Nice touch was the ample cabinetry and drawers under the sink to store toiletries. I appreciated the full size washer and dryer in the unit (tastefully tucked away in a large closet). Also nice was the ample parking - we never had a problem finding a stall right in front of our building - no matter what time of day. The resort is about 7 miles from Disney World - unless you stay right at a Disney property, you are going to be driving a similar distance no matter where you stay. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone wanting a "home away from home" while visiting the attractions in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (two adults, one 4 year old and one 8 month old) stayed at Liki Tiki during the second week of August 2005. We purchased an 8 day/7 night one bedroom package from Ebay. All of my friends thought I was crazy to purchase a vacation from Ebay, and after reading several negative reviews about Liki Tiki, I was beginning to think I might be crazy! LOL!! We took a leap of faith considering we got such a good deal. Check in was easy and the room was ready and clean. We had everything we needed in the room - full kitchen, dishwasher, washer and dryer, and everything to make it a homelike experience. The resort gave us starters like dishwashing and washer detergent, roll of towels, tissue paper, and other goodies to enjoy. We stayed in the 7000 building which overlooked the lagoon and lake. We enjoyed meals on the very large patio. We had a great time visiting the waterpark and pool daily. We declined the tour without further harrassment. The location is really great. Publix and Walmart were very convenient for our needs. We drove to WDW within 15 minutes. We've booked another vacation for July 2006. It's a great place to vacation for a family. It's not a fancy place but for us it was simple and sufficient. Here are my negatives though....Some of the staff couldn't speak English. Most of the staff that we dealt with weren't very friendy or "vacation oriented" in making us feel like guests. During transactions at the paddle boats it was like pulling teeth to get one kid to even speak. They could definitely use a customer service review with some of the staff. Also, at the Lagoon, I carried in a very small cooler for my 8 month old daughter full of milk bottles, baby food, crackers, water, medicine, sunscreen, diapers/wipes, etc. When we entered, the pool manager (without asking) took my bag off of my shouldar (and wanted to store it at the bar/grill)saying that "we have everything you need (to purchase) at Shipwreck Sally's Bar," in which I replied, "I doubt you carry breastmilk or baby food on your menu," and kindly took my bag from her hand. I was appauled with her behavior and inability to respect my personal belongings. She definitely could've approached this situation better! We did purchase items from the bar/grill daily such at lunches, snacks and drinks but no one is taking my infant's bag full of items that she needs while it's 90 degrees at a waterpark!! The pool could definitely open earlier than 10 a.m. - there are kids just dying to swim at about 9 a.m.! All in all, a good experience and we look forward to spending another weeks' vacation there next summer. And, I'll be toting my small cooler to the pool again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Had Tremendous Time, Very Happy I went!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went the last week of August through September 2, 2005. We simply had a tremendous time. We stayed in a TownHouse in the 200's which was not one of the newer ones, but it was great anyway. It was quiet, 2 beds, 2 baths, dishwasher, oven, microwave, 2 tvs, patio, etc... It is also only a 5-10 minute drive to the Disney Attractions. The only things to be improved upon are: 1. They need an adult only pool somewhere. This place is geared to the kids 100%, which is okay, but I'm striving for perfection here. 2. They need an adult only hot tub. Too many kids in the hot tub. 3. They could use supervision at the pool areas. Every thing else was perfect. The staff-members were attentive to any questions or problems. I really am puzzled and wonder how this place that I found to be so great, could have some negative reviews here. I can just say that my experience was fantastic and my wife and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our fam. vacation gone bad !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Liki Tiki resort was very disappointing.Because of the wonderful reviews I read we wanted to go to this place and even stay more time at the hotel with the kids. We arrive at 5:00p.m on Sat.Nov.19 and the room wasn't clean we had to wait for an 1hr and 30min.Went we got the room I had to spent time cleaning the room again. My kids went for a bath in the whirlpool and came out screaming because of all the dirt that started to come out. I could not take a bath in the shower because of a leak on the ceiling. We just had one remote control for one of the TV’S, and we have three in the apt. I call them for us to change room and they told us they did not have any accommodation left. The next day I call them again because we have roaches in the room. Then they moved us to one of their villas. Again, the same problems but this time we had a leak from one of the toilets and the master bedroom had a very bad odor. We had an exchanged made for this hotel, and it was a real nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful Orlando vacation and stay at the Liki-Tiki. We booked the trip last January through Expedia and got a wonderful package. I too read all the reviews, most favorable but some extremely unfavorable so I was prepared for the worst. We arrived on a Friday at 5:00 to find that our room was not ready, at 6 it was still not ready so we went to dinner. When we returned at 8:30 we were given a key to a room but when we got there we found the housekeeper in the middle of her routine. By now we are all exhausted and short on patience, I went back to the desk and requested a new room. The front desk was very apologetic and gave us a new room in the same building. Aside from the check-in I cannot say anything negative about our stay, the room was new and spotless, the beds very comfortable, the linens appeared new. Because of all the reviews I had seen I called the resort the week before we arrived and requested to be in a new building which they granted without a problem. The original town house style units look dated and I am sure the interiors are variable, buildings 500-800 are fairly new and face the pond and water park which can be loud at times. Buildings 900-1200 are across the parking lot and face "woods", they are extremely quiet and have screened balconies. There is a new building under construction, the workers are on site around 7am but we were up and out early ourselves. The construction is cinder blocks so I am not sure about the complaints of "paper thin" walls. We had neighbors around us and were not bothered to any significance. The location is remote, about 7 miles from the maingate of Disney down 192, I am sure during busy seasons this can be a problem, in October or November there was no traffic to speak of, we sailed into the parks and home again. Our trip was centered around Disney World so we spent little time at the resort except to sleep. It was nice to have coffee and breakfast on a few occassions in the unit but otherwise we did not take advantage of the kitchen or laundry facility. The flat panel TV in the living room was great and both bedrooms had 32 inch units as well. It was nice that the kids had their own room and bath. We did spend some time in the water park on 2 afternoons, my kids ages 7 and 8 loved it, thought it was great fun. It was certainly a unique feature to provide, the water park was well staffed with life guards as well. The grounds were well kept, there was a small playground and mini-golf as well as paddle boats for kids to enjoy. When we checked in we were asked to sign up for a "tour" breakfast which we declined and were never bothered again. For what we paid we had a very lovely and comfortable unit with plenty of space for all. You will spend plenty of money on food and other items in the parks, it was nice to be able to save on our accomodations. I would recommend the Liki-Tiki Village without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the pool. The rooms were okay, and the place seemed clean. It is not a luxury resort, but you get what you paid for. One thing..just don't expect a big screen tv in you room. Maybe a 20.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected,,,,,,,”
Reviews.Author: victorgeorge
Reviews.Content: ,,,,,,,After reading some of the reviews on this website I wondered if I had made a mistake after booking three weeks at "Liki Tiki"......But on arriving (the evening of 23rd nov.05,,,a few hours before Hurricane Wilma arrived ),,,I was pleasantly surprised.My party had three 1 bedroom apartments which we booked through Travel City and all were pleased with them,I agree there is some maintenance,etc, being carried out around the resort (which covers a large area ),but at any holiday resort this has to be done sometime and it did not interfere with our stay in anyway.The staff seemed cheerfull especially the security at the gate who always greeted you with a wave and a smile.If you look hard enough you will always find problems at any holiday resort, some people are never happy. I personally would return there anytime and hopefully will do.,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: snowflake13
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write my own review after reading some of these terrible reviews! My husband and I, our 2 kids and my mom stayed at the Liki Tiki and totally enjoyed ourselves! Just make sure you get a newer condo unit. They are very, very nice. The 2 pools were nice, the main pool was actually as warm as some hot tubs I've been in! The only complains I have were that at the time of the year we went warm weather is hit or miss - a few days we went to the little waterpark and the water was quite cold and there isn't a hottub in that pool area! They need a hottub over there so you can warm up! The so called lake is also more of a big pond but still nice. There is also a beachsand area and my kids had fun playing in the sand. Also we went to the timeshare thing - got the whole tour - the guy who talked to us was really nice, until the end when we told him no, then he brings in a manager to lower the price - we still said no and I was very surprised that he got very upset and was really trying to make us feel guilty. So if you can avoid the timeshare thing - unless you don't care and want the cheaper rate or free tickets like us!:>) Also the location was a little far for us. Way down on 192 - we've stayed on International Drive on previous trips and like that area. Although where the Liki Tiki is located is off of the main highway so it is secluted and quiet. Overall I think it is a very nice resort for the price and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Stecarroll
Reviews.Content: szMy family and I stayed in what was called a town house at the resort, and I have to say we were very impressed. The accomodation was very well equipped, with full kitchen washing and drying facilities two bathrooms, lounge, two bedrooms and small patio area. I can also say we had no problems with the staff, except for language difficulties. Our two teenage kids absolutely loved the camp, especially as they could use the pool until midnight every night. The resort is also very close to all the Disney parks. What we really liked about the resort was the fact that we could let our kids explore the place as it was very secure with having gated security. My only complaint was that we didnt book for 3 weeks instead of two.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Liki Tiki, great for the kids”
Reviews.Author: RufustheRed
Reviews.Content: We (myself, my wife and 2 boys aged 12 and 5) stayed at the Liki Tiki resort for 17 days from the 18th of October 2005 and we all thought that it was great. After reading some reviews on the internet which were very mixed I was hoping that the positive reviews were the ones that we thought were right and they didn't disappoint, we stayed in the new 1200 block which was a minute from the water park (which the kids loved), the rooms were modern and clean with plenty of room for us all and with the added bonus of a washing machine and tumble dryer! Depending on the traffic we where only five to ten minutes from Disney and about fifteen minutes from international drive which was ideal. We'd definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ohthatjulie
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, 2 adults, 1 thirteen year old and 1 ten year old, just returned from our trip, we arrived October 23, just in time for hurricane Wilma. No problems here, lots of wind and some rain for 1 day. We stayed in the newer 1200 building for 1 week in a 2bdrm, 2 bath for only $119 per night through CondoExpress. We were impressed with the plasma tv with dvd player in living room. The master bedroom had a king size bed, a large tv and a beautiful 2 person-jaccuzzi/bathroom. The second bedroom had 2 full size beds and another tv. The balcony was screened in and had a table with chairs. We only used the pool area that was behind the main check-in building. This pool was nicely heated and there is a hot tub. The pool playground area was always closed due to activities, Luau Party, fish fry, etc. But that didn't matter, the water there was too cold to enjoy at this time of year, only in the low 70's. The staff was courteous and helpful. We felt safe with the security at the main gate only allowing guests to enter. The only minor problems we had, the bedroom circuit breakers tripped a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: ndpmom1999
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Liki Tiki twice now. Back Aug 2004 and May 2005. We have a 6 year old son and he had a blast. The Liki Tiki Lagoon (water park) is a lot of fun for everyone. They also have a bar/grill with specials all the time. (we loved the chicken fingers) We really enjoyed the Luau that they had one evening too. They have paddle boats, art/craft classes, putt putt golf and a lake that you can fish in. All in all the best vacations we have ever had. We are now timeshare owners. We purchaseed after the first trip down there and look forward to making it our home away from home. Our son calls it our trip house. There is enough fun/relaxing things to do that you do not have to leave the resort, except for groceries and eating out. I would reccommend this reosrt to anyone...espically those with kids! We are looking forward to another week this Spring/Summer. We took our 15 yr old nephew with us last time and he had a blast too! Hope this review helps! Very friendly staff! Liki Tiki here we come!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family loved it, we actually won the trip from a drawing off a radio program. After reading some of the not so great reviews, we went with a PLAN-B in mind if needed. After arriving we were pleasently suprised, from the guard at the gate to the staff at the desk everyone was great. The unit we stayed in was nice 1- bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The beds were ok 1- queen in master & a sleep sofa in the family room, everything worked. After settling in we went for a walk the water slide area was very nice my kids loved it, nice outside bar also served sandwiches price was not too bad. Got up early the next a.m. & went to the parks when we got back we had messages on the phone 1- was telling us the clubhouse was closed that evening for a wedding, the other was telling us all that was happening that evening at the " A LUAU & Pig roast" WOW. You wont find that at the mega resorts. We will give this place 2- THUMBS UP. Please try it you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous !!!”
Reviews.Author: donnaltravel
