Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on this resort, I was a bit leary about going....But figured I would just suck it up and go!!! Boy was I pleasantly surprised!! I went with my husband and 6 yr old daughter. Upon arriving I called and asked for the newest building (1200). When we walked in (room # 1252) it was terrific. A huge condo with 2 bedrooms/2 baths. In the master bedroom was a king bed, jacuzzi and shower/bathroom. In the other bedroom (small, but still fine) it had to 2 double beds. A large kitchen with all the utensils you can think of. In the living area was a large table to seat 6. On the wall was a huge plasma TV (my husband and daughter loved that). I tell you, if you want a brand new unit (I think we were the first to stay in our unit), ask for building 1200. They just started building 1300. One thing I must say, is I couldnt find were they have the breakfast in the morning, which was frustrating, but we would leave by 8am to head to the parks anyways, and that is when the breakfast started! The one complaint is that the water park should open earlier than 10am. We only got to enjoy it 30 minutes the morning we were leaving to fly home. All in all we had a great time, We would definately stay here again!! If you have any questions, you can email me at donnaltravel@yahoo.com Oh, by the way, I am seasoned traveler, I have been to many caribbean destinations. I am a travel agent and would recommend the Liki Tiki to any of my clients!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, My husband our two girls and I stayed at Liki Tiki from Sept. 18th to Sept. 27th. I read alot of the reviews before we left and some of them were hillirious because they said they had to use dirty sheets all week, why didn't they just wash them in the washer that was in their room etc. We were very impressed with the whole place. Very blest by how the lifeguards at the water park were taking care of the children. Some parents got upset with them but to be honest thier children were being too wild and needed to be corrected by someone. Our room was great and had everything in it we needed. The first night our smoke alarm kept going off so we called the front desk and someone was there within minutes(this was in the middle of the night around 1). I was all of the time seeing staff cleaning the grounds etc. When we checked in they did try to get us to take a "tour" but didn't pressure us when we said no. It was like a home away from home for us. So when you read negative reviews just remember that some people you can't please no matter what and aren't happy about anything anyway. For only $63 anight it was GREAT!!!! Thanks! Teri

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days and attended the time share presentation. We were quite surprised that when we turned them down we not harrased for the week. The room was a 1 bedroom and we found it clean and nicely decorated. We had a view of thier water park from a pleasantly large balcony. The room had a full kitchen that was fully equipped, making it nice easy to fix a light meal after returning from the parks. In light traffic we could be at the entranced to WDW in less than 10 minutes. The washer and dryer was a huge bonus. TV's in the bedroom, along a VCR and stereo in the main room. Bring your own shampoo and soap for those provided by the resort doesn't last long. Also you get no daily maid service. But all in all the Liki Tiki was an excelent value at just under $600 for the week along with Disney tickets for lisyening to thier timeshare speal. Any questions about Liki or WDW e-mail I would be glad to help.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LTV the last week of August and had a wonderful time. Having read most of the reviews, I was skeptical about what we would find there and I'm happy to say we didn't find anything terrible. We checked in around 6:00 pm on a Sat. and had no problems and everyone was very nice. We had a 2 bedroom villa and although it was showing some signs of wear, it was still very nice. We had just come from a water park and all needed to take showers. One of the shower handles was broken and I called the front desk and within 10 mins. a maintenance man was there and fixed the problem right away. We didn't use the facilities very much since we were at the theme parks all week but when we did, it was fine. I think the lagoon pool should open earlier than 10 a.m. and close later than dusk since most guests are heading to the parks before it opens. We used the lagoon pool on Wed. morning and the kids enjoyed it although we only stayed for about an hr. before heading out. But they did get to use it for several hours on Sat. before our flight home and even though it was very, very crowded, the kids still had a good time. We tried the food at Shipwreak Sally's and it was ok. The kitchen had all the supplies it claimed to have and the bedrooms, living room and washer/dryer were terrific. We were in 214 and thought it was really nice. I think some people complain because that's all they know how to do. Go and enjoy. For the price, this place can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and 7 year old son and I stayed at Liki Tiki for a week from August 27-September 3. It was wonderful!! We stayed in a one bedroom suite Which was immaculate! It was very clean, very well supplied, Air conditioning system was superb..felt like a meat locker at times..lolol. I dont understand why anyone would have anything bad to say about this resort. It is also extremely convinient, close too Many restraunts, supermarkets, souvenir spots, and all the parks!! Pools were great, my son loves the water park, we even went to the pool at 11:00pm at night sometimes if we wanted to, one of them was open till midnight. It was great and i would definetely go again!! NO problems at all with bugs, or towels, or sheets.. we had more that enough of everything and i cant stress how clean it all was!!!..You MUST TRY IT!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it !”
Reviews.Author: YGOLFA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki from August 20th until August 26th in a one bedroom apartment. We arrived late to find our next door "neighbours" still had the TV on full volume. All the one bedroom apartments are joined together by connecting doors that lets all the adjoining sounds into your apartment. The apartment was very worn and dirty looking. Needed complete refurb. As we were visting parks for first 2 days I didn't really have time or energy to complain. I woke up on the 3rd morning to find the biggest Roach I have ever seen running across the sink ! I went down to front desk to ask for a change of room. Complete waste of time. Staff acted dumb and said they would pass on my comments to day manager when he got in at 10.00am. Needless to say nothing was done. We were out at parks everyday so all we did was sleep there. If I had been staying there any longer or using the facilities, I would have been outa there after the first night. I do not expect luxury for 80 dollars a night, but I do expect a certain level of cleanliness, somewhere that feels safe and is quite enough to get a good nights sleep. Liki Tiki ticked none of these boxes !

Reviews.Title: “The Resort was exquisite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Villas were very beautiful! My cousin stayed at the pool from opening to closing (or if a Thunderstorm is near). If you got a reservation, you will go gallivanting for the continental breakfast. If you are driving, you might see that Floridians do not know the concept of safe driving. We didn't even go to Disney! It was Fun from beginning to the end!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Florida from Iowa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Florida vacation (Aug.8 -15th 2005). We stayed at the Liki Tiki in a one bedroom condo. For the most part we were pretty pleased. The room was very nice. It was clean and equipped with everything we needed. The kitchenette, washer and dryer came in real handy. Loved the jacuzzi!!!!! The location was just fine. It was easy to get back and forth from all the attractions. Universal was alittle farther than WDW but not bad. Walmart was just down the street so that was real conveinient. The water park was nice but not very big. I was disappointed that they closed so early. The only complaint that I can think of was the bartenders at Shipwreck Sally's were alittle rude and not very friendly. Otherwise I definitely would return. It was a very affordable price and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It all started on Saturday. We arrived around 8:00pm. Threw our luggage in the room and went to dinner. Returned around 10:30pm. Turned on the lights and were shocked at the filthyness of the unit. Looked at the note on the table that tells what should be in the room. Missing most items. I called the front desk to complain about the dirt and missing items also we requested handycap rooms. This was a two story townhouse. They brought over some cleaning solution and rags for us to clean. We were told there was no one to help us clean. I called the front desk to request linens and blankets for the pull out couch for my boys to sleep on. Went to bed late. Next morning I found my boys with no pillows and covered up with towels. The linnens showed up at 10am that morning. The toilet seat was falling off. The master bath faucet was falling off. I requested the Housekeeping manager visit our room. She got us a new unit later that night. They balked when I suggested they help us move our stuff. The new unit did smell clean, but as you walked in you noticed grout missing in the tile floor and still a two story. To tired to argue. Tried to order pizza but no phone book or hotel book. Tried to vacuum the carpets but no vacuum. tried to put our medecines and valuables in the safe but no safe. I called the front desk and asked for the General manager. I was told no management was on site. The desk staff was in charge but couldnt make any decisions. I called housekeeping for a frying pan that was supposed to be in the room (I had family coming over for breakfast). Housekeeping told me I would have to get on a list and see if any showed up at 10am during check out. Early next morning found a wasp nest over the balcony. I called the front desk. The exterminator showed up and sprayed the nest, spewing a liquid chemical all over the balcony and railing. When I requested he clean it up because I have children staying there, He suggested I call the front desk to help me. Next morning went on an owners walk and they showed me a $30,000.00 price tag. Went to the General Managers office. Told him about the Rudeness and lack of concern of his staff and the unclean facilities. He informed me we were now in a newly remodeled unit. Clue - fire the contractor. I told him we were going out and needed a safe. He said he wold try but couldnt guarantee anything. He offered me a free cleaning of the room and a free pass to the luau. I told him it was his job to clean my room and the luau didnt interest me. I told him he needede to get me into a single floor unit. Later that night he got us into the single floor unit. It was better but had drywall corner bead coming off. it was missing some of the required items but we were done with place. Tried to make the best of what we had left. My Comments: I traded in a 5 star unit to go there. I was stuck with a 1 star resort with rude employees. I believe the front desk and the General Manager have no Idea about customer service. They could have gone around the corner to Walmart and bought a frying pan or a safe. These items would have cost them less than $60.00. I cant believe they handed me a $30,000.00 price tag but were not willing to give my family service. The worst thing a resort staff can do is tell a customer I dont know if I can help you. Find a way to fix the problems. The General Manager and the rest of the staff need to go. You can fix the rooms, but you can t change peoples additudes towards customers. If I would have know about these resort advice websites I would never have gone to Liki Tiki.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great!”
Reviews.Author: scowdroy1
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Florida and after using a local villa for the past 3 trips we decided to try a resort, as we wanted to have access to a bigger pool and more facilities. Having seen the pictures of Liki Tiki on the web we believed the accomodation to be of a very high standard and looked like it ticked all the right boxes with the facilities on offer. Unfortunately whilst not bad enough to insist on a move the reality was quiet different as the accomodation was tired looking and in disrepair. The main issues were a broken entrance door, a leak in the conservatory area that sometimes formed in to a big puddle outside the door, stained furniture and a blocked toilet. In addition we had problems with the safe being locked on arrival and after renting a video for the children one evening we found the recorder did not work. One final problem was with small ant like creatures daily found on work surfaces in the kitchen. Whilst the resort responded to some of the issues we had, the place seemed to be more interested in selling timeshare with loads of visitors being shown around the pool areas whilst we relaxed. Whilst we had a couple of decent days on the complex the pools were very busy after 11am and quality of food was average at best. The worst part was the sheer volume and size of flying insects and ants that were attracted to you when eating etc so we chose to eat indoors or away from the complex after the first time. We would not return to Liki Tiki but would certainly go back to Florida as it was the best yet with regard to parks, shows and shopping, (as we hit the tax free week with loads of sales).

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to say”
Reviews.Author: citylover0
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Liki Tiki 2 years in a row and will be going back next year. The Condos are very nicely furnished "a real home from home". We had a problem with our hot water which resulted in needing a new boiler and this was all fixed promptly by the very efficient maintanence staff. I did not find the water park overcrowed and the food and service at Ship Wreck Sally's was excellent. I have been to Florida 8 times now and after staying at the Liki tiki I can honestly say this was the best accomodation I have been too. Can't wait to get back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: matchtrader
Reviews.Content: Reading the other review of this resort, I think that some of the other reviewers failed to consider the price point which this resort occupies. For the money, it was one of the better resorts at which we have stayed. Of course, if you want the Hilton you will be disappointed, but if you keep your expectations in line with the prices you will pay for staying at this resort, you will be happy. It was clean, the rooms were fine (if not lavishly appointed) and the water park first rate (bearing in mind that there is no additional charge to use it).

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Oversold”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liki Tiki during the week of July 17. We will not stay here again, nor recommend it to anyone traveling to Orlando. We arrived a couple hours prior to check-in and pre-registered so that we could go right up to the room. The wait to pre-register was about 45 minutes, but I thought it wouldn't matter because we'd save time later on...wrong. When I later went back to get the room key, I had to wait another 45 minutes in a line behind guests who didn't pre-register. No complaints about the room, other than waiting an hour for someone to bring up a set of sheets for the sleeper sofa. Do not stay at this hotel if the selling point is the waterpark, as this is not a waterpark hotel. It has a pool with some novelties that look nice on the website, but the pools get overcrowded and unless you get there early you won't get a seat. Even when you get a seat, you need to keep an eye on it or else it might get taken...literally taken...we turned around and there was an empty spot where our chair was (but at least the nice person who took our chair left our towels on the ground). Many of the people using the pool were there "visiting" someone who is staying there, which may or may not have been the case. If you're visiting someone at the resort, why would you be standing around the trunk of your car eating KFC? Restaurant was okay, but closed very early. I agree with a previous poster's note of this being a lower-level hotel with lower-level clientele.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! We usually stay at a Disney Resort, which are very expensive, but you get what you pay for. We decided to try Liki tiki, as the internet pictures looked great, price was good, and the kids loved the waterpark pictures. Upon arriving, there were no problems. Checked in with no problems. Room was very nice in size. I would give the room a "6" on a 1-10 on cleanliness. The pull out sofa bed was broken (leaned down where your head lays - just old I believe). The pool was completely over crowded, no room to swim even. My biggest compaint was the service. The service at the restaraunt/bar was terrible. The waitress was never there. The steaks for Saturday night were like shoe leather. (Although the chicken strips were good). The service for the room was absolutely lousy! We started cooking pizza ryes and realized we had no cookie sheet so they said they would send one right up. About 1 hour later (and 3 phone calls) we received it. We ended up cooking them on the oven rack and were done eating by the time it arrived. We called down for pillows and blankets another time as there were not enough in the room and got a recording from housekeeping to leave a message, so we did. And the we called front desk and said we would come get them ourselves as we were tired of waiting and they said they would be right up. Again, 3 more phone calls and getting very angry and tired, as the kids already fell asleep, they arrived. (after I threatened to come down in 5 minutes if they were not there yet). Total time was about 1 1/2 hours, with them telling me they were on their way in 5 minutes. Front desk almost never answers the phone. No exaggeration. We put it down and let it ring for about 20 minutes, with no answer still. Bottom line is we would never again, stay at this hotel, as the service is horrible. The waterpark closes at dark due to the fact that there are no lights in the pool and the bar closes as well at the same time. One other gripe we had was 1 night a week there is a luau which the guests are required to leave the pool area at 6:00 for the night, unless you want to pay $70 for a family of 4. Definitely a lower class hotel and lower class guests as well. Oh yea, if you think complaining to a manager will help, it seems there isn't ever one on staff. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “We Were Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mom5X
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Liki Tiki Village. We were disappointed and would definitely not stay there again. They state the two bedroom condos sleep 6. There is a king size bed in the master br, two twin beds in the 2nd br, and a full size (not queen) pullout in the lr. The pullout is most definitely NOT for adults to sleep on, even my 15 year old found it very uncomfortable. We arrived late and there were no sheets for the pullout. After calling housekeeping twice with no results, we had to go back to the front desk to ask for sheets. The water park sounds wonderful but is actually pretty small. You have to get there early to stake your claim on chairs or you will not get a seat. The slides are very close together and also near the stairs so you really have to keep an eye on very small children, or take them in the "baby" pool. The only restaurant is actually inside the water park which is somewhat removed from all but a few buildings and they have limited hours. Liki Tiki is also further away from Disney than we had anticipated. Rt. 192 traffic can get very heavy. One day it took us almost an hour to get to Magic Kingdom, the shortest drive we had was about 25 minutes. If you are looking for restaurants close by, you will also be disappointed. Not too many within a 5-10 minute drive. We traded our week at Sheraton Vistana. I would give Vistana a much better rating. Some reviews mention being pressured about taking their tour. We told them at check-in that we would not be taking the tour and they did not bother us. As far as cleanliness, I have no complaints and we did not see any bugs, although if you go to the pools at night you will need repellant - lots of mosquitoes and gnats.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Liki Tiki Resort very much. When traveling with kids, we always look for a water park area or a pool. Here we had both, the pool right outside our condo door and the water park just a short walk away. We felt comfortable with our kids at the water park and all types of water toys for all ages. Also, right next to water park was minature golf and swingsets. The Liki Tiki was centrally located, so to go to dinner or to shop, it was only a short drive. We paid $330.00 for 7 nights, so we were quite satisfied. We also had a washer/dryer, so you know with kids, there is always laundry to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: fun24/7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liki Tiki Village June 26 - July 3 with my husband and 11 yr. old. We stayed in a one bedroom in the 600 bldg. on the first floor. Great location, we walked right out to the pool. The room was very nice, very clean. The carpet looked fairly new. We stayed on Disney property last year and I can honestly say I much preferred the rooms here. It is much nicer to have the extra space, our daughter could go to bed and we could still stay up a while and watch TV. We ate breakfast in almost every morning and made dinner one night. The trade off is that you must drive to the parks. The bus service at Disney, Port Orleans, was great. The parking at Magic Kingdom is a pain when you drive yourself, as you have to take either the monorail or boat after parking. The traffic was heavy a few times but not really a big deal. The water park was OK - always crowded but my daughter enjoyed it. I preferred the pool near our room, less crowded. I read an earlier review about obnoxious rude guests, we did meet a few nice guests but did notice for the most part they were not overly friendly, but then again quite a few did not speak english. But of course the staff at Liki Tiki have no control over this! We went to enjoy the theme parks anyway. Overall we thought the facility was very nice and great for families. One word of advice if you are planning on spending a lot of time at Universal and/or Sea World you may want to stay somewhere else as this resort is closer to Disney. We didn't mind the drive but others might, took about 20 minutes to get to Sea World area.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this resort for the past 3 years. One of my only complaints is the sheets on the beds. They do not fit! I can not believe that so many people complain about this resort. The rooms are quite large and for the price you pay at a Disney resort (which I have stayed many times) this is far more worth your money. Large kitchen, dining area, living room, master bedroom with jacuzzi, and two double beds in the second bedroom. The waterpark is perfect for families and they have activities going on for kids and adults all day long. They added mini golf this year and bumper boats. I hear go karts are coming soon. We stay here because its clean, fun, and very safe for children. Disney is about a 7 minute ride down the road. We brought many friends with us this year to Liki Tiki and they all loved it. Shipwreck Sally's is the pool bar that serves specials all day long. They have great drinks and food. They also have a children's menu. THis is the only restaurant on the resort so don't expect to eat there other than at this bar. I recommend this resort because it is fun and reasonbly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liki Tiki the week of May 22-29. Check in was a quick and easy process. We checked into a 2 bedroom in the 800 building (first floor). We were directly across from the lake which was nice. The room was fairly big. Kitchen was fully stocked. The master bedroom had a great king size bed and wonderful jacuzzi (which my 3 year old enjoyed very much!) The second bedroom had 2 full size beds and its own bathroom. The pool area was really nice. My son couldn't get enough of the slides however the pool itself is not that big. The only downer was that the balconies are not screened in which made it hard for us to sit outside at night cause there were so many bugs! I did kill two spiders and a huge roach in the master bedroom! Yuck! They do need to exterminate the property. Other than that we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful sheets ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basically our experience was good, but some minor things made it a little miserable. I don't know about you, but when I stay away from home, one of my biggest concerns is having a comfortable bed....The bed was fine, king size.... but the bedding! Oh my gosh... we couldn't keep the sheet on the bed.. The bed pad was slippery and the sheets were too small, so what would happen is that all night long we had to keep straightening the sheets out as they would bunch up and fall off. I was also disappointed in the common areas, like the elevator area. I found that these areas on not kept very clean. Lots of debris and gum. Felt very trashy. The room itself was very clean, and pleasant. I have no complaint there, the washer and dryer were falling apart though. We really did enjoy our stay, kids liked the pool. I thought it was too noisy and overcrowded, but I know that Liki Tiki has no control of that... Front desk was very nice, helpful and gracious. They were able to store our luggage for us. Pooran the gate security guy was very nice and friendly... Would be happy to stay there again, (if they fix the sheets!)... One word of caution....Liki Tiki is located pretty far west of the Disney main gate off #192.... traffic can be very heavy back and forth, and there is road construction. So allow extra time for driving to parks.

Reviews.Title: “We like it a Lot!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have a 2 bedroom apartment for 10 people(!). One room with king size bed, second room with 2 queen size beds (we put 3 little kids in every bed) and a queen size sofabed at the living room. Nice full size kitchen. TV in every room and living room. VCR. Complete laundry room is a plus. We really like a very much! As soon as I walked in I said that I have to write this review because hey deserve better cometns than what I read before. Kids LOVE the pool (even preferred to stay there that going to the parks!)

Reviews.Title: “I Was Really Disppointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed i arrived at the resort before 4pm which is check in time that was fine because it gave us a little extra time to go to the waterpark with the children.Everyone that i came in contact with was wonderful the problem was actually the other guests that were staying there they were rude,obnoxious and annoying i work for a resort so i know what it is like these front desk employees were being insulted just about everytime i went into the front office.I put in a req to be by the waterpark and i completely understood that it was not gtd. apparently noone else understands that. They explain to everyone that they may in fact make a req but it is not gtd. Thats not very diffiult to understand. I am also a guest at many resorts and i know what it is like to want to have a nice unit with a nice view which in fact all the units there are very nice and the views are really peaceful but at the same time if it is not available they can not go out and make it for YOU!!! Noone seems to go on vacation anymore for fun they go just to complain and see how much compensation they can get througout there stay. I have never been to other resorts and have never heard so much complaining from guest over the pettiest things noone seems to be aware that resorts are not responsible for the weather conditions or the insects that roam around it is nature those were just a few of the complaints that i heard while there which are very petty complaints. I found nothing wrong with the resort itself it was very clean the rooms were beautiful and the pools and waterpark were amazing but as a guest as well as a employee of a timeshare resort in virginia the last thing i want to walk into is constant screaming,annoying people. I go on vacation to have fun and relax and enjoy my stay i would honestly never insist on anyone staying there just for that reason alone. I went a week with nothing but other guests complaints i could not even lay by the pool or the waterpark without someone trying to engage in negative coversation about the resort. All in All the resort itself is great and has alot of very wonderful things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Flashy”
Reviews.Author: congalton
Reviews.Content: My family and I (wife and 2 small children ages 2 and 5 months) just returned from a week stay at the Liki Tiki Village. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa in the newer 1100 building. The villa was complete with everything you needed for kitchen utensils, had a 52" TV in the family room, and very large whirlpool tub in the bathroom. For the most part the villa was clean, but the carpet was a bit worn and stained in areas and I had to clean a bunch of dead gnats off of a wall near the kitchen. The outside hallways definitely need attention, as there were cob webs, trash and bugs everywhere in the hallways. It was a bit of a trek to the swimming pool, which was very small and we always had a difficult time finding a place to sit. The pictures of the pool area on the website are very deceiving. We were never called about taking a tour of the timeshare or harassed about buying into the timeshare, which was nice. I had little contact with the staff, but those that I did were never very welcoming. When we called the front desk for questions, we were often directed to a voice mail system to leave a message, for which no one ever returned our messages. Bottom line is that I would not stay here again, not only because of the lack of cleanliness in areas, small pool, and unfriendly staff, but also because we realized that it is best to be connected with a Disney resort or a hotel where there is fun and action going on, with restaurants, shops, large pools, activities for the kids, etc., versus a feeling that you are staying at an apartment complex with a pool. All in all, it was okay, but nothing flashy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old son and I & stayed at the Liki Tiki in building 400 for 5 days along with friends of ours and their 5 year old daughter. We had the adjoining units (with connecting door) ground level. It was fabulous. Very clean, modernly decorated with terrific amenities such as a dishwasher, washer & dryer and a jacuzzi. There was a pool right opposite our units and it was perfect for the young kids like ours. Also, the Liki Tiki Lagoon was an added bonus. We spent a couple of days just hanging out there and it's a haven for young children. Probably not for the older kids but a definite bonus for young children. The grounds were lovely, the units beautiful and at a decent affordable price. Would we stay there again??? Most definitely.....we have it booked for again next year with the family that we travelled with and are staying in the exact same units. The Ryan family Newfoundland, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki fun in the sun!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an excellent vacation to central Florida. Our stay at the Liki Tiki Village was wonderful! Especially for the price! We stayed in the 500 building on the top floor in a one bedroom condo. I believe this to be one of the older buildings-but it was still great. There was the kitchen, den with pull out sofa and a dinette set, large bathroom with whirlpool tub, and bedroom with queen size bed. The condo also had 2 tv's, coffee maker, blender, microwave and dishwasher. TV's were cable with premium channels. The complex was gated with a guard at all times. The grounds were very well kept, with lots of palm trees and other pretty vegetation. The condo itself was very clean (even the carpet) and included everything we needed. We did make a stop at the grocery store for extra laundry detergent, paper towels, etc. They do include a welcome kit with one package of Tide, one roll of paper towels, one packet of dishwasher soap, garbage bags and one roll of toilet paper. They provide four bath towels, 4 washclothes, 4 hand towels and 4 pool towels. You can exchange these on Wed. for clean ones. We just kept washing them. It was great having the washer/dryer and kitchen for a long stay. The pools were great as was the water park. We had a great time cooling off after going to all the parks. The Liki Tiki is exactly 6 miles to Disney's maingate. We also drove to Cocoa Beach for one day and that took about an hour. We booked through Condo Express since they had the lowest rate. We were only asked the one time at check in to take a tour and declined. We did take advantage of the free doughnuts, bagels and juice every morning. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just like all the previous post, we thought Liki Tiki was fabulous and kid friendly. Our kids had a blast at the water park and opted to stay and swim rather than go to Disney. We stayed in the 1100 building which are the newer models, I would not stay in anything less than that, Staff was very courteous and the food at Ship Wreck Sally was pleasantly wonderful. I would recommend this resort to anyone with kids

Reviews.Title: “Great Place we had an awesome time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Liki Tiki, after a weeks stay. My husband and I and our two boys ages 7 and 4 absolutley loved the place. The kids loved the water park and wanted to go every day. It was a small park but big enough for the kids they loved it. The room was very nice and very clean. I will agree with other posters about the walls being very thin we heard our neighbors the first night but then no one there after. The Ship wreck Sally's bar was nice and had great food ate there often. Nice selection of food and they ran specials. The bartender Kenny I believe his name was, was excellent. I would absolutly stay here again next time we go, they only called once about the timeshare tour but I declined then no one bothered us again. They did serve free coffee and juice, donuts and bagels every morning aside of Sunday also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: merijanoo
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with Liki Tiki. I was a bit apprehensive at first, but when I got there I found the Staff very accomodating, in particular a boy by the name of Wally. We stayed there at the end of March 05, during the Spring break period. We stayed in the 1100 unit and it was excellent very clean and very spacious and state of the art with a 52" TV. The pools were great as I have a 5 year old and 1 year old. The free breakfast was in added bonus I had no complaints what soever, I have been staying at various Marriott resorts whenever I am in Orlando. I found Liki Tiki equally on par. Keep up the Good work!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: clhaase
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Liki Tiki Village in Orlando. Let me start by saying that this hotel was not our first choice, but my mother-in-law let us use one of her bonus weeks from her timeshare and we got the week stay for $400. It was an excellent value for $400 for an entire week stay in a two bedroom villa with complete kitchen, washer/dryer, jacuzzi tub and two full bathrooms. The full kitchen saved us so much money being able to make breakfast, pack lunches for the theme parks and make some dinners in the hotel room. There are three sections to the resort. The 100-300 buildings which have 4 units in each. The 400-600 buildings which are high rise and nearer to the road. The 700-1100 buildings, which are the newest of the high rises and closest to the water park area. We requested a unit in the newer section and were put in the 700 building on the top floor (5th). I didn't get to see the other units, so I cannot comment. Because our unit was on the top floor it had vaulted ceilings in the living/dining room and master bedroom which made the unit seem very open and airy. This was nice. I'm not sure, but I don't think the lower units have the high ceilings. The unit was pretty clean. The only part really showing wear was the carpet which was a dark color, but still showed lots of stains. Because there isn't daily housekeeping, I think the carpets take a beating. The bedding, towels, kitchen appliances, plates, pans, servingware, etc. all seemed very clean. The walls were pretty thin, and we could hear the next door neighbors coming home late after the theme parks. Didn't bother our kids or us, but it is good to know ahead of time. We have a 3 & 5 year old and it was so nice to have a separate bedroom/bathroom for them, so mom and dad could have private time. During our week stay, we only went to the waterpark twice and never went to the other pools on the property. The grounds were clean and well maintained. The pools in the waterpark all empty into water at least 3 feet deep, so our kids could only go on two of the slides and we had to catch them at the bottom. It wasn't set up very well because kids have to be older to go on the slides and then the slides in my opinion are to short and slow for an older child to enjoy. We live near Wisconsin Dells, the waterpark capital of the US, and we go to a waterpark at least twice a year and have been to many in the Dells, so we are used to really great, well set up, fun waterparks. This was a little disappointing. We didn't eat at the bar/grill around the pool, but the food smelled and looked good. It would have been nice to have had at least one restaurant on-site or within walking distance, but we had a car and there were many restaurants nearby. The staff was very nice except for the lady in the gift shop who seemed annoyed that she had to interrupt her phone conversation to take my money for the postcards I purchased. I had read reviews before we left, so I knew to avoid the counter next to registration where they try to get you to take a tour of the property in exchange for breakfast/money off tickets/etc. No one ever approached us or bothered us regarding timeshares. Overall a nice place. I don't know that I would stay there again unless I got an incredible deal like we did this time. Their regular rates are comparable to much nicer resorts with many more ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation at Liki Tiki Village”
Reviews.Author: NHmember
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Liki Tiki Village (March 1-7) with our 3 kids ages 7-1/2, 4-1/2, and 8 months. We had a 'townhouse' style unit, which is in the 'older' section of the resort. We didn't do the timeshare tour, so we didn't see the units in the 5-story 'high-rise' buildings, but think we much preferred where we were. The townhouse style villa was very relaxed and close to everything at the resort. There are 3 'rings' of 'older' buildings that circle around a pool/hot tub at the main lobby. Each building has 4 townhouse-style villas, each with 2 bedroom, 2 bath, living room, eat-in kitchen, screened sunroom/patio, with a small balcony off the bedrooms. The townhouse style buildings (particularly the 100 and 200 series buildings) are very convenient to the pool, lobby, waterpark and playground. There is a second pool and hot tub in the '3-4-5 building area'. The 300 series buildings are townhouse style and the 400-500 buildings are the 5 story high rises, but all are close to that pool. The exercise room is also in the 3-4-5 section of the resort. On the other side of the lagoon (pond), there are another group of highrise buildings - the 600 through 1100 series buildings. They seemed to be a bit 'out there'.....even though they were close to the water park, they weren't close to the other pools at all. Our unit (in the 200 buildings) was very spacious and it was nice having 2 full baths. The upstairs bath had a deep tub with jets, although it was a bit short (5 ft), and only had 4 jets. Nonetheless, it was a little perk. The unit had a TV and VCR in the living room and a TV in the master bedroom. The master bedroom was very spacious, had a very comforable king size bed and a slider to the balcony. The kids room was a tad small but had a large closet, 2 twin beds and a slider to the balcony. One twin bed seemed kind of old and soft, but the other was very comfortable. The unit was very quite and we never heard so much as a voice or bang from the neighbors. The unit was clean and well decorated. The kitchen was well equipped with all the plates, glases, silver etc, full size stove/oven, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, and toaster. They give you a single use of dishwashing detergent and laundry detergent, so we wished we had packed a little thing of that from home. The unit had a small washer/dryer. The dryer seemed to work well for drying a couple damp towels, but we did one load of laundry and ran it through the dryer twice before hanging the stuff up to air dry. Although we were in the 'older' units, they seem to have been updated. There were a few signs that they were older (creaky stairs, a little frayed carpet, cracked plaster, etc), but the cabinets and bath fixtures seemed new, the tile was in good condition, etc. There were little things that could have used some attention, like a broken shelf in the refrigerator, a broken handle on the dishwasher, etc, but nothing major, and everything seemed to work. They served free mini-bagels, donuts, juice and coffee in the 3-4-5 pool area each weekday morning (but not on the weekends). It was very quite during the week, but was bustling with activity on the weekend. The pool near the main lobby was very warm (my kids referred to it as 'the warm pool'), and the hot tub was almost too hot. The pool had a large 3 ft area for the kids with a large area of steps to enter and went to I thing 6 feet at the deep end. We didn't try the pool in the '3-4-5 area', but it looked to be similar. The pool was fairly large, so there was plenty of room to play catch/etc even when it was busy. The pool was open 7 am till 11pm or midnight I think. The Liki Tiki Lagoon waterpark had 5 slides - 3 small ones that went into the 3-3.5ft deep section, and 2 larger ones that went into the 4 ft deep area. The postings say you have to be 48" tall to go on the slides, but it wasn't busy when we were there and the lifegards let my 4-1/2 year old go down the slides as long as I caught her at the bottom (which can be a challenge when they come shooting out!). There was also a zero entry section of the pool which was supposed to have a wave pool, but it was never going when we were there. Other than that, its mainly a lot of spraying water/fountain type things in the pool. There is also a separate baby pool that has swings and looked to be about a foot deep. The water at the park was heated, but not to the extent the regular pool by the lobby was. The park is also situated in the middle of a little pond in a big open area, so there is more of a breeze there and that made it cold. It was in the low 60's when we were there, so my kids weren't so crazy about the water park because it was cold. We spent most of our time in 'the warm pool'. I'd say the water park is geared for the 10 and under crowd. My niece and nephew visited (ages 13 and 16) and they were pretty bored with it. The water park was open 10 am till dusk. The resort restaurant (Shipwreck Sally's) is at the waterpark and is definately a poolside bar and grill type place (not a regular restaurant), although the food was good (my kids were especially fond of the chicken fingers and fries). However, they seemed to do last call for food around 6 pm (dusk), so you couldn't grab a late dinner there. They did have specials on the weekened though - all you can eat fish fry on Friday, kareoke, etc. and seemed to be open later then. We really enjoyed our week there and didn't venture out of the resort much. There is a Publix (grocery) about a half mile west of the resort on rt 192, and a super Walmart (much cheaper than Publix) just around the corner on Rt 27 (about 1-1.5 miles). The resort is a bit out in the middle of nowhere compared to most of the hustle and bustle of the 192 corridor. The only downside to that is you won't be walking to any restaurants or shops like you might be able to at some of the hotels further east. From the I-4 interchange there is probably 4 miles of heavily developed area along rt 192, then you go through about 3 miles with little plazas, resorts here and there before you get to Liki Tiki. For us with the kids and the baby it would have been nice to be able to just walk down the sidewalk to get to a restaurant instead of having to load everyone in the car and drive 3-4 miles, but then again it was nice and quite being out where we were. It was about a 40 minute ride to the airport though. There seemed to be a lot of timeshare tours, wining and dining, etc going on all the time, but we received only one phone call about it and said no thanks. We actually wouldn't have minded going on the tour, but have absolutely no interest in buying, so didn't want the hassle of the 'salespeople'. We did recieve a couple voice messages advertising activities etc at Shipwreck Sallys, but it wasn't a big deal. My only slight beef was that there was a lot of 'nickle and diming' for little things. They charge you $0.75 for a phone call, video rentals were $7 each, they had paddleboat rentals and bike rentals. They had kids activities (tie dye T shirts, crafts, etc) scheduled, and they cost $4-10 each. I've been to other resorts where that kind of thing was included, so I guess I got spoiled. They were in the process of building a mini-golf course while we were there. Overall we had a great time and would definately consider going back. There seemed to be a mix of older folks (retirees) and families with young kids there. The accomodations were nice and there was plenty to do to keep the kids busy.

Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Liki Tiki on March 1st. We had requested a newer unit and they honored that request. We stayed in a 2bd2bth on the 4th floor of the 500 building. We were very impressed with the size of the unit. We (my husband and I and twin 2 year olds) were really able to spread out and relax. The place was extremely clean!!! It was wonderful to have a washer/dryer, full kitchen--we saved alot on breakfast. A few times, my husband grabbed some complimentary donuts which were served m-f.The girls loved sleeping in big double beds and having their own TV in their room.The master bdrm/bth was quite spacious and had a jacuzzi tub. The water pressure in the shower was weak.We didn't really have any dealings with the staff other than checkin/out, but the pool grill was pretty good for a pool grill-fast service. The smaller pool right outside our window was very warm and we used it a night--great for sore touring feet!!The location was fine although there is quite alot of traffic on 192. The liki tiki lagoon was alot of fun for the girls even though they were too short for the slides. They also enjoyed the little playground by the lagooon pool. Overall, the place is nothing fancy, but it is much more economical and spacious than staying onsight at Disney!!!This was my first time not staying at a Disney hotel and I would definately stay at Liki Tiki again.

Reviews.Title: “Liki Tiki, "We'll be back".”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liki Tiki 28 Jan - 11 Feb. (We were in the 800 Block). This was our first visit to the US and we were not too sure what to expect. Certainly we had read all the reviews of the resort and even visited their website. I would agree with the comments written in an earlier review and say that the Liki Tiki web site does not do itself justice. We are definitely aiming for a return visit. The 2 Bed apartment was like a home from home. 3 TVs, hi-fi, dishwasher, washer/dryer and a huge bath tub in the master suite, plenty of space, better than two kings in a stuffy hotel room on I-drive! It was clean but we did have one uninvited guest, which was quickly flushed away!! One issue we had was the fact that we were connected to another apartment via an adjoining door. Unfortunately there was no sound proofing and they were like any normal family with kids, quite noisy. This did not in anyway spoil our stay at the Liki Tiki, but I do think the next time we visit, and we will, we will try and get an apartment without connecting doors. Although there is the Ship Wreck Sally Bar & Grill, this closed fairly early in the evening, I do honestly think, with a resort as large as it is, they could benefit from an indoor bar/restaurant on site so you've not got far to go after a hard day trekking around the parks! WDW being only a 10-15 min drive away and Wal-Mart only 5, its nicely placed for a quiet holiday but maybe a little bit too far out if you want to be close to restaurants/bars/shops etc. We and our 13 yr old will most certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: rkmemkc
Reviews.Content: Hi there...we have become secondary citizens to Kissimmee and WDW. We like to travel there at least once a year and have experimented with several timeshares in this area. Well we stayed at the Liki Tiki from Jan 8-Jan 15, 2005 and I offer you this honest and open minded review of our stay. We have stayed at Westgate Lakes and Westgate Vacation Villas and were so impressed that we bought a timeshare at Westgate Blue Tree...although we have never stayed there we decided to 'trade up' to a 2 bedroom at Liki Tiki. We may be spoiled by the lavish properties and room that Westgate has shown us so let me start with - this resort is ideal for families with children. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. We stayed in a 2 bedroom townhouse-like villa. There was a kitchen, living room, laundry room and bathroom on the first floor and 2 bedrooms and master bath on the second floor. The rooms were small and the televisions were very small-13"! There was also no television in the second bedroom. My kids travel with videos and video games and this was something we were not used to. In 2005 the size of the televisions was pretty interesting to us. Now you are probably thinking...you are in sunny Orlando Florida and you are worried about the televisions! Well we didn't have sunny days all 7 so this became and issue when we had to move the couch closer to see the one in the living room and if I had known this before booking, it may have changed my mind. Anyway, if you are looking for a nicer-than-a-hotel room than this is the place. The only 'free-owner' perks are the free coffee, juice and doughnuts in the morning. They offer specials at the pool bar but the prices are not any lower than anywhere else. Before our trip, I read all of the reviews on this site...I can say-I did not see one bug. The kitchen was spotless and all of the appliances were brand new. This was the older part of the resort so I cannot report on the newer high rise buildings. Each of the buildings that we stayed in had 4 units. We did not hear any noise from the other rooms and the staff was extremely helpful. So my overall opinion is this is a very nice place to stay, clean, well staffed, beautifully landscaped, wonderful 'water park' and very clean pools. Great 'pub food' at Shipwreck Sally's and a peaceful setting. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to Walt Disney World but its far enough away to be able to relax after a long day.

HotelInfo.Name: Liki Tiki Village
